Reviews.Title: “Great central location, very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Kay R
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay,rooms were ok but could have been better, breakfast room needed decoration, breakfast was not great, but loads of eateries around about, especially little Asian coffee shop next door in shopping area?

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the Menzies”
Reviews.Author: ekulandaidyl
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults and 2 kids - 13 and 11yo) chose to stay at the Menzies, Sydney - for it's central location, it's proximity to transport options ( Wynyard Station directly opposite), the tourist icons (Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay, Opera House, City/ CDB) were all closeby and within easy walking distance, and it was one of few hotels that would allow 4 persons in one room - making it a cost-effective option for us. Check-in was prompt and our room clean, spacious and well-appointed. The beds were comfortable and roomy enough to sleep 4. The only criticism I could make of the room - was that the bathroom was a little on the small size. Staff were prompt in notifying us of the arrival of our luggage which went astray at the airport on arrival in Sydney. Breakfast was pleasant and there was a reasonable assortment of food to cater for all tastes. The hotel has retained it's old charm and character, which was nice. Staff were all friendly and courteous. We caught the Airport train to Wynyard Station, and were pleasantly surprised at how close the station was to the hotel. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to persons wanting to stay in a good location in Sydney, we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Here's why I gave this hotel a 5 star rating”
Reviews.Author: Appreci8life
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't actually rate a hotel 5 star unless I had a complete positive overall experience. But sometimes there are small things that impress me that make me forget about anything else and I just remember the positive. There were 5 of us, two adults two kids and an infant. At other hotels in the area they would only allow a maximum of 4 people per room due to "fire regulations". It was such a pain to pay for the cost of an extra room simply because we had an infant with us. Menzies hotel was ok with this so we were all accomodated in a single room and they also brought a crib for the baby. The hotel is somewhat old but it is still well maintained and in a good location. The room was cleaned and also had high ceilings. Everything was in great shape although the hotel is starting to show its age. All in all we had a pleasant stay and I don't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “old fashioned values”
Reviews.Author: CastlePerthWA Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was was very pleasantly surprised, the progressive upgrade of the Hotel is obviously now near complete. Our twin double room was very comfortable, with good beds. The staff were very courteous. The Hotel has retained its old charm,beautify character and I would suggest has old fashioned values feel about it. Great location we walk every where as it is reasonably close to the Rocks, the Opera House, Darling Harbour and the CBD. Being opposite the Wynyard Station was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “menzies”
Reviews.Author: hownic Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, and friendly staff. Housekeeping needs a bit of a rev up - quite dusty and not up to scratch. Photos on website could do with updating regrading the rooms on offer - ours was quite tired. BUT lovely foyer, great pool, and happy staff.

Reviews.Title: “In need of refurbishment, Lack lustre staff”
Reviews.Author: Jan E
Reviews.Content: Bedrooms extremely tired. Rest of hotel not much better. Many Staff aggressive. Staff not helpful at front desk Breakfast - ran out of food and tables were piled high with crockery as there was no staff to clear them. Coffee machine at breakfast very good Overpriced Bell boy was the best

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The stay was very pleasant and perfect for a night out in the city, as well as an early morning commute to the international airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very much in a need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service is ordinary overall. Front office staff are extremely helpful and polite.. The location of this hotel is perfect. However, the hotel itself leaves a lot to be desired. The rooms have been sadly neglected over the years. Bathrooms and hallways are dull, not too clean and extremely old fashioned. The whole hotel urgently requires upgrading. Room prices are costly for below standard quality. I would recommend this hotel solely for its position.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Sydney, but tired decor”
Reviews.Author: lowie11
Reviews.Content: I took my wife into the city for a Honeymoon weekend and were able to get a great rate at the Menzies through WOTIF. The location is fantastic being an easy walk to King St Wharf, Cockle Bay and Darling Harbour as well as the Rocks and the centre of the city for dinner. Parking and bag drop off is a pain as there is no valet and you need to go around the back of the hotel and into a private car park, once you have it parked then you need to lug your bags up the stairs. Annoying but not a killer issue once you are in the hotel as you wont need your car again. The room was spacious and well fitted out although a little tired, e.g. the wall mount Tv was small by comparison to other hotels and the carpet and drapes need an update. The bathroom was from the 1960's being a small bath and shower combination and a tiny sink which would barely handle my stuff let alone the makeup and accessories for my wife. Customer service in the hotel was efficient and friendly without being in your way. A good choice for those looking for great location with quality service at reasonable rate for a city hotel. If they did the bathrooms up it would be a big step up and they could charge more too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and location couldn't fault. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good position, poor decor”
Reviews.Author: GrecianHighworthUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superbly situated, 10 minutes walk from Circular Quay. However on arrival we found our room felt damp and asked to be moved. New room was ok. Overall the hotel needed a makeover. Had a tired feel to it. Wifi use in room was expensive but limited free use on lobby. Head Concierge was very helpful about what to do in the area. Bathroom was very small. Within striking distance of good food places.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Lack lustre staff”
Reviews.Author: cathviola Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to Wynyard station making connection to airports and the rest of Sydney a breeze. We had an upgrade to Park view room. Rm 225 was quite big 2 queen size beds but not really enough storage for potentially 4 people. Unfortunately one of the beds had collapsed completely on one side and despite a complaint to the manager there was no solution or follow up offered. The same situation with towels - only 2 supplied for 3 people a request met with no result and we had to get them from the pool area. Overall the cleanliness was excellent but the general room a bit run down eg the non slip stickers on the bath were blackened with ground in dirt. Pool area is quite nice but in general the hotel is looking a little shabby with paint peeling in places and broken soap dispenser in one of the pool showers. Towels ran out in this area etc Staff were helpful when approached at front desk but very laid back and not really going beyond the minimum or chatting to each other before serving waiting customers etc. electronic quick checkout was offline resulting in a very long queue at checkout. Overall the staff service was not what I would expect from this level of hotel but was adequate if you had time to wait - perhaps due to being the Easter weekend

Reviews.Title: “Great location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Robin Lee D Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thoroghly enjoyed the swimming pool and spar. Good buffet breakfast. Beds super comfortable. Close to Wynyard station and all city events. Floor carpet a little tired looking.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It's a pleasure staying at the Menzies. The grand old style of the hotel, gracious staff, beautiful foyer to relax. The position in Sydney is amazing, opposite the Station. Train direct from Sydney Airport. Five minutes walk to Circular Key Sydney Harbour

Reviews.Title: “Menzies stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed at the Menzies before & have found it to be a great location with all the tourist spots within walking distance. We travelled from the airport by train to Wynyard which stops opposite the hotel. The staff are extremely friendly & helpful. The restaurant serves a beautiful meal & the staff are very courteous. Internet boarding passes & seat selection has been a problem each time but reception staff have been helpful & printed them for us. Otherwise no complaints & we'll happily return!!

Reviews.Title: “Menzies not for me”
Reviews.Author: Carol.Jean.
Reviews.Content: On a positive note the Menzies has a central location and is within walking distance of most major attractions. The staff was helpful and the lobby was attractive and comfortable and the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. This is good enough for a cheap hotel but this is not how the hotel is advertised. The walls in the halls were marked and dingy. The elevators appeared old and we joked about never getting in one alone. There is no in room safe and limited space to put away clothing. There was insufficient space in the bathroom to put out toiletries. Internet service was expensive. You were given a limited amount of free time every 24 hour period in the lobby but most of the time we were not able to connect. Some of the people thought that we were in the cheap wing and there might be a nicer area we did not see. This is not a terrible place to hang your hat but it is certainly not a four star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cancel Now”
Reviews.Author: canadiangirl33
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. Change your reservation now. We got a travelzoo deal of $134/night and that was still too much. The rooms are filthy, the towels are threadbare and the beds so soft and worn out who knows how long they have been there. The "superior room" we got as an upgrade with our package makes me worry for those who had less. Staff and management were completely baffling. I called for a cab and was told a rank was outside. I explained that I needed a van due to our large party and was told "it's okay they are out there about 50% of the time". Right, which means I have a 50% chance of not having the transportation my group requires to get us to the airport at 7am. Sydney is a magnificent city and if you are lucky enough to get to visit don't waste your time at a place like this.

Reviews.Title: “Tired - needs a more comprehensive refurb”
Reviews.Author: Leanne_Bear
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Menzies in September 2001. It was a good hotel and for that reason, as well as its superb central location, we chose it again when we returned to Sydney in March 2012. When booking, we noted the increase in room pricing, but attributed it to the passage of time and the indicated renovations/refurbishments. The room we were placed in clearly had not been refurbished or renovated. Down the hall, other rooms were being painted. We were not thrilled by being placed on a floor in the midst of ongoing renovations, but didn't object as our stay was short and the work did not end up affecting us at all during the times we were in the hotel. Nevertheless, this should have been disclosed to us. The room was not thoroughly clean - vents and mouldings hadn't been touched in a loooong time. And why does Australia generally have such an aversion to air conditioning? Like everywhere else in Australia, as well, wifi access was grossly overpriced, as was breakfast. We re-familiarized ourselves with the nearby MacDonald's ("Macca's) in Wynward Station for breakfast, and many Macca's also offer free wifi. Australia needs to learn that in North America, most hotels are now providing complimentary wifi access. I'm not paying $15 or more for an hour's use, sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fabrice N
Reviews.Content: Currently staying. Arrived three nights ago. The bathroom was not clean with some hair in the tube. I shaved two days ago and the cleaning service has still not removed all my hair in the sink. The hotel is stuffy and does not smell fresh. They charge $8 for a bottle of water. The bed is sagging. Only pro is the very central location.

Reviews.Title: “An OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lucyznana
Reviews.Content: Great location! Close to shopping, Cicular Quay / The Rocks. Also very close to Wynyard Station for trips further out of the city. The rooms are clean but need upgrading. Wifi access was not working in our room and the free access in the Lobby was patchy at times. The Head Concierge is an asset to this establishment, he is helpful, friendly and always on hand to help with bags or any other request.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be Better”
Reviews.Author: Layne_12 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stay at your hotel Thursday 22/03/2012 â€“ Sunday 25/03/2012 and would like to point the following that we were disappointed with the following. â€¢ Stain on back of Bathroom door. â€¢ Television reception very poor. â€¢ Lot of stain and scuff marks on walls and cabinet above fridge. â€¢ Fridge freezer compartment iced up. Room service was very poor took two phone calls and 1 hr to get a bucket of ice to my room

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: Sure it's not 5 star - however you are not paying 5 star prices. The rooms are clean and a good size. Definitely needs an upgrade though. Beds are a little hard. Lobby is lovely. Good location if you want to be close to both Pitt Street Mall shopping and Circular Quay/Rocks area. Reception staff and concierge were wonderful! However room service staff member on the phone was downright rude. The main room service menu finishes at 10.30pm. We phoned at exactly 10.35 and she just wouldn't budge. There was no way she would allow us to order a meal even though we hadn't had dinner. The late night menu is pathetic - 3 ordinary items and overpriced. A cheese & tomato sandwich for $15.50 - and didn't come with chips or salad. We ended up getting dinner from the 7 Eleven downstairs!! Yuk! But no choices close by for 2 young girls this late at night. Apart from this - the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Paul Crossin Comments”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great service but expensive for the standard. Business centre is expensive and the printer doesn't scan. Not really business-friendly

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good value with having breakfast included. A shuttle bus to various parts of Sydney might be an idea. As we found it hard to get to Darling Harbour. After two days we worked out the best bus to catch, (probably should have asked at the front desk.)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: chanplc
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is right in the middle of the city, with the train station & one of the biggest bus hub just across the hotel (plus a park too). We stayed in 2 occasions, even the room facing the street was quiet. Staff are always pleasant. Heaps of eateries in the vicinity and doctor's office is just around the corner. Internet was affordable, especially with the 7-day package. The breakfast was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Conference visit to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I arrived early to the hotel due to flight times and was pleased a room was available. All staff very helpful. Nice quiet room lovely facilities and central location . The train so close is great and I felt safe on my own catching the train and alighting across the road at 9pm at night. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: LondonCitytraveller
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Sydney and we were booked into the Menzies by Royal Caribbean prior to our cruise around Australia. Having spent three days in Singapore (Marina Mandarin - a hotel of the highest standards) we were looking forward to our three days in Sydney before the cruise. Knowing that RCCI only ever book the basic rooms we contacted the Menzies before-hand and upgraded our room to a Superior Park View Room. This cost us an extra Â£50 per night. The reservations clerk was very helpful and we arrived in Sydney with high hopes. On opening our room door, our hopes were dashed. The room was dark, small and uncomfortable. There is no in room safe (none in any of the rooms). The 'park view' was a joke - sort of side on view of a small section of a small grass area (hardly a park). It was badly in need of refurbishment - old fashioned furniture and fittings, small bathroom with a toilet that would not flush. On complaining we upgraded to a junior suite (at an extra Â£50 per night over and above the extra we had already paid). This is really two rooms with a view of the train station immediatley over the road from the hotel. A reasonable size sitting area (internet point at a cost) mini bar and bathroom in one room and bedroom, mini bar and bathroom adjoining. Again badly in need of refurbishment but at least it was of a reasonable (not good) standard and we made do for the three days. We had booked breakfast (at AU$19 per person - special price). The first morning we had to queue outside the dining room and when we were allocated a place there was no table and we were offered a seat in the corridor. They ran out of cups - had to use paper ones - the food was not replenished and was of a very poor standard. So much so that we bought provisions to have in our room and thereby 'saved' the AU$38 it would have cost us for the final breakfast on the Saturday morning. The location is great - 10 minutes walk from the Opera House or the Bridge and in very easy rach of the magnificent botanical gardens. This is the only plus factor for what must once have been a superb hotel but has been left to fester and is in dire need of a refurbishment to bring it up to 21st century standards. We shall be visiting Sydney again (all being well) but will give the Menzies a miss; badly needs a change of management and some real investment if it is to compete with even ordinary hotels. Very poor - look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Always Happy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms are always comfortable, beds and pillows of a high quality. Service is quick and friendly. Loved that we were recognised as regular visitor and treated to free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant charm in the city”
Reviews.Author: jessinz
Reviews.Content: We booked the Menzies on Wotif for a long weekend in Sydney. It was a great price and a fantastic hotel to stay at. Our room was large and very clean. There was no view but with the extremely convenient and central location, we didn't need one! The location next to Wynyard Station made it super simple to train in from the airport and catch buses around town. The service was very friendly and professional. I would definitely recommend the Menzies for a long weekend, or longer - we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Conference Time at the Menzies”
Reviews.Author: ByronVIPTravelWriter
Reviews.Content: Although I didnt stay at the Menzies whilst attending a conference there last week, I have to commend the staff for their professional and friendly service. The conference food varied each day and was top quality and even though there were a lot of delegates there were always ample portions of food. The conference rooms were well set up, and I did enjoy the crystal chandelier in many of the rooms. The staff were graciious enough to allow me to play the piano in the piano bar, after I assured them that I had played professionally many years ago. They invited be back to play, and also allowed me to play the Yamaha baby grand piano in the reception bar. Thank you to the Day and Night concierges, Andrew and Mahfuz, you were both helpful, friendly and efficient, and made my visit to the Menzies a happy one. I'll have your hotel in mind when booking Sydney hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: room service tool 65 mins to arrive (after being told 25 mins). reception could not explain the parking validation process without jargon. concierge and bell attendants were efficient and knowledgable

Reviews.Title: “Lively Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Physim
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights whilst on a conference. Hotel is old but newly renovated. Room was clean and well sized, no view to speak of just the buildings near by. Good breakfast buffet for $25. Good conference facilities and well located. Would recommend for the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: princess_trayc
Reviews.Content: We were very happy to get a reasonably priced room for $240 on mardi gras weekend for a friends wedding, when most other hotels in the city were asking $300-$400. While there was a bit of a line for check in, we found the service staff to be lovely and when we asked for a late checkout of 11am the next day they gave us till 1230pm without a question, which we were very impressed with, having been asked to pay extra or just plain refused late checkout at other hotels. We were also given access to our room straight away on arrival even though we were there at 11am and check in isn't till around 2pm. The downside was that the rooms are a little old and could definitely do with a refurb, however the beds were comfy, nice roomy bathroom with full length mirror, plasma tv and plenty of room space made up for the slightly old interior. The reception area and other facilities such as the bars were beautiful and the hotel included a buy one get one free drink voucher in our room card so we could enjoy these areas. The other highlight was the location. Right on top of Wynyard station and easy walking distance to circular quay, Pitt street mall and out wedding locations made it a breeze to get around without cabs. Would def stay here again without questions

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sandi34
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights last weekend for a family get together, Its a perfect location , walking distance to the Rocks, Circular Quey , Darling Harbour, Opera House & the Bridge , The Room was clean & spacious. The conceige was very helpful & the check in staff very quick. Buffet breakfast was yummy. Great weekend !

Reviews.Title: “If they can't be bothered to clean rooms properly, you shouldn't bother staying here.”
Reviews.Author: Groovygrovers
Reviews.Content: Totally unimpressed. Rooms were old, shabby, noisy and smelt musty. Carpet in room and hallways filthy. Only plus? The location. I guess the hotel banks on this fact and can't be bothered to provide better amenities since they have a constant stream of reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Roach in the sheets”
Reviews.Author: jpmoloneyau
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a large cockroach scuttling through our bed sheets when we arrived and wanted an afternoon nap. It took us two phone calls and 20 minutes to get someone to our room to change the sheets and the person taking our calls at the reception seemed completely nonplussed. While it wouldn't have made us feel any less disgusted, an apology would have been nice. But no, nothing then and nothing when we checked out. Not even an enquiry about whether we enjoyed our stay. Having spent 300 bucks or so for the night in Sydney without the kids, the Menzies was very disappointing. The location of the Menzies is great for doing things near Circular Quay, but the rooms are not flash and the breakfast buffet was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Vicki N
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at the hotel several years ago and was given a small room with twin single beds, this time around we had 2 Queen/double side beds with rooms overlooking the park. The bathroom was clean and the room tidy. Staff at reception were very helpful and the free drinks voucher given on arrival was great. C The hotel is directly above the train station (on floor 11 heard nothing of traffic) and a short walk accross the road to enter the station. Plenty of good cheap restraunts/bars close by and easy walking to darling harbour and circular quay. Fabulous atmosphere in the piano lounge on the Saturday night. Check out was a little slow the next day but nothing to unreasonable, taxis are always plentiful out the front.

Reviews.Title: “A very mixed bunch”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter085
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault reception- very welcoming & immediately credited the internet charge (11$) when I complained that the room internet details did not state that once you logged out the credit died. I had thought that the charge would last our stay. Rooms dated & clean on arrival, but bathrooms surfaces were not wiped during our stay & no vacuuming done. One day bedmaking consisted of smoothing top sheet only! Bottom sheet left wrinkled. Noisy airconditioning. Dined in on first night- food was good but the room was stripped while we ate- stripped of tables and chairs! All came clear two nights later- we came up to the area for a drink just after 10 p.m. -piano bar is supposed to be open until midnight. All was closed, tables & chairs gone and the area set up for a buffet breakfast.Not sure if this was for a tour party or a conference. we chose to breakfast in the food court at Wynyard Station!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lio-Isa
Reviews.Content: Good points: Centrally located, very kind and helpfull staff. Bad Points: the rooms are small, not very clean and noisy. We were disapointed by the rooms for this price, with the supplement for the park view. We asked for changing the room and visited at least 6 other but all where the same. During our stay, we had the opportunity to visit friends in the YHA backpacker of the Rocks: cheaper, cleaner, newer and better located with a great panoramic view from the terrace on Sydney bridge and opera house...we had better stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Dated rooms - price doesn't match expectations - but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi04NZ
Reviews.Content: The room itself (242) was spacious but the bathroom pokey and definitely due for an upgrade. Carpet (circa late 80s blue) and furnishings are very dated with a tiny TV. Bed linen clean but very thin. On the plus side the room has large windows which let in great natural light. The street location is very quiet despite being so close (right opposite) Wynyard train station. Would stay here again due to location only but the price does not match the quality of the hotel. Pricey for what you get! FYI - wifi access $11 for one hour.

Reviews.Title: “Old rooms, good location, nice staff, breakfast from the 70's...”
Reviews.Author: Glenn R Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies looks and feels like it hasn't stepped out of the 70's. Clearly needs updating especially as to what constitutes a decent breakfast buffet... Rooms are old, bathrooms likewise, very limited amenities pack, lots of noise through the walls. But beds are comfortable, location very central and the staff were very friendly and helpful. All in all, not great value. Can't help feeling for $50 a night more I would have had a more up to date experience in nicer surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were initially impressed with the hotel, particularly it's very close proximity to the very efficient train system. The room was nice and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was tiny but that is expected. We were unimpressed with the breakfast buffet with tasteless gluggy everything. Also, we had the unfortunate experience on Sunday of encountering the lift system when it gets busy, they either stop working completely or stop at every level, which made me thoroughly seasick and very annoyed. But overall, it does what it needs to!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel very well located for all of Sydney and access to the airport. It is an older style hotel that has been well updated however the corridors do have a musty smell when you get out of the lift which is not noticeable in the room. Restaurant good and breakfast great value.

Reviews.Title: “Average business accommodation”
Reviews.Author: 247Travel
Reviews.Content: What a location! A five minute walk to the Rocks down George Street or minutes from Sydney's best shopping. Amnd right opposite Wynyard station direct from the airport. Now that we have got that out the way, prepare for average. Average service, average rooms and average food - all at above average prices. Here are some of my experiences. The rooms are clean and tidy but smal and average business accommodation. I enjoyed an unimpeded view of an office block next door. The air conditioning was like a cyclone - what to do? A sleepless night with air conditioning or a sleepless night with a humid Sydney night? I still don't know the answer to that one. What about a refreshing beer after work in the Sporters bar? Sorry, we close at 7pm. Fancy a cooked breakfast? Why not. They boast stale bread, over cooked bacon and watery scrambled eggs. Broadband? it's free (in the lobby). Otherwise AU$50 and up for three days on your room. That's if you can get through to Guest services. It took me over an hour to get through. Each time I rang it was engaged. I could go on but this is a very typical Australian business hotel and no one gives a damn. My advice? Shop somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the Menzies is an older hotel but was very clean and all the staff were excellent - very attentative. We ate dinner and breakfast in the dining rooms and both were pleasant experiences with good quality food and service

Reviews.Title: “the Menzies Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lebena
Reviews.Content: fantastic Hotel, great staff, amazing location, train station across the street and bus stops. Pool in basement was a bit cold, and a bit dated, but was lovely to be able to swim. when it was SO hot outside ! Breakfast was also very good. (Buffet style)

Reviews.Title: “Avoid At All Costs”
Reviews.Author: BluesTraveller82 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am rather a cheapskate, but was heading over to Sydney for a wedding, and decided to splash out for 4 nights at The Menzies. I wish I had spent an extra $300 and gone to the Radisson - The place is a dive. Wallpaper was coming off the walls, bathroom sink was dirty, cobwebs around the mini-bar.....and that is just the start of it. Other issues included: - Rooms are serviced between 8.30am - 4.30am, according to the literature in the hotel room. I would really like to know why housekeeping woke me up at 7.25am if that is the case. - Fifteen minutes later, someone else tries to come into my room. This time, it's another hotel guest - seems that they checked someone else into my room while I was sleeping in it. And no, it wasn't my last night in the hotel. I was still booked to stay another 3 nights. So I get up, go downstairs to get myself a coffee, and then go back upstairs to my room. Key won't work. Anyway, long story short, they deactivated all the keys to my room. Two trips down to reception and they finally rectify the issue.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: Lynda783
Reviews.Content: We spent three days in Sydney last September before flying to Brisbane for three weeks. On arriving at Sydney airport we decided to wait for the shuttle bus which was quite a wait. When we arrived at the Menzies we realised we should have caught the train as it is opposite the hotel. The room was quite small but a comfortable bed. It was nice to have an ironing board in the room. The hotel had a shop attached selling papers and food which was useful if you wanted to take things to your room. The hotel is in a good central location and only a short walk to all the popular sights. There are lots of eating places close to the hotel if staying on a room only basis.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: travellady83
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty average, but the location cannot be beat. You can take the airport train directly to this hotel. Get off at the Wynyard stop and cross the street. You are there. From the hotel, you can easily walk to Sydney Harbour, Darling Harbour, The Rocks, shopping, and other points of interest. As a solo female traveler, I felt secure in the hotel and the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy decor but excellent business location”
Reviews.Author: TheErrandBoy
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel I prefer when I am in Sydney on Business. It is well located for George Street, Martin Place and other business hot spots in Sydney CBD. It is very easy to reach as it is practically on top of Wynyard Station which means it is possible to catch the train directly from Sydney Airport - and what a lovely scenic route it is too - with a lovely view of Circular Quay. Good traveller shoping is available in the same street. The Decor is dated but pleasant enough with good sized and clean rooms. The furniture is good for a business traveller. The restaurant is quite good although the last time I was there (February 2012) understaffed. Perhaps the food, which is good, doesn't quite match the price. Sometimes this hotel is used by tour groups and this can create some slowness at breakfast. Breakfast is a strengh of this hotel and has good range of warm and cold fare. Summary this hotel is comfortable, good value, very well located and very easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but breakfast pretty disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of the Menzies was fabulous, so central and short walking distance to many places. Across the road from train station, grocery store and many restaurants and cafes. Only disappointment was the buffet breakfast. The selection was lacking and the hot food was pretty ordinary. Overall we were pleased with the accomodation, particularly considering the price (as we had one night free through Accor).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Sydney location”
Reviews.Author: Madfish56
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Unfortunately first night was Valantines, which pushed the room rate very high. Obviously very busy. Staff very helpful and the room comfortable. Train station was right across the road which gave you access to the extensive rail network. An easy walk into Sydney shopping area, the Rocks, and Darling Harbour. I didn't eat in at all as there are so many places in the area to choose from. Some great restaurants are found in the Rocks area. This hotel is highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment in the City”
Reviews.Author: LouBale
Reviews.Content: I had made the reservation to celebrate my husband's birthday, so booked a Junior King Suite thinking it would provide that extra "something special" (based on the web site description). We were checked in by a lovely and professional young woman who made the point that we were staying in one of their superior rooms, so we headed to the suite with great expectation. We were thrilled to find a bottle of champagne waiting for us - a lovely token. However a quick look around the suite soon revealed a very dated and tired room, desperately in need of repairs... and a face lift. I was not going to let my disappointment dampen our celebration, so we headed straight off to catch a show at the Opera House returning much later in the evening to enjoy some time in the piano bar before retiring to our suite In the light of day, the true state of the room's finish became obvious. There was discolouration (possibly mould) around the air-conditioning vents in both rooms, the smoke detector in the bedroom was sealed over with with appeared to be a plastic bag , the cabling and data assembly under the drawing desk was unsightly and potentially unsafe given its position when seated at the table, the wallpaper was discoloured, aged and peeling around the cornice in both rooms. The disappointment extended to the public areas with the "island drinks bar" in the breakfast area significantly damaged. The plinth at the base of the unit had broken off and a large ugly wedge of timber was shoved under one corner of the unit in an attempt to level it. On check-out I cast my eyes to the chandelier in the foyer, only to see the water effected ceiling around the manhole cover right above the main reception. Not a great first (or in our case - last) impression. With so many choices in the heart of the beautiful city of Sydney - I would recommend avoiding the Menzies until some serious maintenance & renovations are undertaken.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, but choose your room correctly”
Reviews.Author: bodmor
Reviews.Content: VERY easy access to the Sydney train network as it is across the road from Wynyard Station, there is also a Coles supermarket within the train station, which was handy for emergency shopping. Easy access to all Sydney has to offer at a good price. However we (paid for what we got &) had a small room over looking a what I will describe as a large lightwell with views of office workers the next morning ..so pull your curtains. The room & bathroom was a renovated 70s! All that being said the staff were very friendly & attentive. Our friends stayed at the same time as we did & said they had quite a nice room, but we didn't see it!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and found the hotel the best location of any we've stayed in, directly opposite Wynyard station. Although usually on the expensive side we got a fantastic deal through the hotel club we're in, with free breakfast thrown in which made it very affordable. The hotel has a lovely old world atmosphere, with marble staircase, dark wood & carpets, chesterfield & other leather lounges in piano bar all giving an opulant, lived in feel, without being old and stuffy. We were put into an executive suite on the top floor and were surprised at the very small TV screen and small bathroom, but apart from that, found the bed amazingly comfortable, all spotlessly clean and good sized room. Breakfast was reasonable, restaurant on the pricey side.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: MandR50
Reviews.Content: Very central location. Easy walk to The Rocks / Cicular Quay / Opera House / Darling Harbour. Breakfast in hotel expensive - just okay. Powerhouse Museum good. Blue Mountain - Andersons Tours very good. Good value and good meal at Pub in Brooklyn Hotel - just two blocks from hotel - From hotel - turn left into George St. one block on left hand side. Tour of Opera House good. All of Australia very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs a refresh”
Reviews.Author: Loud1Canberra
Reviews.Content: Just an overnight stay for business. The hotel is in the centre of the CBD and close for business purposes. I used the carparking which is a bit expensive compared to some other nearby hotels The room was clean and comfortable although seemed a little tired. Like many inner city hotels you either have a street view with some traffic noise or, as I did, a view of another building but very quiet. Strange thing was that the hotel's main bar/bistro was closedwith the lobby bar very busy. Also they had too few staff on the desk with queues for checking in and out! Overall did the job.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy”
Reviews.Author: ISLANDchampion Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As an Accor Silver club member I expected to get looked after, instead I was dumped in two shabby back rooms with leaking tapes, green mould in the bathrooms and one of the rooms smelt terrible, the worst part was, I bought my family, daughter & her family to the place for two nights and paid in advance, could not get my money back, so much for paying for a club membership!!! I can only rate the hotel on the rooms they gave me....

Reviews.Title: “Shocked!”
Reviews.Author: Avaikinui
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that this is an Accor hotel! I booked a superior room and my poor colleague booked a standard - they were sub standard and certainly NOt superior! Although the manager was helpful and tried to find us something better, the overall stand of the hotel was such that this was impossible - slightly larger room but smallest TV in the world, shabbily appointed and depressing corridors - all this in a week where Sydney is booked out - depressing! Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in good location with a great wine bar.”
Reviews.Author: mintie
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at Menzies for its great location to Wynyard Station and because of a good price we located online. The wine bar was a bonus and the cocktails were great and not over-priced. The check-in lady seemed beastly careless whether she checked us in or not - not a great first impression! We chose a king bedded room with a park view. Room itself was ok - a bit dated - with a small flat screen TV (about 10 years old, I guess) and the mattress was not great. Bathroom was daggy with dirty grout and only just clean. House-keeping was a bit skimpy as far as amenties go and eventually arrived with extra soap and shower cap. Hotal is located near great restaurants so took opportunity to go elsewhere for our meals during our two night stay. Probably would stay elsewhere next time.....

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, perfect location for access to The Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Seha_Suhaimi
Reviews.Content: The room is a good size, as is the bed. Room and bathroom was exceptionally clean. My partner found the mattress a bit soft, but that is purely personal preference and not a flaw with the hotel, as I slept like a baby. Bathroom was an adequate size, not too cramped but not exactly large. Enough room to wheel around a large suitcase with no trouble getting about the room. Very well stocked mini bar (the entire fridge was full). The only low points if I had to pick out the negatives was that the hairdryer barely wheezed warm air, and that the room lighting is slightly inadequate, making the room quite dim even with the lights on. Great location for access to the ferries and The Rocks as it is a 5 minute walk away. The hotel is situated immediately opposite Wynyard station, so you can save a bit of cash taking the train from the airport instead of a cab. We didn't have any problems with noise from the street as we were on the 12th floor, but the walls are quite thin, so do take note. The staff were hard to get hold of, but when you do get service, they are very warm and extremely helpful. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay and The Menzies provided a very comfortable place to go back to rest after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Central City”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel right in the middle of Sydney CBD. Very accessible and well presented. Staff are nice and accommodating and there are a number of restaurants/eateries to choose from. I would recommend to anyone travelling to Sydney for business or pleasure. Great access to trains (Wynyard Station right across the road) and only a small walk down to Circular Quay and The Rocks region.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean”
Reviews.Author: Tom_John69
Reviews.Content: I know, this hotel is rather old but it does not mean that it can't be clean.

Reviews.Title: “fawlty towers...without manuel!”
Reviews.Author: 630mel
Reviews.Content: Received a voucher to stay at this hotel. We were put in room 703..on stepping out of the very shaky elevator we were hit with an awful damp smell in the corridor. Room was extremely small and freezing cold. Smell of damp was present here also; the air vent had water dripping from it and wall-paper peeling off around it where damp had permeated it previously. Went to reception to ask for a different room and were "upgraded" to room 1020 without hesitation (staff member was clearly quite used to this happening). The new room was slightly bigger, warmer and did not smell of damp, however the rest of our stay at the hotel was less than average. Poor service, filthy carpets throughout, out-dated and noisy air-con units, elevators that bump and show wrong level, a breakfast so poor we left and went elsewhere to eat, peeling wallpaper, dripping taps...the list is endless! Thankfully we have a sense of humour and can laugh about how much like Fawlty Towers The Menzies is!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel shame about WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Typically Wi Fi is a rip off, why do hotels in Australia & New Zealand see the provision of Wi Fi as a major revenue earner ( at the prices charged it must be) rather than a service. Otherwise the hotel was an excellent choice. Perfect for transport and easy access to all major attractions

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Adventure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We received a very warm welcome to the hotel with all staff being very polite and helpful. The room was very comfortable and clean. The location was was excellent for exploring the main tourist attractions of Sydney. We had a lovely walk through the Botanic gardens, a dinner cruise on the harbor and some of our party climbed the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: darbymo
Reviews.Content: The hotel has attractive public spaces. Our room was comfortable, but on the smallish side. We were located directly across from the elevators and heard no noise. The concierge service was spotty-one could not suggest a place to buy wine when there was a wine store on the same block as the hotel When we left, the concierge was very helping members of our group check in for flights. Breakfast was predictable. The hotel was conveniently located. It was a 10 minute walk to Circular Quay or Chinatown. There is public transportation and an underground food store directly across the street. The free tourist bus stops within a block of the hotel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies Hotel - January 2012”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Menzies with my wife and youngest son. We stayed in a junior suite. We had a minor problem with the room that was quickly overcome. The junior suite was supposed to have a sofa bed - ours had only a sofa. No problem - front desk quickly organised a rollaway bed at no extra charge. We also used the pool and spa downstairs. Check-out is very busy so you might want to consider using the express arrangements. We also used the private parking attached to the hotel. This worked quite well. The hotel is well served by taxis and Wynard raiwlay station is literally across the road. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk to Circular Quay and about 15 minutes walk to Darling Harbour,. Overall, I was impressed with the hotel If you are an Accor member you might want to check whether the Menzies is going to remain with Accor in late 2012 - I tried to book for September 2012 and it wasn't listed as an Accor hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Happy but not satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent facilities and service. Could not be faulted. even the guy at the door was friendly. The only blemish was that the room had not been cleaned properly. While checking for property under each bed prior to leaving, we found a packet of biscuits and soap that had not been removed. Given this, we were concerned that the room had not been cleaned properly and how much of it had been cleaned. This was very disappointing. This is the reason why I would not recommend. If this didn't happen, I would recommend the hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Chief Concierge, Andrew Austen was outstanding and made our stay special.”
Reviews.Author: Optiguy
Reviews.Content: We spent a month in Australia in Jan-Feb 2011. We arrived in Sydney two days early without reservations. Chose the Menzies at the airport. The Chief Concierge, Andrew Austen was very helpful in reorganizing our itinerary. He made many calls to book a wine tour in the Hunter valley and arraigned return two days later. Sydney was in the midst of a 40 C + heat wave, when we returned to the Menzies, he saw how overheated my wife and I were and treated us to a nice cold beer and sparkling wine. He and the staff went over and above what we expected and made our stay enjoyable and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Bob1600
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here. The hotels location is great. It's within walking distance to Sidney and Darling harbors and many of the city's other great sites. The hotel also in across the street from super markets and other stores. Max Brenner's is around the corner. Hotel staff is very friendly. Rooms are average. Some think that rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kerry M Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised. The hotel is lovely and the staff very helpful and friendly. The room on the 7th floor was very quiet with lots of character. The bed was very comfortable and the air conditioning was very quiet. We had breakfast in the room and it was top notch too. Right next door to Wynyard so an easy stroll to the Quay or Market St. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although quite old now, we did enjoy our stay at the Menzies Hotel. Would be worthwhile renovating the hotel. I would remove the need for 200 characters in the review - I was close to cancelling the feedback because of this.

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 'Standard 1 King Bed Park View ' room. Room was perhaps a little more spacious than comparable hotels; bed was quite comfortable & had a sound sleep, though the a/c noise was unusually loud. Hotel is quite old, hence room was dated but acceptable. Location is central to Sydney CBD & Circular Quay/Rocks area with adjacent access to Wynyard Station. Car parking, because parking station is not owned by hotel, is more difficult than other hotels, but typical of inner city hotels. Can't comment on hotel meals/restaurants as we didn't utilise these services

Reviews.Title: “A Great "Stay at Home Vacation"”
Reviews.Author: werridaddio
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a quick 3 day 2 night stay at the Menzies Hotel Sydney on Carrington St. and we had a wonderful time. From check-in to check-out all could not have gone any smoother. Staff were friendly and helpful and the buffet breakfast was a lovely way to start our day. The hotel was perfectly positioned for all our day trips being only a 5 minute walk to either Darling Harbour or the Rocks. The hotel's entrance was literally across the road from Wynyard Station entrance and although it was so centrally located it was beautifully quiet during the day and night as it is not on a busy thoroughfare. Our room rates were very reasonable ($124 per night) and I would recommend a stay here anytime. PS - the only thing ..... the TVs in the room could be a little bigger for better viewing.

Reviews.Title: “Should be better”
Reviews.Author: dingo_joe
Reviews.Content: Only a 1 night stay on business trip. Great location opposite train station for easy airport access. I stayed in a standard room with Queen bed. The bed was not very comfortable, mattress not real good, thin pillows. bed linen did not stay in position, wrinkling and making for restless sleep. TV has lots of channels but volume was really weird, comfortable listening level on one station, flick to the next station and the volume was really loud, I'm sure people in other rooms would have heard it too, adjust volume and go to another station - and no volume, very frustrating. 1 litre of bottled water is overpriced at $8. In room internet also expensive : 30 mins $6, 1 hour $11, 24 hours $25. But the do have hotspot in lobby 30 mins is complimentary. Dinner in Parkside Resuarant was OK. I chose the set 2 course menu for $45. Entree was good, main was fish of the day, small size and fairly bland. Buffet breakfast in Carrington Restaurant is served from 6.30am until 10.00am Nothing fancy but adequate. Pancakes were badly presented, precooked in silver serving dish with lid. The condensation caused water to accumulate in bottom of serving dish leaving the bottom layer of pancakes sitting in a pool of water. Maple Syrup is presented in an oversize jug, making it difficult to pour a reasonable amount on the pancakes, I easily but accidentally poured over a cup of syrup on my plate leaving pancakes swimming again. Bathroom very small with shower over bathtub. Location less than 10 min walk Circular Quay, Harbour Bridge and The Rocks area. About 15 mins to Darling Harbour. I would only stay again due to location, and would try the next category room for maybe better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: Simon94410
Reviews.Content: When booking the hotel is shown as within the Accor network but when you arrive you'll be delighted to find that they don't take your A-Card. Also, despite having paid in full in advance for a 10 night stay as was my case, this hotel insists on debiting your card $50/day in advance for any of the the potential "extras" you may use, saying they will refund you the balance of what you don't use at the end of your stay. Lobby is dated. On getting to the floor, there are a fair amount of carpet stains in the corridor. As has been commented on here, the rooms are dated, but clean. Aircon output is feeble and insufficient to chill the room and at full blast all night offers no noticeable difference from the corridor in the morning. Bed and bedlinen look the same as Novotel (but remember you can't have Accor points for your stay). TV is basic with 11 channels, mostly all Australian and with only one or two International channels but in nay case all in English langauge. There is little storage for clothes other than a small wardrobe and one small drawer beneath the suitcase mount which is insufficient to contain the clothes required to be unpacked if staying beyond 2-3 days. Standard of room furniture is basic, but adequate: Bathroom is small. Ameneties: one small bar of soap, one small bottle of shampoo, one small bottle of body wash (note, small). Bathlinen varies from between paper thin towels to nearly new handcloths. Low quality loo paper and tissues. if you are an International traveller, forget using your worldwide power adaptor in the bathroom, it wont fit the socket, so you end up charging (or in my case having to use) your bathroom electricals in the bedroom. Water pressure in the bathrooms is poor thus the shower is a dribble more than jets of water. There are no glasses or plastic cups in the bathrooms, you will need to use the wine glass from the minibar. The small bottle of water by the bed in the room will cost $8 if you open it. The price label is turned backwards probably with the hope you open it before checking and therefore without realising the cost. Curtains hang with a gap of around 8" between wall and curtain rack and do not close properly in the middle (note, if you like to sleep in a dark room), Forget this hotel. Frankly, you are better in and Ibis. At least you know what you're going to get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Menzies on several occasions and will do so again. It is most convenient to get to from the airport, being directly opposite Wynyard rail station and is withing easy walking distance to most attractions around the city. Ther quality of rooms varies quite considerably however and we found that rooms at the rear of the hotel were exposed to comparatively high levels of noise from aircon plant external to the building. Our first room at the end of the corridor on floor 11 was quite unsatisfactory for such a prestigious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Badly needs a facelift and generally poor value for money... beds and pillows uncomfortable, service ordinary, towels worn out, bathroom was poor, rooms aged, but location great. Right near Wynard station and easily accessible. Major bus routes right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lousy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mariobrz
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind paying $30 more per night, book another hotel. This hotel is awful for business. It might be convenient for the location but the rooms doesn't even has a safe! Poor indoor pool area, the internet works only in the lobby (even if you pay $24 per day. had to change the hotel after flying 30 hours to get here. Hated the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Mezies has a great location, and is good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, poor breakfast, good (dinner) meals once only but same menu is tiring for a second dinner. Room cleaning seems to have dropped if staying mutliple nights - quite cursory after first night. A lot to like, with location being its greatest asset, but could be better if it really tried.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located central with easy access to trains, shops and restaurants. The staff were extremely helpful. The only downside was a bedside lamp that didn't work and the chlorine smell from the pool was a bit over powering

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is second to none”
Reviews.Author: DerMedicus
Reviews.Content: We booked shortly before travelling as our visit to Sydney was rather spontaneous. The special offer was excellent and we were pleased that a budget price did not equal a budget room. I cannot speak highly enough of all of the staff and their friendly demeanour throughout our stay, particularly the receptionist who checked us in, offered to change the rooms if the allocated ones were not to our liking and took care to explain relevant information. I will definitely be staying there again on future visits whether the special offer is still on or not. Good location also for everything one requires in the CBD and adjacent to the railway station from the airport/to the north shore. I cannot comment on kids activities because my children did not require them. I suspect there are no formal kids activities. I have marked very good because there is no "not applicable" option and I did not want to skew the marks down that I am giving this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only for the Location”
Reviews.Author: Azran1
Reviews.Content: Central convenient location. Right in front of Wynward Station. 500m to Circular Quay, as well as to the shopping areas, smack in the middle of the CBD. Other than that, this was very average. Service was ok, nothing to shout about. Room furnishings were basic. TV has basic. No CNN, CNBC or movie channels, only local channels. Internet is charged.

Reviews.Title: “Located right opposite the train station”
Reviews.Author: lisabutt Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is great as the train for the airport goes to the station across the road from the hotel. The staff are very helpful and welcoming and i couldnt fault their service. As this hotel is in the middle of the city it is a quick walk to Martin place or the rocks district. You can catch a bus or train to circular quay and the chinese gardens. There is afree bus that leaves from around the corner near Martin place that runs until 3.30pm and the concierge has a map showing the route. There is always 5 or more taxis waiting outside so transport isnt a problem. The only complaint i had is the walls are very thin and you can hear all the hallway noise and water running from other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. No frills room.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Menzies is located across a major train station and is a 5 min walk to Circular Quay, Rocks and the Queen Victoria Building. Stay on George street to go to Paddy's market for your souvenir shopping. If you plan on being in your room as little as possible, then this hotel is for you. I just needed a place to sleep, clean up and leave my stuff. No room safe, but there is a hotel safe deposit box free of charge. My room wasn't anything like I pictured on the website, but it did what I needed it to do. If you know how to dial locally, then use the public phone outside and save yourself a couple of bucks. Can't stress enough how good my location was. Not sure if it is a spot that a first-timer would like, but if you aren't new to Sydney, you'll agree that the location is really convenient.

Reviews.Title: “OLDE WORLD CHARM”
Reviews.Author: diandave32 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice location opposite railway, i block from free city bus, short walk to Circular Quay. Beaut decor in foyer and public areas. Breakfast a bit expensive, but depends on individual's needs. Pretty ordinary for price. Only criticism, was not told the hotel would keep the $200.00 on my advance credit card for 2 weeks before releasing it. I use a low credit limit and if I had spent up I could exceed my limit without knowing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pros Service was fantastic. Great location and great value. Enjoyed the buffet breakfast. Cons Some of the furnishings need a freshen up/update (some areas where wall paper starting to peel). Pillow bit lumpy. Overall Enjoyed our stay, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, charm of the past”
Reviews.Author: robinyoung255323
Reviews.Content: We booked here a night before a cruise in December, 2011. Good points.... The location is excellent 10/10. Right opposite Wnyard station, and taxi rank at door. Close to Circular Quay and many Sydney attractions 10/10 Beautiful foyer and heaps of charm. 10/10 Room was spacious. 8/10 Beds outstanding! 10/10 Price was excellent $180 for the 2 of us 10/10 Handy little shop downstairs Bad points.. We booked a 2 bed room (I had my 18 year old son with me) but given a queen bed, but they moved us as soon as I notified them The shower in our room was broken (the head just fell against wall making it impossible to shower). I phoned down ,and because there was no one to fix it at 10pm, they said they would move us (again) however we were in pyjamas and ready to sleep. My son got tape and taped it up so I could shower. Breakfast was $33 and VERY overpriced. It was good, but not that good to justify $33. Checkout was a nightmare., People 8 deep in queues. Halls were shabby and ugly (hotel was being done up) but this will improve Overall.... I would stay here again for sure and would recommend it for sure Overall, I give this a 9/10. The few little problems were fixed, and the drabby halls are being done up

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location...”
Reviews.Author: LauraGolf
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first visit to Sydney and stayed at The Menzies. We had a terrific few days. The hotel is in the best location, right across the road from Wynyard Station. We couldn't believe how close it was to Circular Quay and The Opera House also the ferries and bars and restaurants. We stayed in a standard double double room as we are a family of 4. The room was large, yes it is a bit dated but more than adequate and had everything we needed. When you are in Sydney you spend minimal time at your hotel and for the price and location it was great. The check in with Ryan and check out with Jasmin were easy and friendly and as we had a flight at 9pm we left our luggage there all day with the concierge which was a great service. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Night out”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay..again, hotel is very well situated to get around the city. We were going to the Capitol Theatre, only a matter of going throught to George Street and hopping on a bus. So easy to get around

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: reet02
Reviews.Content: We changed our previous reservation from Kings Cross for the Menzies hotel due to better location and better price and I am extremely happy that I did. The location is perfect walking distance to everywhere, no need to use public transportation at all. The room with 2 double beds was quite spacious, beds were comfortable, room was clean. Furniture was a bit outdated but it was comfortable and charming. On the first days the air-con did not work properly, but later I played with the switch that did not have proper contact and later it turned on. This was not a problem because the weather was not so hot after all. There was a good sized swimming pool inside that was quite refreshing. Free Wifi internet could be used for 20 minutes every 24 hours in the lobby. Parking was expensive, with a discount it was still was 45 $ per night. The hotel staff was very helpful, they even gave us a map with the viewing point to see the New Years Eve fireworks. We enjoyed our stay and we recommend this hotel, will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I woudl stay in this hotel again and enjoy the location and comfort. It was easy access form the airport and the train station was opposite. I found the location also convenient for the CBD but also for the more touristy areas. It was within easy walking distance to the Rocks and Circular Quay. The porter and concierge staff were helpful and were happy to assist me in finding phone numbers. Checkin was efficient and so too was checkout. The rooms were tired but clean and the bed very comfortable. Due to a late meeting I had to order room service and, walthough i was told it woudl take 30 mins, it arrived in ten minutes and was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged on the mini bar - and not just in the usual way.”
Reviews.Author: Brendan G
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at The Menzies recently and just received my bill for the mini bar, only to find that my 3 beers and bag of peanuts I purchased had blown out to include $35 worth of extra goods that weren't even in the room when I arrived. Apart from having no problems with any of the hotels other services or characteristics, it is quite annoying to have to chase around unfairly charged money due to poor monitoring of the mini bar inventory between guests. Here's hoping I even get my money back; what a rort!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Could not ask for a better location at such a reasonable price - (am an Accor Advantage member, so that makes a difference). Yes some say the hotel is looking a bit weary but it adds to it's charm. The staff are all very helpful and friendly and are happy to assist - treat them with respect and they will in return. Enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Coming late from the airport by train, right to the door of our favorite motel.Breakfast then a dip in the pool before a swift book out all culminated in a great stay. Some of the older rooms need a revamp of the bathrooms but sleeping quarters were as always - excellent. Staff were great and makes traveling with a nine year od a pleasure. When staying in Sydney this his favorite, may have something todo with the heated pool and spa. Very relaxing and a great way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Charm!”
Reviews.Author: Resplatser
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! The location is great! Close to many things. It has an old charm with lots of details in dark wood. There was a good access to a computer with decent price. The room was ok but not spectacular. I would like to stay there again if I went to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “style with convenience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Menzies, I was impressed with the customer service and also the facility in general. The motel is easily accessible being across the road from Wynard train station and a hop step and a jump to free bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies-- the very tired Grande Dame!”
Reviews.Author: BrianHalpin Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Menzies on occasions over the years. THE BAD SIDE On this occasion the room was in need of renovation. The mattress needed replacing. It was soft and if one slept near the edge one tended to slide out of the bed.The furniture & carpet were stained. (one chair in particular had nine separate stainings). The bathroom had accumulated deposits of dirt along the skirting boards of the door opening.The plumbing was not working properly so much that faecal material (not ours) came back into the bowl. Even after the problem was 'fixed' by staff the toilet did not flush properly. It was also noted that the leather chairs in the lounge area of the hotel were tired and two had crack/tears in them. THE GOOD SIDE The location of this hotel is great. The staff of this hotel are very personable..

Reviews.Title: “Menzies Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at The Menzies many times over the last couple of years & always felt it lived up to my expectations & have always parked our car in the hotel car park however onthe last occasion only we felt the new fee was too high ($45/ night) used to be $25 on the last visit only several months back, . we would consider alternative accommodation only based on the car parking fee

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay in the city”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great location - across the street from Wynyard train station which makes getting places very easy. The Concierge was a little useless but the ladies at the front desk were lovely and the hotel was clean and easy. Great facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, hotel is a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of the Menzies is great. The hotel though is average. There were only double beds in the room, the tv was smaller than a standard computer monitor and the room itself was tired. It needs a revamp to bring it up to standard again. $31 for breakfast is a bit rich for the buffet breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good location in good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely old character to this hotel in the lobby and the first floor restaurant. Rooms are comfortable with good choice of window ventiliation or AC. Breakfast room was a little bleak with no windows and breakfast not particularly flash for the money - it wasn't much different from an IBIS hotel breakfast range which is 40% less in price. Overwise, good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value and needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: djrg123
Reviews.Content: Had to stay at the Menzies mid-week on a work trip to Sydney. The location is good - particuarly in regards to access to public transport. The hotel is old and needs refurbishment badly. Stayed in a room with no internet option - old shabby furniture and poor lighting. There was also a 15 minute queue at check-in and in the morning the queue to check out was out the door. Apart from paying an exorbitent price for the room rate, was then forced to pay a credit card surcharge for paying by card (didin't matter what card it was). Would not stay there again by choice.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Morgs1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Menzies for three nights in January 2012. Overall this hotel is average, rooms are very dated. Location is good and you can walk to the rocks or darling harbour easily in around 5-10 mins. Train station is directly across the road. Buffett breakfast is expensive (around $30) and not very good!!! Restaurant is also quite expensive. Staff are helpful and friendly. This is a 4 star hotel charing 5 star prices. We payed over $200 per night and it definately wasnt worth it. If you can get a room for around $130 then that would be reasonable but it definately is not worth any more than that. I wont be staying here again and I wouldnt recommend it as i believe it is overpriced and dated.

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very clean an appealing appearance. Check-in desk and conceirge most friendly and efficient. Room was very good overlooking the park. I appreciated the magazines in the room. Breakfast was very good a great selection of dishes, most enjoyable. I highly recommend the Menzies to fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “....”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very enjoyable and a great location. The staff were happy to help with anything at all. We were very disappointed with the breakfast though..........................................................................................................................

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and character”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Extremely simple to access public transport and the heart of the CBD. Short walk to most CBD attractions including the Markets, other tourist areas and large shopping complexes. Many late night or 24 hour 7-11 style stores close by and Max Brenners Chocolate just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very good, friendly service. In an excellent location for walking to Darling Harbour and just minutes to The Rocks. Was excellent for our purpose of the "Harbour Bridge Climb". The rooms were a good size, comfortable beds and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were quite clearly booked in 2 adults and 2 children, but only had 2 towels on arrival, that wasn't a major issue though, we just brought 2 back from the pool. Next morning room was serviced, still only replaced with 2 towels, same next morning. Didn't get clean washers at all. No sugar refill on the second day. I know we could have called down to reception to have these things sent up, but I dislike calling up about menial things like that, they are just standard things that you would expect from even a 1 or 2 starred hotel, it should just be done automatically. Found the rooms a bit under the value for money, but that was to be expected giving the location and time of year. Room and bathroom could have been a bit cleaner, under the beds needed a vacuum, I think that that should be a standard thing as well. Other than the little things, we really enjoyed our stay, kids loved the pool. Location is great!

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pstylist
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the suite on the top floor & loved every second of my Stay here. As it was a working trip, I needed a hotel right in the city and having stayed in other 5* hotels in the city, I would only return here as it has everything. The only downside is paying for wifi which is still a huge requirement for me! I book hotels around the world and always choose the one with 'free' wifi so this would be my only criticism but overall great stay in a great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “housekeeping leaves a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The beds were never made..the quilt was pulled up to cover rumpled sheets! No fresh glasses replaced the dirty ones. We walked past a breakfast tray that had been left in the hall..it stayed there for 2 days. The bathroom was always freshed up...so that was a plus. I was very disappointed with the hotel..one of the pleasures of staying in a hotel is the nice freshly made beds..

Reviews.Title: “Accor menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: rhe decor and service was excellent, the only exeception being one young girl with untidy hair in main dinning room who without being rude was very abrupt. the ammenties are great the location perfect. Have been there twice before, and look forward to it again,hopefully New Year ( if the price is not jacked too much.) P.S. Always look forward to the fine dinning menu

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Joghols
Reviews.Content: We booked a park view room on a Saturday night and for the rate we paid, it was excellent. Our request for a high floor was granted and we were also given a $10 discount off the breakfast buffet. The hotel is not modern but the staff were all lovely and the room was fine. I also booked a room in December 2010 at the Menzies and because they couldn't provide us with a park view room on that night, they offered us complimentary breakfast. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a cheaper option to the modern city hotels and also for it's great location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in the heart of the CBD”
Reviews.Author: AmandaC3 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Would return to the Menzies for any family or corporate stay in Sydney CBD. What isn't in walking distance is only a short cab ride away. The hotel has all required facilities - restaurant/bar, pool, sauna, giftshop etc. Rooms were clean and as booked.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay , expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: all good except for the parking situation. we decided to take the trip based on the pre-xmas specials. having stayed at the Menzies before i didnt remember parking costing $45 a night to park, it took the edge of the special and soured what was otherwise a pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Menzies was very pleasant. The kids enjoyed the pool and the reaturant meals were superb and great value with the accor card discount.
