The room was comfortable but average and in need of an update in fixtures, although the beds were extremely comfortable. One of the best nights sleep I've had in a hotel bed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal, close to cruise port and ferries, and clean room”
Reviews.Author: JulietheCruiseDir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Menzies hotel the night before leaving on a cruise in December 2011. We booked through Novotel website, and got the room and breakfast for 2 adults and 2 children for about $130 USD, which was a fabulous deal for a hotel in downtown Sydney, so much so that we were anxious that it would be yucky when we arrived. The hotel is literally right across the street from Wynard Station, the train that we took from the Sydney airport. We arrived at 11:00 AM and hoped to be able to leave our bags after 2 long flights, but instead they let us check in. Our room was small but clean with 2 double beds (doubles are hard to find in Europe and Australia...usually traditional hotels, not to be confused with backpacker hotels or family hostels, usually only accomodate 3 people). We got a map from the concierge and immediately wallked (about 3 city blocks; again very walkable) to the ferries to catch a ride to Manly Beach and then the Zoo. We went to the pool in the morning, and got postcards and soda form the small attached shop. Breakfast was a full buffet and quite good. Then we walked to the cruise terminal in the morning. Great stay and would recomment to any families, couples, or friends interested in a close and inexpensive stay in Sydney, especially if you are leaving on a cruise at the Overseas Terminal in Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but Tired...”
Reviews.Author: NotYourTypicalAussie
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is in a great location just opposite Wynyard Station, 5 minutes walk to The Rocks, and right in town. Only 1 agent working reception on check in, so we had to wait a few minutes which was not a problem, just noticeable! Room on the 10th floor was clean and reasonably modern, and quiet. Looked like it has just had a makeover as the carpet on the suitcase bench was still the old blue classic style carpet. The bathroom had all the cons like shampoo, etc. Took a while to work out how to flush the loo. It flushes by flicking a light switch on the wall!!! Although the hotel has a few lifts, it seemed only 1 was working at a time causing some congestion, especially on the grond floor. Breakfast was the usual run-of-the-mill buffet style. Absolutely satisfactory but nothing to write home about. Piano bar was nice on the 1st floor. Reception offered buy 1 get one free so we made use the the Piano bar one evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: bakers4564
Reviews.Content: The location is great and is within walking distance to all the sights and sounds of Sydney. The Hotel is located across from the Wynyard Rail Station. We caught the Green Rail Line from the Sydney International Airport Terminal directly to the Wynyard Rail Station out and across the street right into the Hotel. Now the Menzies Hotel Lobby is a 4 Star, but the 2-bedroom was a 3 Star. The hotel rooms are small and old, no other way to put it â€“ SMALL and OLD. The 18â€™ LCD TV is just too small. The restaurant that served breakfast was great! No free wifi in the room and only 30 minutes of free wifi in the lobby. Now, the question is - would I stay in the Menzies Hotel again? YES! Great location!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: janns_10
Reviews.Content: The Men\ies was clean, very well located. We could walk to the Sydney Opera House, the Rocks, the Quay, Queen Vicoria Building, groceries, tour transportation. The one problem with our room was that there was no where to place our suitcases, except on the bed. The room was devoid of any type of tablechair or suitcase stand and had minimal floor space. But it was so well located and priced, we just put up with the smallness.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: margnmike
Reviews.Content: The location is central with lots of public transport very close by. Parking under the building is convenient but expensive, even at the special rate for hotel guests. The room was small even though it was on the "executive floor"and the bathroom was tiny. No wifi except in the lobby for 30 minutes every 24 hours. Had to turn off the air conditioning it was so cold (the outside temp was over 30) and then the room became very stuffy. Lots of noise from the bathroom next door and general building noises during the night. The lifts were not working properly and had to wait about 10 minutes for one to come to the 12th floor, only to get stuck on the first floor. Room service was fairly prompt and good value. The place could do with a good refurbishment, but it is not bad value as is due to its location. The staff were all very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: OzzieMuse
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in early January. I always try and find positive things even when I rate on a poor scale. I'm from a Hotel background and have worked most areas in hotels and have worked for a few international brands. I found the lack of service and lack of friendliness among the staff the most notable. 3 people serving behind reception and I was left standing there for a few minutes before one deemed themselves ready to aks me if I needed help. Bad. Not a great start as first impressions stick. Considering I was the only one waiting, I thought this very bad customer service. Although while waiting, I must admit the foyer, lobby area is very nice and would be a nice area to have a drink or relax in the large comfortable looking chairs. After checking in and being assigned a room, I was not given any information about the hotel, amenities, or even how to get to my room. I had to ask where do I go to get to my room. It's the little details like this that makes a great hotel stand out from the crowd. I didn't feel like I was special, or even appreciated, but more just another part of the staff's daily routine they had to deal with. Bad again. And where were the smiles? Ok, so I am comparing my stay to my many visits to Thailand where I always feel welcome and appreciated. That's terrible that I feel more welcome in another country rather than my own. The room was ok. Clean, smelt ok, nice king sized bed. Sorry, back to the negaitves again: lousy thin pillows. Actually would rate them the worst I've ever had to sleep on. So thin it was almost like it wasn't even there--apart from the lumps all the way through. There were no bathrobes or coathangers or slippers anywhere I could find. The bathroom was on the tiny side, although it did have a basin, toilet, and a bath even a midget would find small. And then there was the noise. Yep, that night we could hear other people flushing toilets and also people having showers. Luckily for me I sleep with earplugs so when I went to sleep I didn't hear any more noise. The only other thing worth mentioning was the elevators. They were posssessed. Each time we went up or down, it decided to take us to the lower level first. Very odd. Oh, and as I left, and said good morning to the guy on the door, who briefly glanced up from his morning news paper to mumble a greating back. Talking of back. We certianly won't be.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but tired - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel knowing it was good 'value' (reasonably proced) for a city centre hotel. By far it's greatest attribute was the location - right outside Wynyard train station direct to the airport, yet walking distance from everywhere important. The rooms were clean enough but VERY tired and in need of redecoration, as was the corridoor our room was in as well. We didn't use the bars or restaurants as we went out all the time so can't comment. We ordered room service one night which took an absolute age and tasted like it was a frozen packet lasagne from a microwave, so didn't do that again. So if you want somewhere adequate, reasonably priced in a fantastic locatiojn that you just want to sleep in it's excellent....just don't expect anything too tidy... would probably go again due to the location. It was also very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “OLD STYLE”
Reviews.Author: HMW73 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Menzies Sydney is centaly located for CBD, reasonably comfortable, with pleasant olde worlde dining room, but in need o serious reno to rooms.. & NO in room safe. staff at reception friendly & efficient.

Reviews.Title: “We will return”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will return. Just 2 suggestions to make: 1. It would be great to see a reading lamp installed above the bed head (for each person). The bedside lamp is too dim and too low to be useful for reading. 2. It is a great idea to encourage reusing towels, but it will not be a successful initiative until there are adequate towel rails - heated ones preferred. For two people there is not enough space to air and dry towels well enough.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: Longdrop
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the 2011 New Year primarily for shopping and the fireworks. The Menzies is expensive $A700+ for 31/12 but cheaper during normal times ($A250). It is very centrally located short walks to Circular Quay, Pitt St and Darling harbour, very convenient for tour buses and the trains. Rooms are large if a bit jaded and although Sydney restaurants are generally expensive in the city the inhouse restaurant is surprisingly one of the best value. Breakfast is good and excellent value with the $A10 discount for guests. Service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Tired, but central”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Menzies to attend a city wedding and the location was perfect. The hotel is opposite Wynyard station so a train from the airport direct to the hotel is ideal. The lobby isn't too bad actually, was nice enough if you needed to relax and wait for someone but I wouldn't go out of my way to hang out. The room we stayed in was tiny but did have a king size bed (albeit the sheets didn't fit the bed). The bathroom was miniscule, plenty of cracks in the walls, but seemed clean overall. The hotel was built in 1963 and it shows. Not much else to report on, choose the hotel because of it's location and nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “bazjules”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Menzies on the 27th primarily for a sporting event. We also went out to Lowenbrau at the rocks. The staff were very helpful and the carpark is a little bit of a challenge. All in all it is a great location, well priced and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies-Carrington Street”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Has a lovely night at The Menzies, staff were helpful and friendly, room was clean and quiet.Even though we arrived early our room was ready for check in, the consierge was very helpful.The lobby is very comfortable and a pleasant place to relax. The room was clean and quiet, took us a few seconds to work out the toilet as we were looking for a button flush but turned out to be a switch.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived the morning AFTER our booking, but were allowed to change days on the spot and without penalty because our rooms were not available that minute. I was delighted - it was my mistake - but Menzies check-in made an immediate decision and made the change - well done. No arguments, no "check with boss", no extended begging.

Reviews.Title: “Experience Feedback”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good for city functions and would be recommeded and personally reused due to this, however, The hotel interior and rooms are very tired and drab. The hotel experience would be a lot mopre pleasant and welcoming if rooms were refurbished along a fresh and clean update. The untidy personal presentation of the conceirge did not enhance the initial appearance of the hotel in the first instance.

Reviews.Title: “In the centre of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Rosscoe68
Reviews.Content: Booked direct via the Accor website and got a great rate. Room was nothing special, but served what it needed to do. Booked a second night, asked only for clean towels which was not a problem. Later in the day asked for more toilet paper, five hours later was still waiting. It would seem that housekeeping finishes around three in the afternoon. Had issues with the hotels Internet, ringing the front desk I was told in a matter of a fact way that the issue was me. Second call to front desk was meet with a well if I have to call someone I will. 90 minutes later still no one. Left to get dinner and told front desk again about Internet issues. Back from dinner still no Internet, once again told by front desk that this was my issue. Took laptop down stairs and was finally told this error message was an error on there behave. No offer to fix, was told basically to suck it up, when I asked if I could move room, was answered with somebody will need to watch you pack! Over all I felt the hotel was okay for what I payed, room was older style. Service left this hotel down the most, when bringing any issue to light, leaving it and hoping I will go away is not the best business practice.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I took advantage of a special offer to stay at the Menzies. It's a hotel that I remember from my childhood for its calm, elegant atmosphere. Positioned right in the middle of Sydney, close to rail, bus and ferry transport, but on a quiet park, it's ideal for visitors. My room was small, clean, comfortable and very quiet (as I requested). Perhaps there were rather too few pictures on the wall and the in-room tea-making facilities a bit spartan, but there was loads of hot water in an excellent shower, nice clean towels and handy iron/ironing board for freshening up clothes. For the money, excellent value I think.

Reviews.Title: “good location, tired room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location for city & Rocks sightseeing & eating out. Room was VERY tired though bed comfy. Swift hot water in bathroom is the best I can say - lighting was appalling (to shave or do make up here was really difficult, the room's bar area was much better lit!). Buffet breakfast most disappointing - tepid coffee, fruit bowls empty & no sign of being replenished - an hour or more before dining room closed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, right next to the train station, free bus stops, restaurants. 10 minutes walk to harbor bridge and opera house. Very friendly staff and very helpful when we need any help. They go above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. I am glad we chose this hotel for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Sydney accommodation venue”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We visit Sydney from New Zealand usually two to three times a year, and find the Menzies a comfortable, well serviced place to base ourselves from a convenient central location. Martin & Alison Skerman

Reviews.Title: “The challenges of the Switches!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. My only problem was some of the difficulty withequipment such as the lighting in the room. There was no booklet of instruction in the room. Any of the problems could have been easily solved if such information had been available. e.g. Switching the tv on to the free channels. After receiving a message on the screen that there was a problem with the service and to contact the reception, I could not find a number with which to contact the rception short of taking a trip down to it. This same message came up four times before by chance I pressed a button on the remote which took me into the free channels! Another problem related to the standard light. It was not until the second day that by chance I discovered which switch related to this lantern and was not not working for me because of teh almost hidden dimmer buttons on the lantern! The airconditioning I also could not turn off, merely to a minimum. Fortunately there was a great great blanket available which kept me from freezing and minimising leg cramps I ended up with. Finally I also had trouble discovering hw to flush the toilet only doing so the next day by chance in turning on what I though was a light switch over the wash basin! These are not really complaints but more challengers I have not experienced in other hotels where I have stayed!

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: enjoyed our stay at the Menzies, great location to the rocks, cafes clubs etc. rooms were a great size. bathroom really nice. breakfast was lovely and service was good. would stay there again, close to staions.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappionted”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For starters when i booked in did not have a booking then i had to go onto the internet on my phone to produce confirmation, the booking was under PAMELA RYAN nothing like LOUISE- so this was inconvient i booked it on line and they could not even get the name right. There was 3 people in room only 2 towels and apparently i was meant to ask for another towel, If i booked for 3 people they SHOULD know to give me 3 towels... I called for room service ordered my meals had to tell the girl 3 times what i wanted ordered 2 chicken bugers with lettuce and mayo only & a pizza & 2 pepsis when the meal came i got 1 chicken burger with sauce i did not want and 2 plates of chips??? figure that one out??? and the pizza and drinks............ Whilst i was ordering tea i ordered a couple of pepsi and wanted a water and thought its okay i would get it out of the minibar but then realising not one bit of mini barin the room.. NOTHING....then did get questioned on this when i checked out she asked why did i not ring down to reception and tell them --- i was going out to a concert with the kids and was over the whole thing and really did not have time to stuff around anymore than i had already. The the bed was the most uncomfortable i have ever ever slept in. I am a advatage plus member and i would say it would be by far the worst i have stayed at., and i have stayed a quite a few. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “location...location...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: a little overpriced for what you got but the locality made it worthwhile.... handy to walk where ever you want to go & Railway link saves Taxi $$ even from the Airport.... easy as !! I loved that ...

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: Lilian T
Reviews.Content: I've travelled to more than 20 major cities in 15 countries & nothing has disappointed me more than this hotel. The reception was cold (we didn't even get the hint of a smile). Room is nowhere near the online photos and so we felt cheated. The carpet is worn out & had holes. The aircon temp control isn't working. The tv is very small & Foxtel channels showed old films. The bathroom is smelly and wasn't cleaned the next day, ie, dirt & hair strands were on the floor, tub & sink. The soaps, shampoo & shower cap we used weren't replaced the following day. Check-out wasn't smooth. I tried to call the front desk twice to advise we were checking out but no one answered. Our bill was pre-paid & we didn't get anything from the "mini-bar" so you'd think check out would take 30 secs, but it took 7 min or so because there was only one girl manning the counter. Anything positive? Great location, and I liked the pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Not a patch on Asia”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the cost of living in Sydney is alarming, even more so when one is charged $8 for a bottle of water when tap water is perfectly drinkable, $90 for parking when, if you managed it yourself it'd cost $50, and $56 for a decidedly average breakfast without an espresso coffee in sight. That said, our stay was acceptable, relatively speaking. Relative to similar hotels in Sydney - but absolutely no comparison to the competition in Asia in service, room quality, aesthetic and cost. The best thing about the Menzies was it's super location. We'll be back, but will spend a bit more and stay in a real 5- star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SydneySasa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Menzies on 17th December as we wished to see the wonderful Sydney illuminations and enjoy a relaxing evening afterwards. We upgraded to a Superior Room and had dinner at the Parkside Restaurant. The service was excellent and the food was first class cuisine. After seeing the illuminations we made our way to the piano bar where we had a wonderful evening. The pianist was excellent and the whole atmosphere was such fun with everyone joining in singing Christmas carols. The only downside of our stay would be the breakfast - why can't Sydney hotels have warm plates on which to place our hot breakfasts. By the time one gets back to the table the food has gone cold and the cost I feel is exhorbitant. One would be better off going down to Circular Quay and having a freshly prepared HOT breakfast and pay a fraction of the cost. Having said that, would I recommend the Menzies - YES I WOULD. The staff are very friendly, the location is excellent and the cost - very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but What A Let Down”
Reviews.Author: marlowstevens Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Completely overpriced for aged three star accommodation in Australia's most vibrant city, with rooms offering a pungent smell of decay. Not a member of A-Club, and the Accor Advantage Plus membership meant that I paid more than available pricing on-line. I did not know that TVs were still available in such small sizes, (ideal for a car). Housekeeping forgot two days in a row to clean properly and even though the air conditioning did not work in one room, three days after reporting nothing was done. I also received an incorrect charge to the mini bar, which after three emails was refunded. I can however, recommend the excellent food in the main restaurant. Even though the breakfast fare was incredibly ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “thank you”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and great service. Getting around in Sydney was so easy from the hotel (Circular Quay and darling Harbour were such a short walk). The only criticism I had was that there was no toaster in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A historic hotel with promise that comes up a bit short. Great location. The lobby is inviting, restaurant, pool, gym, etc. Rooms were completely underwhelming, small, underappointed. The beds had THE cheapest mattresses I've ever slept (lousy) on. You could feel and hear every spring. Had the actual room been better, then I'd highly recommend. As is, I found it poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “One more good stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Menzies once or twice a year with a friend for a catch up. As she travels from fhe north and I travel from the south it is so handy being right at Wynyard Station. The rooms are so quiet at night we always have a restful sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Not Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Menzies is reasonable, not the nicest place I have stayed in. King bed appeared to be smaller than King beds of other hotels I have stayed in, if thats even possible. Concierege gave me a swipe card that didnt work, and there was also a bit of confusion when attempting to book in the other rooms I had booked. Booked a "park view room" and to my surpsrise the window was the smallest view I had ever come across. Curtains would not fully shut however hard I tried, resulting in light streaming in and directly onto the bed as soon the sun came up.

Reviews.Title: “43rd wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was very good. The staff on floor 12 seemed very happy to be working there ans with their floor supervisor, whom we also found very friendly. The breakfast was a bit overpriced, but the restaurant looked a little old and tired.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, very close to everything that you need in the CBD. Only thing is one of the lifts were broken down, the hallways in the hotel are a bit dark and gloomy, and rooms are a little run down. Could do with some light renos (lick of paint and some brighter light globes here and there) other than that, cannot fault the Menzies. Excellent staff

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Bob5432
Reviews.Content: We found the location to be very good. Not too far of a walk to the Rocks or the Circle Quay. We did a lot of site seeing by foot and found that the Menzies to be very centrally located for what we wanted to see. The rooms were somewhat small but nicely furnished with nice bathroom and shower. The reception desk seemed understaffed for both check in and check out.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel in great location. The hotel reception was understaffed on entry which would have improved the overall stay. The rooms are small but clean and well appointed. The price of stay was exceptionally low for sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My son and I have stayed at the Menzies twice a year for the last 4 years it is convienent, gret loction and very friendly and helpful staff. Would highly recommend it to anyone with youg children. The location is excellent as Wynyard station is across the street making it accesible to the airport andwalking distance from harbour, the rocks and the city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great email received before our stay. Desk welcome was ordinary. Cleaning was less than expected. Bed mattress was old saggy and uncomfortable and toilet and shower use next door was obvious. Couldn't get coffee at the piano bar on first night and found that area too noisy or rowdy to use. We ate at nearby restaurants. Position was excellent but will check out other nearby hotels in future. Sorry to give such a dismal evaluation.

Reviews.Title: “Great position but freezing cold air-conditioning”
Reviews.Author: AnnieQ4153 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great position for a Sydney Hotel but the room was freezing and no matter how the airconditioning controls were manipulated it made no difference. We didn't spend much time there in the daytime and just got the extra blankets out at night, so we could be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Ageing Gracefully?”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here mainly for it's convenient location. Whilst staff and services were good the rooms show the signs of aging. The TV and carpets were recent but the walls, bed and fittings need refurbishment. Not up to advertised standard.

Reviews.Title: “Suggestion”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: With the seemingly oversized trays for room service, it is impossible to take the tray from the staff at the door. This meant that on two occasions the staff had to continue on in to the room to place the tray safely on the bed. Given that my wife was in bed on both occasions it was somewhat embarrassing for her and probably for the staff as well. The large tray size may be to impress the guests but it seems both unnecessary and less manageable for the staff. A safety issue with hot beverages.

Reviews.Title: “experience at Menzies.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Room size is too small. May be because of the Sydney city center. Big timing gap between Check out and Check in time. 10.30a.m. check out and 2.00p.m. check in. Need to arrange room priorities as per customers arrivals. Good facilities of swimming, gym etc... but too small looking at the size of hotel. Location is excellent. Major attractions are on walking distance. Ample parking space at extra additional cost. Public transport is on the door step.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RhoKnuckles
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part a group block for a school trip so I don't know the price value, but I would say the value as a whole is average. For my first time in Sydney I can't compare to other hotels in the area but it's has a great location with The Rocks and many tourist areas in walking distance. The bus and train are also near by. By looking at the website, I was in a superior room and also a corner so it was nice and bright with two windows and fully stock mini-bar. Apparently the mini-bar is on honor system? as when I checked out they asked if i took anything. Never been asked before, always been sensor charged or housekeeper would see by inventory. The flat screen on the wall is a little too small to be placed bare on the wall and looks awkward, a larger TV is needed. The hotel also had 24 hour room service which was much needed when me and my school buddies would come back from a night out and be able to get sandwiches are 4am.

Reviews.Title: “Shower Curtain had black mold on hem!!!”
Reviews.Author: Enjoy2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the north wing and the first thing I noticed when we walked into the room was a smell from the bathroom. I called and someone came and sprayed a fragrance. Was OK for a while but noticed black mold on the hem of our shower curtain when I took a shower. YUK! Asked if they could change the shower curtain - that was on Monday and no one came to do that until Wednesday. Didn't receive shampoo one day so called and was told it would be sent up right away. No it wasn't. Had to call next morning before I took a shower. Still was a smelly bathroom! The room was very outdated with windows right next to an office building. Needless to say we couldn't open our curtains because we could see people working in the office building right across from our room. Room felt dark and dreary and worn with a small TV that offered limited reception. Other than a desk chair, there wasn't any place to sit and relax - had to lay or sit on bed. Ate in restaurant one day for lunch and it was very good. Reception people were very friendly though but wouldn't recommend staying there until rooms are updated and fresh!

Reviews.Title: “Once Upon a Mattress”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My reservation for four nights called for a standard parkview room with a king bed. Upon arrival after a fifteen hour flight from LA, I was greeted warmly and was told I was being upgraded to a large parkview room with big windows. HINT: Big windows equals a room in the far wing (elevators past the gift shop). Don't go there. Room was large but the mattress was horrible...so soft your body sunk in so deep a pillow was not needed. After two nights of this misery and an aching back, I asked for a room change. I was initally accommodated with a wooden board under the mattress which was hilarious. I refused this fix and was finally moved into a room in the main building above the lobby. This room was smaller but afforded me a view of the park through a single window and a king size bed with a normally firm mattress. In addition, this room had a comfortable club chair plus a desk with chair. Both rooms had small 24" flat screen televisions with an acceptable amount of stations. The Parkview Restaurant (for dinner only) was very expensive, but the staff was friendly. The hotel is right across the street from Wynyard Station on City Rail, a direct run to and from the airport. There is a supermarket on the second level of the station which is a great place to buy food and drink at a regular prices. The hotel was nothing special, but lower in price than some of the alternatives. If you can sleep on any kind of mattress, it's a good choice. If not, beware!

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in North wing that is showing its age. Tv screen was smaller than my laptop and expected a lot more. Great CBD location & good bar area. Room is in need of upgrading as are the common areas. ADSL was ok however most hotels are now offering free adsl.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - but need to replenish mini-bar”
Reviews.Author: Travellor69 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with wonderfully warm and friendly frontline team members. It just gives me the irates when the minibar isn't replinished and you don't know what has and what hasn't been registered....I would recommend business travellers to this hotel - the best place to check in to when arriving from the airport - catch the $15.00 train and it takes you almost to the front door....!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Review of Menzies Hotel, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have always found the Menzies an excellent place to stay and the staff are always courteous and helpful. We will be returning towards the end of January. We particularly like the closness to Wynyard Station as this is our main public transport usage whenever we stay at the Menzies.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but still disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies comes with an excellent reputation and so I was expecting more for the amount I paid. I rang the concierge for info for the Accor voucher I had and he was reluctant to find out the info I needed. The wait service was disappointing - I don't think the staff were trained properly. The waitress served us in a rush even though there wasn't a lot of patrons in the restaurant and there was a fair wait for our first cocktail - which was worth the wait, by the way ;-) One of our desserts was returned because of poor quality. The amount was taken from the bill but a substitute wasn't offered which I thought unusual. One of the beds was lumpy. I sound like a whinger but I really expected more and was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: winifred711
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we had a function close by. The hotel is located in a great spot there are heaps of resturants nearby,the Rocks & circular quay all in walking distance. The room was clean though not one of the biggest i have stayed in but ok if your only sleeping there and not spending a lot of time in there. TV was really small that is my only complaint but again we were not there to watch TV. Staff were really helpful, would stay there again i booked online and for Sydney the rates were quite reasonable, checked out the resturant menu for dinner it looked good but really expensive & there is no need to pay top dollar as there is so much choice within easy walking distance!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Menzies Great!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for this old world style hotel in the heart of Sydney. Opposite Wynyard Station at which the airport train stops. Easy walking distance from Circulay Quay (ferries) and The Rocks historical area - do not miss the Rocks market on Sundays.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was great and clean! Good service from everyone. Good gym and Indoor pool. Friendly staff! Perfect location to get aroud the CBD of Sydney. Busses and trains next door. Walking distance to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, Town Hall, Sydney Tower and Pittstreet Mall, etc..

Reviews.Title: “High priced poor accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was very small, a single width wardrobe, no storage room, could hear every toilet flushing and shower for every room above. Should be ashamed to charge the rates for the very poor quality of the room. Dined in once, food was of ordinary quality and high price. As somebody who spends 100+ nights away each year, this is the worst accommodation I have ever experienced, anywhere. Very disappointed, would not recommend to anybody except somebody I didn't like!

Reviews.Title: “Wrong name on subsequent reminder of stay email”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The reservation was made on line by our company's travel arranger Helen Egan. When a reminder of the upcoming stay was emailed the name on the reservation was incorrect. My name Jason Furness the guest booking was made for, not Bruno D'Agostino as stated on the email. Helen rang the Menzies and they said they "would fix it up".... alas they did not..... Highly inefficient and disturbing as I was travelling from Queensland, and I needed reassurance that the booking was in my name.....

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is a great hotel when you need to stay in Sydney.It is central, with good access to all transport. The service is excellent and rooms are clean and well appointed. I strongly reccomend the Menzies for a great place to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Back Break hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at The Menzies in the past and had a very good experience, so when coming to Sydney again we were happy to book our rooms. As per last visit, the service at check-in was good and the rooms were clean. Unfortunately, the mattress in our room was so hard that my husband could barely get out of bed in the morning. The staff at housekeeping couldn't have been more helpful trying to find us a better mattress and when that failed they attempted to make the original mattress more comfortable with some blankets. Alas, this was not successful and we were informed that these were the new mattresses and it was suggested that we contact the duty manager. On doing this he managed to find us a room with a slightly better bed, unfortunately this was a down grade from the room we had booked and paid for. No offer of a credit. While the duty manager was pleasant enough, he is obviously over-worked because he failed to notify reception of the room change meaning that they gave the room to another couple who later entered our room and he neglected to make the restaurant reservation for us. Unfortunately, I would not be able to recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is very well located being very close to Martin Place and walking distance to Darling Harbour, Circular Key and China town. It is an old hotel but the rooms have been well renovated and the corridors are very well done. The gym is well equipped with running , cycling and rowing machines. There is also a good range of weight equipment. Breakfast is godd biut as with all hotels over priced. The air conditioning in the rooms was on the warm side. The staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is a fantastic hotel in the heart of Sydney. We enjoyed a 5 night break to Sydney recently, staying at the Menzies and found the hotel and amenities to be spot on. The check-in staff was helpful, fortunately for us upgraded us to a park view â€“ it was not the biggest window in the world but was nice to see a view of the small park over the road nevertheless. The room was clean spacious and has everything you need - except wireless internet, however this was available reception though. Location wise you couldnâ€™t find better - Bus stops are across the road, and itâ€™s a 5min walk to the Circular Quay ferry terminal and about 5min walk to Darling Harbour. There are plenty of options for snacks and food with a small Coles (Supermarket) across the road in the train station and a bigger Coles a couple of blocks away. All-in-all a pleasant stay, we would definitely stay there again â€“ highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “poor value for $$”
Reviews.Author: Dennis621
Reviews.Content: very poor value for $$: TV is ridiculously small and room is sparse: walk a few blocks firther south and save $100

Reviews.Title: “Not what expected from Accor (meals great, room poor)”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Restaurant and meals were great, but the room very dated, hairs on the carpet still - not sure how long since it has been vacuumed. The bed was extremely soft and spongy - much prefer a firmer bed. We were near the elevators and the walls must be thin as heard them going up and down into the night and early morning. At nearly $250 won't be staying there again :-(

Reviews.Title: “weekend away”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel was reasonably clean, the bed was firm and comfortable, the staff helpful. we were put in the older part overlooking the city and the noise from traffic was what kept us awake for some of the night. the breakfast was good and plentiful but expensive. i only have fruit and toast as did a few othere women in the dining room so the cost of $25 was a little steep. maybe a choice of two kinds of breakfast would be a way to go. opposite the station and with bus and taxi at the door it was very central. ten minutes walk to the rocks where we had dinner was great. i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Menziers Hotel, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very dispapointed in the standard of the hotel. Firstly no confirmaiton of our booking with the hotel - lucky I took with me the confirmation email. First room - bathroom covered in silicone, doors chipped, squeeky door. Breakfast room - not enough toasters for number of guests, No bowls, cereal, milk - had to ask. Second room - similar to first.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies is a superior hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Central, close to transport and shops Close to the airport train at Wynyard Station which is only a 15 minute trip I was given a free buffet breakfast from the excellent reception staff Menzies is a superior hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location was great short walk to Darling Harbour & The Rocks. Opposite Wynyard Railway Station. Hotel great, service great. Rooms were a bit dated, bathrooms were lovely and everything was very clean. Cafe's in hotel and a couple close by.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but does need some work”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It would be nice to see some of the staff actually smile. By far the best staff member I encountered was the Chief Concierge Andrew. The impression I got from other staff was that I was an inconvenience. We stayed 2 nights the first morning breakfast was terrible. The next morning was a huge improvement. The television in our room was pathetically small and you almost needed to have binoculars to see it. Remote failed to work and needed to be replaced and the TV cannot be switched off with the remote. I have encountered better TV reception from remote outback locations. I have stayed at this hotel before and will no doubt again. Just accept basic accommodation and fair service.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you need to be in the city and need great access to public transport then The Menzies is for you. You are guaranteed that you will receive a decent room and be able to get a good night's sleep. The staff are always helpful and the concierge is very knowledgeable and willing to help answer any questions that you might have. I regularly stay here for business trips and know that I can expect a pleasant stay and an easy trip to and from the airport even with lots of bags.

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies Hotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the centre of Sydney, very close to all transport links and the ferry terminals. All the services were of a high standard and the staff were very efficient, cheerful and helpful. I strongly recommend the hotel and will undoubtedly stay again when next I return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: While seeking to use our complimentary night through ACCOR, we were told that we could only have a room with double beds, not a queen-sized bed as we had had in the past (unless we paid an additional $30. This was bad enough but after waiting for over two hours for the airconditioning to heat up, it was still blowing out cold air. When I contacted reception, the girl said that they couldn't change the temperature in that wing of the hotel as it had been changed over to summer setting. (What is the use of having a temperature control in the room?) The girl offered us extra blankets or a room to another wing of the hotel that would definitely be warmer. Thank goodness it was but that wasn't the end of our dilemma. When we accepted the new room she had to make a new key for our old room (for some reason) so that we could move all our belongings to the new room. Lo and behold it didn't work! She made a new one and (you guessed it) it didn't work either. However, she was able to let us in with a master key. Overall, this was not a good way to spend a "special" night in a city hotel. We could not recommend it to anyone (although the girl who was assisting us was very pleasant about the whole matter).

Reviews.Title: “My Complimentary Room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was delighted to find my room ready, as requested, when I arrived about 9.00am. I needed to rest (an early flight & bereavement) but was shocked at the poor grade room. I voiced my dismay to Reception and was immediately re-located into a quality room, as expected by an Accor Member. I ate in the hotel twice and the food was superb as was the staff who waited with smiles and good humour. All staff were respectful and supportive, except for the first one who must have been in need of more training. Yes I will stay there again as it is located in an area of the CBD which suits me, being close to transport.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms now outdated . Shower head faulty so could not shower. Advised at desk with minimal response/apology Value for money not there when compare to say other more modern /updated hotels such as The Westin

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only reason”
Reviews.Author: Gustypants
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated for business or pleasure (right outside Wynyard station) but apart from that nothing to write home about. The rooms are spacious, rather grubby and almost empty, you get the feeling that you are staying in a large shed. Comfy beds but a TV so small that you need a telescope to see it. Friendly staff and a pleasant bar but that is it. Make sure you get a good deal otherwise you may be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean & service okay. The room was showing it's age. The bath towels were almost hand towel size & there was one small piece of soap to share between two people basin & shower. The parking charges were not represented correctly on check in. 4 star is an over estimation on my values.

Reviews.Title: “very nice location”
Reviews.Author: DARquest
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. Very clean, food was good, bus and metro station right outside the front door. We walked to shop and eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very relaxing stay. Only disappontment was booking for a 7.30 dinner and having to wait nearly 20minutes for our table to be ready. Our meal was very enjoyable. Staff were very friendly and obliging.

Reviews.Title: “Normally great place to stay but bad experience this time”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: have stayed here lots of times over the years but this time the receptionist on booking in was rude and argumentative. The room I got was substandard and the shower was poor. Very disappointed this trip compared to the many trips over the last 10 years. Carparking at $45 night is too expensive

Reviews.Title: “Recent visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Liked the reception service, value for money and location mostly. Room was clean and food was good too The facilities were suitable and were utilised We didn't experience breakfast as we had a late checkout which was appreciated

Reviews.Title: “NOT EASY ACCESS”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We ended up cancelling our booking because we could not get access, the traffic was terrible, signage for the hotel was terrible, to get to the car park you had to go in a certain way, our google map told us to take a right on Erskine and you can't even do that, luckily I had a map, even though one way streets aren't marked clearly, absolute nightmare, receptionist rude when I phoned for assistance, never again, unless I went by train, just to try it because it looked great on Sydney Weekender.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WDMTraveler
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is its' location. It backs up to George St and is close to all downtown attractions, as well as the Sydney Opera House The downside, it is an older hotel. The rooms are strongly in need of updating. The bathroom was very small and the stool was just underneath the small vanity and next to the sink. I had to make sure I had the stool lid down so as not to drop anything in it when doing my hair and makeup. The staff was very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Frozen in time, but well connected hotel”
Reviews.Author: RogueFury
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel where you enjoy your stay. Back in the '60s and '70s this would have been a great hotel. The rooms are dark, bathroom tiny, and everything looks and feels worn down. Upside, the place is right next to bus and transit lines. You can also walk to Circular Quay, the Opera House, bridge and Darling Harbour. Good thing there is a 7-11 next door. Snacks are cheaper at the 7-11.

Reviews.Title: “just great”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: dinner was excellent. asian waiter was great. good sense of humor. breakfast was great. nice stay. rooms very roomy. good shower.we have dtayed here before and will again. our friends enjoted it too, and they will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fading grandeur”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location. Terrible restaurant service but good food. Hypocritical eco credentials - they ask that you reuse towels, save water etc. etc. but expect you to buy imported bottled Fiji Water at $8.50 for a small bottle!

Reviews.Title: “Menzies - great location”
Reviews.Author: Gary1964Melbourne Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the city opposite Wynard station. It offers a range of dining options, good sized rooms, professional staff and overall is a great hotel. The downstairs sports bar offers good priced meals and a range of drink options, with many beers on tap. There are plenty of large screens that are braodcasting a variety of sporting channels. On level one is a restaurant and piano bar which offers a finer quality of dining. Couple this with the pool and location it all adds up to a good place to stay whilst in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “No coffee available”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room and Bed comfortable, Absolutely hopeless that coffee not available in upstairs bar after 10pm according to the barman.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in a nutshell”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hair dryer didn't work in the room. Toilet light in reception toilets didn't work. Queues at reception but mostly pleasant staff. Otherwise good stay. Dining room dinner and Panio Bar entertainer were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for short stop”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, 30m from Wynard Station entrace. Excellent service from front desk, no fuss. Room was more than comfortable, didn't spend much time in it, but bed was sufficient. Only slight detraction was the state of the buffet breakfast in the morning, choices were narrowed due to high volume of people and the lateness of attending. So get in early! Other than that, would stay again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Menzies again after finding the location very central.The hotel has great ambience. As an Advantage member, after staying at many other hotels, I do feel the bed are rather uncomfortable and raised in the centre. I couldn't fault the service especially in the restaurant. The waiters were very friendly, informative with the menu and efficient. The food was also very good but find when staying for several nights the choice isn't great enough not allowing us to use the restraurant every night of our stay. I hope to visit Sydney again soon and will definitely stay at the Menzies.

Reviews.Title: “Needs extra blanket”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine and the facilities are good. The quilt on the beds are a bit thin, especially on a cool night when there is no heating. There should be a spare blanket in the rooms as there is at teh IBIS.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot”
Reviews.Author: JoeSharman Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pretty much what ive come to expect from this chain. Everything was the way it was sposed to to be. The room was a bit dated but still everything was tidy and clean and the price was competitive with the cheaper motels in the area. No banging and crashing from other rooms come through the walls.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary stay at the Menzies.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Menzies last Saturday. Service at the reception desk was very efficient. The room was very comfortable. We would like to thank the Menzies management for the bottles of beer and nuts. The service and food at breakfast was good. Unfortuneately we experienced noise from the airconditioner, being in a rear room, but there is always traffic noise from a room at the front. Just a point about the escape notice in the room; the writing is extremely small and it is located too high on the door for a shorter person to read.

Reviews.Title: “Mr Mitchell Dawson”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice stay, your staff are very helpful room was very nice only one thing i would say that the rooms may need better pillows thanks again It was a very nice stay, your staff are very helpful room was very nice only one thing i would say that the rooms may need better pillows thanks again

Reviews.Title: “My 1st disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay at Accor hotels often in both Melbourne and Sydney. My most recent star at the Menzies was a little disappointing. Having stayed at the same hotel a number of times, I found the rooms a little 'tired'. The hotel is well located, central and easy for commuting around Sydney. My only disappointment related to the tariff. I initially booked for business for 2 nights. Then I had to extend by a further 2 nights, followed by a necessary further 1 night. I would of hoped (expected) that the latter tariffs would have reflected my initial stays by offering a discounted rate. I was basically re-checked as if I was staying on 3 separate occasions. Perhaps the front office staff could be given discretion to acknowledge the situation and average a tariff over the 5 night. Even the option to gain authorisation from management. just a thought.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights, after two nights we asked if we could change rooms as our room was very noisy. This was actioned immediately and in a very friendly and professional manner. We were very impressed and our next room was very quiet. While the rooms were a bit tired looking they were very clean and the room service was excellent. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Great location, very central. Would definately stay again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is superb because it's right next to a main station. The staff were very friendly and helpful. However the room was very bad. We had a king deluxe room but we were very disappointed. The bathroom was mouldy and damp. The taps were hard to open and squeaked every time. The carpet in the room was very thin and did not give a feeling that it was clean. In addition, the doors made loud noise when opened or closed. So we did not have good sleeps during our stay because the neighbouring rooms kept slamming the doors during the night. Overall the room wasn't good enough for such price.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies Hotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Lindy1956 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good facilities and located within walking distance to Circular Quay. Handy being opposite Wynyard Station to catch a train to the airport. Our stay was short, as it was just a stopover after a week long cruise. We did not eat at the hotel because after being on a cruise you eat way too much, so we just had snacks during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Menzies Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I picked the Menzies due to its location and service. The staff ever polite, friendly and were willing to assist me with my inquires. The rooms were roomy, clean and comfortable. Check in and check out was prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: a great venue close to a major transport hub & shopping, in the heart of Sydney. If you would like somewhere spacious, with a great bar for a pre-dinner cocktail or two :-o , great eats etc, then look no further. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, room service was quick and good, it was a great place to snuggle up with a friend I rarely see. One thing I liked about the room (junior suite) was the little kitchen, which means I didnt have to fill the kettle up in the bathroom (something that always irks me)

Reviews.Title: “Menzies Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Menzies hotel is situated in heart of Sydney CBD. Being an older but well kept hotel the rooms are large and comfortable. However, the rooms facing Margaret Street are subject to horrific noise from night clubs. We were unfortunate to have one of these rooms and on Friday and Saturday nights hardly slept at all. We will never stay at the Menzies again if we were given one of these rooms. Otherwise we have no complaints at all with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hotel review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The only complaints I have with the hotel is how slow it was to get served at the front desk and the front desk staffs poor attitude plus the lift service is extremely slow. Otherwise everything was ok

Reviews.Title: “Family trip in sydney cbd”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Loved the central location of the Menzies, 5 min walk to Circular Quay, 5 minute walk to QVB shopping Mall,Pitt street mall and George street. Sydneys Public transport is the best and Wynyard Station is right across from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “first time”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: online reservation easy and provided me with directions which were easy to follow and found location with no trouble. This is a great location for anyone wanting to be close to public transport and within walking distance to The Rocks, Circular Quay, Opera House, Harbour Bridge and the Waterfront. Take your pick of dining, will satisfy everyone. Take away to Fine Dining and plenty of out door dining, great atmosphere. Great for tourist or even outer Sydney suburb visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jenni H Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Menzies often and always love it. It is in a great location - easy walk to The Rocks, Circular Quay and Botanic Gradens. Staff are friendly and helpful, especially concierge staff. Definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - A bit tired”
Reviews.Author: cyberce
Reviews.Content: Pluses Location is very convenient Nice breakfast - but an idiosyncratic food layout that takes some getting used to Mostly helpful and friendly staff. Negatives Tired decor - bathrooms are from the 1950s? Front desk seemed incapable of delivering messages. Two messages were left for us. We only got them after asking for them - rather defeats the point!

Reviews.Title: “Needs an uplift urgently”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Old and dowdy!!! So many other better value updated places to stay. Breakfast is like eating in a canteen!! yet still charged over $30 a head. Its a great name and great location. Staff seem good (but some could de with upgrade too)...so why not bring it back to its glory days!!

Reviews.Title: “Menzies Sydney”
Reviews.Author: JudyDarwin Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel on the recommendation of a friend who enjoyed her stay at the Menzies recently due to the high quality of service from its staff. Staff are friendly and helpful. It is a four star hotel which charges four star prices, yet the standard room we were booked into was fairly ordinary. My partner forgot his toiletry bag - the only toiletries in the bathroom were soaps and shampoo/conditioner - no razor, no toothpaste and no shower gel. It was easy to purchase replacements, however other hotels similarly priced provide these items. Food was expensive - and not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Stay At Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall, stay was good, nice location in the heart of sydney, price was reasonable, the only 2 things not so nice was 1st the kettle, they were quite old. 2nd the beds were too soft. Every other thing were excellent for me. Facilities, service were all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Family stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris767 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As a family trip with young childrens, very demanding, we had everything we asked for, a cot, extra blanket and extra pillows. The location is great, in front of a train station, a park, and very close to the most commercial avenues and mayor attracions. The people at the hotel were very helpfull and warm. Service in general was good, only the cot was not made at the morning, the rest, very good!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug_Mike
Reviews.Content: I must say upfront the meal we had with friends and family in the hotel restaurant was outstanding! It was a $50 3 course special and well worth the money with very high standard meals with terrific presentation and delicious flavours. Service was also very high standard and setting and surrounds were lovely old private club style design.Rooms are very nice for what in parts is a very old building. We stayed here so we could do the Bridgeclimb on a wet but exhilirating night and enjoy ed the meal and some drinks afterwards in the adjacent bar and overstuffed lounge chairs, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: MargharitaMan
Reviews.Content: Overall, as a member of the Accor chain, I expected a far higher standard.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies is getting tired”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Menzies is very well located (city centre, train, etc) but my room was a bit small by today's standards and some of the appointments a bit out of date. However it's quite good value for a short business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies in Wynyard”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great spot straight across from the Wynyard station (10 mins from airport on subway) with hire car on opposite corner and easy access to the Bridge. Rooms (9th floor) are a little outdated but clean and tidy and very comfortable, the elevator was a let down ,of three only one seemed to work and was always full and slow, restaurant was good and hot breakfast great. I'd be back, cheers

Reviews.Title: “Location is excellent”
Reviews.Author: Minorby
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 days in Sydney for the halloween weekend, Stayed at the Menzies, Location is excellent, the hotel its self a little run down, no bell boy to carry your bags and breakfast was only ok, could have been a lot better for price paid. Room was good a little small but ok, shower water was only par average but room cleanliness was very good. Staff were friendly but few. in all areas. The elevator's are so slow, that I once decided to take stairs, this is also the fire escape so once you are in you cannot get out except for going all the way to the bottom and it lets you out at the back of the hotel in a dark dinge laneway. the have internet but at a price... Everything in Sydney is at a price. even had a lady beggingng for money.

Reviews.Title: “solid hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location similar for business or leisure travel, especially when travelling by air (direct connect by train to airport, station located opposite hotel entrance!). The location compensate for slightly older furniture and basic sufficient cleaning. Definitely good value for money and can be recommended without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Quality of Service & Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Welcome- Warm helpful and inviting. Room- Comfortable- too cool A/c Noisy and blowing onto bed. bath room- No toilet Brush I am short- 149 cm and could not reach the mirror close enough to see to apply my make. up. Bed- Lumpy and uncomfortable. Evening Meal- slow service. Drink was not served after an hour and had to repeat the request. MEAL DELICIOUS Lifts- Far too slow.oNLY 1 IN USE Breakfast - Excellent. Service at breakfast fast and efficient. Departure- at 10.00 a.m. Only one receptionist who was filling in for some one else. We waited 15 minutes and the asked the door man for assistance HE WAS EFFICIENT AND POLITE AND HELPFUL. The hotel itself is clean bright and welcoming. The fact that the hotel is so close to Wynnyard station and walking distance to city and shops and business area is a big plus when a stay is either for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Some lights didn`t work, cobwebs in room, expensive and poor quality food from room service. for my purposes the location is what it was all about and i would recommend the Menzies for that reason and some great memories from long ago.. Service staff very pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Great location and would definetly stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We traveled with 3 kids(6,4,1) and our friends had 2. Their room was right next door and we couldn't hear anything. The hotel was across the road from Wynyard Station and is an easy walk to Circular Quay. The beds have white bedspreads so you know they are clean! Only negative was the bar fridge was hot and totally full so we couldn't put anything of ours in. A pain when travelling with small kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wish I had of had more than a night to explore. The room was comfortable and clean. No view though I the room we were in. Would recommend for a clean nice hotel in Sydney. Walking distance to station and circular quay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the normal standard of Accor”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very dissapointed.... Not the normal standard of an Accor hotel. Rooms are old, the only thing it has going for it is it location!!! Very central to everything but I will not stay their again just not what I am use it from Accor!

Reviews.Title: “Over night stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The quality of the room was excellent and the service from the staff was great ,very friendly and helpful,the hotel has all the amenities you could need for a great stay, pool,sauna,gym ,everything you need is there and it's all in the heart of the city, I would have no problems staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out beds otherwise fine”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location , Restaurant was very good, Staff were attentive and polite. Room was very dated. The bed was well past it's use by date. Big dent on both sides and very uncomfortable. If it was my own bed at home it would ahve been at the tip years ago. Room 626

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies well located”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located to Wynyard Station giving easy access from airport train. Close to city shopping, The Rocks and Circular Quay. Rooms well appointed and clean. Breakfast just above average and needs revamping.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: felt the pillows were very ordinary and therefore found it hard to sleep!! othfront counter service was great and overall tidyness of hotel was acceptable in all areas. I plan to stay there again but only hope have a better sleep nextt time. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Airconditioning did not work”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Airconditioning did not work in room, requested a new room and after following up a second time upgraded to a better room but airconditioning was only marginally better. The hotel is in a great location for use of rail to and from airport and generally accessing the CBD and rail network.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel and room were OK, but some things weren't up to expectations when comparing other similar hotels: Room service - were not answering the phone for an hour or so so I had to contact reception/manager, but when it came (no delay) the order was wrong; No bath robes; Aircon not effective. Mini bar prices like a 5 star. There's better value for money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with easy walk to the Rocks/circular area.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very convenient location. It is very clean however, getting a little dated now. Was a very classy hotel in its day. We didn't utilise the restaurant on this occasion. Great value for money compared to other options in Sydney at this time.

Reviews.Title: “One to skip in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Tatjana Z
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 14th ('Executive') level at the Menzies in Sydney last night and must say that the deal was not at all worth the $215 I paid for the single night stay. Whilst the lobby was very impressive and the reception staff were quite helpful, the room was drab and could have been cleaner, the alarm clock didn't work, there was no shower lotion in the bathroom and I unsuccessfully attempted to contact room service five times (waiting a long time on each attempt) to no avail. It wasn't a terrible experience, but unless this hotel betters its standards it should decrease its rates if it wants to offer value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with the food service and quality of food. Our evening meal took over 40 minutes to receive and then we received a wrong meal and a side was forgotten about. The waitress also 'questioned' us in regards to the wrongly received meal! Breakfast was the worst buffet we have had. The majority of the food was cold and there wasn't much in the bain maries. We were quoted $25/ breakfast however we were charged $31/ breakfast and it definitely wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “quick trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we used our free accor advantage card night & went to the "basement" near the quay. it is within easy walking distance of the rocks opera house quay martin place etc parking is a bit rich ($45 a night) but you can find spots in the surrounding streets for all night between 1900 & 0700 if you look hard enough. piano bar & surrounds has a good feel about it

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although our first impression of the Menzies was great as we walked into the opulent lobby, our elation was soon shredded when we stepped inside our room on the 14th floor. Deemed by the hotel to be an executive floor, both bedroom and bathroom were of postage stamp proportions and the view from our window was of a brick wall. The design of the bathroom was dreadfully cramped and we kept banging out legs into the toilet seat as we used the vanity. The bathroom was far too small to have a bath in it and would have looked a heap more spacious with just a shower. However, the room was clean and the staff very helpful and efficient, but we probably wouldn't bother staying at the Menzies again. There are other hotels with bigger, nicer rooms with lovelier outlooks for much less. Sincerely, Jennie Flack

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean and central”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A good, clean, central hotel. I have stayed there before and would recommend it. I was there for a course so didn't spend much time in the room during the day, but it was great for what I wanted. And now I just need to fill up the required 200 characters! ..................................................................................................................................................................

Reviews.Title: “It was 5 stars 25 years ago!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service was great but the condition of the room was terrible. The bathroom had no fan so it steamed up completely. The gaps could be seen around the shower taps. Wallpaper was peeling away in parts. Wallpaper didn't line up. Holes existed where network ports used to be. Power points didn't work in some places. The basin in the bathroom didn't line up to marble benchtop. All these things detract from the stay and when you're paying around $200 per night you want high quality. The room was very basic and we wouldn't recommend the Menzies hotel for the price paid. Money needs to be spent on bringing this hotel up to scratch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located opposite Wynard Railway Station so the access to the airport was very straight forward. The rooms were lovely and quite. Our only comment was on the soft bed. We got used to it on the second night but it took some getting used to. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were more than happy with our weekend away, the pool & spa is great to relax in after a full day walking to all the sites. A very relaxing stay. The bed and pillows were great. We dined at the Parkview Restaurant where the meal was tasty and filling. The concierge staff could not have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hgotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies hotel is next to Wynyard station which makes it easy to go from airport to hotel to airport, and also is in a convenient location to visit offices in the City. Rooms were of adequate size, with comfortable bed and double glazing. Staff were quick for check-in and helpful in storing bags. Nice easy chairs in spacious lougne overlooking small park if you need to wait around in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel close to main atractions of central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located hotel opposite Wynyard Railway Station. The staff at this hotel were very professional and helpfull. What I like about this hotel is it is very close to main attractions of Sydney . just off George St which is one of main streets of Central Sydney .

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Seeing Downtown Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall, a good hotel. The location couldn't be much better as it is directly across the street from Wynyard Station. Things that could be better: The breakfast buffet is not worth the money (or any money for that matter) The beds are an odd foam type mattress The plumbing is LOUD (lots of clicks, pops and drips all night)

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoy Staying at The Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we love staying at The Menzies- its location makes it so convenient for us to travel around Sydney and see what we want to see. We have stayed there 4 or 5 times and never had any issues - except maybe the pool could be a bit warmer! I have recommended The Menzies to friends and they too have enjoyed their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfy Bed!”
