Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel had an old feel, but it was very well looked after and still very classy. The staff were exceptionally helpful, especially the concierge Janina. This was one of the most comfy beds we've ever stayed in. It was hard to get out of bed and leave.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is conveniently located opposite Wynyard Railway. The rooms were okay for the price but the mattresses were too firm. Also, the lighting was so poor it was difficult to read(no reading lamps near the beds) and near impossible to apply makeup in the bathroom. Breakfast was not great as everything tasted reheated and the bacon was "rubbery" from sitting in the steam too long. However, the staff was very polite and helpful and the price and location were great for a spot of shopping without the hassle of city driving and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Was only in Sydney for a couple of days relying on public transport, The Menzies Sydney's location was ideal being situated opposite Wynyard Station and close to buses and Circular Quay. We would stay again it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Why the Menzies?”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very handy to all inner Sydney sites and locations. Minutes from the harbour and great shopping such as the Queen Victoria Building. The service was very good and the Piano bar was on fire. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the city”
Reviews.Author: LesleyCarey Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located directly opposite a station and is a 10 minute walk to the shopping area of the CBD so it is well located for what you are paying. Rooms were OK, there was a very small TV fixed to the wall so you had to be directly in front of it to watch anything. The main hotel restaurant had a very boring menu so I went out, there are quite a few places around to eat. Pleasant helpful staff and a nice lobby if you have to sit and wait.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Aussies07 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location and a big room, what more could a family of four ask for? No complaints. Would perhaps prefer Queen and 2 singles rather than 2 doubles though. Car park cost very high, but I guess that's a big city for you! High ceilings made the room feel even more spacious. Forgot about complementry breaky for kids, wish someone had reminded me.

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies. Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: JeffMears
Reviews.Content: Having struggled between budget and overly expensive hotels on previous visits to Sydney, we were introduced to Menzies by the hotel info counter at Sydney Int airport. The price was right for a basic double-room, though you could up-grade by paying more to a higher quality room. The public areas of the hotel are very good, with special mention to the piano bar which provides great close-up entertainment and ambience with a fun night ! The best part though is the hotels location re buses and taxis across the road, as is literally Wynard Station were you are one stop on the train from ithe iconic world renowned view of Sydney Opera House and the equally famous Harbour Bridge ! Better still whether you are arriving or leaving Sydney you literally walk across the road to / from the hotel reception into the station with you luggage in tow, catch the elevator down to the train platform and walk onto / off the train which wisks you direct to the airport within 15 - 20 minutes tops ! No expensive taxis or over-loaded mini buses ! Great location ! Great Hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Park View Resturaunt”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: patriciamoseley@bigpond.com Having stayed at he Mensies in May2011 which was a very happy experience. This time in the Park View wasn`t. We told the staff when we arrived at 6pm that we had a Show to go to and had to be out by 7,30pm. We didn`t get finished in time and we had to run 3 blocks and didn`t quite make the start of the Show.This Hotel has a very good location for us as we arrive by train from the Nth Coast. and is very easy access. We will be thinking twice about staying again , unless the staff in the Park View changes its customer relations.

Reviews.Title: “Accounts Let Down otherwise good stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The only downside was that it took the hotel 5 days to release a $200 holding charge on my credit card even though I had paid my account in full at time of departure. Good hotel, good service, good location

Reviews.Title: “Old and Tired”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and has a good reputation. However, it is looking old and tired and is in need of substantial upgrade to bring it back to the level that it deserves and for which it charges

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location was great but that was about the only positive comment I have. The bathroom was really bad and more like a bathroom you would expect when staying in a 3 star motel and the food quality was very poor (both room service and restaurant)

Reviews.Title: “some disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room appeared to half the size of that advertised on wed site. Bathroom small with mildew in the shower around the soap holder, no opening windows which didn't allow fresh air, especially when the aircon didn't work. Furniture that appeared to be purchased from an old wares/ second hand furniture dealer, a very dangerous glass topping on the bed side table that move up and down up to 15 mm's due to unevenness of table top and seemed like it would shatter if you placed a coffee cup on it, outside the room the halls were scuffed and dirty, particular the doors into the rooms, and it would be a good idea for you to let prospective customers know that they will be up for $45.00 a night for parking. Many places in sydney are well below that or even complimentary. Sorry doubt if I will be back, travel to sydney up to 10 times a year from Kiama and that can add up to some serious permanent business.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location for our stay and going to the theatre. Service faultless. Cocktail Bar, we felt should be open prior to 5.30pm, had to rush our pre dinner drink to get to dinner for 6pm dur to theatre 8pm. Dinner very good and service excellent. Room very average - needs a total refurbish - air conditioning duct in room very noisy and unable to turn off. Would only recommend for location and dining. Enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Good Value hotel option in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: JeremyC-99
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed a night at The Menzies having stayed there a couple of nights about 5 years ago. This is a good value hotel option in the CBD. In my view its strongest positives are: very friendly service from all staff I encountered; a good CBD location close to Circular Quay, the Rocks, the main shopping areas and not far to walk to get around to Darling Harbour; I found the room and hotel generally very clean again. Other positives include internet access in rooms and in the main lobby (I used my own wireless modem but understand that internet WiFi access in the lobby area is free for the first 30 minutes after you login) - though I really feel internet should be free these days in keeping with the increasing trend in overseas hotels; car parking is available under the hotel and is mid-range cost at $45 for 24 hours (my experience is that overnight car parking in hotels in the CBD ranges between $35 and $55 at present). The downsides are that this is an older hotel and feels a bit dated (not dirty/not unkempt just a bit dated); there is no safe in your room (at least not in the double room I had this time); the walls seem a bit thin and at times I could hear guests in other rooms. If you get a good rate on the hotel then this is a comfortable and good value accommodation option. It really sits between the Average and Very Good rankings in Trip Advisor ie it is Good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Bertie748
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a great location. The rooms are a good size with great beds and pillows. The bathroom is big and very clean with nice toiletries on offer. The location is perfect as in its a nice stroll to the harbour where the ferries are and also the Bridge and Opera House. The bus/ train terminal is across the road so getting around is made easy. If you want a really nice dinner with views of the Opera House and the Bridge book a window table at Peter Doyles Seafood restaurant, 2nd level or outside if the weather is nice. Very nice food and service. Tea/ coffee and Wifi available.

Reviews.Title: “September Sydney Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Staff pleasant and helpful. Excellent location for Sydney shopping! The hotel has an old world charm which I particularly liked. The room was very clean, though a little small. The location has to be one of the best in Sydney. Right opposite Wynyard station, yet within walking distance of Martin Place and central Sydney. The main purpose of the trip was so my daughter could attend Sydney Town Hall for a school musical function, and we were able to catch a train to Town Hall Station - very convenient. Also great shopping at the Queen Victoria Building. We are hoping to plan another trip soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: oldmancockatoo
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a late evening flight from Perth, avoided the long Taxi queue, and caught the train from underneath Airport car park to Wynyard Station, Walked 60 metres across the park to the hotel entrance. The hotel was one of Sydneys grandest 40 years or more ago, but now, it is average as far as decor goes. The staff were friendly and we checked in about 11pm. Dropped our bags and went straight out to get something to eat. We rarely eat or have room service in hotels because of the crazy prices. Plenty of places nearby to eat. We take our own wifi for the same reason. The room was comfortable, clean and quiet, hot water was fine and the airconditioning controlable. The hotel is an easy walk to the Theatre we went to, (forgot its name now, to see Jersey Boys, great show) Also short walk to Circular Quay for breakfast and the Harbour, Opera House, Harbour Bridge etc. There is a 7-11 off the entrance to the hotel open until about midnight and is a lot cheaper than the other store about 100 metres up the road. All in all the Menzies met our expectation. We paid $189 Aud. without breakfast which was about $30 each or maybe more. Cheaper to eat elsewhere Would I stay again, probably not, only because I would like to try other hotels, not because of any bad experience

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but needs an update or a good clean”
Reviews.Author: celenac
Reviews.Content: Location is great and the cost is reasonable. We managed to get a single room for a family of four rather than connecting rooms which suited us as our children are young. There was plenty at breakfast but most of it overcooked. It did not appear that fresh and the coffee was awful. Luckily just outside the hotel was a great cafe. The Menzies is not flash but I would recommend it if you are looking for a well located, family friendly place to stay in order to make the most of what Sydney can offer.

Reviews.Title: “Wedded Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies continues to live up to it's hard-won reputation as an establishment of distinction! My mother and I had a week in which we attended TWO family weddings. It was absolute bliss to return each evening to courteous service from all staff, a spacious room and sumptuous food. Access couldn't be easier with the the rail network across the road. At no stage however were we aware of any noise. Family members who visited said they would certainly book next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We traveled from the country by train and were delighted to get off at Wyndham Station, escalator up to street level and just across the road was the Menzies. The staff were extremely polite and made us feel very welcome. The bed was a little to soft for me, but other than that, the room was lovely . I like that the windows actually open for fresh air. We had a wonderful buffet breakfast, and the staff were very attentive. A short stroll to beautiful Sydney Harbor and the fantastic Opera House. We would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Usually my stay is without incidents, however, this time was unusual. I arrived Sunday morning around 10.30am. I asked about breakfast and we were told to go up to restaurant for breakfast. When we got there they had already shut. Quite disappointing. Concierge usually know the times for your services. I gave another concierge on that Sunday an important letter that had to be posted to Royal North Shore Hospital I.C.U and it is has never been received. I can only hope that it was posted but lost in the mail. Dinner in the restaurant is always one of my favourite things but when we had our water poured at the table my glass was absolutely swirling with what looked like dislodged scum of some kind off the inside of the glass. My sons water in his glass was quite clear so my glass must have been dirty. I asked the waitress if lemon juice may have been in the water jug but it does not so it could not have been lemon pulp. I am booked to stay another 2 nights from 7th October and still look forward to coming. I can only put these issues down to training of new junior staff which I understand takes time for them to learn the job. As always, I will take this opportunity to commend Andrew your most valuable ambassador in Concierge. Please send him my regards along with my son Jakes best wishes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great service, excellent central location as is close to Trains, buses, ferries, CBD & Darling Harbour would stay there again if we visit Sydney. Very easy to travel from airport to hotel as it is directly opposite the Wynyard train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great handy location”
Reviews.Author: Lemazintransit
Reviews.Content: Super easy to get there on train direct from the airport considering the station is across the road! Handy location to all major attractions, super easy walk to circular quay. Rooms were very spacious and clean. Down side was you couldn't open any windows and it was a bit stuffy at times. Our room was right next door to cleaners who were a bit noisy as they were coming and going. Also the night door man was a bit rude on one of the nights upon returning from a wedding, but everyone else was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired hotel with poor restaurant in good location”
Reviews.Author: Missfezzle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Menzies for work for a few nights in July. Check in went smoothly enough. I got to the room and it was small but fine for a few nights. Went to have a shower only to find a used bandaid in the tub. Disgusting. The room is dated and the hotel is falling apart slowly. Such as the wallpaper and paint peeling. I tried to order room service. I was redirected three times before I got through to someone... The chef. Who was rude and hung up on me. I eventually got through to someone again. I asked if there were vegetarian options for dinner. I was told I could have garlic bread or the pasta with tomato sauce. So I did. And it was exactly that. Pasta with a tomato sauce. Not even vegetables. Waste of money and the phone calls to order it. I would not stay here again nor would I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had to wait until after 3pm to check in as room was not cleaned, however was provided with complimentary breakfast. Great location, walking distance to CQ, city & Surry Hills. Had a executive suite so room was good size. Bathroom was a bit old and run down.

Reviews.Title: “A night in town”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As we were having a harbour cruise on the Sunday we decided to spend that night at the Menzies and have a nice dinner and a couple of drinks at the Piano bar to relax and unwind. This turned out to be an excellent way to complete our weekend, the manner in which we greeted at this hotel was freindly and made us feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Penrithchick Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, wish we would of had more time. Great location, close to the rocks, circular quay and king st wharf restaurants. Breakfast was lovely, service great, rooms clean and comfy. Def stay again or recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “great spot”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we found our room quite spacious although in need of some minor repairs eg toilet flush buttonin need of repair, architrave under fridge warped and damaged ,the bed was heavenly soft very much to my liking but too soft for my hubby.The location was fantastic so close to the centre of the city , breaky a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to train station”
Reviews.Author: VivoOra
Reviews.Content: You can't ask for a better location than to walk out of the exit of the train station directly into the reception area of the hotel. An older hotel, the rooms are due for a bit of a refurbishment. Unfortunately I slept on one of most uncomfortable, soft and squishy matresses I have ever slept in, but that's not to say there's one of those in every room - and it may have been to some people's liking. My room on the 3rd floor overlooked the park on York Street, but also overlooked the very busy bus stops on the road below. And Sydney's buses are very busy. But, I can't blame the hotel for being located near the buses. Another reviewer would put that down as a plus. Overall a good hotel in a great location; close to trains and within walking distance of all of Sydney's major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Queen room, bed was comfortable, no air conditioning in the room itself (own temp control etc) so room felt bit sfuffy, staff were friendly and courteous, very helpful, second time i have stayed there and would not hesitate to do so again

Reviews.Title: “Room Quality”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Second rate room. VERY VERY old and tired room. Cracks all over the bathroom walls. Desperately in need of a TOTAL REFURBISHMENT!!!!! Terrible value for money. Positive - bed was good!! Food in restaurant was excellent. service very good. Only quality of room was hopeless. would only come back if I got a decent room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for easy access to great shopping at Pitt Street Mall. Easy stroll to Sydney Harbour and Circular Quay. Cheap taxi ride around the city and to the Capitol Theatre, but best of all 15 minute train ride from Sydyney Airport and train station is below the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed with the quality of our room and its cleanliness compared to other hotels in the CBD that we have previously stayed in. Having said that the staff were helpful and the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty ordinary, really.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were very polite, quick at the reception desk, and helpful when we wanted two extra teacups. Switches for the lights and in the bathroom were a bit confusing, and the toilet was practically under the sink so you had to stand almost over it when fixing your makeup. It was quite quiet until everyone upstairs started using their bathrooms in the morning but I guess that happens everywhere. The bed was very comfortable but the pillows were terrible - all four were either very thin and hard, or thin and lumpy, so we both found it difficult to get comfortable. It was all a bit tired but I guess that's why it was fairly cheap - however I would expect the pillows to be a bit fresher and newer. Also it was weird how they made up the bed - two sheets, then an old thin doona without a cover, then another sheet over the doona. If you rumpled up the bed even a bit (I sat up in bed with my cup of tea to watch the tv) then the unclad doona came into view quite easily. But it was very conveniently located, the park over the road is nice, and it's probably a lot quieter than down by Circular Quay. Perhaps a "Superior" room would have better pillows and blankets.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ellystravels
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for location being just across the road from Wynyard Station however after spending around 180.00 p/n when we walked into our room it was dissappoiting. Our view out of the window was a blank wall the tv was so small and the general room was tired looking. Wewere staying in Sydney to catch up with friends so I booked the room being a Accor member. Yet our friends who called up and booked a room over the phone received a lovely room with a lovely view. You would think they would look after their members a little better. Dissappoited overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations, average service n facilities, small room.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is just opposite to wynard station, seven eleven is just next door which is superb. But The room is very small, ceiling is low, airflow is not that good, building is rather old n need refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Privacy concerns”
Reviews.Author: MaccasOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Menzies with a group of friends, having booked our rooms via the Accor website during their June sale. On arrival, I gave the reception staff member my name and she confirmed my booking and handed me a pre-printed guest registration form to sign. When I looked at it closely, it had my name and the personal details (address, phone numbers, email address etc) of another person whose name was identical to mine and who lived elsewhere in Australia. I alerted the staff member to this and she said "oh don't worry, just cross that out and fill in your own details". I couldn't believe it! I told her I was very concerned about what I considered a serious lapse of privacy, with me being privy to another guest's details and them obviously being privy to my details and I asked why this had happened. I was offered absolutely no explanation, only a comment that 'the only person who would see your details is the other person with the same name'. Well, that's still unacceptable! I had booked through the Accor website, and as an AClub member, had all my personal details correctly entered along with my AClub membership number. Also I had stayed at another Accor property earlier that week and had absolutely no trouble with check in or the accuracy of my personal & contact details. This can only lead me to believe that it was due to an internal issue at The Menzies and I brought it to the attention of the Duty Manager that evening, Again he seemed to be at a loss to explain how it had happened but I must admit it has left me with concerns about the security of one's personal information. Additionally, my friends and I had asked for rooms on the same floor (this request having been made two months prior) and the check in staff claimed to have no record of that request. Suffice it to say we were given rooms on different floors. The overall experience - a bit troubling and I must admit it has coloured my impression of The Menzies and their administration processes and obvious lapses.

Reviews.Title: “Did not end up staying at the Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My Accor Complimentary Night at the Menzies was given away to some else by the Menzies Manager at my request because we were unable to make the trip to Sydney due to an illness, for further details contact Menzies Manager. We will book in again at the Menzies again soon.

Reviews.Title: “In easy reach of everywhere”
Reviews.Author: mgtkHongKong Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotesl around Sydney CBD and inner suburbs but come back to the Menzies as the most convenient for most purposes. Bad name, (where are the Whitlam, Hawke and Keating hotels) but great location for public transport, and also for getting across the Bridgeor onto the Eastern or Western Distributors by car . Service is OK, though queues for checkout can be longish, and the restaurant can be slow. However the food is good. Rooms are fine - spacious and comfortable, quiet and good bed. And the carpark (run by Wilson Parking not Accor) takes you through some historic tunnels of Sydney, built I believe, by direction of General MacArthur, to provide safe passage during WWII, and in true Sydney style, never cleaned since!

Reviews.Title: “No”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service was terrible. Could not recommend this to any one. It was a bit like staying at Fawlty Towers. I actually felt sorry for the staff; there was not enough of them and they did not really know what to do. Simple things like putting wine glasses on the table was outside their knowlege.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location ,friendly staff, room size was generous as expected and comfortable, bathroom could do with an update and was small but neat and clean,The entertainment in the piano bar was very enjoyable even thought we did get there late and people were friendly .Didnt get to have a meal there but will try it out next time. Arrival and check out were hassle free . This hotel was value for money and would reccomend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Online Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am Kevin Davis Personal Assistant and I did book this hotel online with the company credit card, but when Mr Davis checked out he had to use his personal credit card to pay for it as he was informed that the room wasnt paid for. I think your system of booking online is inpractiable when you dont use the same card or atleast ask your guest to bill it to the card that the confirmation was made with, Im sorry but im not happy with that service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great sleep”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies Sydney is located in the CBD and is centrally positioned so that it is walking distance to most inner city spots. Had a great sleep in the beds and the room I had was very spacious. Service in the lobby bar was a little disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Menzies at least three times a year. The location is perfect for trains, buses, groceries and Sydney shopping. With parking underneath the hotel it's never a problem and the staff are always courteous, helpful and extrememly friendly. I don't even bother looking for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and the service was efficient, friendly and professional. The hotel is central so access to eating and dining is easy, and the room service meal was of good quality. We had a car and the cost for parking for 4 nights was equivalent to an extra nights stay. Perhaps normal for Sydney?

Reviews.Title: “Old tired and out dated.”
Reviews.Author: Fibenton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and tired. Rooms are cold with aircon that just didn't work. Out look was into a central courtyard - very nasty. Bed was old and lumpy. Needs a Reno badly!

Reviews.Title: “Feedback to Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Please note my wife and I stayed at the Hotel last Sunday night as it was my wife's birthday. Reservation F5Y-025V Room 1215 Unfortunately the overnight experience did no go to our expectation. Upon arrival there was a very slow response / solution to me not bringing my ACCOR card with me. Next time I will certainly bring the card. At 8.00pm we ordered a bucket of ice from Room Service and it never arrived. We had a bottle red instead of champagne. When checking out the next morning I advised my car was parked in the carpark down stairs and the cost was charged to my account. Next we went down to the carpark and was told we needed a Hotel voucher before we can collect my car. I had to go back up to reception and ask for the card. These 3 issues whilst they are not massive do not reflect on your staff and their training and I feel that I would not recommend your Hotel to my friends. Robert Poynting, Managing Director, Subway Development of Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Regularly used corporate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter W
Reviews.Content: I was allocated Room 226 this time, a better-than-average room. However, the TV did not work: although I reported it om check-in, it was not fixed for more than 24 hours. Showerhead did not adjust, and sink faucet in bathroom sprayed uncontrollably. There was no lounge chair for watching TV, and only a coffee table - not really convenient for eating room service meals. Mini bar items were not replaced after first night, and some items had expired. Room service breakfast offered 'sausages', but breakfast dining room offered only 'chicken sausages' - URK! No shiraz by glass in Sporters Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but walls are thin.”
Reviews.Author: RyanTravels24
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at the Menzies Sydney to wrap up a 20 day visit in Australia. The hotel's lobby is absolutely stunning, with glass chandeliers and plenty of seating area. The rooms are very cozy, and the beds are really comfortable. It's very easy to find your way around this hotel, and I have to say that the breakfast buffet at this hotel is absolutely delicious. The pool area is nice but the hot tub and sauna are even better! I only have a few complaints about this hotel. First, not all of the keycards worked! I shared a room with two other people and somehow, my key decided not to work during the 4 night stay. That wasn't a huge problem though. What bothered me was the fact that the shower leaked!!! After a day of confusion and soaked clothes, I had to put towels over the shower head to keep it from leaking! Hopefully that got fixed. Lastly, the walls were REALLY THIN. I could hear people from out in the hallway late at night! That's an issue but this hotel is so perfect in many aspects, that you can't go wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: “A choice between a room with no air-con or a room with a deplorable bed.”
Reviews.Author: AussieSteve88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel earlier this year for a couple of job interviews. I stayed two days and was unfortunate enough to have to change rooms after the first night of my stay. One room was in the south wing and the other in the north wing, so I will quickly review both wings. The south wing looked magnificent. The bathroom was neat and tidy and the room was what you would expect from a four star hotel. I found the tv difficult to use, but worked it out eventually. The problem with the room was that the air-conditioning wasn't working. This meant that the room was really really stuffy. My partner had trouble sleeping and I found it difficult. The bed was standard and I couldn't complain. Overall, the first room would rate 3/5, 4 if the air-con was working. Because of the air con problems, which made sleeping difficult, my partner and I requested a room transfer. The valet who moved our bags said that the air-con in the north wing was better and easier to work. While this was the case, it's a shame the rest of the room wasn't up to scratch. It was clearly the older section of the hotel and was incredibly run down, you could see it from the carpeting in the halls. The bathroom was disgusting, the grouting was mouldy, the toilet and bath/shower were disgusting. The room was oddly set-up, with the tv on a bracket that made viewing almost impossible. The bed was also deplorable. It was the oldest bed I've ever seen and needed to be thrown in the skip!! Basically, if you lay in the middle, the bed sagged so bad, you fell about 50 cms lower than the level the bed!! This made it impossible to sleep!! Overall, I would give the room 0/5!! It also should be noted that when moving, my partner and I left some stuff we had put in the mini-bar in the room, which was then thrown out on us, which was quiet disappointing. Other basic notes in the hotel: Service: Besides throwing out our stiff in the mini-bar, quite good. It took them a while to decided to move us to the second room, but I can't fault them otherwise. Value: Paid about $150 a night, so not bad, but if I had spend both nights in the north wing, would have been very disappointed. Cleanliness: South wing was great, so was the lobby and the bar. North wing ... don't go there!! In fact, the lobby was impressive, really nice and well kept. It looks amazing!! In the lobby they had free wi fi, it was only about 30 mins, but was quite nice to get some time to check my e-mails for free. Location: Close to Wynard station, like 1 min walk thru the station. This makes the hotel close to the rocks and Pitt Street Mall, which is what my partner and I go to Sydney for. On the whole, I may go back, but only if I could be guaranteed a room in the south wing, the north wing was terrible and def wouldn't go back. On the whole, the hotel had some ups and some downs, but mostly downs.

Reviews.Title: “AGAIN, ANOTHER late entry/missed travel stay for a review.”
Reviews.Author: NQTropics
Reviews.Content: THE MENZIES, ON WYNYARD PARK. SYDNEY Stayed 11-13 MARCH, 2011 Location: 14 Carrington Street 2000 SYDNEY Opposite Wynyard Station overlooks the park. Reception: Reasonably friendly staff with check in/out. Would not have hurt them to smile! Hotel facilities: 60â€™s 70â€™s trying to be OLDE world. Dark corridors and a musty old building smell. Also in the rooms. Complex facilities include bars, quiet lounge. Restaurants, Gift shop and news agency. Internet den as such. They have a lot of tour package tourists here, so it was crowded. If you want to take ride to anywhere there are busses out the front and the Train station across the road. Below that you have a supermarket and takeaways. Local pubs also nearby. In two words, Handy Accommodation. Get the feel of this review yet? Room: Junior Suite 1 King Bed. Master stroke here. Forget the official website pictures; the room (Our booking) is not how it is. The windows are dirty small portholes to the busy street below. The overlooking park reference is overstated. They have made two standard rooms into a â€œsuiteâ€� by connecting them. Two identical bathrooms with shover over bath. One side has a lounge and TV, the other the bed and a TV. Not a Suite in my experience as there is no flow or feeling to the space. The musty smell was bad, as mentioned with corridors. One bathroom toilet had duct tape holding the cistern pipe to the pedestal. Not that I check for these things it was too obvious to miss. Minbar and Tea/coffee etc as a usual in most hotels. Two lots of hanging space. Funny about that! Rate: Used Accor Advantage Plus. One free breakfast diner one paid. Room AU 320.00, second night AU 350.00. Food: Breakfast was buffet style and had nice offerings. Again it was busy with tour guests. Overall only a very average but reasonable stay. Would not recommend unless you are on a tour looking for cheap lodgings which Iâ€™m sure they offer these groups. Safe travels R & G

Reviews.Title: “Great except be prepared for $50 parking”
Reviews.Author: cheshrgato
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Menzies is in a great location if you like to walk to your destinations in Sydney. It is across from a small grassy park, and a Starbucks. It is adjacent to a train station and a bus station. It is a few walkable blocks fron the Rocks, the Circular Quay, the Harbor Bridge, and the Opera House. George Street is one block away and has tons of pubs, nicer restaurants and shops. The malls are also nearby. Max Brenner chocolate shop is a must do at the end of the block. The rooms were nicely appointed, adequately sized. Small like all urban European hotels. Very nice bath, incredibly comfortable bed, even for picky me. Grout needs a good scrub / replacement on the floor, or I'd give a 5. The television was small. The magazine library in the room was a nice touch, and was frequently updated. The room service prices were reasonable for Sydney prices, and the food was fast and delicious. Lastly, the parking is not through the hotel, but a separate company. WITH validation it is $50 AU a day. So ride the train or bus.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies, great location, nice staff, hotel looking a little tired”
Reviews.Author: MarkF54
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Menzies a couple of times a year. The rooms are basic but always very clean. The staff are always friendly and the piano bar is a good place to relax. The pool and spa are ok but nothing to get excited about. All in all the Menzies is great because of it's location. I will stay again. It's near the buses and trains and a short walk to Circular Quay. Tip: skip breakfast, it's very ordinary but the evening restaurant is good.

Reviews.Title: “central to northshore bus stops”
Reviews.Author: pardre Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was at the correct location to get the buses to the northshore it is also handy to the rocks, circular quay & the ferries Nearby shopping arcades were very handy Resaurant for dinner was good Will use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay was good. Our only negative was the party which went for several hours into the night in the next room which was annoying. The location was great for what we were looking for being central to our needs. Parking was good value being an acceptable amount for an overnight stay. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: SteveandDD Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: What a nice surprise to find our hotel directly opposite a train station - we are from the country and decided to take a citylink train into town. The hotel was clean and comfortable but most importantly QUIET!!! We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, room very run down - must of been oldest part of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Would suggest not requesting a twin room - was an older and run down part of hotel. Usually rooms are lovely. However, service is always very good at this hotel. Breakfast is quite good for a buffet. I will continue to stay at this hotel for all my business in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location. Bed is very comfortable. Had the best sleep ever. Had dinner at the restaurant great food at a good price, nice surroundings and good service. Buffet breakfast was a bit ordinary. Good place to stay as it is close to tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kalwatch Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel as the location is very central to Darling Harbour, The Rocks and Sydney CBD shopping. You can walk everywhere, hence no need for buses, trains, just park the car and walk. It is family orientated as it has an indoor pool, gym, spa, sauna. The restaurant is also excellent as is room service.

Reviews.Title: “Heating”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is well situated the central heating is kept uncomfortably hot for sleeping and there is no individual room control of this. The concierge service was particularly friendly and helpful. Rates on special are good value.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: missannabelle2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Saturday night when it had been 23oC in Sydney during the day. The air-conditioning clearly didn't work and our room was like a sauna. When we complained to management, we were moved to another room which had wet carpet due a leak in the bathroom. The new room was also very hot and noisy. We did not sleep well due to the heat and did not enjoy our time at The Menzies.

Reviews.Title: “Room not sufficent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I feel that the room was not as good a depicted in the pictures online. The T.V. was terribly small. And the parking was inconvenient. However the hotel in it self was very clean and beautiful and the location was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “no good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There is no way that this a 4 star hotel. The rooms were in disrepair and grubby................ We booked the surperior room which was $200 / night ( without breakfast ) and it was terrible so we were offered another room which was still in the same class and looked a little bit better however still tired and grubby. The bathroom floor had not been cleaned and we also found broken glass on the floor. we would never stay here again or recommend anyone to stay unless they had to be across the road from a train station that takes you to the airport and they didnt care about the quality of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great therapy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked in to see Jersey Boys and we chose the Menzies because of the pool and spa and central location in Sydney CBD. We were not disappointed. The pool and spa were great and put us in a very relaxed mood for the show. It was only a short walk to the Theatre Royal. The 3 course dinner after the show was declicious and with advantage plus it was very reasonably priced. The breakfast was good. The service matched the old world charm of the Menzies. I will continue to choose the Menzies for Sydney short breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location close to Circular Quay, the Rocks & Darling Harbour. Wynyard station on the doortsep makes travel easy, especially with kids. The rooms are fairly basic but clean & perfect for an affordable short stay. The 2 double beds were not the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in (one very soft, one hard & both seemed way past their use by date) but we could not complain overall. A cot is provided free of charge which is unusual but just part of the really good service at the Menzies. We would return & let others know about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love staying at the Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Love the Menzies, the restaurant, the piano bar, the pool. Love it all! and it's smack bang in the middle of Sydney! We stayed here and had a young teenager and toddler and while the toddler was well looked after we enjoyed ourselves at the piano bar. too relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Accor 20 year celebration”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When booking I continually asked if there was parking included and was told there would be parking avail. I was never told that it was $45 a day extra. I did ask for a room with a view and was told that they would upgrade me. I thought it would be to a room with a large window that I could sit and look at the view. Not a tiny window that you cant sit and look out. That cost me an extra $30 a night. There were no biscuits in the room to have with tea and coffee (I have a motel myself and I thought that this was just courtesy ). The beds are too soft . Also we had trouble entering our room everytime because the swipe card had trouble working, or we had trouble working it. It does not show you what to do and we had never seen it before. So after getting to use our (free) night I definitely dont think the value is there anymore which is a shame as I have been a member on and off for a lot of years going back 20 years.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CHM1943
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights. With family to visit over the weekend in the western suburbs and on the central coast, and business to attend to in Chatswood, the Menzies was ideally located. It's right at Wynyard Station, and is close to all other public transport, and also to Darling Harbour. The room on the 14th floor was a good size and well-appointed, and the staff were most obliging.

Reviews.Title: “Young Endeavour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Desk staff very accomodating with room preferences (not near lifts) and granting a later than normal checkout time. Concierge staff most helpful. Excellent night on Friday in the Piano Bar, Pianist Kylie Stephens was outstanding making everyone feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the airconditioning and age of rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When I booked in I asked the front desk what is the room like. His comment was it "is on the 10th floor!" Room should have only been let out as an emergency last booking. Overseas back packers are in better condition. Thank God Ben organized a change of room, didn't even bother with the airconditioning as it takes half an hour to work. Choose the hotel to be in walking distance of Darling Harbour. As I was walking back and forward I noted where all the other hotels were. Dining room and service first class. Food lovely

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Artwrk
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Sydney for a family vacation with my wife and two kids (ages 14 & 7). The hotel is perfectly located in the city center of Sydney across from Wynyard Park and train station. The hotel has a very nice lobby area with a cafe, restaurants, and a convenience store. We were granted an early check-in by the hotel staff due to a 6:30 a.m. arrival in Sydney. We stayed in a double double room in the north wing of the hotel with a view of the adjacent office building next door. While the room was okay for our needs, it was definitely starting to show its age. Some of the furnishings in the room were a little worn and looking a bit aged. The beds were comfortable, but were on rolling casters. Every time we sat on the beds, they moved 6 inches. I found this kind of odd and annoying at the same time. While the hotel itself was average, the best thing about this hotel is the location. The hotel is a 10-minute walk to either Circular Quay or Darling Harbour - two of Sydney's main attractions. The rear of the hotel is also on George Street which is a main thoroughfare through downtown. There are plenty of shopping and eating venues on George Street to choose from. During our stay at The Menzies, there were several large groups of high school aged kids staying at the hotel. The kids were getting pretty loud in the lobby area and even on our hotel room floor. It didn't get to the point of getting out of control, but there were a lot of kids running about the hotel during our stay. We found the train station very convenient for getting breakfast, coffee, and snacks. There is a Coles Market in the train station which was very handy in getting snacks and drinks for the kids. Overall, The Menzies is an average hotel in an excellent location. While the rooms could be a little nicer, I WOULD stay at The Menzies again. One big negative is the wi-fi situation. I was told by the staff that wi-fi was available free of charge in the hotel lobby for each guest for 30 minutes in a 24 - hour period. The wi-fi was fair at best, and was really only available for approximately 20 minutes each session before it timed out. We had a pleasant stay at The Menzies, and an unbelievable time in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Worn around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on wotif.com and expected a park view. Our room was on the corner of the building and so you could just see the very edge of the park. My reservation also promised modern ergonomic furnishings - the whole room just looked worn and tired, the bed was uncomfortable, the bathroom wasn't exactly spotless, and the service was terrible. The positives? The water pressure in the shower was quite good, and the location was excellent, right across the road from Wynyard Station, and close to the shops. For the money, I expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Menzies hotel due to its location and the quality of the facility. I had a wonderful stay at the Menzies hotel due to its location and the quality of the facility.I had a wonderful stay at the Menzies hotel due to its location and the quality of the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You ....”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: for all your help during our stay, especially when our arrival was delayed and you very kindly accommodated us with an extra night at the hotel. I would certainly recommend The Menzies and will be staying with you again on my next trip to Australia.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: mar7har
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of Sydney. Grand style for a reasonable price. Booked and prepaid well in advance for a junior suite and absolutely no regrets. Loved the suite, facililites, ambience and of course location. Walk to anywhere worth going to in the city and Wynyard station seconds away!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: crookedannie
Reviews.Content: Well worth considering on a stopover in Sydney. Excellent position in city. Bang inbetween Darling Harbour and Circular Quay (either walkable in l0 mins). Plenty of eating places nearby. Rail station on the door step. What more could a tourist ask for. Oh yes and a bed to die for.

Reviews.Title: “thumbs up for location, thumbs down for comfort”
Reviews.Author: NibblingNomad
Reviews.Content: I would only recommend this hotel if your top priority is location - this is right next to the Rocks and easy walk to Circular Quay. In my case, comfort is more important, and particularly a comfortable bed. On this basis, I do not recommend this hotel. Check out the pic of our mattress! It was some cheap, thin thing that squeaked. Also, check out the lame blankets. I got a neck ache after 2 nights . . . the choice is yours. Oh, and parking is AU$45/day!

Reviews.Title: “Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Two of three lifts in the South wing were not operating. Guests that were not hamperred with luggage or health problems were taking the stairs but those who required a lift were queing on on all floors, in our case over 10 minutes. At least one of the EFTPOS machines at checkout was not operating causing further delays on checkout. Certainly inadequate if one was tied to a tight schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Truly went well beyond what was expected”
Reviews.Author: duckby4
Reviews.Content: After having been caught up in the ash cloud drama and having fleed Tasmania a day early than expected the Menzies went well out of their way to accomodate us.. after a 12 hour bus trip and arriving at Sydney Airport at 4 am in the morning after a 6 am phone to call the Menzies we had rooms made available to us to rest our weary eyes. Some 26 hours after checking in no extra charge was made to us NOW THATS SERVICE well done to everyone the staff were fantastic...

Reviews.Title: “basics”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Your towels are getting very thin and your tea bags are too exotic.....please can we have basic tea for our early morning cuppa!!!! Camomile and Early Grey are specialty teas! Breakfast was a bit of a none event!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Pfeiffers
Reviews.Content: Had to attend a function in Bridge Lane. Walked to Circular Key for dinner and then walked to function. This Hotel was clean and comfortable, the service was excellent and the location was ideal for our requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Good size rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a very good size. The rooms are clean. It was in a very good location for the main attractions in Sydney. We was disappointed though as there was a half a open packet of sugar left sitting there and also the tea/coffee sachets hadn't been refilled.

Reviews.Title: “love the menzies, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel with a great location, right opposite wynyard train station and a coles express for those late night needs. also easy walking distance of the cbd and circular quay. staff are always professional.

Reviews.Title: “SYD Break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located across the road from Wynyard Train Station (take the lift to the top floor if you're catching the train). There is a park opposite hotel so there is no building directly looking in. I stayed in a Junior Suite. Plenty of room and it was quiet. Staff were pleasant and efficient. Room service was good and prompt. There is a convenience store in the hotel with a good range of products.

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies-A Grande Dame”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at the Menzies, arriving the night before a 1 day conference, knowing of it for many years, although never having stayed there before. I always regarded it affectionately, having supplied it equipment many years before... Everything went smoothly-with the improvements in the Accor Advantage website, my booking was easy, and quickly confirmed. The staff I spoke to was friendly and competent (I called ahead, due to arriving late). It has a relatively small lobby, elegant 1940's brass and marble feel, and easy access from everywhere. Being in central Sydney, it is in a great location for anything you choose to do. Breakfast was a very adequate (especially the hot food), but not overwhelmingly elaborate smorgasbord. The only (minor) negatives were that the room (and I acknowledge that it was a "free" Accor Advantage room, which are usually the smaller interior rooms) had some peeling wallpaper and looked a bit tired, and that there was no fruit juice at all at breakfast. All in all, it was more than adequate, and I will be happy to stay there again, arrive earlier, and utilise some of it's finer (pool, sauna, bar...) facilities!

Reviews.Title: “wet sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: room was great, staff wonderful, facilities were excellent, dissappointed with mainmeal in restuarant, sydney turned on the rain i think to impress us (we are from the bush), we would return to the menzies but would only recommend the breakfast (very good)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the heart of Sydney for those with families. It is very close to the subway and the rest of Sydney's attractions. The rooms are well presented and spacious. The staff while helpful are not over bearing. However the internet was expensive and some of the hallways were shopping their age. I would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: cavamebri
Reviews.Content: Fairly old hotel, but quite like the fittings. Otherwise nothing special about it - just another room in a city! Breakfast was quite expensive i thought

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Xanadu73
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Menzies. While the hotel itself is tired and could do with a refurb, it is very clean and offers all the amenities you need. The best thing going for it (and the reason I returned) is the location. It is extremely convenient for public transport being directly across the road from Wynyard train station, which is on the city circle loop, as well as being on a direct line to both the domestic and international airports (AUD$15 one-way trip). It is also an easy 10 minute walk to Circular Quay...enough time to enjoy an ice-cream on your stroll back from dinner! You are also just a short walk to the CBD's shopping. I did not eat in the hotel during my stay so I cannot comment on the food offerings. I wouldn't choose this hotel for a 'romantic' getaway with your partner, however if you are in Sydney to eat, drink, see and do then it's an ideal base.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable accommodation for the price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and accommodating and agreed to move us into a room with a view. Overall the hotel is reasonavble for the price. Its an old hotel and the lifts are very noisy to the extent we could hear them until late at night in the room we were in. Room sizes are average but the bathrooms are tiny, especially for a family. Would we stay there again - Yes. Its comfy accommodation at a reasonable price in a good location. And the staff are friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay there again. Just dont expect a five star ...because its not.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, location and service are a big plus!”
Reviews.Author: travelbugg0808
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we felt very welcome by the concierge and reception, helping us with our luggage and we arrived a little early, so tired from our flight but thankfully there was a room available. The room was nothing special but was decent for the money we spent and overall room was clean and beds were comfortable. Room temperature was a little stuffy, and there are no balconies in this hotel, so that was a let down but overall it was decent. Breakfast is reasonably priced and very good, had a few drinks at the Piano Bar aswell and atmosphere was great! Hotel is close to everything in the city! Trains, buses and taxi's all outside the hotel, rocks and darling harbour about 15 mins away, close to shopping and pubs and cafes, all a short walk from the hotel. Staff were absolutely fantastic, Meredith from breakfast and Yasmine from recpetion were so sweet and very helpful, concierge named Pascall and the Manager Murfouz were really great aswell. They all make you feel very special and they went above and beyond, very good customer service standards at this hotel. Only downside were the lifts were very slow and we had a friend cvisit us third day and he paid a lot for parking but overall this hotel has a very classic feel to it and we wouldn't mind coming back as long as the prices are the same. Thank you Menzies staff for a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer serice and a great stay. Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Mlleruby
Reviews.Content: I had to find a hotel at short notice and almost everything was booked out in Sydney on a Wednesday night. I hesitated to stay at The Menzies having read a few poor reviews but my stay was a happy surprise. I stayed for 2 nights in a King Room facing Wynyard Park. Although my room was in the older section of the hotel they have done their best to renovate the furnishings and it was quite pleasant. Loved the key system - just wave your card over the door lock and presto! What really stood out though were the staff - they were the best I've ever come across staying at a hotel anywhere - friendly and professional. I had room service which was also excellent, enjoyed the TV system with numerous pay TV channels and the bed was comfortable with good pillows. The toilet flushed by pressing what looked to be a light switch - unusual! Constructive criticism - the hotel was full on the first night but only one lift appeared to be working. A note to advise guests why we had to wait so long would have been helpful. Also the towels are a little small and worn. Overall I would definitely stay at the Menzies again, it was very good and is in an excellent location. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally right across the street from the Wynyard Train Station, where you can access the airport and any other location you desire in Sydney. We were able to walk to Darling Harbour, the Sydney Tower, the Rocks area and the Opera House/Circular Quay (a bit of a long walk, but still walkable). The Menzies Arcade next to the hotel connects you to George Street, which is loaded with shops, restaurants and pubs. The hotel itself is nice; bathrooms are very small, but we were comfortable. The concierges were extremely helpful. The only disappointment was the eating choices at the hotel itself. We usually eat outside of the hotel, but we flew in from Cairns on a Thursday, and arrived at the hotel at around 7:30 PM. We were in "travel attire" and were tired, so we did not feel like going out or to the fancier restaurant on level one. Instead, we went downstairs to Sporters Bar & Grill for a more casual meal and a couple of cold beers. We walked in at 7:45, and they told us they were closed. We ended up at the fancier restaurant, where mains are in the $35 range. By the way, when I checked in, I asked the desk clerk how late Sporters was open that night, and she said they were open "late". I guess 7:45 is late in some people's eyes. If you stay, don't count on Sporters being open. I have no idea what their hours are, you just never know when they're open. The following Saturday, we wanted to stop in for a beer, and they were not even open at all on Saturday. I'm not sure how you can call yourself a "bar & grill" and be closed at 7:45 on a Thursday, and not open at all on Saturday. Other than never knowing when Sporters was open, our stay was great, and I would certainly stay there again if I returned to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies Hotel was an absolute disgrace”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely dissappointing. First we had an upgraded hotel room for 4 people & the room was extremely small. Our friends from NZ had a standard room & there room was heaps bigger. We booked for 4 people & every day there was only 2 towels in room. Our daughter had her own pillow for sleeping & that went missing. Funny no employee could find it. Then after we had not touched the mini bar & even after checking out & room was checked, we get a bill for $13.70 saying it was for the mini bar. My face mirror was broken by one of the cleaners but not reported. We have called the hotel with regards to this & no one will return our calls. Parking was a disgrace. fancy not having carparking for no charge while staying at hotel. No one tells us that until we are at hotel. JOKE. Then we find dents in back of car & no one knows about this either. The hotel was a disgrace & we will be telling everyone of this & not reccommending The Menzies to anyone. Should have stayed at a backpackers hostel . Definitely will not be back. The holiday at this hotel was one that won't be remembered. Disgraceful & that is an understatement. Why won't anyone return our calls? I wonder how many other people have had these problems. They must employ ex crims hey.

Reviews.Title: “Family holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Would stay here again. The service was great. Concierge Andrew went out of his way to make you feel welcomed, no matter your age. Location was central to Darling Harbour, the CBD, The Rocks & public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well .located hotel where the customer is the most important person in the hotel, well done.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located next to Wynyard station, one stop from Central station, the hotel is well located. The room we had was large with 2 double beds. We had 2 young children with us and they were very welcome. The customer service is amazing from 100% of the staff we dealt with. Even the door porters chatted to the chidren and cared about them. This hotel is good value and suitable for business and family travel. We felt more welcome here than in many 5 star hotels, we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “love the piano bar - room cleaners need supervision”
Reviews.Author: PAK777
Reviews.Content: I often stay here when visiting Sydney for business - the main attraction is the piano bar! The staff is great, selections of wine good- along with the nibbles! It is a good place to meet a client or guest. As mentioned previously by others, the rooms are so-so. I think that the key for me is that the cleaning staff leave an impression of not much care taken.

Reviews.Title: “avoid”
Reviews.Author: Marky_Mark4
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin. The front lobby and the location are the best aspects of this hotel. It's just next to the train station so it's really convenient. The rooms on the other hand are not worth the price. My room was just a little noisy since the hotel overlooks a busy bus stop in central Sydney, so I asked for a change to a quieter one on the other side of the building. Got a new room and great I thought, except that the new room was just as noisy, and on the same side of the building. So what if the staff can't provide a quieter room. That's understandable. But why waste everyone's time changing rooms for no good reason. I guess the staff just don't care. The bed in the new room was the saggiest piece of rubbish I have ever slept on. A disgrace actually. Maybe that was my punishmemnt for bothering the staff with my room change request? The bed must have been 20 years old. Woke up with a backache in the morning. Carpets were a little dirty also. The gym is in a itny little room with no windows and what little equipment there is is very old. Anyway, I could go on.....but I won't. I would say AVOID this place, unless you get a super cheap price on the room, or you really have to be right next to a train station. It's maybe a 3 or 3.5 star standard place.

Reviews.Title: “Like stepping back in time”
Reviews.Author: scotthumphries
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on business. Quite a large hotel right in the middle of the CBD - the location is great. The decor in the public areas and my room (823) were dated and felt like they would have been chic in 1979. My room was quite noisy and had no obvoius heating controls. On the plus side, it had a decent iron and ironing board which is rare! Re decor, I understand from my colleagues though that some rooms are refurbished. It's a bit of a time warp but the location is useful. The nearby Rydges Jamison is more modern.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were all very happy. It was a wonderful hotel, the people were friendly. The swim and sauna each morning was fantastic. The room was always absolutely clean and we slept deep. No noise. The Menzies was perfect for a seminar in the city, which was walking distance and at night we had great restaurants to eat at. Altogether a great relaxing stay to refresh for a a hectic 7 day conference. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “My trip to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: From the moment that I parked my car I knew that I was in for an unforgettable experience. Whilst I only booked one room withy two beds I was updated to two interconnecting rooms for the children. My time spent at the Piano Bar was also enjoyable with a very accomplished youg female pianist.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: darkroots
Reviews.Content: Although this is an older hotel, well maintained, updated, and the room/beds were very comfortable. Staff extremely helpful in planning day trips, great but reasonable food spots, etc. Nice breakfast buffet - but get included in your room rate since separately it is pricey. right across the street from train station which has shopping, grocery store, eateries, etc. ONly a few blocks from waterfront

Reviews.Title: “4days with Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staffs were helpfull and friendly. Thought the location is perfect and within "walking distance" to the main entertainment venues, restaurants etc especially when you are travelling with kids. There are something that probably can be improved such as: the quality of furniture, electronics appliances. It was difficult to watch the TV due to the size and distance to the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic restaurant, rooms ok”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location = walking distance to Quay, City and Darling Harbour. Food and service in restaurant fantastic. Rooms ok but, given we were 3 or 4 (parents and children) in rooms, only 2 cups, glasses, towels etc on arrival - they should note how many people booked to a room and ensure additional 'supplies'. Breakfast good. Facilities (TV size etc) in rooms could be better - with DVD player - for kids, would be great.

Reviews.Title: “meh”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and very functional. The thermostat was broke and the room was sweltering, so was advised to 'open the window' which meant lots of city noise. On the topic of noise, the people in the room next door were either vacuuming or using the hairdryer at 1 o'clock in the morning, regardless, the noise was way above what I had expected. I stayed due to location, which is excellent for hitting the rocks, circular quay, and the harbor, and I had friends from over seas staying there. Didn't use many of the services, so really can't rate good/bad.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: Buzz0611
Reviews.Content: For a so called 4 star hotel, the Menzies hardly rates as a 3 star hotel. Firstly we were given a room looking out onto a central area which was horrific. We couldn't even see the sky. It felt like it was night time when it was a sunny day. We were booked in for 5 nights, so the next morning I asked to be shifted to a room on the outside of the hotel. The girl as the front desk eventually did so but only after huffing and puffing about it like it was a major inconvience to her. This room was better in so far as it had some light coming in the window, but the beds were so worn that I could feel the springs coming through the mattress when I sat or laid down. The fan in the bathroom didn't work, so every time you used the shower you had a sauna and a fogged up mirror. The lampshade on the desk was loose and the fridge in our first room didn't keep our milk or drinks cold!! I requested a spirits glass from reception, as they only provide wine glasses, but it took 2 hours for it to arrive at our room. The desk chair was covered in what looked like dry spilt milk and was so disgusting I wouldn't even sit on it!! I asked for it to be replaced with a clean one, but it took me to ask 3 different people to eventually get a so called "clean" one (it was actually almost as firthy as the previous one). The third person I dealt with over the chair was a front desk male who was so extremely rude and condescending to me that I was almost in tears. It was like it was too much trouble for him, like he had better things to do with his time. I just don't know how he even has a job there as he was just sooo rude!!! The whole hotel was full of American high school kids who had no respect for other guests. They would run up and down the passages, sit in the hallways, press every button in the lifts so the lifts took forever to go up and down and hogged all the facilities!! Lastly to cap it all off, for the last 3 nights we had trouble with a group of young people who came home late (4am, 3am, 2am) and then yelled in the hallway, slammed their door continuously and played loud music!! Your typical nightmare when you are sightseeing all day and are exhausted. The girl who checked us in was extremely nice and even asked us the next day when she saw us how our room was. The concierges were lovely, opening the door for you and helping you with your bags down the steps. And lastly the location was quite good. But despite all this I will never, never, never stay at the Menzies again and I would definately not recommend it to anyone (not even my daughter's high school!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfy room, good food”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were in the Sydney CBD for shopping and show, the Menzies Hotel is a very central location to all the major shops and transport connections, train, bus & ferries were just a short walk. The room overlooking Wynyard Park was roomy and comfortable but I didn't pay the extra $18.50 p/n for parkview room as the website suggested. We dined in the Parkview restaurant using our Accor Avantage Plus membership card which gives us 50% of meals for a couple which is a great saving with mains at $36. The food and service was first class, even when dining at 9.30 following a show, however the restaurant could have been a little warmer in July. The downside is car parking at $45 p/n makes it expensive when staying 2 nights. A great place to meet friends for coffee or a drink in the ground floor coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Cannot beat the location, the rooms are adequate. I got to stay on a half price special so was very affordable....but $45 to park a car 24 hours...IMO way over the odds. Staff all very friendly and helpful. Room very quiet even though next to elevator..didn't hear a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Our busness stay over”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the welcome we recieved at reception was excelent. Our room was good and as we attended a function for dinner that night away from the Menzies we cannot rate the Restrurant. Breakfast was very good. Lois L Garlin

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? 1. When flushing the toilet it sprayed up over the seat each time used. 2. Each time I turned over in bed the entire bed ,oved by a few inches. 3. Room fittings about 15 years out of date. 4. To stop full room service at 10:30 pm just as the theatres are closing is pretty poor planning, but the toasted sandwiches that I paid for from limited room service were presented at the level i would expect from a Truckers roadside cafe. I've used Accor for some years but this experience is causing a rethink. Sorry I can't be more positive but my total bill was close to $450 for the level I expect in a $100 motel.

Reviews.Title: “Old style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel- quiet, very old style. Hotel is in the process of being renovated. The room we had was very old although clean. The bathroom was extremely small. The air conditioner was hard to regulate. The regular milk chocolate in the mini bar was past it's time and was white in colour. I wouldn't stay again in a room like that given it was $179 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Family stay in the city”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the warm welcome, the heated pool facilities and kicked on back in our room to watch in house movies. In the heart of the city we were close to whatever took our fancy - Pancakes at the Rocks, a trip to see the under floor map at customs house

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Quality hotel, good reputation, rooms getting a bit tired. Broken rail in bathroom, bath fixture was also not working. Bathroom just a little too small and layout not the best. No way of adjusting the airconditioning. Air conditioning looked as though it was a repair to a repair which had broken. Having no way of adjusting the aircon caused restless nights sleep. Other parts of the hotel were good as I like the grandure of the old style hotel lobbies.

Reviews.Title: “good food and wine festival and accomodation for all”
Reviews.Author: chunky51 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: was a great day and night spent at Menzies hotel Darling Harbour with my partner, we went to the good food and wine festival and tried all the food and wine we could , had a lovely lunch and got plenty of samples and products to take home , the beds at the Menzies were so comfy we wanted to stay for longer, breakfast had a great selection and you weren't rushed , had another engagement the next day, so had to move on, thanks Menzies for a great night . would stay there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everyone was polite and friendly. The location is excellent next to Wynyard Station which conveniently has a Coles in it. The evenings are pleasant (we stayed Thursday night) with a brilliant pianist in the house bar. Rooms/ hallway could do with a spruce up before long.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in a Superior Wynyard room overlooking park - room was very comfortable for 2 adults and 1 nine year old for that time. Location of the hotel is fantastic to explore Sydney, by foot or train/bus is right outside hotel. Staff are extremely helpful and welcoming. (Especially Meredith in the Carrington restaurant). The only issue we had was the inconsistancy of housekeeping. Some days we had excess coffees, soaps, towels etc and other days none were left when we needed it. Having said this, housekeeping staff were friendly and were extremely busy with a delegation of young Americans visiting. We had a fantastic time at the Menzies and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK. Rooms were quite old with no view and the toilet kept running. The pool was nice but could have been warmer.
