We had breakfast inclusive which was good, but there was always something that wasnt there. The coffee cups had run out, the glasses had run out, waiting for the food to be replenished or for the staff to take away dirty plates. Overall, it was in a good spot and an OK hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the Menzies Sydney a great place to stay due to the location. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is great value for money, yes a little tired but clean and safe. The rooms were large enough to fit 2 adults plus 2 children plus luggage. TV small but adequate. Room service meals were well priced and a good size. With the hotel being opposite a railway station, it provides easy access to the airport without the worry of traffic. We will be back - highly reccomnend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “complimentary room - below standard”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We used our complementary free night at the Menzies however when we opened the door to our "standard" room we were disappointed with the size of the room and the view through the window. We immediately went back to reception and for an extra $50 we upgraded to a room with a view of Hyde park, and a slightly larger room. The service was friendly. The room was clean. The proximity to public transport was also great. We also enjoyed the quietness of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Bit dated & disappointing, but a good location”
Reviews.Author: PippinCat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights away with friends. The rooms were clean and roomy, but the building really needs a revamp. We stayed on the 4th floor and the walls were rough, marked, carpet worn, and the rooms a bit down-at-heel. There was some metal box bolted to the wall beside my bed which I scraped my leg on twice - no idea what it was, just hanging off the skirting board. The lift was slow, the breakfast patchy (no reflection on the wait staff - they were run off their feet trying to keep up with the hungry hordes). Breakfast cereal was a choice of three: a weet box clone, corn flakes and what appeared to be rice bubbles. No muesli. Don't think I've ever been in a big hotel where there wasn't at least one type of muesli. And the hot food kept running out. Ate sausages without eggs or toast as supplies were out. We had two rooms but somehow couldn't have adjoining rooms - not sure why. We were a little early (1.40pm) checking in but would have waited if we could have had connecting rooms. The location was very good, even if the view was of buses. Wynyard Station across the road was convenient. Close to The Rocks, but a bit of a hike to Darling Harbour. Parking fees were expensive - $45 a day - but the staff were exceptional. I won't stay there again; the choice wasn't mine but for a little extra we could have stayed at the Novotel Darling Harbour or somewhere with a bit of a view and not so shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy customer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very noisy was next to the lane and noise started and 5 - 6am not happy. Got blanket as there was only a very thin layered doona with no cover but two sheets either side. Blanket was not soft and warm had to use my mother in laws dressing gown to keep warm.

Reviews.Title: “Sack the Breakfast duty manager”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, great lobby, great concierge, clean rooms. The breakfast duty manager should be dismissed. There is systemic problems in this area. I had breakfast twice during my stay, and couldn't believe the range of food recepticles that were empty (run out). Coffee from pot (run out). Bread (run out), bread plates and cereal plates (run out), spoons (run out). On both occassions I observed as guests continually had to approach floor staff for more food/bread/crockery/cutlery. Numbers of guests in the dining area was lean to moderate. I have never observed such a poorly run breakfast buffet. Sorry guys.

Reviews.Title: “SATISFIED”
Reviews.Author: chris1953 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located opposite Wynard Station and an easy walk to George Street, The Rocks, Circular Quay and the Bridge. Rooms are a little old fashioned but good sized and clean. Comfortable bed ( King size) Nice little piano bar and well equiped Gym. We enjoyed our 2 night stay

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, shame about the quality of the beds”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Menzies with my mother for an extended long weekend. We stayed in a twin room (two double beds) in the older part of the hotel. Good - Location (fantastic - accross the road from the main city bus stops and Wynyard station (on most of the train lines), around the corner from Max Brenner's chocolate cafe, and walking distance to Darling Harbour, Theatre Royal (Jersey Boys!!!) and shopping), very quiet in the room (and we were on the second floor) Bad - Matresses and pillows were about 20 years old and were uncomfortable (and I'm not usually fussy about this), breakfast was not worth the normal $35 pp (better value at 50% off), popular with tour groups (mainly American teenagers when we were there) Overall, I would rocommend it for the location and if you can get a good deal on the room

Reviews.Title: “Menzies - Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We cant fault the Menzies. From the time we arrived at reception to when we left was a great experience. The room was lovely. The food was beautiful. The staff was more than accommodating. Very professional and friendly. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: aussieloz88
Reviews.Content: Had to change rooms because air conditioner in first room did not work. Rooms are very very small. Nice staff and crap Internet. Lastly the mattress in the second room was very very poor. It was two single mattresses pushed together, they felt so bad I am reasonably sure they went to the tip to get ones that people threw out after 20 years of use.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Priced correctly at $150.00 per night, anymore would not have been reasonable. Parking very expensive at $45.00 per night and is not a good indictment on the hotel. Parking should be subsidised by room rate. Overall hotel is clean and pleasant. Breakfast facilities should be available for the early business traveller. Hotel is still trying to trade on its previous name and should concentrate on giving genuine business traveller more attention.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at The Menzies hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight so we could see The Jersey Boys. Hotel is in great central location & easy to get to from Wynyard station. Staff were very helpful & very busy - extra guests I suspect where there due to flights being grounded by volcanic ash from Chile.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at a centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good centrally located hotel clean and tidy but egg thrown on restaurant window was there for the duration of my stay. Not a major issue but one which could have been rectified by Hotel management sooner rather than later

Reviews.Title: “Hotter hot tub”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I thought the room design & comfort were great but the bath/shower looked like it hadn't been cleaned in ages! Loved the pool & spa but it should have been much hotter. Very disappointed that the sports bar wasn't open during the weekend, was looking forward to watching the footy and having a drink, had to go else where. The staff were great, specially the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant couple of days.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is extremely well located, close to trains and all other transport. Short walk to Circular Quay for ferries and Harbour Bridge. Has a great atmosphere, character & old world style. Everything was very good, service, food etc. Did find bed in standard Queen room probably due for replacement (not comfortable) My biggest complaint was about Hotel policy of charging a % fee for paying the bill by any credit card! Totally unnecessary and after a lovely two days put a sour taste in the mouth upon departure! What are they thinking, would they rather all bills be paid in cash causing extra security and armed vehicle pick ups.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay.Great central location. Close to Pit St Mall for City shopping. Short 5 - 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour. Across the road from Wynyard Station 1 stop to Circular Quay and the Rocks. Would have liked for the Sports Bar to have been open to be able to play pool due to very wet Queen's Birthday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Attadalephil Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The beauty of this Hotel is its proximity to Downtown Sydney everything is very close and it is easy to get to all the main tourist spots. We received excellent service from all the staff.The shuttle bus from the airport dropped us off and picked us without any problems. The room was reasonably clean could have done with a bit more TLC as we found a discarded tissue next to the bed. The breakfast was reasonable for a smorgasbord type meal though some of the items were not replenished when used.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The major asset the hotel has is its location in relation to wynyard station. The rooms are ok but not the best at the price point, also the internal noises of the hotel were similar to train travel noise - but softer. all up a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Overnight at the Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: while this is an older hotel- the staff and serivce was of an excellent quality. Everything was easy to do here, the staff very friendly and helpful. Location is fabulous right across from Wynyard St. It was super easy to get the city loop train to Central to get to the theatre and out to dinner. Close enough too to go out for a reasonable walk over Sydney Harbour bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Accor told us it was the same standard as the Sofitel - very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: GayleandLisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Menzies over the Queen's Birthday long weekend and I have to say found very little to be happy with. The primary complaint was the air conditioning in our room, even on the warmest setting it was blowing cool air. I note from other reviews that this is not a new concern. Perhaps the hotel charges at a four star rates and hope people don't complain. The heater sent to our room as an interim measure broke down after a minute of use. We were moved to a large room in the North wing which was better in terms of AC but lacked in cleanliness. There was a half smoked cigarette balanced on the hairdryer in the bathroom. The hairdryer itself refused to work after the first use. All of this was exacerbated when we arrived at the Restaurant for dinner. After specifically inquiring with the concierge if we needed to book and being told no, we were turned away as there were no tables available until after 8.30pm. The breakfast buffet was adequate but crowded. It was difficult to eat anything, as soon as the food was placed it was devoured in minutes by the waiting hordes facilitating another long wait before it was replaced. The elevators were grubby, in one we saw a stash of cigars and cigarettes stored in the recess for the lights. The only saving grace was the service offered by Jessica at Reception who arranged for us to change rooms with a minimum of fuss. Definitely not to the standard of the Sofitel as advised by Accor when booked.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at The Menzies Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very good, nice front service people, very helpful. Just one thing we couldn't find how to turn the lights on over head of beds. Nice and close to Train travel. Lovely quite rooms, nice big rooms plenty of room, good shower. If you don't want to eat in the Hotel, there are plenty of places really handy and very well priced especially for breakfast. The location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was GREAT except the beds & no thermostat in room”
Reviews.Author: travel97Alabama
Reviews.Content: We liked everything about the hotel except for the beds....The box springs have completely caved in and it looks more like a hammock than a bed....Every morning my husband and I both awakened with terrible back and body aches!! I have been all over the world and have never slept on such a worn out broken down excuse for a bed...This is an embarrasment for this hotel to except paying guests to sleep under thise conditions!!!! Also, we got so hot several nights of our stay and was informed that the temp is not controlled in the room even though a thermostat is on the wall..... other than that, the room was clean......Oh, one more thing, the maid did not leave us hand towels, or wash cloths on 3 different occasions.....If these things I listed were corrected, the Menzies would get a A+ rating, but at this point they get a C-.....................

Reviews.Title: “Well done during Flight crisis”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the servivce and assistance given to us as Quantas passengers during the volcanic ash crisis. The staff were exceptionally helpful, the meals were well organised and we were looked after well. I woul congratulate the Menzies for its handling of the additional bookings

Reviews.Title: “Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location directly opposite wynyard station, staff very helpful, rooms are in need of an update as they are very old. service very good and kid friendly. The location near busses and trains and close to shopping made the stay very easy with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Poor night's Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was brilliant, the staff, cleanliness and service was of a very high standard. We were upgraded to a King which we thought was excellent. Our room was on the 14th (top) floor, right under the airconditioning unit. The noise was unbearable. We actually had a very poor night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Want my money back”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Menziez on Saturday 11th June, it is now Thursday 16th June and they still have not released the $50 deposit they held on my credit card. Hotel staff are very rude and unhelpful when I've called trying to find out when I'll get my money back, and still don't have an answer.

Reviews.Title: “FAIR STAY”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Mattress too soft - providing very little, if any, back support Inability to control room temperature - often too cold Absence of shower gel Absence of slippers/ robe/ umbrella Poor parking facilities

Reviews.Title: “We Keep going back!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We always have a great time at the Menzies. The rooms are of ample size, the beds are really comfortable, the bathroom is quite roomy and very clean and tidy. The Food is great and good value for money but the highlight has to be the Piano bar after dinner on a Saturday night. The pianist/guitarist is fantastic and hugely talented. He gets everyone involved for a singalong to all your old favourites and every time we go we always have a great time.....

Reviews.Title: “Menzies Hotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: susanbluecanberraACT Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent position. It is easy to take the train from the airport to Wynyard and just walk across the road. It is within easy walking distance to the main shopping area, as well as to circular quay and the Opera House. The staff are always very helpful and pleasant. The foyer tea/coffee area has a charming old fashioned ambience and is a relaxing place to sit and enjoy a drink or tea/coffee. The beds are very comfortable. Last weekend was a cold weekend for Sydney and I found the room a little cooler than I would have liked, but would stay there again. The full breakfast is a bit expensive at $31, but again the staff are pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal getaway”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I arrived early but was able to access my room: quiet luxury and a welcome rest before heading out to sightsee.This hotel was such a wonderful find as everything I needed was within easy walking distance. I came to see the Jersey Boys and discovered I was only a few minutes walk from the theatre. Next day doing the tourist bit was easy from here. Wonderful start to the day was meeting a lovely couple during breakfast. Staff were very helpful. To top it all off, I had the choice of either a bus or the direct train just across the street to take me back to the airport. Loved it all!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location and good staff”
Reviews.Author: MollyFW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Menzies in central Sydney last week. While showing its age in some areas of the rooms it was perfectly satisfactory for my stay. I also found the bar / cafe area very comfortable for a number of meetings I had during my stay. All in all, better than expected and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel - good price, good staff, great city!”
Reviews.Author: Julia2600
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Menzies as we had a conference for part of the long weekend recently. We booked last minute and were pleased with the price and that breakfast was included as part of our Club membership. We ate in the restauarant for dinner and were pleasantly surpirsed -we received complimentary tasters - which were very tasty, and the meals were good quality and substantial, and our waiter, Shaun, was great. The only downside of staying at the Menzies was the price of parking - $45 per night, which is pretty steep and adds a lot to the bill at the end of a 2 night stay. There aren't many parking options in Sydney, so don't take the car! The Menzies also has a pool, spa, sauna and gym - the gym has a good range of equipment. All in all, a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “DATED!!”
Reviews.Author: JSAA
Reviews.Content: The lobby is a lovely, spacious and open area and the location is very good. The room was horribly dated. The carpet was pulling away from the wall, furniture looked like it was over 25 years old, the beds "rolled" away from the wall everytime you entered from a side and the bathrooms had very little counter space! I hear that some of the rooms have been updated but have an understanding of what your getting before booking. The window looked into guest room windows on the other side of the hall. Could no recommend as anywhere near a 4 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Froze the first night”
Reviews.Author: Penesloppy
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights on the Queens Birthday long weekend, as we were attending the Jazz and Blues Festival. We'd stood in cold, wet conditions all day so we were looking forward to a warm night in our hotel room. In spite of setting the temperature to the highest it could possibly go, we shivered all night. As well, our "king" bed was actually two singles pushed together. In the morning I asked for a room transfer and we were put in the "North Wing", twice the size of our original room and as warm as toast. I don't know what was wrong in the first building we were in, but the fact that the guy at reception offered to send us up a heater has to tell you something about the regular state of the air conditioning. Overnight parking is $45 per night, the most expensive in this city that we've come across. Apart from all that, lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mailler”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I purchased a budget room and that is what I got, but the staff and service were excellent. The tile work in the bathroom was broken and room spartan. The corridor and room appeared old and fairly worn with scuff marks and stains. The view to an internal wall was pretty depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to the Menzies Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great central location - easy to walk to all main attractions. Also very easy to get to from airport by rail. It is a shame the room was a little tatty and in need of a revamp. Overheating was a problem in trying to get a comfortable stay in the room (even in June weather conditions). Service was great from concierge, reception and cleaning staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great, central location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great central location, right opposite the Wynyard train station (with services to/from the airport). The rooms were clean and comfortable, although there was a room service tray with food on it left outside a room near us for at least a day. Otherwise, good staff and service. A good place to stay for a short sojourn Sydneyside.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Zeke212
Reviews.Content: Step into The Menzies for a meander down history lane. Oddly refurbished in no logical order, the place is in a great location (literally on the doorstep of a train station), but just lacks that little pizazz. Room service food passable, rates very good. Great for overnight stay, but not if you are trying to impress.

Reviews.Title: “Thomas' birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My son Thomas spent his 8th birthday in Sydney visiting the Aquarium, Wildlife Park and the Zoo. The Menzies' location was excellent for our visit and central to all our needs for the long weekend. Staff were really pleasant and helpful, and the room itseld was more than adequate. Thankyou:)

Reviews.Title: “Lifts the major problem”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have already reviewed our stay, so at the risk of duplicating our comments, I would say that the stay was only affected by extremely slow lifts. Otherwise, service and standard was fine. Restaurant menus were good, and Jan gave service above expectations.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Menzies a number on times, we find the location great, close to transport & a short walk to the main attractions. Staff are friendly & always helpful, would recommend to friends & family

Reviews.Title: “Free Night with Accor!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a free night using loyalty card Advantage Plus.The previous week we had stayed at Accor hotels at Brisbane, Coffs Harbour and Maitland. At The Menzies we were given a room on the top floor near the lifts that were noisy all night. So much for a good night's sleep prior to catching an early flight! It seems to be an Accor policy to allocate their worst rooms to "members" utilising their free night! In other respects the hotel was fine - good facilities and central.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and loved the vintage feel!”
Reviews.Author: M-CHF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Menzies for work and held a meeting in one of the function rooms the following day. I didnâ€™t actually pay for my room or for my food, so there isnâ€™t a great deal I can say about cost and value, but I absolutely enjoyed my stay. I travel frequently for work and have stayed in dozens of hotels, but The Menzies has probably been my favourite in Sydney. The staff were professional, the room was spotless and I loved the breakfast. The hotel catering and event management services were also great. I really enjoyed the attention to detail â€“ the staff opened the doors for me as I came in to the lobby, took my bag and called an elevator for me after I checked in! I also loved the vintage feel of the rooms, furniture and communal areas like the Piano Room and restaurant. I gather from reading other reviews that the decor is an acquired taste! If I were to organise another function in Sydney, I would definitely pick The Menzies.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag - Reception poor but Concierge amazing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: VERY Mixed experience. Reception was absolutely awful, basically slow and unhelpful. I rang hotel 4 times to get directions and lady seemed annoyed. Why she couldn't just give clear directions in the first place is baffling. (Yes they have a carpark at the back of hotel, then the lane, then the fact it is not labelled the Menzies etc. etc.). When we finally arrived she kept us waiting and then her manger stopped her to deal with a phone query, after we had waited so long, he barely looked up to apologise. Not a great look. Room was way too hot and a little small for price. The bar didn't even know how to take a meal order and seemed annoyed at the request (very surprising). The only positive experience I had was the concierge was amazing. The gentlemen, in particular the manager, went above and beyond to assist me and was funny and interesting. He really makes your hotel. I wish I could rate better just because of him!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thi hotel is conveniently situated in the Central Buisiness District area of Sydney.It is close to all local sites as well as being well serviced by local transport, with a train station opposite as well as various bus stops immediately outside the hotel. It is about 30 minutes from the aiport to the local station opposite, but on a direct link. the station,which has sufficient lifts to help people with heavy luggage get from the train platform to the street, with only the road to cross to get to the hotel. It is well run, by friendly helpful staff, with a choice of restaurants and bars. The only downside is that although it is an accor hotel group facility, it does not recognise Accor Favourite Guest reward card facilities.

Reviews.Title: “MenziesHotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Situated opposite Wynyard Station , the location was ideal for exploring the sights --especially the area around Circular Quay. A short walk to George St enabled us to take a tour of the City sights on the free green shuttle bus. All staff were friendly and courteous, the room was clean and the bed very comfortable.Overall , an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary for a Four Star”
Reviews.Author: apj101
Reviews.Content: For a 4* hotel, I thought that The Menzies was very average. The lobby was nice and the service was good, but the rest of the hotel needed work. The lifts didn't seem to all work - some issue with them, so there were long waits to get in a lift sometimes. The actual rooms were nice but need updating - they are starting to look very tired. The mattress sagged and needed to be replaced. The room service food was nice but nothing to write home about. The thermostat in the room didn't seem to work either, but at least you can open the window if needed. On the upside, the gym was quite good. The hotel was across the road from the train station. I wouldn't rush back to the Menzies. I thought it was a good three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average place but great location”
Reviews.Author: nuttjobz
Reviews.Content: This is a handy place for tourists -literally across a one way street from Wynyard Street station - trains are fantastic especially if you get a weekly pass.Which covers you for a return trip from the airport($15 each way) and can be used on any ferry bus or train.The oly catch we found was you need to specify your "zone" - we were travelling daily out to Olympic Stadium which requires a zone 2 pass and we had been issued with a zone 1 - no worries though - rail staff are exceedingly helpful. Back to hotel - rooms a bit tired but for the money we paid we could hardly expect the Hilton.Dinner was expensive but nice, and breakfast buffet was good. All in all okay but probably wont stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous old world ambience. Lovely rooms and great location. Recommend the Piano Bar and Restaurant on 1st floor. Only complaint was slow service to get a drink in the downstairs lobby bar. Order 2 rounds as you wont see them again for a long time!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were only there for the weekend but we had a fantastic stay. All the staff members were so friendly and helpful. We did not dine at the hotel but the menu looked yummy. The pool and spa are great. We will definitely be back again soon. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing on the whole”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Not the best of experiences, check in was poor, staff tried to assist with queries but overall very disappointing. Hoping the next time I stay there that they do lift their game! Rooms on the whole were good.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel to stay in...air conditioner was not working too well and was very hot in room that is why I rated the sleep poor....we did report this the next day. Have stayed at this hotel before and had no problems with air conditioner.....apart from that one problem which hopefully would be fixed I cannot complain about anything and would highly recommended this as a hotel that is good value for money and close to train station and darling harbour. We would stay there again... the staff are absolutely outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights at the Menzies for a Bridge climb”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for a Harbour Bridge climb, short walk to the bridge. Got a free bottle of wine, cheese board and chocolate cake when I mentioned on arrival that it was my son's birthday the next day! Got a corner room which was slightly bigger...very pleased with our second stay at the Menzies.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff in a great location. Great value. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Our only negative - because we stayed on a Saturday night we did hear some street noise during the night. This could have been avoided if we had closed the window but my partner is a fresh air freak. I would certainly stay at the Menzies again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect base to explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for the weekend to catch up with friends. It is perfected located close to The Rocks, Circular Quay and city shopping...the beautiful QVB and Strand Arcades are 5 mins walk away. I really wasn't at the hotel very much apart to sleep and shower but the rooms was clean, quiet and I felt very safe seeing I was a solo female traveller. I would recommend this hotel to anyone needing a central base. It's not luxurious but clean and comfortable and was perfect for me. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Poor service from staff with regard to letting us know what was happening...45 mins in the lobby at 8.30 pm with two small children whilst the fire alarm was going off....no one told us what was going on...checking out too forever with 3 staff and the line out the door...would I recommend to a friend..Yes but with reservations regarding service and car parking

Reviews.Title: “Not the best for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The business centre is a internet cafe type room, where you put coins in machines to view internet and print. I needed to scan a document which I couldn't do from the hotel, even asking reception to scan some important documents. Had to walk down the road to an internet cafe to get some documents scanned and emailed. The business centre is a joke, you couldn't host a meeting there. Hotel was OK, but as I travel for business a LOT I was surprised by the lack of facilities. Still recommend as a nice clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay at The Menzies Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies was very nice to stay at, friendly staff, rooms were clean and very good for the price. Only drawback was the parking of our car and getting from the carpark to the hotel.The carpark guys were a little abrupt in manner and we were not shown or told how to get to the reception area....we had to ask. Also had to carry our bags up a flight of stairs from carpark to the lift. We didn't have a lot but not the point. We would probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Grand yet comfortable and conveniently located in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: BlondieandDodgy Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is a great city centre hotel with all the modern conveniences fused with beautifully restored glimpses of the grand hotels of the past. Our standard room was roomy and bright with all the mod cons including a flat screen television and very comfortable bedding. The pillows were a little hard, and on request, housekeeping provided something more to our liking very quickly. Slept like a baby. On the 2nd night we returned for a drink in the Piano Bar, after dinner down at the Rocks, and ended up staying for over an hour as the pianist played favourite after favourite surrounded by a very enthusiastic audience. It was great fun. Nice cocktails too. Wynyard Railway station is literally across the street so it is super convenient for travellers. I would love to return but will have to wait for a special to appear on the Accor website as the room rates are little pricy and the internet and parking are not cheap either. All the staff were super helpful. A very pleasant weekend indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and great position”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night our room was so clean and comfortable and the hotel was located right in the heart of the city within walking distance to everything. the staff were very polite and helpful and we were able to leave our bags at the concerge all day. We also arrived early and we were allowed into our room at 9.30 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Our weekend away”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Since we joined the Accor Group we received a complimentary night , we chose to stay at The Menzies, where we have stayed previously, and always found to be excellent, the Hotel is in a great location between Circular Quay and Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at a Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peggysue43 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Top class service in all aspects, thoroughly enjoyed our stay, would recommend to all. Staff were very freindly and helpful, we specailly liked the warm welcom upon our arrival, it was very busy, but the front staff still had time to get us a trolley for our luggage while we waited to check in

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SophieT1
Reviews.Content: We loved the Menzies! It is located directly across the road from Wynyard train station and within easy walking to the city centre and Circular Quay. They have a great indoor pool and spa and the staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for many years. Excellent location. Staff are always friendly. Lifts were playing up this time, but a small inconvenience. If you want a good value hotel in the harbour city this is it. Train station 1 minute walk. Harbour ferries 5 minutes. Shops around the corner. Rooms are a good size. Bathroom a little compact but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely planned around location. The concierge department were very helpful in every respect. However, the housekeeping department left a lot to be desired. They never brought things that we requested until at least 24 hours later, and sometimes we never received them at all. In that alone, the value was not worth it....It was a very small room for the value as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wynyard Railway Station directly across the road, best way to get around Sydney. Free bus just around the corner in George Street, main attractions are all within walking distance. The piano bar was great, Rob was fantastic, got everyone involved and getting to know each other. He is an excellent musician. If you go there, ask him if he remembers Sue from Springwood and Veronica from Scotland and please give him my best wishes. Could not fault The Menzies in any way, I will definietly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Free Advantage Plus Night”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and 2 other couples. We have an annual night out to use our complimentary night and usually have dinner and breakfast at the hotel. The convenient location means we can easliy access the Dendy Opera quays for a movie, the railway opposite, and the Quay for our trip to Manly. We found the rooms excellent, the service exceptional and the food above average. we have stayed there before and are quite prepared to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with Accor club”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had paid 2 years of membership 2 x $289 and not been able to use our free nights accomodation. we booked a night prior to the expiry of the membership for the night of our anniversary one week after the expiry, this was done online and was confirmed and when we arrived we were told that we had to pay for the accomodation, we very dissapointed and we rang the Acccor club, we were transfered through to 3 different people and the third was unable to help or put us through to someone who could hung up on us. I would not recommend the hotel chain because of this experience.

Reviews.Title: “outdated”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was outdated but was clean , staff friendly and very helpful,no restaurant to eat at on Sunday night ,to get to the Pool which is also showing wear and tear one had to pass by the lobby ,overall in a good location but not value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel. I enjoyed it and would definitely stay there again and recommend it to other people i know. The service was very friendly and helpful! It is a very homely environment which made my stay comfortable. We stayed there as we had a concert at the entertainment center, it was a great location for this as it was only a short taxi. And a lovely walk in the morning for breakfast at the rocks! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies Hotel, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Exellent location - right over the street from Wynyard Train Station, which is a 15 minute trip from the airport. Only 10 minute walk to Circular Quay. We had a parkview room overlooking the park, were on the 6th floor, and it was lovely and quiet - couldn't hear any city traffic or noise. Rooms are a little old, nearly due for renovation, but clean. Mattresses on the 2 double beds a bit saggy, but OK for 1 person to sleep in. Room serviced nicely every day.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: when i first arrived, was greeted by the very friendly and helpful Andrew (concierge) who took my bag and me straight to the front desk to check in. The room was very clean and neat; lifts worked well. Was always greeted at the door and it was mostly held open for me to enter or leave. Fantastic location and very knowlegeable staff - when i asked for train directions, the person on the door coud tell me exactly how to manouvere the trains and the stations. well done Menzies

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I checked in at 2 pm on Monday the 9th of May in room 1411,I asked the receptionist if there was an up grade available and she said they were booked out. We returned back from dinner approx 10.30 pm and could not sleep due to a very noisy air con,we turned off the air con but still the same loud motor sound. I rang reception at 1am, very frustrated not able to sleep, a very helpful receptionist Neahmar relocated us to another room on the 5th floor. I was told they had 6 or more rooms vacant that night, I was not very happy. Regards Geraldine Campbell

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value for a great stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is an excellent place to stay in central Sydney. It has great public areas (lounges, bars, restaurants etc) in the old plush style that adds character and charm yur stay. The rooms and average in size and features though the rooms in the old wing are a little small. The staff are quick efficient and easy to deal with. I highly recommend the Menzies and a great place that is wonderful for money.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, good service”
Reviews.Author: jaenderc
Reviews.Content: I recommend staying in Menzies hotel. Its location is perfect, you can walk to many attractions in Sydney from it, they have a very good complimentary concierge service. Wi-fi is always a problem in Australia, I can't understand the reason, but they grant you thirty minutes daily for free. In most countries that'd be outrageous, but considering Australia, where most hotels simply make you pay a lot of money for wi-fi, it is reasonable. I would mention that the bathroom is ok, but should be renewed. Overall, it is a very good option.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with the musty smell that greeted us as we got out of the lift. A wet patch on the carpet adjacent the lift progressively became worse all weekend. Housekeeping was not up to the standard we are used to at Accor hotels,in particular, bed making skills were nowhere to be seen. We certainly hope our next visit (whether it be to The Menzies or another hotel in the group) will see a marked improvement. Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Len0s
Reviews.Content: We chose this place as the Tripadvisor reviews were positive and the price was better than many in similar locations - and we were not disappointed. The hotel was nothing partiuclarly special - but it was fine for all our needs and the location was spot on. It was close to the train station for access to the airport - and walking distance to Harbour Bridge, Botanic Gardens, Darling Harbour and all the places we wanted to go. The staff at the desk were friendly and helpful - and there was a small shop which was useful as we forgot our toothbrushes! Breakfast was not included in our deal but it was quite good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “MENZIES HOTEL SYDNEY”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very close and within walking distance to all the Tourist sights plus the Shopping area, very friendly Staff, Rooms and ammenities were very clean, just off the busy thoroughfare, therefore it was nice and quiet. Lovely old worldly type Hotel but also with a modern outlook and ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies Hotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I thought the staff were very helpfull and curtious and there was no waiting for service, room was what I would expect clean and comfortable. We were told that we would get a discount for our overnight parking but we did not receive any discount at all. I was glad that I knew Sydney as I picked up my car and expected to be able to drive to the front to pick up my wife who has a broken arm and waiting for me but I had drive all over the place to get back to the hotel and she was getting a bit worried but it turned out in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Room was average but no real complaints”
Reviews.Author: glennomeister
Reviews.Content: Great location, check in/check out staff member was good (same person each time). I was in a standard queen room. Not bad and was happy enough with it, but it didn't inspire any particular positive reaction. Room was neither big nor small, the bed was much more like double size than queen, soft mattress (I'm happy with firm or soft but I know it matters to others), TV was flatscreen but a pretty small 4:3 format, and being 6'3" high I actually couldn't stand completely upright in the shower without my head touching the ceiling. Going back next month and staying in a 'junior suite' with my partner, looking forward to that.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: z3girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Menzies for our weekend in Sydney and had no real issues with our stay. Coming from the airport, the Wynyard Train Station is directly opposite the hotel. It is then just a short walk to all of the central city locations, whether you want to visit Darling Harbour, The Rocks, Circular Quay or the shops in the Pitt St area. Nothing is more than a 10 minute walk away. The room itself was perfectly adequate for our needs. It was only a place to sleep so we were happy with the inside room,with two double beds for three of us. The pool and gym facilities were great - we made use of the pool and spa both days and were pleased to see a 5.30am open time for the pool which allowed us a quick dip before we headed out to the airport for our flight home. The only odd thing about our stay was that there were only two sets of towels provided in the room and two sets of cups and saucers and glasses for drinks. In a room that has accommodation for four people I would expect that four of everything would be provided. Despite specifying on our booking that there were three people staying we still had to ring housekeeping on both days of our stay to have an additional set of towels delivered. They were delivered promptly but, in my view, this shouldn't have been necessary and was the only blot on an otherwise trouble free and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, great service”
Reviews.Author: JCB_8
Reviews.Content: I booked the Menzies because of it's conveneint location in the heart of the CBD and the rate was very good. Initially I was allocated a 4th floor room which was a bit noisy becasue it was right next to the lifts and near the air conditioing compressors. The staff kindly relocated me to a room on the 12th floor which was much quiteer and was excellent. To me the staff are the greatest asset - very helpful and very knowledgeable. The proximity to Wynyard Station and the Coles etc is fantastic - Coles are open to midnight every night and is very convenient. With Wynyard you can go straight to the airport for a $15 fare - can't beat it! Rooms are clean, showers hot, Piano Bar very good and meals and service excellent. I will stay here again for sure

Reviews.Title: “May stay for business”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we had a group form work staying and two rooms were not up to scratch and we needed to shift, by that we mean they smelt of sale smoke or musty and just needed to move. However the location and service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not of high standard”
Reviews.Author: DP5563
Reviews.Content: The troop landed in Syd and admittedly the flight was delayed so it was a late arrival at the hotel. The restaurant had just closed 12 minutes before but being we had a large group of work colleagues something could have been arranged... no. They were not willing to do anything food wise so we were left with no dinner option at the hotel. Plan B we asked for suggestions of where the closest restaurants are to get some food, after all we were a "little" late.....no can do either. They had no suggestions of ANY restaurants close by... really. By this time the service was getting rather frustrating. So our team ended up finding a pancake parlour. The sleep quality was poor and the internet was very slow, even to the point we couldn't hold any meetings over Skype. Unfortunately won't be using this for business (or leisure) again.

Reviews.Title: “The experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Always receive excellent service and enjoy the stay, well located to meet all my needs. Hotel is close to all facilities for transport, eating and leisure. The in room facilities make it easy to relax and/or work after hours, this allows me to keep on top of work requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Very accessible to bus stop, taxi stand, train station. There's also a grocery store, bread shops,... inside train station which is just a hop away from the hotel. 7-eleven within a few steps.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel felt more like a cheap motel than a top brand hotel. The rooms were old and scruffy and dirty, the facilites poorly maintained and the housekeeping was disgraceful. We had a dirty sock in our room when we arrived!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Menzies. Very close to all the venues we wanted to go to. Room good, bed great, the bar area nice. very nice Hotel. Would stay again. Stff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our stay at the Menzies in Sydney. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly. The hotel is located opposite Wynyard station which is 20 mins by train from the international airport and is close to Darling Harbour, The Rocks and the bridge. We were told the room would be ready from 2pm but whn we arrived at 9:30am we got in the room straight away.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location and the general areas are nicely decorated and old charm. Our room (standard king, park view) was a good size, nicely furnished and to the standard expected. The staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Visit Again.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was great, we had a junior suite and it was worth the extra. Dining service is terrible in the restaurant. It has been like this on most of our visits to the restaurant. They seemed to be understaffed and the staff there seemed to lack co-ordination and direction. The fault seemed systemic. I asked could I take my cheese platter to the room but was told this could only be done by room service and I was quite happy for this to be done but by way of an apology which really wasn't required it was said " I'm sorry this is a pain in the a"

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Awesome breakfast”
Reviews.Author: johntimothyhopkins
Reviews.Content: Overview: We stayed here 4 nights while in Sydney. The Menzies is fine, nothing special. We booked at the airport on a website and when we arrived at the hotel the agent behind the counter could not find us in the system. I guess they have receptionists that forward online reservations or somthing. I then had to email her my reservation to check into our room and after a 20 minute wait we were able to check in. The room was fine, TV has lots of channels, internet costs $25 per day which is highway robbery in my opinion. We had an issue with a bug on our last night. The night manager handled the situation very well and came up personally to see it. He offered us another room to sleep in and we wouldnt have to move our things. He also compensated us fairly by comping some room service. We stayed Easter/Anzac weekend so all of the hotels were expensive, so I cant relate to the value. However, a big nice breakfast was included. The breakfast buffet was among the best Ive been to at a hotel. Im sure it wont disappoint. Pros: -Great Location close to Darling Harbour and Circular Quay -Decent sized room -Management handled difficult situation well -Breakfast was awesome and free with our booking -*Really close to Max Brenners Chocolate (Went here every night we were in Sydney!) -Room service was good. Cons: -Slightly overpriced -Could be cleaner

Reviews.Title: “very good but.....”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is nice but old and beginning to show it. The lifts smelled musty. The room was small but comfortable; the bed very comfortable. We had reason to complain about the booking process and reception was unhelpful and, perhaps worse, seemed disinterested.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the Menzies we have stayed on several occasions.It is a lovely hotel and the staff are very friendly and helpful.It is very central to all the shops and transport.We like to stay on the first floor as we dont use lifts and our room overlooks the city park it is very nice

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay For A Few Days in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Sydney for a couple of days over Easter to go to Randwick Races with some old friends. The Menzies is great place to stay on such trips. It is an older style hotel with a marvellous foyer and bar area. The service is top class and the room we had in the North Wing was was large, comfortable and very clean. The hotel rates are very reasonable for what you get. My only complaint would be that the $48 per 24 hour parking charge for our car was a bit over the top. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies a hit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time during our stay at the Menzies. The hotel provided great value and a central location to all the popular city sights. The room was spacious, beds were very comfortable. The indoor pool was a hit with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on special deal”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel overall. However the airconditioning was less than efficient and luckily it was a cool period. Tea/Coffee facility could have included some biscuits this lack of seemed a bit mean. Maintenance personnel had no regard for guests sleeping early am as was woken up to loud hammering of pipes adj to room, was looking forward to lie in the comfy king size bed. As I paid special price I am happy to say great experience, however if I had paid full rate I would have requested money back or moved to another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a handy location to rail and bus services as well as the Central Business District, Circular Quay and tourist attractions. Rooms are neat and tidy with usual facilities. Friendly staff make it a comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Family Hoilday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location however very old room needed refurbishing. 1 bed was very comfortable and the other one was very uncomfortable and you could feel the springs. Foyer and waiting areas were beautiful and the indoor heated pool was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “We will return to the Menzies in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Crawford_62 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Concierge excellent with advice on sightseeing. Piano bar with live entertainment adds that something extra. The Menzies provided the charm and service of a bygone era. Enjoyed relaxing with afternoon tea in the foyer bar with lovely outlook to street and park. Complimentary mixed nuts won my son over. Indoor pool great to return to after a busy day sightseeing. So convenient right over the road from Wynyard train station. This is our 4th stay at the Menzies and we will return. Location and charm have won us over.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Giulia73
Reviews.Content: We were two families staying here just before Easter. We got a good deal since we stayed for $129 in a quadruple room. From the domestic airport it is 7 stations to the hotel (Wynyard) and the hotel is just opposite the station. The location was great as well as the service. Rooms ok but nothing fancy. Perfect for families with access to pool, jacuzzi and gym. We did not hsve breakfast but bought directly from Coles Express in the subway station oposite the hotel (great opening hours!!!!). Because of the location we had an unforgettable stay in Sydney. I warmly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location and reasonable price. Tired hotel that needs some work. Room was clean but needs a paint and show lots of marks on walls. Corridors were similar. Air conditioning from the building next door provided a constant background hum that was annoying. Bed was very comfortable. I will stay there again due to the price and location and if I'm only there to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Odour in the hotel suite.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel room smelt, we had to go down and buy some airfreshner because the odour was so bad. Our window looked out on the a brick wall and the beds and pillows where terrible with big dips in the bed so you kept rolling into the middle. We did not stay around the hotel much so did not really get a feel for the rest of it (mainly because the room smelt so bad we just wanted to get out of there). On the whole I would definately not return.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies for WebDU conference”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The one bedroom unit had a large comfortable bed. Overall the unit had a nice layout with desk, round table and even a lounge chair to chill out in. It didn't have above floor level power outlets except for at the kettle and in the bathroom - so bring a power board laptop owners! Excelent buffet breakfast. Would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzie'slocation meant I could do business on foot. More importantly a room in the North Wing meant a quiet night. Overall the service was friendly and whilst the rooms show some wear and tear they are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: enjoyed stay. Milk in fridge was off as out of date. bed not as comfortable as would have liked and would have appreciated another pillow. we were most appreciative of a late checkout as we had a late night. 'the service at the counter was excellent and we found it a convenient part of the city to stay. we travelled by train and it was most handy to this.

Reviews.Title: “UK Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were greeted in a friendly and helpful manner. However, we did not expect to have to stump up a $50 per day deposit for a room that was already paid for. Very surprised that we had to pay for WiFi access. Room service was excellent and facilities generally good.

Reviews.Title: “Are they serious!”
Reviews.Author: frasercoast
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the Mardi Gras weekend, 5 star price but a 2 star property, This hotel is overpriced at a rip off level. Check in was very slow, took 15 minutes just to get to the counter, then was a very slow process, never had this problem anywhere before. The hotel is old.. very old, the room reflected this although clean it was in bad condition. The only plus for this property is the location. Will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No Four Stars”
Reviews.Author: billwould
Reviews.Content: First let me say that the location of the hotel is fantastic. It is close to just about everything. The staff was congenial and did their best to satisfy the challenges that we encountered. Now the negatives. Internet was $25 per day and parking $40 per day. The bathroom is tiny, the tub is elevated and at 6"3" my head hit the lowered ceiling in the shower. There were no fire sprinklers in our bedroom and the daily housekeeping was sketchy with old glasses left and very little attention to detail. On our second of four days we had a couple walk in on us with a key given out at the front desk. My wife was just exiting the tiny batroom after having taken a shower. It was the second room that this poor couple had been given a key to with the room being already occupied. Of course when the front desk gave this couple keys to our room it locked out our keys which we unfortunately discovered after going to the pool. The front desk should have realized this (can you say training?) and delivered new keys as soon as the mistake was realized. When I went and reported this I was told that our account showed us as being booked for four days and that they didn't understand how this happened. On our third day we started to get on one of the elevators and the couple inside hurridly got out stating that the elevator had dropped a bit and then would not move. Its door finally opened after they had set off the elevators alarm. We decide to not repeat thier misfortune and pressed the button for another lift. All this did was re-open the doors on the faulty elevator time and again. At this point we all decided to walk down a flight of stairs to see if we could access a lift on another floor. Vey bad move. Once you enter the stairwell there is no way to re-enter any of the lower or upper floors as the doors are locked preventing re-entry to any of the floors. We walked down eleven flights of stairs (with a bad back mind you) only to reach the bottom and a sign stating that the exit door was alarmed and not to be used unless there was a fire. We were now trapped in the stairweel with no phone or any instructions on how to get out. We opened the fire exit and sure enough the loudest alarm I have ever heard sounded. We later were told that the doors on each floor only open in case of a fire. One would think that there might be some notice of such or at least a phone in case someone were to be stuck like us. Can you imagine a child opening the door and then being stuck. The next day before we departed we got on another elevator (not the one that was malfunctioning the day before) and when the doors closed it dropped a bit and then proceded to go up, not down. As soon as it stopped and the doors opened we hastily exited. We did take our chances on a different lift as we did not want to repeat the stairwell fiasco. We awoke on our final day with an invoice under our door requesting payment for the four days when the entire stay had been pre-paid in advance. As I said the hotel is idally located but with all of the challnges we encountered, faulty elevators, no fire spriklers, tiny bathroom, six foot three inch tub to ceiling shower, the stairwell of no return and double billing I just have no way of believing that The Menzies is any more than a three star hotel at best.

Reviews.Title: “one bad night ; 2 good nights”
Reviews.Author: baroncairns Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: checked in late and was " upgraded " to room 604 where i had the worst night's sleep that i have had in any 4 star hotel in australia ; this was due to the whistling noise that occurred internally within the walls of the room every 10 minutes or so ; i am not sure if this was a water pipes noise or a railway related noise ; i should have relocated that night but i was too tired after travelling ; i asked to relocate at 5am the next morning and the hotel to its credit promptly relocated me to room 522 ; this room was quiet internally and the remaining 2 nights of my stay were fine ; i cannot believe that the hotel has not received complaints about room 604 before ( or even the whole 04 series of rooms ) so this problem should have been fixed before ; if not at least the hotel cleaning staff must also hear the same sound which i heard consistently all night on my first night ( 31/3/11 ) and should heve reported it before guests had to put up with it ; a pity as the hotel is really well located being near the wynyard park exit for wynyard station and in a handy part of town .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Position, great service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Your hotel is in a fantastic postition, so convenient to walk everywhere or use the wonderfyul train service you have in sydney. Also the service was great. I have already recommended your hotel to friends as we found it so convenient and having a supermarket just across the road in the train station was also a bonus with a young family.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay at The Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Location of the hotel is convenient being across the road from Wynyard Station. Food and atmosphere in the restaurant and buffet breakfast was very pleasant. Room was very clean, however bathroom a little compact. Pool and spa area was nice but could have been a bit warmer. Staff were quite friendly.

Reviews.Title: “CBD convenience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This would have to be the most conveniently located hotel, taxi rank and train station outside the entrance and bus in the next street. Train can take you downtown, to airports or to central station. Nice bar and breakfast room but you can find better priced meals and drinks outside hotel but still acceptably priced especially if you are an Accor member who receives a free breakfast in April.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney getaway”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location! This is a lovely, clean hotel with pleasant friendly staff -special mention to Andrew Austin at conceirge - made the stay even more enjoyable. The hotel is centrally located with approx 10 min walk to Habour Bridge, Queen Vic Building, ferrys and the train station is across the road. Some parts of the hotel are looking a tad old and could do with a fresh coat of paint particularly in the passageways we stayed in the north wing. The indoor swimming pool was far too cold, but overall GREAT place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had two connecting rooms, one was disabled as requested and was perfect for my disabled mother - plenty or room for wheelchair and very comfortable. Staff fussed over my mother like she was the queen and everyone was really helpful - nothing was too much trouble for them. Can't wait to return and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: ThemeParkReviewTrips
Reviews.Content: We booked our group into this hotel for a stay in March 2011. The hotel staff were all very nice, rooms were fine, and the location was fantastic. We will absolutely stay at this hotel again when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Parking”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the service, meals and room however I did have an issue with parking. I was travelling with my 82 year old mother and the parking became an issue. I think valet parking should be offered for those who need it and also the fact that the hotel does not have lift access to the carpark should be more of a reason to have valet parking when you have luggage to carry.

Reviews.Title: “Piano bar great but room needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room is in serious need of an update, the bathroom was really average with a filthy shower curtain. The piano bar was entertaining and breakfast was fine, really the only problem with the hotel are the rooms, at least we one we stayed in anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Old”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Disapointing with the standard of the rooms - Parking is very expensive, Room was very small, linen was not as clean as it should be - no face cloths, not what i expected from a hotel of this reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Stayover after late International Flight arrival”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location to catch train from airport and virtually walk across road from Wynyard. Good quiet rooms and very comfortable. Maybe a tad dear for breakfast but very handy to other venues to suit all budgets. Very good service with late checkout and handy to George St and The Rocks. As was complimentary room were in older section but still very good.

Reviews.Title: “clean comfy and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: susiesnowflake Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is well situated at the back of Wynyard station but is incredibly quiet for such a central hotel. My room had fresh air (wonderful for a good night's sleep), but was not noisy. Booked on a special, very economical rate and guaranteed upgrade. Couldn't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the foyer, reception and bar on the ground floor are nice the restaurant on the first floor is a bit dated. the room i had was fine however the bath tub was not able to hold water as the metal drain was warped so the plug did not seal. having a bath that was the main reason for staying there so it was a pretty disapointing experience. in the quiet of the night the walls rattle/vibrate as its above a train station. It took a while to get use to the noise and get to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: smartywishbone
Reviews.Content: If you go to this hotel ask for a nice room (these are not found in the north wing) and request a room over looking the park. Our room looked at a brick wall and was fairly ordinary. The room is spacious - but that's the best thing you could say about it. In the room you are immediately greeted by some nice looking bottles of FiJi water near your bed - don't touch them as it will set you back $7.50 each. I've had passable red wine for less than that and a beer in the bar has more appeal. The general ambience of the hotel is good - a brown leather 1940's feel and a great resturant and bar on level one with bygone era charm. Great service from the barman and waitresses but attendance is somewhat lacking at the front desk. Its in a convenient location for public transport especially trains - you can get one from/to the Airport easily and is Central to down town. For the money I wouldn't stay here - at least not in the crappy north wing rooms with zero appeal. Its a shame because the Hotel wasn't full and I'm sure there were nicer rooms available - just not offered to us. If I wasn't going to spend much room time anyway (and got a deal) I might consider coming back if only to eat and have a long island ice tea.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location - ten minutes from bridge, opera house, circular quay, darling harbour, tower, etc. Very comfortable rooms - quiet, large bedrooms. Elegant reception area but the rest of the hotel a little dated. Very expensive to us brits at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies Hotel Sydney Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, central to everything withi Sydney CBD, transportation and places of interest. Room is very comfortable though not grand. Hotel lobby is quite impressive and spacious rendering a relaxing atmosphere. The swimming pool and spa are a bit out of the way and isolated, giving a feeling of being insecure. Restuarant menu is a little limited, perhaps may be because it was on a Monday night but whta we had was good. Restuarant staff was very friendly and helpful. Wish choice of breakfast beverages was better but has room for improvement. Staff at the check in counter and concierger are very helpful. I appreciate the help from the concierger in checking in my flight on line. It gave us peace of mind to enjoy ourselves around the city without worrying the flight. Thank you to all the staff at the Menzies.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My ratings say it all. Staff do make an effort to satisfy your needs. Hotel location fitted our needs being close to everything and the train station opposite. Have already recommended the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is right in the heart of the Sydney CBD, just what we were looking for. Convenient to buses, trains and taxis and easy trip to the airport. The service was excellent and polite. Very refreshing to be made feel so welcome. Our room was lovely. We have stayed at the Menzies before and have decided now after two excellent experiences to make it our Sydney hotel. So much of sydney is in easy walking distance. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Rooms”
Reviews.Author: relyablesauce Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was up to a high standard except the rooms as they need upgrading. The furniture and bathrooms are fine but the carpet, wallpaper and ceilings need re doing and then it will be fabulous ! The beds are amazing and the most comfortable I have ever come across when staying away from home. The staff was very friendly and it came across as genuine and not commission based sentiment, quite refreshing we found.

Reviews.Title: “Freindly staff and excellent service would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If check out is 10am then room should be cleaned after not before as it is not for cleaners to pack personal items of customers and remove from the room once again before 10am. I was at breakfast and returned at 0955. this my only complaint and a tip for the future....

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A well presented hotel with a grand entrance , situated opposite to Wynyard Railway Station with easy access to the city. Room was comfortable with everything needed for an overnight stay. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddictSD
Reviews.Content: I had an extra day in Sydney and decided to book a room via a Travel Zoo special. I have to say this hotel is great. The lobby was nice and the rooms were in great condition. Circular Quay, King Street Wharf, and Darling Harbour are only a short stroll away. The Wynyard Station is right across the street in case you want to catch the rail to other areas in Sydney. I don't quite understand the fuss from other reviewers about this hotel. They must be accustomed to staying at 8 stars properties!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harbo Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Menzies for one night. It was in a great location. Easy to walk to from Circular Quay and right across the road from a train station. Room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. Highly recommend and will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I did not enjoy my stay at the Menzies, we were first placed in level 6, a very high pitch annoying sound keeps going off every 5 minutes, so i called the reception and requested a room change, i have to admit the man at the front desk was very polite and gave us another room in level 3....everything was fine, but very early in the morning we would hear taps going off, ppl turning on their showers...the noise control is very poorly managed in this hotel, so i think if u want a peaceful relaxing getaway, i would not recommend Menzies.

Reviews.Title: “no title”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good locationas opposite Wynyard Station. Does need to be tarted up as looking quite tired. Also when in rooms, can hear all noise from corridors - people coming and going. TV didnt work very well and had to get someone to fix it while there.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Melbournechick
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a great rate through Travelzoo at $129 per night with a complimentary upgrade. Our expectations were not high as Sydney is so expensive, but we were there to catch up with friends and were out the door early the next day anyway. The bed was comfortable, the room was pretty quiet and it was clean so no big complaints. Just a few small things that were a bit strange was the toilet roll holder being so far away from the toilet. The towels were the same, we were not sure where we should hang them while in the shower as there was no where close by. My only critism was that when we checked in at 6:30pm on a friday night there was only one person at the reception desk so the process was long. Fortunately on the saturday they had a great system that if you had already paid you could just hand back the key and go, that was excellent. Only small things, I would recommend more staff on the front desk but I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well located, good service, comfortable bed. Room smelled musty-damp........only drawback Older rooms but sufficiently appointed Walk to great shopping, Opera House, restaurants... Did not eat, quick stay and turnaround but comfortable and efficient

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the City”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is a great hotel in a convenient location in the heart of Sydney CBD. The staff are attentive and helpful. The rooms are tastefully decorated and very clean.
