It is a great hotel if you are not keen on paying 5 star prices. Great property and part of the Accor Hotel Group. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A night In the City”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Being an Accor member for several years and having stayed at the Menzies on previous occassions it is apparent that there has been a gradual decline in both service and food quality. The example I give relates to the dining room booking that was made for 6:00 pm. Upon arrival at the dining room staff were still setting up (no big deal) and informed me that the dining room was not yet open. I politely remonstrated informing that I did have a booking and that the early time of the booking was due to the fact that we had to be at the theatre by 7:00 PM. Fortunatly the oversite was rectified to my satisfaction. Additionally the hot food served at breakfast was poorly prepared and not of a stanard of a major hotel with the reputation that it once enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and food, shame room was so dirty.”
Reviews.Author: Cullen99 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful and recognized me even though I only stayed two days. Room service was prompt and the food hot and plentiful. Unfortunately, the bathroom had hair (the bad kind) on the floor and the rooms and hallways are very tired. Windows are permanently shut, so no fresh air. Windows of the room faced the other room windows, so curtains needed to remain shut. Best used only as a pit stop, but rather high priced for that.

Reviews.Title: “CBD Sojourn”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very good location. The hotel is an older style establishment, but well maintained. The restaurant was excellent, however the breakfast was very average. Parking was something of an ordeal - best to arrive without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Greatly dissappointed and surprised”
Reviews.Author: carnifex
Reviews.Content: I stay in Sydney hotels regularly and my favourites were either booked out or had incompatible rooms so due to the location of the Menzies decided to stay there. I booked on Wotif a Queen bed room which cost $320. This was a basic room package, no breakfast. The hotel smelled musty on entry as if they had just steam cleaned carpets, the room also was very musty and yet the carpets were dry? The furniture was 1950'2 and tired. The bed was hard and an old spring type you can feel in the bed. The pillows were out of shape and clearly older. The shampoo and conditioner were basically detergent and in an age where manufacturers provide sample size product I was surprised that the Menzies were filling their own from bulk. I know this sounds pretentious but this hotel charged top dollar and isn't providing a compatible service. It really was an experience you would expect from a local hotel/motel rather than a City hotel. Tired and smelly and in need of a significant renovation. Position is excellent though.

Reviews.Title: “If You Want a Question Answered at the Menzies Don't Ask the Staff”
Reviews.Author: gastronomygals
Reviews.Content: Gastronomy Gals just spent 6 months since our stay at the tarnished Manhattan Gansevoort touring Australia checking out what passes for hotels and catching out the hotel and restaurant industry not only on their food and beds but the ability for the disabled like myself, wheelchair bound, to get equal money for value and even more important sometimes just getting the door! Gal #2 and I have our travel patter pretty well down pat. She has a extensive background in public relations and publishing and I, Gal #1, have been a chef since starting an apprenticeship at fourteen. I have been a chef for lets just say more decades than I care to admit, yelling "away on table 4" and chefing in over 30 countries. When we travel we triple check that my wheelchair, as an equal paying customer can use everything you an able bodied person can. Then as Vegans we call and check with the kitchen and Gal #2, my main squeeze gives their ads, promotions and bling the Madison Ave once over to make sure we weren't buying into something there isn't. Well we were promised full access to the pool and jacuzzi and were told that "even the piano bar you can roll right up to" and when asked "is their a disabled toilet with every bar, restaurant and outlet we were confidantly assured this was the case." After all this research, we arrive at some very early time like 6 am after 2 hours on a Virgin Blue (I think blue is lying to her mom as her virginity along with her tarnish was lost years ago). I asked at check-in where the pool was and I was told through the arch, simply swipe the card and enjoy. So we went to our room, changed, came down in our bathing suits and opened the pool door, To what wonderful surprise for this wheelchair bound weary traveller, a staircase and no other entry. Strike one Mr. Menzie. After that debacle we go for breakfast and explain first to the "catering manager" what Vegan means because he thought it was a chinese food. The chef, only to get when requesting tomatos cut in half and grilled with sauteed mushrooms, then waiting 40 minutes a bowl of tomato and mushroom pure arrived! Strike 2! Bottom of the ninth, bases loaded so we call the manager (the same one who didn't know his own pool had stairs) and another 45 minutes we get a passable breakfast. At that stage all I wanted was my COFFEE! On their menu it stated "a mug of espresso" or any other coffee or hot chocolate was $5.20. The bill came and because of the stuff up the food was comped. However, the coffee which was meant to be $5.20 x2 was charged at $20. When we showed the mistake, my spouse was given so much attitude this writer, who has been a qualified lip reader for 30 years read the word "b###h" on the lips of the staff as we left . We were only there for 24 hours and the start was terrible and if we thought it couldn't get worse when, as nature eventually calls, I asked where the nearest disabled convenience was. I was then told the only one was in the basement so we went down there. Apparently this high end hotel thought disabled people would be ok using a restroom complete with water damaged sagging ceilings, paint hanging like stalagmites, and a hole literally punched in the wall and hadn't been cleaned since Sir Robert was in office. The only saving grace was the evening meal. As planned, it was a chefs table arrangement where we left the final test to the chef to attempt a hail mary play and they did. The Peter Lehman 2007 was exceptional, the beat salad was mind blowing and the Verdura Griglio was a memory to keep. So, Mr. Menzies, every great Prime Minister listened to their advisors so we suggest you put the entire house staff in a room with the building plans and the evening restaurant staff and don't leave until you know your own building like the back of your hand. Lets also make sure the breakfast staff have been body snatched and posessed by the amazing evening crew. Would I ever stay there again? Sadly no! Nevertheless, I would eat at the restaurant anytime and recommend it. Mr. Menzies, stop spinning in your grave, your name wasn't irreparabely tarnished, just a little around the edges. Anyway this Gastronomy Gal has so many more hotels to roll through. Bye for now

Reviews.Title: “A Weekend to Remember”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A pleasant greeting, a smile and a nod,....that is what greeted us at The Menzies. A quick taxi fare from the airport, the entrance door was opened wide for us and that was just the doorman. The staff at the reception were warm and obliging and nothing was too much trouble. Directions given by the concierge weren't just a point in the right direction, we were given a map and also advised on referred eateries. A very comfortable stay and would recommend anyone staying in Sydney to absolutely stay at The Menzies.

Reviews.Title: “review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The beds were great and that was really important to me. The location was also fantastic.However I would really appreciate it if food and drinks from the mini bar were just left in the bar fridge and not displayed prominently so you can see them from every part of the room! Not that I have anything against the idea of mini bars per se, but I hate the fact that it is all junk food and drinks and I hate having it all in my face. I am sure other hotels do this too, but since you asked for my opinion there it is.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, central to everything. My preferred place to stay when in town. Easy access to train station direct to/from airport. Staff are friendly and obliging. Pleasantly surprised with the quality of the meals from the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and grand old hotel charm”
Reviews.Author: hobbieeboo
Reviews.Content: I took my fiance to this hotel as a small one night getaway for his birthday. The hotel popped up and travel deal newsletter so I got a good deal. I mentioned when booking that we were coming for his birthday and they seemed very pleased. On arrival the check in staff were lovely and were able to get us to our room right away even though we were early for check in. Our room was a bit plain with a very small flat screen tv mounted on the wall but that was all over looked when we saw the complementy bottle of champagne and a note wishing us a happy birthday stay with them. While the room was a bit plain the bathroom was lovely. We enjoyed the pool and spa while were there which was a great way to relax before dinner. We enjoyed a quite pre-dinner drink in the piano bar which was lovely. The next day we ordered room service breakfast and it was great and tons of food. I have done a lot of room service breakfasts and normally disappointed but this was exceptional. All up we loved the big old hotel experience and the service to match, the rooms need a little bit of an upgrade but still very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, nice lounge/bar, not much else.”
Reviews.Author: FlyingSomewhere
Reviews.Content: On entering the hotel from the train station, staff standing around talking, nobody bothered to open the door for me. Haven't stayed here for years, but used my Advantage Plus complimentary night here before it expired. Consequently, I was given possibly the worse room in the hotel (#601), overwhelming noisy, but also needing refurbishment urgently. Sounded like I was on top of a train station, requested a room change, told there were various A/C units behind me. Concierge came to room, no offer to take bag, had to go some distance to new room. Told it was 'so much better' room, and it was certainly quieter, but bed springs were gone... curtains held back with safety pin. Couldn't find my key when I went out, turned the room upside down and realised that the concierge must have taken it with the 'old' one. Returned to my room 4 hours later with new key, but also keys left on table.. no message... felt creepy. Staff - lovely female receptionist, and 2 young women in the bar, the rest disinterested. Hotel rooms desperately in need of refurbishment. Great position and nice lounge/bar area.

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what you mean.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I came to Menzies about 15 years ago for the first time with my family and I liked the hotel for the good location and a very good service. Since then whenever I have come to Sydney I have stayed in Menzies.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but poor service”
Reviews.Author: ka7i3
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel numerous times over the years as it is a good location. Older rooms but still clean and comfortable. This time was staying with parents. I visited the hotel early to pay for the rooms as did not want parents to know the price. Specifically asked the checkin staff not to tell my parents the cost, they said they would write it on numerous pages of the booking. Once parents checked out they were advised of the cost. Called hotel and spoke to the manager on duty and advised her of the situation. She sounded un-interested and told me that she would deal with the situation as she knows who it was... I then asked her how she know who it was as she didn't even ask my name. Once this occured I lost all interest in talking to her. I emailed the hotel but as I expected.. No reply. I felt that the situation was poorly delt with. I was not expecting anything, just don't want anyone to be put in the same situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: rovingrabbit2
Reviews.Content: Sydney unfortunately is an expensive city for visitors so the Menzies hotel is not exactly cheap. You can get a deal on the web for around $280 a night for a standard room with no breakfast. However, there are plenty of breafast options over the street at the Wynard station for around $8 for eggs, bacon and toast with tea and coffee included. The hotel location is very good and within walking distance to the water - bay area and this is a big plus and its what you are paying for. The underground train station (Wynard station is right across the road and the city buses are in the same street which is handy. Plenty of taxis around should you need one. Check in time was 2pm although I suspect the hotel may have been able to get us in a bit earlier if we had arrived before this time. Staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. We had a standard room on the 12th floor with no particular view except another building but that was no drama, who looks out the window anyway? Our room was smallish but not too small, it had a comfortable queen size bed, a good wall mounted tv and a functional bathroom with shower and bath tub combined. The air con worked well and the temperature was just right for us. Many hotels are too hot - this hotel has got it right . The room was very clean and quiet with no street noise although our neighbours next door were able to be heard coming and going later at night although we were not really disturbed by this. There is a selection of free magazines to read in the room and this is a nice touch.Mini bar has the usual high priced drinks, water (from Fiji) at $7.50 a large bottle- but Sydney tap water is fine so you don't need that..... How about Aussie bottled water guys? Expect to pay $12.90 for a half bottle of wine and around $4-$6 for snacks from the mini bar, all about standard price these days wherever you stay. An ironing board and tea and coffee making facilities was a big plus. I was disappointed there was no in room safe. Safe deposit facilities are available, free of charge at reception although these days a small safe is pretty much standard fare at most places. Dining facilities are good with a coffee and wine bar on the ground floor, a breakfast restaurant and a a la carte dinner estaurant. There are plenty of other eating places closeby if you don't want to eat in. Room serice is available 11am -11pm and has a good choice of food with prices similar to most restaurants in the vicinity (eg mains around $35 or club sandwich for around $22 and wine from $29 to $40 a large bottle. We enjoyed our stay at this place. Its a genuine 4 star hotel. With good facilities and a gym and pool. For room comfort I think 7.5/10, front desk staff and concierge 8/10. Cleanliness 8.5/10. Overall value for money 7/10... I marked this down a little because I really think Sydney hotels are overpriced . Would I stay again? Yes, its a nice comfortable hotel with good roooms and friendly, helpful staff. Thank you Menzies Hotel, we enjoyed our stay with you.

Reviews.Title: “good location - but hotel is run down”
Reviews.Author: wgary
Reviews.Content: The location is very central in business destrict. But the rooms ware run down, the pool and sauna was direful! Breakfast buffet was fine also stuff was friendly. Additional charge for internet and also for paying with credit card. Overall to expansive for this service - I would not come back.

Reviews.Title: “SYDNEY STAY”
Reviews.Author: gertie55 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location - central to most of Sydney's attractions. Stayed here for close proximity to theatre to see Jersey Boys. Walked to The Rocks Markets, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, Patty's Markets, the Art Gallery to see the Terracotta Warriors, city shops, caught the bus to Bondi and the train (station across the road) to the airport. Bed and pillows were very comfortable and room was very quiet to ensure good night's sleep. Standard size room. Not cheap but proximity to everything makes it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Dame in need of a facelift”
Reviews.Author: Mungbeans11
Reviews.Content: I have a love/ambivalent relationship with the Menzies. On one hand I love her old world charm. The staff are outstanding. On the other hand I am disappointed that the rooms are so run down. My last stay, for example, the toilet seat was broken. The corridors have a sad kind of down at the heel feel. But nothing lifts my spirit like entering the foyer of the Menzies, and the central Wynyard location makes this a good hotel for business travellers. Sadly I don't believe that the hotel is now very good value for money as I can always find other better appointed hotels for around the same price. I will however keep coming back occasionally because I would love to see the Grand Old Dame restored to her former glory.

Reviews.Title: “Only location”
Reviews.Author: Doitu
Reviews.Content: Me my wife and our son stayed there for three days, we paid 290-360-360. The room was just not even standard, we had no free breakfast, the indoor swimming pool was closed, if you pay your bill with a card you get an extra charge 1,5% !! the only good thing is the location and that some off the stuff trying to do their best.

Reviews.Title: “Low Point of Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hi guys, my new bride and I stayed at Menzies at Wynyard 2 weeks ago with our friends and family and never before have we ever been disappointed with any hotel under the Accor banner. The day after the wedding we travelled from Victoria to NSW and the first place we went to was the lobby bar which was closed at 5pm. Slight annoyance, but at this stage it was not a big deal. Check-in was fairly quick, but there was no personality whatsoever. The hallway carpet reeked of mildew on all our floors (7,8,11). The bathrooms were tiny even comparable to the toilets of a small airplane. To my disbelief, there was a hole in our bedsheet which I paid an upgrade fee for a larger bed. After a huge day of sightseeing our group was excited to the idea of having a swim in the heated indoor pool. Again, to our disbelief the poor was out of service not to be available until another month. This information did not appear on the website where I had read 'heated indoor swimming pool'. Sadly, the disappointment did not stop there... On the last night of our 2 night stay we came back to the hotel at 11pm without any issue. I went downstairs to get some fresh air and upon my return I had first hand experience on what happens when the door keycard reader battery goes flat. I had to go back downstairs and was given a new keycard although I had explained that there were no lights on the reader. I had to return back downstairs and was asked to wait for the duty manager to come up and open the door to my hotel. Without a doubt, this has been THE only bad...no...extremely disappointing experience with an Accor hotel. I had tried to fill out a comment to put in their comments box, but neither a pen or comment card were to be found anywhere near the box itself. Go figure.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the menzie carrington St was great . great location, staff friendly and helpful, I would recommend anyone to stay there, close to inner city and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We planned to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary in Sydney, and having recently signed up as an Advantage Plus member in January we thought it would be nice to stay somewhere new. The Menzies is located in the heart of the city, we managed to fit a lot in our day due to its prime location. Then upon our return to the hotel that evening, the concierge had arranged a complimentary bottle of champagne be delivered to our room - with a lovely message. The dinner in the hotel restaurant was delicious and the service exceptional. Will definitely return and recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, and that's it”
Reviews.Author: tomaroc
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is well located, but that s all it has! Very expensive for what it worths. No internet included, Breakfast very expensive. Road works going on next to the hotel during my stay. Very noisy. Hotel staff random.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay indeed.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service provided by the hotel staff was excellent, the hotel is located conveniently in the city and the room was very neat, tidy and most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Room amenities”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was on a small size even though it had a king size bed. The TV screen was very small and the air-conditioner was not very effective. The furniture and fittings need updating. However the location was great as it was not far from the Rocks and Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “ANZAC IN SYDNEY”
Reviews.Author: PaladinAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Well, from arriving at The Menzie's we were greeted as if we were cthe only persons staying, it was great very personal and professional, Room was park view upgraded by hotel front desk, was very nice . dining facilities for breakfast , well excellent value, top selection of breakfast choices juices, cereals, hot foods, and lots of coffee and tea several variety's location well ecelentto martin Place, rail station rihgt opposite to all location inc airport if this is your choice, well stocked Taxi rank no delay's here!! In all well suited to family .business traveller. would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Menzies on an Accor special for 50% of the normal rate. This was great value and we really enjoyed the hotel. Great location, nice room overlooking the park. Great comfortable king bed in our room. Dinner in the restaurant was superb and the service was very attentive there. We would love to return but will have to wait for another good offer as it is very expensive normally/

Reviews.Title: “Telephones are there to be answered! The service in this hotel was terrible”
Reviews.Author: ajhh
Reviews.Content: My experience of The Menzies Sydney was average. After a long day at work I returned to the The Menzies Hotel, which is conveniently located off York Street, at the top end of the Sydney CBD, close to my office. My room was on the 7th floor. As soon as I exited the elevator my colleague and I noticed a strong damp / musty smell permeating through the hallway. I was worried my room would have the same foul odour, but I was pleased to find my room clean and odour free. The bathroom was small with old fittings, the bed was too soft and the view onto an adjacent concrete wall, uninspiring, but the room served its purpose for a night's stay on business. My real problem with the hotel began at 11pm. Having worked late I arrived back to my room and ordered room service from the limited and very unhealthy late-night menu. I dialed the room service extension three times, each time there was no answer. I then called reception three times, again no answer. I then dialed for the concierge, surprise, no answer, so finally I dialed for the bellboy and my call was received and he took my order. The food arrived 20 minutes later. The gentleman delivering the food came into my room and instantly got distracted by the television and started watching the program. After a cough to grab his attention, he refocused on his job and passed me the receipt and then walked out of my room failing to close the door! After a good night's sleep [the room was quiet] I went to check out at 8.30am. Being unsatisfied with the hotel's service l I opted for an online survey to be emailed to me. It has been three days and the survey has not arrived. At $300 a night I expect a lot more from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Unexpected surprise”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Menzies Syndey on many occasions. Great central location in the Syndey CBD. The rooms are a good size, quite, and the King size bed always ensures a good night's sleep. The staff and facilities are VG.

Reviews.Title: “At the summer 3 day vacation rate this was excellant value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check rates available both direct and on website. Had inside room in north wing no view but no noise.

Reviews.Title: “A good time in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies Sydney was perfect for our stay as it was central easy walking distance to what we want to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable”
Reviews.Author: djfowler Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location directly opposite the Wynard train station. Ideal if you want to catch a train from the airport. In the centre of town but also a quite area. The foyer cafe is ideal for meeting with people while in town. The lobby and halls are all of a higher standard, but the breakfast restaurant and the rooms are from another era and tired. It is like you are in two different hotels. . Rooms were quiet. Front desk staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast was extremely average for the price - next time I will eat out. The rooms are ok and the experience fine for work, but I probably wouldn't stay here for a holiday

Reviews.Title: “ok for price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we got a special deal - room ok but not happy that the pool was out of order and were not told this on arrival so you had to go by taxi to a public pool and claim it back theybshould have had shuttle bus service to another accor hotel pool as who could be bothered with this !

Reviews.Title: “POOL CLOSED”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Whilst we couldn't find any issues with the hotel itself, we were very disappointed that the pool was closed and that we didn't know before we arrived, the alternative offered were not practical especially as the weather was extremely hot

Reviews.Title: “Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms starting to get a bit old, but service and cleanliness always good at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Stay at The Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We received wonderful service at The Menzies, staff very helpful and pleasent, room was very spacious and clean. The Hotel is very close to all Sydney has to offer, train and bus services are almost on the door step, food was superb. We will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, Friendly and very helpful staff, Had a delicious breakfast. Enjoyable Stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Seemed a bit tired. The room air conditioning was poor. The TV could not be operated as the room had no remote - it took several calls and several hours before one was delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring Sydney, able to walk down to the Rocks or Circular Quay quite easily, or opposite the train station for further afield. Hotel is getting a bit tired and run down though. We had a room "with park views", and whilst technically that was true, we didn't fancy standing on tip toes to see the corner of the park, but mainly just road going past the park. Rooms were quiet and all, just looks like it's getting due for a birthday

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here”
Reviews.Author: MateyandMe
Reviews.Content: The wife and I were given tickets to the musical "Jersey Boys" and decided to stay in the city overnight. I immediately thought of the Menzies Hotel which I passed so often when I worked in town and that its reputation was nearly second to none. We booked a room about 2 weeks prior to our night out and were assured that it was a very good room. On the Sunday we arrived, we were met by a sour faced desk attendant who couldn't work out my credit card. We were given a room on the Executive Level, so we thought we would get a room with a view...yeah a view of the back end of a building, not of the park. Then I saw the chair with what I thought was a stain. We ordered in for a pre-show snack being a Steak Sandwich and Nachos which were pleasantly edible and filling. We went to our show and when we returned we thought we would order a toasted sandwich as a late night snack. I tried to ring and had to wait 3 minutes for the phone, only to be hung up on. I tried 10 minutes later and spoke to a foreign sounding person. I ordered a ham cheese and tomato TOASTED sandwich for A$15.50. It arrived 30 minutes later, cold and not toasted. I was so hungry I ate it anyway. The sleep was fair, but the air conditioning was noisy. We would not recommend this hotel until they get staff who actually want to work in hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The menzies is a good place to stay. However, be careful when you choose your room on internet. If you want a room with a separate area, you have to take the deluxe suite .

Reviews.Title: “Menzies Experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Menzies Hotel was a very comfotable one. The room was well appointed and the Bed very comfortable. The location of the Menzies provides one with a break from the hussle and bussle of city traffic and noise but was close enough to most facilities. Service was also very good both at reception and in the restaurants. All in all a comfortable couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We feel very comfortable at your hotel. The restaurant and coffee shop in the foyer are both excellent with fantastic staff and good food. The only thing that I find disappointing is the breakfast. The items offered with the continental breakfast are fine, but the hot section if just not quite right and could be better. The scrambled eggs are horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at the Menzies!”
Reviews.Author: hellokitty87
Reviews.Content: The Menzies was definitely a steal I booked my vacation on Expedia.com and got a great rate for hotel/air fare to Sydney. I loved everything about the Menzies the decorating may be a bit dated but aside from that everything was GREAT. Directly in front of the hotel is Wynyard Station so you can catch the train to get around or get back to the airport. The clubs are walking distance and everything is close by McDonalds, Krispy Kreme, Coles, etc.. 5 minute walk to The Rocks about 10 minutes to the Sydney Opera House etc...I love Sydney and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed with this grand old hotel. Holding a 4.5 star rating, I was expecting old style splendour and service to match. We upgraded to a king room and the room was no where near the size I expected. Shower was in the bath and TV remote made more noise changing channels that the TV itself. Mix up with the booking saw me arguing with the reception staff that breakfast WAS included. Parking was available but in a public carpark serviced by other people. No one told us we had to have the parking validated, there was no lift up to reception so we had to carry bags and reception staff seemed totally disinterested. Thought this was going to be a great surprise weekend for my husband's 60th birthday - turned out to be more of a surprise for me.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I didn't know Sydney so this was a good pick, really central and rail right across the road. Lovely bed, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bed bugs bite! :(”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight on a business trip when I was 7 months pregnant. The room was tired but I wasn't too fussed as I just needed somewhere to sleep. Then I discovered a pubic hair in the bed. I requested a wake up call from reception that never eventuated. When I thought the worst was over I developed a huge itchy rash all over my thighs. A doctors visit confirmed it was due to bed bugs. This is definitely not a 4 star hotel. Save your money and go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Like stepping back into a hotel room from the late '80's.”
Reviews.Author: sarah_jane082
Reviews.Content: I seriously had to check to see if were actually staying in a four-star hotel. After trying to contact the front desk on the hotel internal system serval times unsuccessfully, I then had to ring using my personal phone - and was placed on hold for 20 mins! The room was old and not well furbished. There was mould in the bathroom, and the shower curtain (I thought only caravam parks use those still) had a cigarette burn in it. The TV did not work properly nor did the lamp work. The two single beds pushed together to make a "king" sized bed certainly did not make for a comfortable nights sleep either. When we brought these concerns to the duty managers attention, she simply offered us a complimentary breakfast. It was certainly not worth our time or money to stay at the Menzies, and we will definately not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “jersey boys”
Reviews.Author: tgreenpod Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great stay went to see Jersey boys great show did lots of shopping and had yum cha

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious !!!”
Reviews.Author: Mischv
Reviews.Content: Will never stay at the Menzies again, extremely bad service, dingy old room, tv didn't work, mould over everything and the staff couldn't care less, still haven't heard anything back from management about my emails, absolute rubbish hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were tired”
Reviews.Author: Leathl
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a lovely entry way but this is not reflected in the rooms. The rooms are tired and dated and require an upgrade. I was put in a room that was dark and looked out to a wall of another building. The bathroom although clean was quite small and outdated and the hairdryer did not work. I purposely did not take my hairdryer to save luggage space and weight. I did have a lovely swim in the hotel pool.

Reviews.Title: “TWo nights at Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Army62 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked into hotel using memebrship of the ACCOR Club, initial receptionist was professional although 'frosty' when she stated that as I had used the ACCOR club for accomodation, I was not entitled to breakfast I did not wish to cause a 'scene' so when quietly into night (memo: Accor Club, I will speak further to you about this) even though my reservation confirmation stated 'breakfast included'. Room decor was 'tired' and perhaps rooms could do with a fresh coat of paint. On the second night the toilet continually 'flushed' night manager 'Steve' arranged for my wife and I to be placed into a superior room, which was great, the night staff could not be faulted for service. All in all would recommend this hotel, however some reception staff should be informed to honour promiese made in writing on reservations. Hotel centrally located to The Rocks, City and Kings Street wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: Lynsey13
Reviews.Content: We paid an extortionate amount as it was New Year and the exchange rate was rubbish. However, it was really really expensive for a small room that over looked a back alley and was in major need of a refurb. Reception area is plush, concierge very helpful indeed and the location is its best feature - less 5 minutes walk to Circular Quay. That said its my second stay here as its just about affordable compared to the other hotels around the Rocks. In summary perfectly adequate but about time someone got the paint brush out.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend away as a local tourist”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The size of the room in the old wing was very good and reasonable well appointed, although looking a little tired. Breakfast, on both days, was just bedlum. Reminded me of a cafeteria, this aspect needs improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay great value deal. Kids loved it. In the centre of Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything you need to see in Sydney..”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: So close to everything, walking distance to Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, The Rocks and in the heart of the city with Excellent shopping and Dining..

Reviews.Title: “good value but a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. I had a superior room (slightly larger than normal with a view over the park. My room was on the 10th floor (of 11) in the older part of the building. Lower floors may be noisy due to the bus terminal outside the front of the hotel but my room was fine. Rooms are dated and basic but functional. TV is small. Staff were friendly and helpful. Pool is good but a little tired and dirty. This is one of the few central Sydney hotels that can accommodate 4 people in one room - so good for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bluey829 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ha ving stayed at the Menzies several times I am always welcomed back as an old friend/. friendly helpful staff, rooms are spacious and as i was travelling for 2 nights i had 2 different rooms, this suited me well. Good breakfast dining room got very busy on Saturday morning , tryto be early to avoid the queue. Being a member of Accor also helps.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to lineup & wait & wait & wait.....bad”
Reviews.Author: mantisalive
Reviews.Content: Waited in line for 30minutes just to check in. While bored out of my mind, I noticed the black marks on the ceiling, the stains all over the mats & knew this hotel was not going to be up to standard. After i finally reached the counter, we were greeted and presented with free breakfast vouchers for waiting so long. (Shame the next day there was a MASSIVE LINEUP for breakfast, which we couldn't be bothered waiting yet again). Room 'junior suite' was ok, big room, small dodgy bathroom, bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet, so slept well. At checkout waited again in line too long & again waited in line to get our car out of the Wynard car park they recommend you use. So overall, i would never stay at The Menzies again, unless you feel the need for getting in a long line and waiting, felt like a school excursion not a weekend off. Also there was rubbish everywhere in the hotel, empty boxes and stuff left around the corridors that no-one seemed to care about.

Reviews.Title: “New year in Sydney!!”
Reviews.Author: skipper65191282
Reviews.Content: Recently satyed in the menzies as part of a cricket tour, ideal for the city and the transport network, hotel in need of re-furbishment, interior looks tired dark corridors etc, rooms basic lack of draw space and hanging space, mini bar vey expensive, poll and sauna area poor, pool had a scum line around it would advise to stay clear.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is situated close to all amenities that Sydney has to offer. We found it to be good value for money as it provides a clean and well-maintained establishment with restaurants both within the hotel and nearby. For either a shopping trip or a short leisure holiday, it was ideal for our family. We would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “christmas 2010”
Reviews.Author: bjsa Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed Christmas Day & Boxing Day, staff friendly, bus at door. Our Christmas Dinner was out of this world ,set 3 course with great options, could not fault it. Worth a chef hat. Our maitre' d made our day with his comments. Bed was very comfortable, and we like openable windows, that was a plus. Nice view of the park. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: ozegirl Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night here recently as we were going to see a show at a theatre nearby. We booked a standard room, however the airconditioning unit had an awful rattle. We rang reception and they immediately offered a change or room or upgrade. We said just a change of room was fine. We met a young man at the elevator and we were taken to a lovely large corner room (obviously a upgrade, which we were not charged for). There was a little trouble with the door security key and he said he would call maintenance to fix it. Next minute there was a knock at the door and standing there was obviously a Manager (in suit) and the young man. The Manager apologised for the inconvenience, showed the young man how to fix the problem. He was very pleasant. We have stayed several times at this hotel and love its location, the rooms are always clean, staff curteous and efficient. Lovely spacious sitting areas at both reception and next level up where ther is a nice piano bar. It is never a problem to leave your bags after checkout so that you can spend the day in the city. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “A liitle dissapointing for the money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i stayed in many hotels during my 6 week holiday of Australia and new Zealand and would say this rated at the lower end and one of the more expensive. I felt that the hotel was in need of refubishment. in saying that it was clean enough etc just a bit drab and dissapointing for the price

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in CBD”
Reviews.Author: db6279
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Menzies as it was in the middle of Sydney CBD. All top attractions were just a train stop away. Hotel was clean and decorated very well during xmas season. Breakfast was exceptionally good. Lastly, although rooms are outdated, there was enough space to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Jan Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I love the hotel for the entrance, piano bar area, the dining area for dinner is a must do. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. A stroll to the city, or to Circular Quay, Art Gallery and gardens are just an easy stroll. The rooms are beginning to look a little tired, but we all get that way after a while. Thank you Margaret Fallo

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Dated needs agood refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: andysreview18
Reviews.Content: On first impression this hotel looks good but away from the reception area the hotel is tired and dated. The rooms were sparse of furniture, in one of our rooms there was just a wardrobe but no other storage units.

Reviews.Title: “sydney at your doorstep”
Reviews.Author: brightl
Reviews.Content: Want value for money? then this is the place. Train station across the road so easy access from airport. Buses outside the door or around the corner. Excellent buffet breakfast, friendly staff, excellent pool, gym and internet cafe. Newsagent part of the complex and you can buy bus tickets here. Quick easy walk to Circular Quay and the Rocks. Great shopping all around. Surrounded by plethora of eateries.. from restaurants, to food courts to take away. Smalll park across the road so you can get out of the room and stretch your legs. Very safe, clean. Only drawback was I had a room facing the laneway at the back and it was very noisy thanks to a large fan? but bought some earplugs from the Pharmacy next door and that solved the problem. Has windows that can be opened for those who like some fresh air. All up, ecomonical, clean, safe, perfect location for walking or transport. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “3rd rate hotel with”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked and paid a premium for a park view room, but got a tatty, dark, depressing back lane view room. Complained and was grudgingly moved to a park view room with unserviceable aircon. Asked to be moved again which was done. No TV remote in room and a noisy, worn out bed . Cramped, old fashioned bathroom. Tiny closet. Tiny 4:3 TV. This hotel is seriously showing its age and its staff have an air of resignation. To be avoided at all costs especially considering cost.

Reviews.Title: “dinner service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent but the dinner service not quality of the cuisine has significantly lowered since my last visit. We had to wait a long time for both our meals and the bill.

Reviews.Title: “The Concierge was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: 80sgirlChristchurch
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the positives of this hotel. The complimentary breakfast was very good and worth staying in the dingy rooms for. The menzies had top notch customer service and the concierge was friendly, funny and knew all the best places to go in sydney. He also helped us with everything including booking airport transfers which our travel agent should have done really. He was effortless in customer service and helped us with our luggage unlike the concierge at the gold coast hotel we stayed in. Because of the service and excellent breakfast we felt compelled to stay. the location was central and around the corner from all the shops and was not very far to circular quay and darling harbor which was very pleasant. The downside to this hotel was that the rooms were small, the beds were cold and uncomfortable and the walls were peeling. the elevators were old and slow and the corridors were dirty, unkept and there were pain marks and stains on the carpet. The television only got two channels when we were there and the view was horrendous. Okay, we did not pay or ask for a room with a view but the back-end of an old building and a tin roof out of one tiny window was awful. The pool was tiny and had such a potent chlorinated smell it was enough to make you ill but if you avoided that and upgraded your room I guess it would be a pleasant enough stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, but very old.”
Reviews.Author: Lucky_delf Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Unfashionable and old looking. All rooms were design at 80-th and furniture are pretty old. But service was really very nice and friendly. And it is the best to get here from airoport by train. 30 sec. walk from train station. 20 minutes - and you are in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but not goldie”
Reviews.Author: Hilltriber
Reviews.Content: The Menzies Sydney is an old hotel with a good location. The advantage of a good location basically stops right there. The rooms are very tiny with barely any furnishings, and no security box to put your valuables (very odd for a hotel not to offer this option). The corridors on top and ten floors smell musty because of the old carpet (probably has fungi and mites). My partner and I first checked in after New Year's Day. Our bed was a queen-size but it really felt like a super-single. Being Asians, we are not big size people but we found the bed just too small for us, so we did not sleep well. The manager was very nice, and the following day, he offered to move us to a king-size bedroom. We really appreciated the gesture; still, the king-size feels like a queen-size to me. My advice to people is that a queen-size bedroom at the Menzies is only for a SINGLE person because the room is very tiny (like economy/budget hotels in Europe). I paid A$670 for 3 nights at the Menzies booked through the Accors website. I dont think it is cheap because it does not come with breakfast or free internet access. Internet connection in fact is expensive here. In future, I hope to explore better options in Sydney hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfectly located for visiting Circular Quay and Pitt Street/George Street, QVB, Hyde Park, Darling Harbour. Friendly and vey helpful staff. Only downside really is the swimming pool. Didn't really live up to the star rating of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service : good Room : clean Location : fine, near bus stop and train station suggestion : Additional welcome drink provided

Reviews.Title: “Christmas 2010”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies was great. My children loved it. Fantastic location and the concierges really helped us to plan our outings. We didn't make it down to the pool which was our one regret (ran out of time). The only problem was that we had two double beds rather than a double and 2 singles which meant a slightly reduced sleep quality (being kicked in the back by a 12 year old will do that to you). However this was due to our late booking and that was the only room available for a family of 4. So our fault not the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, a tad bit cramped but the service was very good.”
Reviews.Author: LamboFerrari
Reviews.Content: The lobby service was excellent. They took our baggage and stored them and returned them immediately when we wanted it. The location was very very ideal. It is right across from the Wynyard Train Station in Sydney. We took the train a lot so it was very convienent. The room was nice and tidy and the layout was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Special Night out”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four, two children, 12 & 10 The hotel was perfectly placed for our plans. The room was clean & comfortable. The staff were courteous & helpful. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Inner-City Spot”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great value hotel within walking distance of all attractions, this is the place to stay! The service was great and the room was spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely old Hotel that needs an overall upgrade & refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in nice location”
Reviews.Author: dwarrenty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice. Once in Nov when I was a walk-in and they claimed there were few rooms left and I had to pay A$300 per night. Then in Dec I was able to make an advanced reservation on their website and I got a room for half the price. The hotel has two adjacent wings. The northern wing seems to be more recent, with south the wing that holds the lobby. I prefer the northern wing, though the rooms were similar. The windows open in the rooms so I was able to have fresh air, and the lack of screens surely made no difference on the 10th floor in December. The pool is average and usually empty. The pool changing/shower room not so great, almost want to walk wet through the lobby and shower in my room. The location is more of a business area on the Wynard train stop (from the airport) and is withing 5 blocks walk of pretty much everything, west to the Darling Harbor waterfront, north to Cirqular Quay where the ferries run, and south to the older parts of town. Come suppertime, there are no restaurants nearby, I had to walk to Darling Harbor where there are tons to choose from, but due to its proximity to offices, they fill up early on weekdays.

Reviews.Title: “Poetic license”
Reviews.Author: Leecurtis Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Special Christmas Deal offered on the hotel's web site took quite a bit of poetic license when it came to describing the room. In actuality it was cell-sized, with musty carpets, low quality TV, broken showerhead and the AC blew directly on to out heads as we lay in bed. Only one of us could be standing in the room at a time. The sound insulation was non-existent so you could hear everything going on in the hallway (which also smelled very musty) and in the neighbouring rooms. The cost of the bottle of water by the bed was $7.50! and breaksfast in the dining room was around $30. No a la carte options for gluten free or other diet challenged guests. Fortunately there were some good cafes nearby--an italian one iat the back of the nearby arcade and the Organic Cafe right down the street. The hotel lobby looked tired and past its hay day. There was no way of telling the difference between the bell boys and the concierge as they were dressed in the same manner. When you asked one a question, it was obvious who was who because the bell boys didn't know much at all. Unfortunately, the concierge wasn't around often. The in-room internet charges were ludicrous but they offer 30 minutes of free wireless in the lobby every 24 hours. (There is a great convenience shop down the road towards the south on the corner on York that offers good inexpensive internet service.) The hotel management philosophy was obviously to milk the guests for every possible penny. What a shame that such a grand old place has fallen into the hands of such greedy owners. It felt as though they cater well to the rich but simply use the less wealthy of us to fill in the blanks.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor room quality.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: All is wrapped up in the title. We stayed 10 days in this hotel for a familly trip in Sydney. We booked the room through a 50% discount deal linked to the Accor advantage plus card. The room was simple, without any touch of high-end but comfortable. The view was very poor (just a wall in front of us). In terms of value : the internet wired access is out of range... : 11 dolars for one hour, 24 dollars for one day... When it comes to the parking, very convenient, the cost is also very high : 39 dollars for a full day (including the night).

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an ideal place for access to public transport however, the rooms are in deperate need of an upgrade. In our children's room you could hear toilets flush in other rooms throughout the night. Breakfast was a major disappointment - the food was terrible. Parking was also very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great time the hotel is central to very thing we wanted to see. We had dinner in the hotel I would recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “P Hearne”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As usual our stay at the Menzies Hotel was very good. The location of the Hotel is very central to Sydney CBD, shops, Chinatown, Darling Harbour, Opera House. We also find accessing public transport is quick and easy. Being an Accor member also makes the whole experience more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “menzies stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good Location friendly helpful staff the bar prices where way to high

Reviews.Title: “Wheel chair access”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have often stayed at the Menzies and enjoyed it. However, this time we travelled with an elderly person in a wheel-chair. We parked in the carpark underneath which had no direct access to the foyer, we had to take a lift in the Wynyard station which put us at the street level of the Menzies - across the road. The street has limited ramps for chairs and we had to navigate our way across a very busy street pushing a wheelchair.

Reviews.Title: “Accor Free night”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay.Only complaint from me is the price of a beer,$9.When at a nearby pub the same beer was $4.50. The price of parking under the Menzies is also far too expensive.A Wilsons parking one block from the Menzies charges $25 flat rate.(we travelled by train).

Reviews.Title: “A great way to explore the city on foot”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal position to explore sydney city attractions by foot and short train trips. The pool was great for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies hotel stay was very pleasurable the staff were friendly and efficient. But most importantly the room accommodates a family which can be difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you are arriving by air and want to spend some time in the city, you couldn't ask for a better located hotel. The reception exactly matched my expectations - worldly and functional. Staff were efficient and courteous. The room was adequate, but a bit dark with no ceiling lighting - this was probably in keeping with the era of the building. The bathroom was good although the lever for the shower/bath didn't work properly. The TV remote had a mind of its own - it would sometimes stop working, the TV volume would mysteriously go up and down and the sound had regular static interference. The bed was a bit soft, but comfortable enough to have a good night's sleep. The airconditioning was set a bit warm with no obvious way to change it. The ambient noise level was good given the amount of traffic that obviously passes outside the hotel. The mini bar had a wide range of supplies. The buffet breakfast was good with more than enough variety to get the day started. In summary, the hotel has a wonderful feel and an outstanding location. A few minor maintenance issues spoilt what was otherwise was a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, food and service ... but beds :-(”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Would recommend the hotel to those thinking of staying in Sydney. Well appointed hotel with terrific old fashioned dining room with great food and good service. The bed I had was woeful though. Felt like the mattress was a 100 years old and you sunk in like a banana. Upgrade the mattress and perhaps the decor in the rooms facing the park and it'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Heritage with modernity”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, with good amenities and thankfully WITHOUT the usual intrusive music in common areas. Exceptionally good location at Wynyard Station and a block or two from central businesses and retailers. Pleasant and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Coppola Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in the service and the quality of the breakfast, otherwise the room and all oter services was ok, not exceptional

Reviews.Title: “One of my most favourite hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: Carmania
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times and I just love it. It's not the newest hotel (although they have updated some of the levels) but the atmosphere is great. The rooms I've stayed in are small-ish and the bathroom is tiny but the bed area is really nice. I hate how some hotels don't have overhead lighting - this is one one them. However the piano bar is fantastic. A nice quiet area to have a few drinks. I've seen both the girl and the guy play and they are both really good. The whole bar got into a singalong one night I was there last year. It's also in a great location with the buses and trains across the road and things like Centrepoint and Martin Place are within walking distance. The breakfast is okay but the coffee is great compared to what you usually get at a hotel. There's a 7-11 downstairs if you need junk food at any hour of the night. At night the park across the street gets absolutely infested with cockroaches, never seen so many in my life. That was interesting to see. I have stayed in nice and not so nice hotels and even though this is not opulent it ranks high in the ones I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Good Food Good shopping”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location excellent for shopping.. Enjoyed a great evening startin with fabulous food and later siting around in the piano bar

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere unless you like cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: mrsbkaz
Reviews.Content: The good: great location, friendly staff. The bad: on the first day we came back to our room to find that the door was left open by housekeeping by flipping the latch between the door and the frame - a hard thing to do by accident. The hotel said they will investigate, but we haven't heard back. Then on the last night (out of two) we came back to find a giant (7cm) cockroach in the middle of the room. The front desk staff gave us another room, though it was up to us to face the cockroach by ourselves to get the stuff out. The new room was an upgrade, in a sense that we got a bigger bed, but a downgrade, in a sense that the aircoditioning wasn't working. We were glad to be checking out.

Reviews.Title: “great location and style”
Reviews.Author: lynwal742
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located and certain old elegant style. For a very reasonable price a very nice place to stay. The rooms are well presented although the TV's could be a bit more modern but still no problem. Very pleased with this stay and another in December following this.

Reviews.Title: “location location”
Reviews.Author: fletcherCanada
Reviews.Content: great location,clean,comfotable beds.I paid an extra 25$for "park view"dont waste your money as the view is not worth it.the concierge was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Old, overpriced, outdated”
Reviews.Author: cpha5723
Reviews.Content: The bed was comfortable, the hotel is in a good location. This is where the positives stop. The lobby is beautiful and grand, though this is definitely not a sign of whatâ€™s to come. Reception was incredibly rude and pretentious, and took us 30 minutes to check in. As soon as we exited the elevator on our level, the decor was dingy and outdated. The hallways werenâ€™t well lit, they were dark and had a cold feeling. The walls, and the doors had cracks and peeling paint/wallpaper. It looked like a badly decorated ship cabin from the 1960â€™s. I can see how the hotel might have had character, MANY years ago, but its certainly not the same anymore and definitely in serious need of refurbishment/restoration/redecoration. The rooms were just as bad, just as characterless and lacked â€œwarmthâ€�. The bathroom was awful- tiny, old, shower/tub combination. The room in general was just run down. I came here with my partner for a romantic weekend- it was severely dissapointing and I wouldnâ€™t recommend this to other couples looking for a romantic place to stay. Also, the supposed four star rating is ridiculous, I would give this hotel at the MOST a 3.5 star rating. Definitely over priced for the poor run down rooms this hotel has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, but would recommend this hotel and definitely stay again. The only thing is we would recommend you ask about getting your luggage to the room before going to the carpark. We had to walk up stairs with luggage - not fun!

Reviews.Title: “I night at the Menzies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Having to go to an all day meeting, it was made easy by my being able to drop of my bag early in the morning and keep going. That evening we spent an enjoyable hour around the piano bar. At check out again the service was very thorough. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Mark Daniels”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Menzies on numerous occasions for Business and Leisure and I always have an excellent stay. I choose the Menzies for the following reasons 1 The Bed (firm and comfortable) 2 The View (nice park) 3 Location (easy access to airport via eastern distributor) 4 The Service (staff always excellent)

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Cougar111
Reviews.Content: Check in time was 2.30pm. We arrived at 8.30am and they allowed us to check in and go to our room. A big bonus to the Menzies staff for that. We had one large bag but no one offered to take it to our room and the check in staff never mentioned anything about helping or getting help with luggage. Though that sort of thing doesn't worry me as I prefer to carry my own luggage anyway. Just thought it would be nice to be asked, especially since the price per room is way over the top. We paid $620 for 2 nights and for that price we found the room to be average size, the tv was a bit small and the bathroom was very small. Overall I found the room to be quite dated. Nice enough for about half that price but not happy when paying so much. The lobby is fantastic, the bars are very good, the location is excellent for walking to Darling Harbour or Opera House/The Rocks. The Staff were very nice. Quite an hold hotel, which I did like, has character. But really, the price is what would put me off. Seems standard for Sydney though, way overpriced. Overall was quite enjoyable, no hassles, everyone nice, just keep the cost down.

Reviews.Title: “Room comfort”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Airconditioning needs to be much cooler. We changed rooms because of this issue and found the second room not much better. Is there a reason for this. I have stayed in hotels all over the world. I find that you can always have the room freezing if you wish. Thanks Barbara Blinman

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Dan_Sin_Kween
Reviews.Content: Darling Harbour is only a 10 minute walk away. And with Wynyard station literally just over the road you can get to just about anywhere. Circular Quay is only one stop away. As for the hotel itself, the corridors could do with some redecoration, as could the rooms. Facilities were ok though, but I'd prefer an in-room safe rather than having to go to reception every time. The only meal I took in the hotel was breakfast as I prefer to venture out. This was an impressive hot and cold buffet. There's a bar upstairs, I believe there's live music on Thurs-Sat nights. I wasn't there on a Saturday but Kylie Stephens put on a good show on the Thursday and Friday.

Reviews.Title: “Receiption Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When we travel overseas, Hotel receiption make sure first to confort the customers then worry about the paper work.... In my check in - I found the trainee had better understanding of the customer service concept than the resiption in charge at the time who bud in the conversation to make things diffecult. As for the Piano Bar drink was warm and nice time.

Reviews.Title: “All fine except for the noisy next-door party.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Usually this hotel has provided completely sound-proof rooms. We were surprised this time and disappointed to be beside a very noisy party group whose every word could be heard through the adjoining wall. However we would possibly stay there again, despite the lack of sleep, to give it another try because of the convenience of location and the usually fine service there.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: greg094
Reviews.Content: Not a 5 star hotel. Dirty and damaged room. Lots of noise from the railway and boozy pedestrians catching trains. Microdot TV with poor controls. Antique shower and bath combo. Lots of extra charges (Credit card fees are NOT welcome). Over rated. Best described as a High end back packer hotel. It is definetly NOT a 5 star CBD hotel. I would rate as a 3-3.5.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had a very enjoyable time staying at the Menzies Hotel Sydney. Rooms very comfortable, and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “63rd in Sydney - a generous rating”
Reviews.Author: Saley69
Reviews.Content: Location is OK - but then it's down hill. Poky bathrooms, lifts that are troubling and slow, dreary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had just returned from the UK and our refresh overnight at the Menzies could not have been nicer more comfortable or charming. The old world style and service of the hotel was a refreshing change. The breakfast was excellent and only a short walk to the city for a vist to town before our flight was simple with the concierge providing excellent service and direction. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed & annoyed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Slow front desk service; room keys (we tried at least 6) wouldn't work, so we couldn't get into our room unless accompanied by a staff member with a master key; inefficient service by one of the concierge staff; limited tea/coffee/milk available in room; houskeeping wouldn't answer phone; two of the eating/bar facilities were closed/unavailable for service

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Menzies...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is a great place to stay while visiting Sydney. Easily accessible from the airport via train, no need to change trains/lines, and the Menzies building is right on top of the station. Although the wait to see one of the only two reception-staff took a while the service was warm and friendly & I was pleasantly surprised when I received My room key even though I had arrived a little earlier than the scheduled check-in time. A great place to stay when in the City, and a very central location. Would recommend to others for sure.

Reviews.Title: “shocking beds”
Reviews.Author: Tasman96
Reviews.Content: The beds are universally shocking at this hotel. It doesn't matter how often I stay here (the location is perfect for me) they all sag badly. When mentioning this to checkout staff - an unconcerned 'sorry Sir' is all you get. Please turn the mattresses regularly or REPLACE the beds !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location just across form the Wynyard train station which is on the line from the airport. Great service and the meal on the Sat night was excellent value, especially using the Accor Advantage card. Just thought the rooms were going to be a bit bigger when we were put on the Executive floor.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Menzies stay 3-6 Nov 2010”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location excellent. Staff friendly but knew nothing about Accor card use and "Benny" was hopeless.. a new staff member given little assistance in both coffee lounge and piano bar. Food was good when served but tiresome to order. Could not get a glass of Chardonnay as Manuel, sorry, Benny did not know how to.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family in a room with 2 double beds and it was big and clean and the beds very comfortable. The hotel would have been very glamorous in its day and is now a bit worn looking but very nice and clean and we loved the 1960's style restuarants and deco. Would stay again and it's in a great location for such a good price. Good breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “Nov Ek Sydney Install”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location. Parking a little expensive. Very pleasant staff. Breakfast menu a little limited. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “overll Menzies is a beautiful hotel few things need a bit of update, lift especially gets stuck evey now and then,”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Toilets need update. overall fascinating property restaurant is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies 11”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location for business or pleasure, good service and reasonable rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very close to train and buses, walking distance to The Rocks and ferries, Hotel very quite on weekend we were there

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have been a guest at The Menzies for over 4 years and find that the standard on service has never changed. Right from the time you arrive to you leave all Staff are very cheerful & helpful. The Menzies has a good location for those flying to Sydney where you can use the Airport Link train to Wynard Station and walk across the road to The Menzies

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and very pleasant service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I feel the rooms need a refurb, looking and feeling very old. Air con blowing directly on the beds is annoying and creates ills. Well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: DavidPMessingham
Reviews.Content: This is a good location as you are only a ten minute walk from either Darling harbour & all it's attractions or in the other direction Circular Quay & all it's restaurants & attractions. The hotel is well appointed & well worth it's four star rating. The room was clean & had all the niceties that go with good quality hotels. The concierge desk was particularly helpful with car hire, maps & trip bookings. Reception were very efficient & friendly in fact you would have to be very picky to find fault.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in October”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean reception staff were very accomodating. The other staff very friendly and welcoming. Room was cleaned well with no interuption to me. beds were comfotable and I slept quite well. A/C was very quiet and did not disturb my sleep either which is sometimes an issue for me.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the Piano Bar!”
Reviews.Author: OzCru Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great central location, perfectly placed for shopping and the major tourist attractions (The Rocks, Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay etc). Good quality hotel with all the usual 4* facilities, although oddly, no rack of tourist brochures that you usually find in the lobby of hotels, thus necessitating hunting down the concierge for info. The Piano Bar on the 2/F is a real imncluding a Rod Stewart look-alike, at least on the nights we were there. Apparently it's one of Sydney''s quiet secrets.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location!”
Reviews.Author: Wroblewtore
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Menzies on our honeymoon and were greeted with an upgraded room and a bottle of champagne (and a personalized card from the duty manager). The concierge was excellent in suggesting places to dine and even contacted the restaurant that we were heading to to ask that they set aside a table for us. The hotel is across the street from the subway (easy to get to airport) and walking distance to the harbour and all attractions in the area. The rooms are a little small as it is right downtown, but there was sufficient space for our purposes and the rooms were very clean. I would highly recommed this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A little dated”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a little dated but in quite a good location and a short walk to Shops.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location - walking distance to the city centre and Darling Harbour, across the road from the railway station. Staff were friendly and helpful, room was pleasant - overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “most disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms very small and pokey, bathroom disgusting. Sound of lifts going up and down al night very annoying. Quality of hotel has degenerated since my last stay a few years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were bitterly disappointed with this Accor hotel. We are used to very good value for money, but the amount was far greater than the service. The room was tired and bed hard as. The window was not clean and unable to see out of clearly. We were not made to feel welcome and there was not a good ambience. Sorry but we are normally very happy...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2x4
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in a Standard Room for 4 nights with breakfast included. The breakfast was good, lots of food and choices. Although our room was a bit old, we did get what we paid for, a standard room with 2 double beds. The room was clean and comfortable. The Desk staff were very nice, friendly and helpful. The Conceirge were always pleasant and helpful. The indoor heated pool was too cold and the spa was too hot! The best thing about this hotel is the Location, we either walked everywhere or caught the free bus (333, behing the hotel on George St) and then walked to where we wanted to go. The train station is across the road from the hotel and there are lots of shops, Mc Donalds and a Coles Supermarket there, if you keep walking through you go under the hotel and come out in George St. If its raining and you want to get to George St come out of the hotel and turn left then go into the Menzies Mall and walk through to George St. Would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kby121148
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, decor a little tired but excellent location for public transport. Had two rooms and paid the same price for both but quite a difference in size for some reason. A distinct lack of storage drawers in the rooms. Staff at the concierge and on the desk could not be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay.”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideChez Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
