Reviews.Content: Our first stay at The Menzies. Great location, easy walking to all attractions and as a bonus, train and buses only metres away. Very clean and well presented rooms. Large lounge and bar area . Expensive breakfast but pleanty of close by good value venues . On the down side, check out very slow,(understoof this to be the normal..so allow extra 10 /15 minutes). Cant imagine why we have overlloked the Menzies for so long... we will be back.!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: fethatucka Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room and service were great. Food and drinks were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm and service”
Reviews.Author: lcid Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel which provides old world charm with first class service. The location is just perfect for a stay in the city with everything close handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - close to everything in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisShaunIllawarra Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were pleasant and helpful, room was very clean and comfortable - couldn't ask for a better place to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Older, tastefully modernised hotel, well situated for access to shops and tourist attractions which Sydney affords.”
Reviews.Author: Hayden55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the The Menzies Hotel for five nights. The hotel is centrally situated in an ideal position to visit Sydney, providing easy access to the main tourist attractions of the area, and the main shopping centre. The railway station is close by. The hotel itself was well maintained. The rooms and furnishings were in excellent order and scrupulously clean. The sanitary facilities in the room were comprehensive and functioned well. There was, as one would expect, an adequate complementary beverages bar in the room, which was resupplied with tea and coffee daily. There was a mini bar and small fridge. Storage space for clothing was adequate. A steam iron and ironing board were also provided. The staff were well turned out, polite, and very helpful on the occasions we asked for advice/ directions. We had a most enjoyable time whilst in Sydney, and, although we didn't spend very much time in the hotel, we were most satisfied with the facilities it afforded and the way we were treated by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ladybirdLorraine
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Menzies last July. Even if we had a very small and dark room that needed to be renovated for four people (we could hardly open our luggage and move around), we would come back there because it is quite well located, just opposite the station and 10-min walk from the Opera and Darling Harbour. It is very good value. The staff are very nice as well as at the reception as at the entrance or at the restaurant. The swimming pool is not very large but do not forget we are downtown so it is a luxury to have one there! Concerning breakfast, you must come early if you want to have some choice. In short, you can stay at the Menzies if you are looking for a good value and well-located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grotty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneHello61
Reviews.Content: Only good thing is that is close to the city centre.. Otherwise rooms smell and are old and badly in need of refurbishment ...corridors are full of dust and toilets in the reception area were very dirty...only one staff member at the cafe stand hence the service was very very slow... twice i presented a gift card at reception and twice they werent able to process it.. as an accor hotel this one was definitely one of the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Fading Splendour in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Fwombats
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. Despite booking well in advance (4 weeks), our room type (double/double) was not allocated to us on arrival. Some haggling saw us settling in. Rooms are getting tired. Wobbly occasional table, chips in the enamel on the bathtub sort of thing. Room was a good size and everything worked. TV size could have been a bit more generous. Package included breakfast (x3), but problem on 2nd morning when staff member demanded that one of us upgraded to the full breakfast before our daughter could eat. Nothing on web site or booking advice about this. Rest of the staff were great, helpful and courteous. Parking is outsourced at remote site, so allow time for getting your car to parking and back (no valet service).

Reviews.Title: “Very easy to find for solo first time travler to Syndey”
Reviews.Author: Nlingenfel
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Very easy to find using Airport metro. Very pleased with hotel. I am a 68 year old female.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here upon arrival in oz, would...”
Reviews.Author: R0sey2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here upon arrival in oz, would recommend as an excellent base. Concierge was very helpful. 5-10 min walk to Sydney aquarium and marina (stopping en route at the Liverpool fc cafe for brekkie). Approx 20-30 min walk to opera house/bridge/docks etc. Next door to hotel was a mini market store to get good value bottled water as you set off. Bus to bondi beach only 5 min walk too. Only downside to hotel was no coffee/tea making facilities. Although nice pool.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Where ever I lay my hat
Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Daddybear3
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location for visiting sydney when you first walk in the hotel you expect grandure but when you get up stairs the rooms are a little dated. Our mattress was extremely soft and the bed was very low we had to keep our curtains closed during the day as the office staff could see straight into our room even though there were nets. We went into the sports bar down stairs which was extremely dirty and the staff weren't interested in cleaning as the place wasn't that busy and the management knew this as they decided to hold their weekly meeting in the bar in the middle of the afternoon. The plus point is the location also there was a underground station across the road which had a Coles supermarket great for snacks also Darling harbour and its food courts and restaurants wasn't to far to walk

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a hotel to avoid”
Reviews.Author: Blitzem
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the the lobby looked nice, but the room was sad - scruffy, poor maintenance standard and daily cleaning is atrocious. One day we returned to find that someone had made the bathroom dirty - glasses not washed, left on the sink, stains on the tiles that weren't there when we left, fluff around the bedroom. On another occcasion I discovered a cockroach on the mirror in the bathroom. And to make things worse they had the nerve to charge my credit card for more with no explanation a month later! The management is totally apathethic. STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny BLACK bugs around the sink area! Freaked me out!”
Reviews.Author: sharyncortes
Reviews.Content: The price was fair. Reception area was slow to respond. Buffet breakfast lacked variety! I did find one exceptional concierge/bellman, Alex and one exceptional bellboy, Jack. Sorry, but this place needs to be better kept. Mold in the showers and broken tiles too were quite a surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Guillermofog
Reviews.Content: I have just left the hotel this morning until today after 6 nights while sightseeing Sydney. The Wynyard train station is litterally one minute walk across the street and there are plenty of buses in the area. It is walking distance from circular quay, the opera house and a few restaurants around the rock. The concierge is very happy to help and give directions on how to use the public transport. Going from and to the airport is very convinient with a direct train line. You can also ask them to arrange a shuttle bus for $12 one-way. The rooms are not glamourous but are well kept and clean. We got a prepaid offer, so good value for money. Check-in was really efficient and took around 3 minutes. It was really appreciated that landing in an early morning after 20 hours on a plane from Europe, our room was ready. With the express check out we just left keys in the box. Please note that credit card fees apply (1.5%). In our case as it was prepaid it was not the case.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Hotel in City Central,Needs an Update”
Reviews.Author: James007MEL
Reviews.Content: Hi, we chose this hotel for its name, location and facilities (pool,etc) and shown on there site. Although the hotel was large,clean and quite we found it to be a little run down and outdated in comparison to other hotels in the area in there class. The rooms are clean but have old decor and furniture, the bathrooms are lower standard and the views less to be desired (brick walls). At arrival the computer system was down and we waited 40 minutes approx to get our rooms. Parking was also an issue for this hotel and an expensive extra cost on top of room rate. Overall the hotel was quite, easy to walk to being in the central, staff helpfull and attentative and at special offered rates fair. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our brief stay - thank you !!”
Reviews.Author: TheGirls08
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at Menzies recently while attending a concert at the Opera House. Friendly concierge warmly greeted us on the red carpet as we arrived and all staff were very professional, welcoming and helpful. It is a grand old hotel and we felt it has been maintained very well over the years - modern yet still retaining some of its opulent charm. We had a comfortable king room overlooking the park and also enjoyed a visit to the sauna (pool and spa also looked inviting but were rather busy on a Friday afternoon so we chose not to join the crowd). Gym looked well equipped as well. Didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on that aspect. Location is fabulous for just about anything in Sydney CBD - we enjoyed an easy stroll to The Rocks for a meal and easy walk to and from the Opera House as well for our concert. Trains and buses also right at the door. We were just disappointed that we were only staying one night !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice place”
Reviews.Author: cuss
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Menzies for 5 nights last week and was completely satisfied with all aspects. The location is great. A short walk to the Rocks and Circular Quaye for boat rides and right across the street from the train station/bus depot. Also close to Darling Harbor restaurants and bars. Internet access was too expensive but there were non-password protected wireless accounts available in the lobby, so no issue with that. I was in room 1028 which was a big 10th floor room, so no road noise. No complaints from me at all. Very good service, very good room, excellent location = 4 star review.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KMPAdelaide
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel 16 years ago and loved it. Since then I've stayed another 5 times and had no problems. The location is superb. The room service & breakfast is great too. However they've not upgraded anything except the TV's in all this time. The room they gave me last weekend was a horrible, dark room facing the back. One wall had 4 locked cupboards where I guess an airconditioning vent or something was. It was dirty & horrible. I asked them to move me which they did but they looked at me as if I was from another planet when I told them what the problem was. The next room was better. But the cupboard that the fridge was in was dirty. The bathroom door on the inside was revolting with finger marks & what looked like makeup fingerprints. Really no excuse for this. All it needs is some spray & wipe. I would have called housekeeping to complain but was getting late & only staying one night so I cleaned it as best myself with some soap & facewasher. The corner where the table fitted in - the wall was dusty with dirty marks. Again all it needs is some spray & wipe. There was an upholstered chair at the desk & was falling apart front & back you could see where the material was coming away from the chair & all the tiny nails exposed. There's no excuse for this. Its just bad maintenance & cleaning. The bed was clean & comfortable. The bathroom otherwise clean. I've not had such bad rooms here before so I guess I've jusy been lucky in the past. I would recommend this hotel because of the location & breakfast & room service meals good & reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Freqtravellerperth
Reviews.Content: The Menzies has a good location accessible to trains and transport in CBD Sydney, reasonable price for rooms. The rooms are however quite tired and in need of updating - especially the bathrooms that are on the moldy / mildewy side. Aircon was also an issue - far too warm for our comfort, with the control apparently broken Overall the Menzies is a reasonable option for Sydney... but a short stay is probably best. There are better places to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely stay made our anniversary.”
Reviews.Author: kitkatR
Reviews.Content: I really can not understand some of the negative reviews that have been written especially the one by ffitzi below. My husband and I stayed for 6 nights this past week and we could not fault the way we were treated nor any of the services offered by the hotel that we experienced. From the moment we checked in and all the silly questions we asked to the moment we checked out we were shown nothing but respect, politeness and friendliness. The only supposition I have is that if you treat people with contempt and disrespect then that is what you usually receive in turn. Yes the hotel is a little older and less modern that some of the others in Sydney but our standard King double was clean, spacious and well stocked of facilities. The bed was reasonably comfortable (much more so than some I have slept in throughout Europe) and actually was a King rather than two singles joined together as is the practice of some hotels. The only blip in our stay was that on arrival to our room we found a single rollaway bed in the middle of the room but as soon as I reported this to the desk it was removed within 5 minutes. We did not try breakfast at the hotel as I usually like to try various cafes in the city I'm staying in, but we did try room service which was prompt, tasty and good portion sizes (not too large or small). So would we stay again? - most definitely - and I would not hesitate to recommend to family or friends. Service, comfort, cleanliness, space, location. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great location - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ECB2010
Reviews.Content: The best aspect of the Menzies is the location. It is situated directly opposite the Wynyard train station in Sydney's CBD, which makes it a convenient 15 minutes commute from the airport. Moreover, the hotel is no more than 10 minutes to the Opera House, Harbour, "Rocks" district, and Market Street shopping area, which means its great for accessing the major tourist sites in downtown Sydney. The hotel is comfortable and reasonably priced and so was ideal for our four night visit. Travelers in search of luxury will need to look elsewhere, but those looking for comfort, convenience and affordability will find a bargain at the Menzies.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: brennerregular2010
Reviews.Content: The stay started with an incompetent receptionist who didn't between a surname and a first name and never thought to ask for a confirmation which resulted in unnecessary confusion. When I saw my hotel room it looked small and cramped, the bathroom only a few steps above an airline. We then proceeded to try to acquire the internet for about 2 hours speaking to everyone from the front desk to the help hotline and porter. We finally were able to purchase wireless internet for $100 per person for 10 days. We had the wireless access for 2 of 10 days before it crashed. We were then forced to purchase the broadband internet for $25 per 24hrs. No one that we spoke to seemed to have a clue about the internet options. Luckily, one or two people were able to offer some assistance. The concierge specifically directed us to Mcdonalds to use their wifi. (Which was the most useful tip we had gotten all day). The housekeeping was sloppy at best. The towels reeked like mold. A few days into the stay the lifts completely stopped working for a few hours and you were not permitted to take the stairs because they are for emergencies only. Guests were stuck in their rooms for at least 2 hours if not more. The full breakfast offered is expensive and unoriginal. We are picky eaters and did not care for what was on the hot breakfast options so then had to eat from the continental options. Each day the options remained the same varying only once or twice with pancakes and hash browns in one rotation. This is not a hotel I would recommend or ever stay at again in my life the only positives are the location and the helpful and apologetic concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel for visiting Sydney - very friendly and good value.”
Reviews.Author: Crips
Reviews.Content: The Menzies Hotel is as central as you can get and althougth a bit 'tired' decor wise that is certainly not reflected in the attitude of the staff. Not a modern Hotel but well run and friendly and allows easy access to the rail station and down to the wonderful harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Yoyomasterpups
Reviews.Content: Menzies is in the heart of the CBD and right across the Wynyard Train Station and just a sneeze away from George Street. Good services and facilities. We can't forget the cinnamon scent of the lobby, very cozy. Rooms and bath are clean, just hope ours had a good view.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: jenard
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is ideally located for the main areas of Sydney, wihin easy walking distance of The Opera House, Harbour Bridge,Circular Quay, The Rocks and Darling Harbour Older style hotel with friendly staff and good size comfortable rooms. Next to Wynard underground station. Whist there try a ferry to Manley Bay from Circular Quay,cheap and great views of bridge and Opera House. Food and drink prices in Sydney quite high ( try Harry the Wheels Pie stall at Woollamalloo for a good snack)

Reviews.Title: “Menzies, Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: Azureair
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at The Menzies. The entrance Foyer is very opulent and quite an eye opener. Reception staff were very helpful and informative, we were quickly directed to our room on the 8th floor. The room was of a good size but a little cool, the south wing had a problem with the heating, which unfortunately was not resolved whilst we were there, which did make it a little uncomfortable. The Hotel was opened in 1963, which makes it around the same age as me! Unfortunately like me it is starting to show its age, a little rough round the edges but still trying hard... Overall a great location, a little rough around the edges, most staff pleasant and still worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: Walkabout09
Reviews.Content: Location: Inner CBD, five minutes walk from major shopping attractions and business centres, ten minutes walk from the harbour and King Street Wharf, train station across the road, and situated in a safe area - what more could you want?! Front desk & Concierge: Lovely staff who couldn't have been more helpful. I often wonder at the negative comments made by people who say they waited to check-in, if they rush their own check-in? Waiting for five minutes while they check another guest in will not kill you. They were all polite and professional, what more could you want? The room: If I could've taken the bed and pillows home with me, I would have! I enjoyed a wonderful sleep and wish I'd stayed longer than one night. The room was clean and comfortable with modern decor. I wasn't in long enough to be 'offended' by the view of the next building, a garden-view room would've been wasted on me as I've never spent much time looking at the view from an inner CBD hotel room and I can't understand why guests can be so indignant that their view was of another building. I imagine it would be a different story if the hotel was located next to the sea, harbour, or mountain but it's inner CBD and no one is in their hotel room for long. Quiet, clean, and ultra comfortable...what more could you want? The atmosphere: A lovely, welcoming foyer that was enhanced by the grand piano on Friday night. What a lovely surprise that was! How many hotels afford their guests such a charming treat these days? Enjoying a glass of vino as the piano played while the frantic pace continued outside, was utterly spectacular. The Menzies has such an inviting atmosphere, I can't imagine anyone feeling uncomfortable. The business centre: Though this trip was for leisure I frequently visit Sydney for business. I was impressed on a personal and business level by the business centre that's available. Firstly, there's more than one computer/internet terminal set up in an internet cafe style but privately partitioned. Very impressed by the set-up because it's a cheaper alternative than paying for the Accor internet connection. Other: I wasn't there long enough to enjoy the gym or other amenities but I would LOVE to organise a function there. Shame I look after Brisbane events and not Sydney's ;) Would I stay there again? ABSOLUTELY! I travel to Sydney frequently for work and usually stay at The Grace Hotel. I enjoyed it so much I'm going to request The Menzies next time! What more could you want in a hotel?!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money for the whole family!”
Reviews.Author: Janet069
Reviews.Content: I can't believe it when i found this 4 star hotel at such a gd price (stay four nites to get the best deal, only that it's prepaid and cannot be cancelled) and can accomodate a family of four ( w 2 active kids). They have 2 double beds that fit us comfortably with gd central heating. So I was overjoyed when i learned that it's situated at such a convenience place. train station is right opposite and there's a coles supermarket above the station! there's all kind of eateries around and also found a sovenience shop(basement) around the corner selling at reasonable price. it's walking distance to about everywhere! For dining, don't miss out the food court at the basement of Myers (a few streets down). it's better than chinatown. pricing is reasonable, it's very clean and gd presentation. there's both western and asian cruisine. Oh, menzies staff are helpful too. infact, we plan to stay in this hotel longer next time to explore sydney and its surrounding. we need not buy any travel pass becos of it's excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies is perfect in every respect, Service, Location and Value for Money.”
Reviews.Author: levymal
Reviews.Content: We stay at this Hotel at least once a year. It is like one's favourite item of clothing or shoes - comforting and familiar! The service is great, as is the location. In addition, we consider it to be great value for money. All things considered, we can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: shebSAM
Reviews.Content: Nights of stay: May 15, 16, and 17, 2010 Room location: Second floor, facing inner building walls. Odors: None Cleanliness: No issues. Beds clean Noise: None. Room cooling/heating central system with very silent fan Staff: Very helpful, courteous even though some donâ€™t know English. Available Breakfast quality: Superb, better than excellent

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Richard_SK
Reviews.Content: The location is good, to the opera house is in walking distance, The room is terrible, very old, a 4Star hotel without safety deposit box, No shower curtain, every time you shower wet everywhere, the mattress is old & any movement it makes the sound back to you. Never seem the air-condition controller like this I think over 20years old(Pls see my photo), one more surprise is the housekeeping can open my door without knock and also even I have double lock, the security chain stop the door open. Breakfast is expensive, also no congee, hotel should provide at least one of Chinese food, reception is very busy one 2 staff stand there all the time. No loyalty program, but its accor chain hotel. 27-29May2010

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, hotel could be better”
Reviews.Author: bennyh66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Menzies for four nights. I picked this hotel because I am a advantage plus member. I got the same rate as everyone else and I would say the same room. I asked for a view in my request. Yes i did get a view of the building across the lane way. I could be just and say that we ended up with this room because we arrived early, but we did not get a room until midday. The T.V. had a hum in it so they sent a guy up to fix that. Then the air con was cold so the same guy came back and fixed that. The Hotel never sent any apology for these things , but the repair guy did say sorry. Room was not properly cleaned, toiletries not refilled, sheets not changed for 4 days - we only asked for them to be changed on the second day, but it did not happen. I would stay somewhere else next time as it was not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dianem252
Reviews.Content: Girlfriend and I booked this hotel for one night through the qantas site to see the musical CATS and do a bit of shopping. The site quoted the full rate as $699 but a special of $219 (bed and breakfast) so thought this was a bargain and a bit of luxury. The room was very very standard with very old furniture, tv could hardly watch as it was so small. No view, only of other people's rooms. Very disappointing as we were looking for a little indulgence for one night. although the beds were very comfortable and clean, the bathroom needed attention to the mould etc. The whole place needs a refurbish and more staff needed on the front desk. Breakfast was very average and really not worth the extra money. I know it was a standard room but I thought it would have been much nicer. Location was ok. I certainly don't know how they can quote the full rate as $699.

Reviews.Title: “Failed the test”
Reviews.Author: newkstar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Menzies for two nights in mid-May for work. I stayed here because the business meetings were in the hotel, so it was very convenient. It is well located in general, being just off busy George Street and opposite Wynyard Train Station. As others have noted, the hotel is in general rather tired. On the plus side, reception was friendly and efficient as was the concierge service. We also had a set 3 course meal in the restaurant one evening and it was very pleasant. My room was also quite spacious, although the TV was both old and tiny, the windows were filthy and the toilet was continually noisy. Those items to one side, the hotel failed for two reasons. First, my room was not serviced at all on the second day. Because I got back late to my room and I was tired, I did not bother trying to get this sorted but it just should not happen. Secondly, the hotel consists of two, connected towers. A fire alarm went off in one tower (a false alarm) but not in the other (where I was sleeping). Hardly confidence building!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: coober
Reviews.Content: Great location, good size rooms, value for money, hard to find better hotel in this class.

Reviews.Title: “It didn't come up to my expectation.”
Reviews.Author: No_Life_No_Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Menzies for 6 nights from the end of April to the beginning of May. Unfortunately, everything fell short of my expectations. Firstly, the room was too old. The door of mini-bar no longer had a bar and all the bottles fell off every time I opened it. The hair dryer was completely broken. It seemed to have 3 levels of power, but the only level I could set was the weakest level. It took 20 minutes to dry up my hair!! Secondly, the housekeeping was hopeless. When the door of the bathroom is open, a small space appears between the wall and the door. When I returned to room, it looked cleaned up at first sight but I found the lots of hair left in that space of the bathroom. Disgusting! A few hairs were also seen on the bathtub. Thirdly, the hotel staff were very unfriendly. I was a bit surprised that the cleaner didn't say anything like "Hello" when she got into the lift. She didn't even meet my eyes. The only advantage of this hotel is its location!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious service, rude concierge and absolutely failed to live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: damienhj
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Menzies, and as a regular traveller, would have to say that the rooms were definitely not what I expected for the pricetag. There were cracks in the walls and the rooms were very very dated. The hotel seems to be in a timewarp despite the fact that it is right in the heart of the city. When we arrived, the bathroom was not clean, and there was a distinct odour of sewage. If you looked out the window, there it was, for all to see. The facilities were all dirty â€“ including the sauna. For $300 a night, this was deplorable. The service was pretentious and condescending â€“ the Menzies has all the initial appearances of a 5 star establishment without any of the style or courtesy that you would expect. With a concierge to greet you, but no intention to assist you in any way, it was offensive. The hotel rooms need to be updated, the service staff must undergo training in customer relations and the concierge should be placed in a position more appropriate for the skill set. The rooms were that sad and bland that we were forced to leave the hotel, but luckily due to the close proximity to attractions we had an absolutely fantastic time in Sydney â€“ but rest assured, it certainly was not due to the accommodation. Although the beds were comfortable, there really was no justification for the inflated prices of this hotel. The Ibis is not that far away â€“ spend the extra cash on a cruise of the harbour instead!

Reviews.Title: “delusional”
Reviews.Author: Gongchick01
Reviews.Content: As this hotel was recommended as part of a weekend trip to Sydney, I was absolutely disgusted with the hotel service and facilities. The staff were rude and incompetent. When giving poor service - word of advice, don't insult guests. And it didn't get any better from there. My room had cockroaches, mould all over the bathroom, a shower which was inoperable and cracks in the wall. When I dared lay on the bed, I went flying towards the window which was met with a distinct sewage smell coming from outside. The one thing that I can thank the Menzies for is making me spend as much time out of the hotel as possible and experience Sydney - because the bonus facilities certainly weren't a bonus when 3 people get allergic reactions..... A definite must NOT go to!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - rooms getting a little dated and worn”
Reviews.Author: geeijo
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 rooms during the accor half price sale so our stay was good value for money. Liked the friendly doorman and the reception area is very nice. Our rooms were ok - double window kept the street noise out (11th floor) but did get noise from other peoples showers the following morning. 2 rooms near the lift but no noise issues from that. The room was clean but getting a bit worn. If I was paying full price I would have expected more from the TV - it was fairly small and reception not always the best (but still watchable). The bathroom was a bit weird with the toilet coming out of the wall at an angle into the room and the flush was a lightswitch! Tall people would hit their heads in the shower as the bath is built up off the floor and roof above the shower is built down - i am not tall and could reach up and touch the roof easily! I had an issue where my switch to flush the toilet kept stopping working - reported it twice and had to leave the toilet unflushed both times. I then checked out so don't know if it was eventually fixed or not - mainly just a symptom of it being an older hotel as in general everything was clean and well looked after - just a bit old. So great for our price - at full price my preference would take me somewhere a bit more modern.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdamMogg65
Reviews.Content: Happy we stayed at the menzies its location is great and service is wonderful. Throoughly enjoyed our time at this hotel and in Sydney . Thank you Menzies

Reviews.Title: “Unrealistic hotel policy and disgrace service”
Reviews.Author: hovi
Reviews.Content: I was staying at The Menzies Sydney for 6 nights (It's my first time staying there). I'll definitely NOT recommend my friends to stay there. 1. HouseKeeping attendant was aware that the "Do Not Disturb" sign was placed at the door knob, but still ringing the guest room to reconfirm if cleaning service is required. This is an inappropriate and unacceptable action. 2. At 1pm on 30/04/2010, Instructions given to HouseKeeping to clean my room before 7pm. However, i found that my room was not cleaned when i get back to my room at 9pm. 3. At 9:50am on 01/05/2010, HouseKeeping Supervisor called my room to explain why room wasn't cleaned the day before. She claimed that the "Do Not Disturb" sign was placed at the door knob. But this is not true, as i had it removed before i left my room. That's what I did every day during my stay. Also, it was the inappropriate time to contact me as I was still sleeping. The HouseKeeping person should have checked if the "Do Not Disturb" sign was placed on the door knob before calling me. 4. The "Do Not Disturb" sign is not effective at all, as it fell off every time when i open the door. 5. Housekeeper in Office or Front Office staff have no visibility on guest room status, such as hotel guests placed the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door. 6. I had a late flight on my check out date, therefore, I was enquiring the late check out charge and the half day room rate. I was advised that there is no half day room rate available due to hotel policy. I was offered either paying for the late checkout charge $20 per hour or the standard room rate $299 if i want to keep my room till 6pm. This is ridiculous and unrealistic that I have to pay for a lot more than my original daily rate if I want to keep my room for a few hours more. I would have chosen the other 5 stars hotel if i'm paying for $299. 7. Piano Bar was under staff, therefore, I did not receive any table service. I had to order and get the drinks myself on the bar counter. I cannot believe that this is happening in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Big_Davo27
Reviews.Content: Service on checkin was the worst I've ever encountered. Was told that they couldn't find me a room to match my booking; eventually found one and upon entering it, found it was already occupied! After another long wait a room was finally found. Due to multiple problems during check-in, was offered free breakfasts for duration of stay; on checking-out, hotel attempted to charge for these until reminded of problems and corresponding offer of complimentary breakfasts. Concierge service was helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff who would do anything for...”
Reviews.Author: bendalong
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff who would do anything for you. Make you feel very welcome. The rooms are small and very clean. unfortunately though the rooms must have thin walls as I could hear the shower and toilets from the rooms next to me and the air con is very loud. The beds are hard and the pillows are thin and uncomfortable. The shower is in a dangerous position in the bathtub. For convenience this hotel is great and the staff are great.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a great location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: vixer
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on its location and fairly good value rooms. Easy walk to Darling Harbour and Circular Quay, great for shopping on George Street. Unfortunately its location does mean noise and even on the 9th floor we were disturbed by trains late at night. Plus our room was right near the lift so we heard them going up and down as well. Staff mostly friendly and polite - though one receptionist did tell us he was too busy to get us a replacement kettle (ours was leaking). Breakfast very expensive - go elsewhere. Rooms very average - bland, no character but clean. Sadly, our double bed just couldn't fit both me and my husband :-( - both being quite tall - so I slept in the other double bed in our room for the duration of our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Right over Wynyard Railway station”
Reviews.Author: johnjan6410
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is an older hotel which I'd say was quite the place to be once and today this hotel is still very nice and the staff very helpful and polite, it's location is tops with Wynyard underground station right below with easy access to other parts of the city and a direct line to both airports with trains running every few minutes. It's an easy ten minute walk to Darling Harbour and or Hyde Park, with many other sites within walking distance. Our room though quite large and comfortable with two double beds was in the North wing and faced the centre cavity of the building which gave us a view of walls and other windows, being from out of town and preferring a view we requested a move to an outward facing room but unfortunatley was told that the hotel was full, but as a sweetener we were given free drink vouchers and a bottle of bubbly in our room so it turned out to be a cheap drink night especially for my wife. My only complaint was apart from the lack of view our room had an exceptionally small LCD tv on the wall which was some distance from the bed and dificult to see. Otherwise this hotel was satisfactory for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value”
Reviews.Author: terminaltraveller
Reviews.Content: Asked for a room on a high floor. Got one on the 7th floor; with a great vew of a wall. (My fault, I suppose I should have asked for a room with an external view) Room stank of stale cigarette smoke. Small TV was hung off a wall, and picture wavered for ~5 minutes until it became moderately stable. Every time minibar fridge door was opened, most of the stuff in the door tumbled out, some bright individual had removed the keeper bar from the indoor shelves. Given this lack of value, chose not to sample the restaurant, the bar, or anything else associated with this property. Bright point; stay was just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: hbomb1947
Reviews.Content: I chose the Menzies principally for its superb location -- just a few blocks' walk from the Circular Quay and attractions such as the Sydney Opera House -- and it did not disappoint on that score. But what really enhanced my stay was the outstanding service I received from the staff. The concierge staff were extremely helpful to me in planning both daytime and evening excursions. Then, subsequent to my stay, the front office and concierge went far beyond anything that they were required to do when an airline lost my luggage (and in the luggage were several souvenirs that I had just purchased in Sydney). The Menzies staff, at my request, sent a concierge to visit area vendors and reacquire souvenirs that were similar to the ones that had been lost; then the hotel shipped the items to me in the United States (via a shipping method that I approved). Of course I reimbursed the hotel via a credit card authorisation (and was subsequently compensated by the airline), but the point is that it was very generous of the Menzies to take the time to do this for some random former guest from halfway around the world who had only spent four nights in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “disapointed”
Reviews.Author: dewar1962
Reviews.Content: stayed one week for our 25th wedding anniversary global round trip.Disapointed with the scruffyness of the 3rd floor standard room. We complained about mold under sink rim but nothing was done,we went out and bought a can of air freshener to try and hide the musty smell. The bed was comfortable and clean but only one bedside cabinet.We only had breakfast twice which was a bit pricey but o. k.The staff were helpful and polite and the location is fantastic.I would not rate this hotel above 2/3 star at best and hopefully the owners will take notice of all these negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but don't use the phone”
Reviews.Author: Callawho
Reviews.Content: Great location and very friendly staff but I was staggered at the bill I received on leaving. We made 2 calls back to the Uk for between 5 and 10 minutes each and the costs were Â£84 and Â£92. This really left a sour taste in the mouth on leaving. There are 3 bars we saw in the hotel but the downstairs bar and the ground floor bar were hardly ever open - certainly not when we returned to the hotel in the evenings. The only bar open was a small piano bar which was good and comfortable, but expensive, although the bar staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: PSDuvall
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrrived to the morning of our departure EVERYTHING was perfect. Our park view room on the 3rd floor was clean and comfortable. The concierge staff was more than helpful with dining reservations and finding art galleries. Upon our departure I spoke with to manager on duty, a Sunday morning, to tell him how pleased we were. Michael -Palm Springs, CA USA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: NigelHa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located near Wynyards station and handy for the train to the Airport. Very, very expensive restaurant. The nearby Cafe Capri is recommended for breakfast. Also no inroom safes. Rooms are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A dingy little hotel”
Reviews.Author: christinak02
Reviews.Content: I am sorry but the only positive thing about this hotel was its location. We stayed at The Menzies for 3 days and at the end I just wanted to go home. I was tired of management apologising and without anything being achieved. I honestly think if "management" spent less time replying to these reviews and more time in making sure the hotel ran smoothly as problems arise - it would be a more enjoyable experience for all. Rooms were stuffy, small house keeping was a joke, towels were thread bare, sheets had holes, walls were dirty and breakfast was revolting. Bringing this to the attention of staff achieved nothing. You would go up to your room and the card thing wouldnt work so you couldnt go in to your room and so it was a another trip down to get it organised. Seriously it wasnt worth the money and even after all this time I still feel the same way as I did when I left. Just dont bother unless you get it dirt cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: nickvegas
Reviews.Content: This place needs renovating. Location is ideal but rooms are almost 70s style. Why on earth would the owners not shut it down for 6 months and clean it up??

Reviews.Title: “Location = perfect, Hotel and service = terrible”
Reviews.Author: ms88Sydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner on a Friday night as she had a party to go to nearby. Either my expectations are too high or this is in fact the worst hotel I have stayed at. As other reviewers say: old and out-dated. But it doesn't end there. The service is terrible to boot. So I had called in advance and the operator told me that the hotel has valet parking and to take our car to the lane behind the hotel but if we have lots of bags we can take the car to the front of the hotel on Carrington Rd and the porter can valet from there. As we had some bags we decided to take the latter offer. When we parked right in front of the hotel we had to carry all our bags inside ourselves as the porters just looked on like we weren't even there. I went up to him and he said sorry they don't valet from the hotel and we have to go to the lane. I didn't even bother arguing. On check in the receptionist was good and checked us in quickly and gave us clear instructions to get to the room. We entered the room and were literally shocked. It was smaller then a room in a budget hotel like Forumla 1. The thing that shocked me most was that it had a CRT television! Are they serious? A CRT tv in the year 2010 in a supposed 4 star hotel. Pathetic. I can't get over how bad the room was. The bathroom even was so old. So we decided to go down and get some food. The restaurant apparently isn't open at that time. Then we go and ask a porter if the bar and bistro is serving food. He said sorry but no where in the hotel is food being served at this hour apart from room service (3pm). Just in case we went down to the bar to ask and she told us that the restaurant on the reception level sell food all day. So why did the porter tell us that they don't? Anyway the food wasn't too bad but the service was pretty bad. All night while trying to sleep thing was creeping and crawling and making noise. Couldn't fall asleep. Next day we checked out and the girl at reception was an over zealous little creep. Thought she knew then she really did. I set her straight. Poor hotel. 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: themaysEssex
Reviews.Content: stayed at the menzies between 2-8 feb, found hotel easy from train station across the road, hotel postion just cannot be better, walking distance to all major sightseeing venues, the room again was good, good size, modern bathroom,only down side was we had no view,but not every room can have a view over the city, nice pool and sauna to use after a hard day of walking , all staff very helpful, if we were in sydney again i would not look anywhere else to stay , thankyou menzies hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies was fine and suited my purpose”
Reviews.Author: Aloushka
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night and chose this hotel because it was convenient to my place of work (which was opposite Wynyard Park) and because of renovations taking place at my home that day. My room was clean and tidy and very handy for me from a work perspective. The decor was somewhat old fashioned, but my room was cosy and comfortable nevertheless and the view from my window was very pleasant over Wynyard Park. Would come back to this hotel. Aloushka, Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, a little dated but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Gat16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central, opposite Wynyard station (where thereâ€™s a Coles supermarket), and it's an easy walk to Circular Quay etc. Certainly, itâ€™s getting a little dated in some respects, but the room was clean and comfortable and had everything that was required. The staff were friendly and helpful. There are lots of nearby places to have breakfast, so I didnâ€™t eat in the hotel and canâ€™t comment on this aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: SeymourMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The room we were given badly needed renovating. The hall way from the elevator on the 10th floor had a musty smell. The staff were friendly and curteous and the location is great for getting around. It is overpriced ,if the other rooms were of the standard of the one we were given.

Reviews.Title: “Sir Robert Menzies died in 1978. That was this hotel's prime time”
Reviews.Author: QT_Fanatic
Reviews.Content: We're on a Group Tour, so it's not going to be 5 Star luxury. Location is great, just one block back from George St and opposite Wynyard station. I'd reckon that most of the staff deserve to be working in bigger and better hotels, because they tried so hard. From Andrew who ran the porter team to all the breakfast crew and the staff in the Piano Bar. You all did a great job. But what do you do about a hotel that's past its prime. It has the small of old age left over from a time when people were allowed to smoke in rooms. Fittings are a little loose here and there, but for the price, it's OK. BTW, if you're in for breakfast and the watery scrambled eggs are not your style and the baked eggs have run out, just ask the staff for what you want. They will cook them to order, just for you. No problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, but dirty, unclean tired rooms.”
Reviews.Author: singlemumKent
Reviews.Content: I arrived and struggled up the stairs of the hotel with suitcases and a tired daughter the porter watched and laughed when my daughter stumbled. We were allocated our room quickly and directions given by a friendly helpful receptionist, the porter watched as we struggled to move our luggage to our room. When we arrived at our room it was dirty with mud on the carpet and a thick layer of dust on the dressing table. exhausted from our long flight we went to the beds. They were unclean with a delightful black pubic hair on one of the pillows and blood on the sheets. I am not sure the room had been cleaned and prepared for new guests but i was assured that it had. When we complained to the same receptionist she offered us another room which was no better and an excutive room for 40 dollars extra a night which was smaller and noisy due to building work taking place below so we kindly declined and chose to stay in our original room if they could clean and change the bed which they did but took 90 minutes, which must reflect how dirty it was!! This hotel is ideally situated for all the main attractions of sydney. The reception staff were extremely helpful, the foyer is clean and beautifully decorated. The porter and room staff were hopeless and the room disgusting. I would rate the location a 4 star but the rest would not rate as high as a youth Hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Drab, out dated & overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: hypermini
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights over New year 2010.Our booking was for a room with City views. After being allocated 2 drab dreary run down rooms, with views over blank walls, moving the luggage ourselves, we were finally offered a room over looking Wynyard station, through badly scratched windows, still equally drab, but could not be bothered to complain anymore or waste anymore of our time. During our stay in the room, the bed was not made up one night, the carpet was not vaccumed for the entire stay, neither was the mini bar replenished. This is certainly not a 4star Hotel. Bearing in mind we paid Â£450 room only for NYE alone, we were disgusted at the service we received & would not reccommend this Hotel to our worst enemies.

Reviews.Title: “The camera can lie”
Reviews.Author: phantomdublin
Reviews.Content: Despite fine pictures on the web this hotel is in bad need of a decent clean...kick marks on room doors,finger marks on inner doors,carpets that haven't been properly cleaned so that there are lines of white dust at carpet edges both in rooms and corridors.Suffering from jet-lag on our first night we stayed but moved out after second night especially as our daugter suffered a serious attack of food-poisoning which we suspect followed an evening meal of bar-food

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: electrocuter
Reviews.Content: We had booked a garden view room a couple of weeks in advance. Upon arrival we were told we got "upgraded" to an executive room. Our "upgraded" room was not only tiny but overlooked a dirty alley and some ugly buildings. I'm not sure what the difference between a standard and executive room is but this room could not have gotten any smaller and was a simple room with a simple bathroom. The location however was superb, right by the train station and walking distance to everything. The staff were lovely. If you're just looking for a bed to sleep on that is close to everything then i would recommend the menzies.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Reichtmann
Reviews.Content: Booked through secret hotels on Lastminute.com, what a surprise! Very happy with this hotel as it is so central, room was clean, a little dated but still comfortable and I wasn't paying huge amounts of money anyway...would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, but excellent service”
Reviews.Author: loldoctor619
Reviews.Content: Wanted a hotel central to the city and found this one. The service was great from the moment we entered. Our bags were delievered straight to our rooms by the staff. The hotel is old though, and the rooms are dated. We also found some things in our room did not work properly. The mini bar didn't open properly, and the sinks in the bathroom would often clog. The buffet breakfast in the morning was good, but didn't change. The concierge was very helpful. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Sydney in a nutshell”
Reviews.Author: Meagan_K
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is Sydney mentality personified - it's all about location, location, location. The other details, like rooms that have been renovated in the last 25 years or an air conditioning system that doesn't drip and drop during the night don't seem to figure in the hotel's equation. We booked two nights as a secret last minute deal on a booking site. The hallway leading to our room was rundown, with wallpaper peeling off and an inbuilt smell of cigarette smoke (although we were assured that it was a non-smoking floor). The room was small but adequate. Our TV didn't work so we rang reception and a handyman came up straight away, which was good. But he said the TV was busted and could at best only magnify reception so we could get some of the channels. I was not very happy with the solution but the point of our weekend was not to sit in the hotel watching TV so I left it. The airconditioning vent (on the wall right next to our bed) dripped and dropped the whole time and kept waking my husband up. I woke up too at some point because the room was so stuffy. I opened the window but it overlooked the aircon machines for the building and was loud and hot. So I cranked up the aircon, leading to more dripping and dropping and restless sleeping. I can say though that the cocktail bar was nice, with a good range of drinks and fair prices ($15 a pop). Overall though, we spent minimal time at the hotel because it felt so rundown. It wasn't the best hotel we stayed in but, yes, it is well located. I wouldn't go back though - I'd rather walk a little further and have a better hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but few restaurants around”
Reviews.Author: sincenyamities
Reviews.Content: On hotel location, it is clearly absolutely fantastic especially for those using public transportation : metro across the street (litterally), major bus hub across the street (also litterally), and easy walk (700m) to Circular Quay. Only drawback is that Wynyard is a business district, there aren't that many restaurants around compared to say the Rocks or Kings Cross. However, we can recommend Bar 333, which serves good cheap food. Hotel lobby and staff make you feel like in a 5 star hotel. There is a doorman opening the door for you, a concierge always happy to give advise and recommendations, and lots of seats and sofas where you can have drinks. Rooms are more standard for mid-range hotel. Beds are comfortable, rooms are quiet. Bathroom is dated, but fonctional. Service in the room was ok, not exceptional. We had to ask sometimes to get new towels (they were simply put back in place), and get the trash removed. Overall, we had a fantastic stay at the Menzies, and would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Check the price before you make a reservation- only stay here if the price is right!”
Reviews.Author: AdelaidianTraveller
Reviews.Content: Menzies has a great location in the center of Sydney, and it is located above the Wynyard underground railway station. If you're feeling energetic, you can walk to many of Sydney's leading city attractions from here. Also, it is a good location for business travellers who need to stay in the CBD. However, it is a very ordinary hotel. It is principally an accommodation facility, with small rooms. Also, some rooms are dated and "tired". If you decide to stay there, make sure: 1. Check the rate- what they quote you can vary dramatically! Whether you're looking for high quality or budget accommodation, there may be a better choice nearby- for example the Travelodge Wynyard just a short walk way. 2. Ask them to give you a refurbished room- and avoid one of the tired rooms! There is a certain inevitability about hotels like the Menzies- they rely on their large size Nd central location, and they do have a place in the market to provide basic accommodation and convenience. Just don't expect an exciting stay or any opulence! 2.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug6Kl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in front of Wynyard Station and many buses and taxis are parked in front of the hotel.Within walking distance to Opera House and other attractions. The family room is quite spacious eventhough there is not many furniture. Overall very pleasant stay. Concierge very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Classic but dated”
Reviews.Author: sleepyash
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and across the road from the subway (Wynyard stn) and bus stop. Nice lobby and has a relaxing feel to it. The rooms wouldve been great in its day, but is long overdue for a makeover. My only amusement is the bathroom facilties reminded you of a puzzle gone wrong. Firstly, a funny "light-switch-type" button to flush the toilet- god knows how the cleaners could ever give that a decent clean. The shower ceiling would suit a midget, if you were 6", you would be crouching down; and the bath tub has a plastic-feel to it - it didnt look very clean, but thats due to the polymer-type surface. Also beware when entering the bathroom of the 1 inch thick granite tiles as you can easily stub your toes. I was impressed with the room service and helpful concierge. Buffet breakfast was pretty good and a wide selection catering for all. I only stayed here as we were over for the work Xmas party during GFC year (but thats another story). One block over is the Amora Jamison, worth spending a few bucks more if its a special stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: millie1983_uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, unfortunately as it was a late booking we paid a rip-off price of 168GBP through ebookers.com for one night in a basic room. Location was very good as it is walking distance to the opera house and circular quay. Rooms were clean and staff were friendly and efficient. We were woken up at 5am by drunk youths shouting in the corrodor outside our room, they smashed a ceiling light and we had the night manager knocking on our door by mistake, but apart from that little bit of drama it was overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - rooms desperately in need of an update!”
Reviews.Author: KTJMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location. But the beds are hard, and I swear I was bitten by bed bugs - or something worse! The rooms are poor in quality - compared to other hotels in the area, this one needs an update. Also surcharge for using Amex!

Reviews.Title: “friendly, well run hotel, nice restaurant/bistro. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: hokanohito
Reviews.Content: stayed two nights over a relatively busy weekend in a standard room but could not fault the hotel, especially the service, and bistro/ restaurant. The staff were efficient, friendly, helpful and relaxed. The room was tasteful, easy to rest in this hotel. We did not have a view, save looking down on to the pool, but the bed was comfortable, the room was well kept (with tea/coffee) and the bathroom well equipped with amenities, plenty of towels, very nice bath! Nice pool downstairs although highly chlorinated, spa and steam room was good to use especially later in the evening/early morning. Was conveniently located and easy to walk to sights. Taxi from airport was $40. Would stay at the Menzies again.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated but not on the ball”
Reviews.Author: unclegeoff
Reviews.Content: The hotel id ideally situated being close to the harbour and opposit the Winyard rail & bus station. The rail station is huge, but all underground, with a shopping centre and entrances dotted around the area. The hotel appears to me to be resting on its laurels of past performance and is no better than than the average motel. A couple of points which irritated were the cost of the bits and bobs in the room bar. Why do they put such outrageous charges on these items which can be bought for a tenth of the price just outside the hotel. It turns a possible service into a dis-service. The dining room was so dark you could not read the menu. I had to take it to the Maitre D's desk to get under a light. It was also icy cold and could not be altered, or so I was told. Overall, its handily placed for sightseeing, but I wouldn't eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: grainte53
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Menzies for 2 nights for a social function at The Rocks. Room 733 was very spacious for a Sydney hotel, 2 x double beds were very comfortable, room very clean and quiet even though our room was very close to the 5 lifts - I don't think I heard any of the lifts at all. The hotel is old but well maintained. They should consider having a history of the hotel posted in the bar so you can bask in the dignitaries that may have stayed there. The Piano bar is a great spot for a pre dinner drink - they had a great piano player on the Sat night with Austrailan Idol competitors there as well - a bonus! Reception was very quick to deal with check in and check out - our friends who arrived on Sat morning were given a complimentary drink voucher as their room was not ready - not bad for a 9.00am check in! Car park was a little hard to find but with our Accor membership the day rate for parking went from $65/day to $26 - a bargain for Sydney. Great location 10 minutes walk from Circular Quay and The Rocks - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Boulder-USA
Reviews.Content: Located across the street from a Metro station and a short walk from the Rocks, this hotel was exactly what we wanted. The staff were helpful, the rooms clean (even if a bit small). With a reservation made a month in advance, we felt the rate was very good, probably as good as we could have obtained in this area of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central location. helpful, congenial staff.”
Reviews.Author: KristiKN
Reviews.Content: This location can not be beat.It is a short walk to Sydney Harbor Ferries, The Rocks district, the botanical gardens, shopping and restaurants. The train station is right across the street, if you need to venture farther, It also makes the hotel easy to find. The rooms were large, though lacked in good light for makeup. My roomie thought the bed was less than perfect. I slept well as the room was quiet and air conditioner worked well. The pool was indoors and comfortable. Nice on the hot day we used it. The gym was clean and uncrowded. The internet srevice, average and 8 bucks an hour. I' m not sure of the price as we booked as part of a tour. The lobby is well appointed and comfortable, spacious and nice to sit in. The only negatives are the cabbies smoke right outside the front door and it stinks up the otherwise luxurious area. The cocktails are quite expensive. 20 semolialns for a martini.

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience”
Reviews.Author: vball_canuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Menzies for 6 nights and found the hotel to be perfectly fine. The rooms are small (probably due to the era that it was built), but comfortable and perfectly adequate. The bed was very comfortable (new mattress) and the room was clean and cleaned well daily. We were accomodated with an early morning arrival after a long international flight - out first room assignment was a room that was not serviced, but that was fixed and hey, mistakes happen in life. Wireless Internet in your room was $13.95 for 2 hours - not the outrageousness that others have misquoted - and the signal was good. The hotel location is awesomely central. The Wynyard station is across the street and there are plenty of cheap breakfast places in the station. Stop worrying. Stay at the Menzies.

Reviews.Title: “Central (Business) District”
Reviews.Author: Out_of_valley
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is located in the middle of the central business district, directly across the street from a rail station (which has many shops, including a supermarket, in it). The hotel is within easy walking distance of the Rocks (oldest part of Sydney), Circular Quay and Darling Harbor. A place to get information on buses is in the entrance to the station. Also across the street is Carrington Park, which is small but pleasant. The lobby is lovely, but the room looked onto an interior courtyard, which made it a bit gloomy. But the staff was very helpful, and it has a decent gym, for those who want to work out. Although there are many, many places to have a cheap lunch, the business district shuts down at night and it is hard to find a place nearby for a casual dinner. There is a good Indian place in the Rocks and a Japanese place on York Street; ask the concierge for details and other suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Menzies”
Reviews.Author: BarbroK
Reviews.Content: Very good location, walking distance to both harbours with Aquarium and Opera house. Train station just on the other side on the street, free gym and nice rooms. Expensive to eat at hotel, but breakfast in the diner across the street was superb, so we we're happy.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some detailed cleaning”
Reviews.Author: tootyfancy
Reviews.Content: I wasn't actually disappointed, because I had read the reviews beforehand, but it was far dirtier than I anticipated. Our room was luckily, a deal through an agent. Positives: Staff, esp. the concierge were excellent all around. Even housekeeping was friendly. Location was great- had brekky in the train station almost ever morning. There's also a grocery store on the 2nd level. A bottle shop and convenience store a couple feet away. Negatives: Housekeeping; halls were filthy and rooms were dirty. No vacuum, sweeper service, or toilet and sink cleaning during our stay. The glassware wasn't actually replaced when dirtied. Just rinsed and wiped. The bed was on rollers and would roll away from the wall when I got into it. There was quite a bit of dirt buildup behind the bed and the nightstand that became obvious when my bed moved. Room tv-the speakers were blown and had quite a bit of feedback with the volume off. Pool-no outlet for gaseous chlorine. The smell was extremely strong in the hall on the way to the elevator. Luckily we made light of it and had a few laughs with the other guests. Everyone was thinking the same thing.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, but great location”
Reviews.Author: Kaycelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our Sydney portion of our honeymoon. Without even mentioning to the front desk when we checked in that it was our honeymoon (our travel agency may have contacted them), they gave us a free upgrade to a nicer room with a garden view. We also received a bottle of champagne when we got back to our room later that day with a handwritten note from one of the hotel managers. My husband and I don't care too much for fancy hotel rooms as long as the room is clean and comfortable and the location is good. The Menzies definitely met those criteria. Because it's an older hotel, some of the decor is outdated, but if you're not spending much time in the hotel it's perfectly fine. It's about a 10-20 minute walk to most Sydney attractions, which makes any negatives seem pretty minor (and there weren't many at all). Our reservation also included the buffet breakfast, which was excellent. I would definitely stay here again if we ever visit Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Extremely helpful and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: livindownunder
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is in walking distance to the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, The Rocks, Chinatown and the Fish Market. We took a bus to Bondi Beach which was easy to find and only a 30 minute ride. The hotel staff was absolutely incredible! Extremely helpful and the Concierge went above and beyond any that we have encountered before. We felt they had first class service in the reception, concierge and housekeeping. The low price we paid for 2 rooms left us rather skeptical but the hotel far exceeded anything we expected. Our room was very roomy, not outdated or run down. We had a buffet breakfast included, there was a large variety of hot foods, cereals, breads and muffins as well as fruit and yogurt. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Location and Style”
Reviews.Author: sufr54
Reviews.Content: The Menzies, Sydney by sufr54, 4 more photosWe already had a hotel in Sydney, but it was to far from all of the main attractions, with a little research we found the Menzies Hotel on Carrington St. What a stroke of luck for us. A beautiful hotel in the old Grand Style with marble floors, rich deep hard woods everywhere and hanging chandeliers. Not that this makes a hotel, but in this case it did, it just had that Grand warm feeling and you were treated that way also. We had a wonderful room, overlooking a small park, the food was good and the staff were exceptional. The location was fantastic for us. We were right where we wanted to be: 1 block from George St., 3 block to Circular Quay, 6 blocks to the Opera house and the Botanical Gardens, 5 blocks to Darling Harbor, 4 blocks to the Rocks and the Sydney Bridge. Another great shopping location was just up the street at the Queen Victoria Building ( http://www.sydney.com.au/qvb.htm ). Out the front entrance was an entrance to the Wynyard subway station which gave us access to all of Sydney. The shopping complex, underground, at the Wynyard was fantastic. http://www.sydneymenzieshotel.com.au/

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: aussiemumdad2kids
Reviews.Content: The location of the Menzies is hard to beat - 1 block from George St & across the road from Wynyard station (within the shops in the station is a Coles supermarket - very handy). We enjoyed our stay with the positives being 10 minute walk from Circular Quay, The Rocks & the Opera House. Easy to catch the ferries over to Darling Harbour from Circular Quay also. Positives for this hotel would be housekeeping, room service (only ordered sweets & they were very nice), internet room, pool & taxis always out the front. Whilst the negatives are minimal, the beds are really ordinary - very old I think. Uncomfortable & didn't encourage restful sleep & whilst we didn't have breakfast so can't comment on the food - the price was enough to keep us away.... If you are after a clean, basic room in a great location in Sydney I would recommend the Menzies. If you are used to or expect great views and sleep number beds I'd suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “staff did not care”
Reviews.Author: NzSass
Reviews.Content: This was to be a fun filled holiday for me but it turned into a nightmare at the maenzies Hotel. First I rang to confirm my booking a week before and they did not have but charged me for a room in April so quite confused rang management and left messages and they did not reply so had to ring everyday until I got help from the finance person who was great but her only and found that the hotel had made a booking mistake so offered me my booking again and tried to say it was one free night which it was not as my credit card says I paid again for two. My room had a terrible smell and bathroom unclean to make it worse the dust was thick on all surfaces so I was glad I had my own drinking cup with me because their glasses were dirty and the area around it. Went down stairs to ask for another room and was told booked out which it was not and I had to have my room or I could leave. leave and go where at 5pm at night so I went back to my room. That night was kept awake by a party in the room next door 702 and though I asked them to quiten down alittle the languge I recieved back only made them go louder and my room was rocking. I went to reception four times that night and they did nothing except till me it was Friday night and I should expect this. left early in the morning for a day out and was told thats the one that moaned about the party as I walked out so I made sure i stayed out the whole day as i was nervous to go back. That night the door would not open with the card so up and down the lifts i went to try and make it work again the staff were very aggressive in nature and then told me it was my fault by this time I felt a victim and all I wanted was a shower after a long and happy day out. This is not the end though the party came back that night and even louder than before and again no help from the staff who even laughed at me this time. Four in the moring is no laughing matter. I checked out next day very early and was made fun of by the staff and told i was an old nana and to get a life. I am 42 and well travelled and have never experienced anything quite like this. Only good thing it is central however as a tourism and law teacher have told my students and friends never to go there. Pity as it was so promising. thanks Tonia NZ

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but very average service”
Reviews.Author: MissChoco
Reviews.Content: Good location, Wynyard train station is just across the road. Quite big space room. but very average service, or even poor for the housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Warning of hotel management lacking”
Reviews.Author: sony_cybershot
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is to be getting a bit long in the tooth city hotel in the center of Sydney. From that formerly 5* hotel became a passage hotel for arriving and/or leaving Australia tourists. Despite before-paid Late checks out were removed from the Housekeeping management on the departure day after the standard departure time during our absence luggage items â€žfor securityâ€œ from the hotel room. The return of the luggage took place neutrally. 1 hour later with the check was tried out also still to place 2 AUS$ for local telephone calls in calculation showed the indifferentism opposite the guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,rooms in desperate need for an update.”
Reviews.Author: charlottev
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the menzies as I had booked a "secret hotel" on last minute. The location of this hotel is great, right across the road from wynard station, close to the the harbour and in walking distance to QVB, pitt street and etc. The rooms are very outdated, a very old style air conditioning system that was not working properly for us. The bed was very uncomfortable, the mattress was way too soft, possibly a very old one! Both had a terrible sleep, which was much needed as we were heading overseas the next day. I would only recommend this hotel because of its location and also the price we paid was quite reasonable for sydney. I definitely think this hotel needs a freshen up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, just outside of railway station in CBD”
Reviews.Author: vivekgupt
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal booking through lastminute.com. Checkin process was amazingly quick, room was comparitively spacious, clean and well kept. Can expect a location better than this. Just 1 minute to get to the underground rail station in Sydney CBD. Walking distances to George Street

Reviews.Title: “good location , great deal”
Reviews.Author: innocenteyes68
Reviews.Content: nice hotel lovely staff. no balconies just a room with bed and bathroom. bathtub in bathroom could do with a clean up from the mould on some tiles. older style 4 star hotel but nice for short stays and for the price paid on expedia.com for 3 nites cant complain.

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies is a great base for a family travelling with teenagers and young children.”
Reviews.Author: Possumtasmania
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Sydney and we stayed at The Menzies for 4 nights. It is very conveniently located opposite Wynyard station and all the attractions are within easy walking distance. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We didn't eat at the hotel as the prices were very expensive, especially the full breakfast and there were 6 of us.... We would definitely stay here again though as it is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Heritage, few areas to improve”
Reviews.Author: ozcookie1
Reviews.Content: Drove to the hotel and had trouble finding the parking which was poorly marked. In the end we double parked outside the hotel and went inside to ask. It's around the corner. There is quite a hike from the carpark to the foyer so be warned. We arrived at 1.30pm and were told to come back at 2pm as that was the check-in time. Foyer was lovely with plenty of cosy chairs and couches so we waited there. We had recieved an excellent deal with the accor advantage plus and had a standard room which was in the annexe part of the hotel and faced onto an internal view of other rooms. The teenager thought it highly amusing. Room was quite comfy if a little dated but was certainly spotless and the beds comfortable. The teenager 'hotwired' the flat screen TV within 30 seconds and was playing his 'playstation' on the TV which kept him amused. Pool, spa and sauna were good and we used these a few times in our 2 night stay. Breakfast was as expected for a 4 star hotel but nothing special. Having stayed in 4 Novotels across Asia and Aus in last 6 months I can say this ranked at the bottom. Not due to the food but I'll echo previous comments that the breakfast room felt like a cafeteria and had very little atmosphere. It's completely at odds with the historic nature of the hotel. That being said we both enjoyed breakfasts each day. Can't beat the location and we met several businessmen who had been coming here for over 40 years and would never stay anywhere else. But the hotel is obviously very busy and in need of redecorating. Enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Sydney trip would have been perfect.......”
Reviews.Author: trekkingyogi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Menzies for three nights as part of vacation package from Gate 1 Travel for our first year wedding anniversary. The Menzies was actually an upgrade from the hotel included in the regular package. But really it wasnâ€™t much of an upgrade and it was a big disappointment. Definitely not 4 star! Menzies looked very sad and dated. It definitely look much better and newer in the website. We got stuck on the elevator on our very first ride. The elevator cars badly need an update. After being stuck, I felt scared everytime I stepped into it. Stepping into the hallway and room felt like stepping back in my parentsâ€™ time. We stayed in the executive level on the 12th floor. If they called that executive level, I wonder how the condition of the regular floors were like. Management claim Menzies to be a historic hotel.
