Some historic hotels I know have nice distinctive atmosphere, but not Menzies. It has no character at all. It doesnâ€™t seem like the management plan to upgrade any day now. Helloâ€¦â€¦.. The breakfast room is like a cafeteria with a lousy buffet which is exactly the same day after day. Everytime I was in the breakfast room, I felt I was staying in the motor lodge. We arrived very early in the morning on our first day. We were very hungry when we arrived at the hotel and decided to have the buffet breakfast there. It was not included in the package and we definitely thought that it wouldnâ€™t cost much. But holy cow, when we checked out we found that that lousy breakfast cost us $31 each!!! What a rip off. I didnâ€™t pay that much at a Four Season Hotel for a breakfast. We loved Sydney. It was very spectacular. But we were not happy everytime we had to go back to our hotel. If our stay was not prepaid, we would definitely move to a different hotel. The plus for Menzies is its good location and the friendliness of its bellboy/concierge. But then everyone in Sydney were very friendly and there were lot of better hotels in good location. If not for this hotel, our stay in Sydney would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “NOT 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayKickers
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing!! This is definitely NOT a 4 star hotel â€“ not the room we were assigned to anyway!! The swimming pool and spa room is very run down and in desperate need of an upgrade. Looks like the foyer/lobby is the only part of the hotel that has been â€œdone upâ€�. The fixtures & TV in our room were old (thought most 4 star hotels would have flat screen these days), the lighting in our room was poor, there wasnâ€™t even a hand towel rail in the bathroom. The worst part about our room was the noise - we could hear the plumbing of our entire floor each time someone in another room flushed a toilet or turned on a tap or shower â€“ very frustrating at early hours of the morning being woken up by this!! Also full breakfast was $35 â€“ the most expensive I have ever come across in a hotel!! The only good thing I can say about this hotel is its location. We stayed in 2 other 4 star hotels during this holiday and both were far better than the Menzies. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: steada
Reviews.Content: I came to like the Menzies even with its cleanliness and bed comfort issues, because it was immediately across from the Wynyard train station which also contained a grocery store and food shops. Since I was interested in travel in the Sydney area, the hotel gave me easy access to all modes of public transportation (ferry, train and bus) in Sydney. In addition, it was within walking distance of many major attractions and shopping. There is a separate charge for internet, but it can be done in two hour blocks that last for 120 minutes over as many days as you stay in the hotel. If you compose emails offline and then connect to send the emails, you will use very little time. Of all the hotels that I stayed at in Australia, it was the best arrangement and I had the least problems with transmission. At the right price, I would stay at the Menzies again, but I would not stay there if I was traveling with my spouse.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: PaprikaSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in a standard room, spacious enough to welcome 2 adults and 2 children. There is an iron, a minibar, a hairdryer, TV screen is big enough and enough bath towels for all of us. The check-in / out was fast, staff very pleasant at the reception. The hotel is very well situated, hardly 10 minutes to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour. My only disappointment was the restaurant where my daughter got her beefsteak overcooked, it was even impossible to cut it; after we complained the waitress brought us another one very good. I would recommend this hotel and stay there if I should come back to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: WellFunkMe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Tues-Fri last week for work, lovely hotel in a perfect location - right opposite Wynard station. I received a welcome card and bottle of wine from Management and a complimentary upgrade... The service was excellent, and surprisingly - no queues when checking out at 9am on Friday morning (my pet peeve!!) The only thing - you cant get on the net and charge to the room, the hotel has a 3rd party provider- you must use your credit card

Reviews.Title: “Extremly Impressed”
Reviews.Author: sassyangel1973
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Menzies to holiday with my three children. I arrived early and went straight to my room. It was a spacious room with two doubles beds, I can't complain about the service as it was prompt, when the front desk knew there wasn't enough towels they were quickly delivered. I didn't have any problems with my television. Everything I feel was up to standard or higher. I will be recommending The Menzies to everyone.The concierges of the Menzies couldn't have done more to help my stay well done Darryn and Phillip. This hotel is wonderfully central to everything

Reviews.Title: “Menzies hotel sydney”
Reviews.Author: melbmovergroover
Reviews.Content: Sydney. The mezies Hotel We spent 2 nights here on a 'secrets' deal. Being so cheap we were not sure what to expect. The location is amazing. Our room was large, clean and comfortable. However, the thing the impressed us the most was the helpful staff. From the concierge looking up movies and restaurants, to housekeeping tracking down a lost parking ticket, the staff went out of their way to help. My only critism would be from an environmental aspect; no dual flush loo's or water saving shower heads.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: sigash
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with our stay at the Menzies. The location is perfect, on check-in the staff were so helpful and friendly, all staff we dealt with were just wonderful. The beds were very comfortable, good size room and it was really quiet. The housekeeping was spot on, the breakfast wasn't fantastic but very adequate. I would stay there again for sure and certainly recommend to others. Thanks Menzies for a lovely stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, like hotels used to be”
Reviews.Author: oldmikeNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Got the room at a special price of only A$79 for the night. At this price only expected the cheapest room at the hotel and this is what I probably got but it was fine. The room allocated was in the north wing with no view but was large with two beds and it was comfortable. The room has everything that I needed for the stay.The staff at reception are friendly and helpful and are an asset to Menzies. The Lobby of Menzies is very grand and reminds me of hotels in Europe. I did not use the restuarant as there is plenty of food courts in the area. The location by Wynyard railway station makes travelling around easy. Just a note for anyone booking Menzies it is an older hotel and the decor is getting dated but it is a good comfortable option for a central Sydney hotel that is often available for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Menzies”
Reviews.Author: AzCowboyJake
Reviews.Content: You know, you'd think with as many reviews as the General Manager, Michael Smith, has responded to on this sight, he might think about making a few changes in his establishment. Evidently, that hasn't sunk in with him, however, since my experience at The Menzies was similar to others who've written here. We just got back from Australia yesterday. We spent 5 nights at the Menzies (room 623). The internet charge others have mentioned here is still in place. They wanted $30 per day to hook up with their wireless. Are they insane???? Who in their right mind would pay such a exorbitant rate. For $8 per hour you can use their computers (they have four available), but they don't offer a printer of any kind. When it came time to print our boarding passes for the flight home, we were out of luck. We had 2 adults staying in the room. The Menzies afforded us 1 water glass, 1 wash cloth and 2 bath towels for the two of us! On our second day there we spoke with the housekeeper and asked that the room be set up for two people. She assured us it would be taken care of. Not so, however. Toward the end of our stay, she simply didn't leave any wash cloths at all. We were forced to use the bath mat as a hand towel. Can you imagine? The coffee/tea bar was a wonderful convenience. The Menzies provided two cups and saucers and a variety of tea and coffee. The only problem was that the cups and saucers were never replaced with new sterilized ones. The housekeeper simply rinsed the cups out in the bathroom each day and set them back on the coffee bar. That's just gross! Makes me wonder if she rinsed them out the day we left and placed them on the coffee bar for the next guest. Our room included breakfast each day. The first day we were delighted with the offering. By the second day, however, we realized it was exactly the same as the day before. By the third day, you can imagine, breakfast was downright boring. Each day they served watery scrambled eggs, tasteless sausages, two types of bacon, soggy potatoes and sauteed mushrooms with spinach. Everyday it was exactly the same. The selection of sweet breads was limited. Fresh fruit consisted of canned pineapple chunks, diced melon and watermelon wedges. The granola was some kind of bran flakes with raisins tossed in. We never saw a pastry all week. It certainly wouldn't have taken much creativity on the part of the kitchen to vary the breakfast offerings, but like in other areas of this hotel, they just don't seem to be interested in "going the extra mile" for their guests. There were two phones in the room, but only the one on the desk worked. The other was just the alarm clock. Our TV set was horrible the first day and the remote didn't work either. After complaining, they eventually replaced the old dinosaur set with a flat screen. There is no safe in the room for your valuables, so protect your passports while you are in the Menzies. This hotel "recycles" their room keys (card type), but reuses them so often that they don't work since the magnetic strips are all scratched. We turned our keys in after the second day and had them replaced. The woman at the front desk told me to protect the card so it wouldn't get scratched. Can you imagine someone saying that to a guest? With the Sheraton, Hilton and Four Seasons in the immediate area, I will definitely opt for one of them on my next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with The Menzies!”
Reviews.Author: barrattt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Menzies for 2 nights on a roadtrip going to Qld. Thought we'd have a little stopover in Sydney for a couple of days and wanted somewhere central to stay. Found an online special for $99 a night for a family of 4 - BARGAIN! Parking cost $32 a night but pretty standard in central Sydney. We found our room to be clean, comfortable, well maintained, quiet. Fantastic location - so very central. Would recommend the Menzies for a good value stay for anyone visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: nursewebb
Reviews.Content: Opposite train station and many buses at the door step. Comfortable bed in mediocre size room overlooking Wynard Park. 99 dollar rate thru travelzoo.com.au. Great for the price. Only one facecloth in our room too, too funny I thought that was accidental. All necessaries provided.... if it was a room in NYC it would be luxury.... but I havent stayed in any other hotels in Sydney CBD so cant compare. Suited our purpose of a two night stay perfectly. Starbucks across the park, Coles supermarket and McDonalds plus many many places to shop and eat in the train station itself. 7 Eleven two doors down. You really cant fault the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that is about it”
Reviews.Author: Pogi1994
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the common areas such as the lobby and upstairs lounge were nice. Our room on the 11th floor was adequate but nothing special. Other reviews have said that housekeeping is stingy with towels and washcloths; that was our experiance was well. One thing that I really had a problem with was the wireless internet service. First, the prices are ridiculous. $30 for one day of access. You have the option to buy a number of hours of access that you may use over the course of your stay; however, 10 hours of access will cost you $66! Now, it gets even better. For this price you would expect to be able to work and access email from your room. Maybe, maybe not. The higher your floor, the less signal strength you have. On the 11th floor, signal strength was very low and often dropped completely. Apparently, up on the 14th floor there is no coverage at all. As I already said, for the price they charge I should be able to work anywhere in the hotel without fear of being dropped. The restaurant and bar are very overpriced. However, there are plenty of better options very near by. All in all, to me "the menzies experiance" means high prices for not much in return. There are lots and lots of other hotels in the area that I suspect offer better service.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location, Uneven Performance”
Reviews.Author: BearX220
Reviews.Content: My son and I had booked in at the Sydney Harbour Marriott, but a killer Expedia rate for The Menzies that averaged out to US$75 / night for four nights made us change plans. First impressions were excellent. The bellman spotted us emerging from Wynyard Station with our bags, directly across Carrington Street from the hotel, and darted across the road to help us in. The lobby was large, comfortable, and opulent, with panelling and leather sofas everywhere. Check-in was speedy and friendly. That was the peak of the Menzies experience. Our third-floor room with two double beds was large but furnished with tired, dinged fixtures. No bureau drawers, no phone book, fridge empty (although hotel literature makes reference to "your minibar"). Corded phone by the bed not hooked up (although a second desk phone worked). Pathetic little TV, a 13" flat screen mounted too far from the beds for viewing; volume limited to three choices, mute, too loud, and earsplitting, and reception was poor. The view from the room was non-existent, looking out onto a "light court" (air shaft) that put one in mind of the correctional system. Be aware that if you are given a room in the Menzies' North Wing you have a 50% chance of ending up admiring the "light court." And this after I had written in advance asking for a room with a view -- it was perhaps punishment for booking an inexpensive Expedia rate. Windows could not be opened. Room and corridor decor say 1980s throughout. HVAC worked very well. Housekeeping was erratic and oddly stingy. We were allocated one facecloth for a room capable of sleeping four; when I left a note asking for a second, the maid replied with a note of her own saying I'd have to ring the housekeeping manager and make a special request. Dirty glasses were left in place for days. Room service continental breakfast is $25, but you can nip across the street to the bakery in the foyer of the Wynyard railway station and get delicious fresh-made croissant and muffins for $1.50 apiece. Lobby bar closed inexplicably at 530pm on Saturday afternoon, just when one wants a drink. Clientele swarming the lobby was mainly backpackers and teenagers, mostly American, on coordinated youth tours, plus some airline crews on layover; not many business travelers or older people about, suggesting that The Menzies is marketing heavily to the discount trade. Checkout took about 30 minutes owing to long lines and a clerk shortage. Cannot top the location with the train across Carrington Street and The Rocks, GPO, Pitt Street shopping and Darling Harbour all less than 10 minutes away. But one can spend a little more for a somewhat nicer, more consistent service experience, and my son and I agree that's what we'll do next time. I've seen enough of the "light court."

Reviews.Title: “Great value - definately would consider staying here again”
Reviews.Author: bileneblu
Reviews.Content: I got a really great deal for this hotel for $79 per night. So I planned a trip for the July school holidays with my family. I booked into a standard room which comprised of 2 double beds and 2 single beds overlooking Wynyard Park. The room was very spacious and is just opposite Wynyard station which was really convinient for us as we took public transport alot. What made the stay very pleasant was the friendly staff who really made an effort to be hospitable and helpful. Overall a really good weekend. A+ hotel.

Reviews.Title: “grand”
Reviews.Author: loloMelbourne
Reviews.Content: this was not the first time we stayed at the menzies, the main reason we stay, a feeling of warmth. our flight was early and they had no troubles checking us in,ANDREW is simply wonderful and makes you feel like you have to tell him your live story his manner is something you just cannot fualt, he treats you like a member of the family and is interested in what you have planned for the day with a tip of interest, for us it was raspberry fudge from the blue mountains ( we didnt find the store but we looked) we had a wonderful stay and great time with many laughs thanks see you next year lois and jenny

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience”
Reviews.Author: scottino84
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on lastminute as one of their top secret hotels and got a great deal at 99 AUD. The location is great, facing a small park and walking distance to the whole CBD and the rocks, etc. I arrived at about 9:00am and they had a room ready for me. The room was well furnished and comfortable. I used the fitness centre, pool and hot tub. All was clean and well maintained. The concierge took special attention to greet everyone as they entered and to recognize guests and acknowledge them when they returned. This was a nice touch. He was also very helpful and let me an umbrella to go to the opera. If I ever had to leave the CBD the train and metro was right across the street. Overall a very nice hotel that pays attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rymnol
Reviews.Content: We got there 8:00 AM and if weren't picky to have a non-smoking room, the room would have been ready right away, however we didn't have to wait long for them to check us in after a couple of hours breakfast at starbucks down the corner, also 7 Eleven is next door, Staffs are friendly and helpful. Room is quiet small with no dresser to unpacked your belonging, the bed is too soft that you feel the spring, room is dark can't see your make-up even at the bathroom, and there were only few programs on tv, i know we aren't there for the room. ok on the bright side, we were surprised there was a voltage converter on our bed the following day we got back to our room. location is the best, train station is just across the hotel, we bought day tripper fare ($17AUD) which could be use on train, bus and ferries, so do plan your day (don't forget child fare if you have children below 16) circular quay, the rock, bridge climb, chinatown, darling harbour, and shoppings all are within walking distance. tip: buy drinks and store it in room refrigerator, lindt's is just a few block way,,,,yummy, oh yeah foreign exchange is inside wespac bank and American Express counter charge "no fee" which you can get coupon from the visit Sydney book upon arrival at the airport, and the bank is just a corner away. Those restaurants on the Rock offer buy one main entree second is free, before 6:00 PM, Good food and great deal. Don't forget to grab Visit Sydney book at the airport as you walked out from the plane, there are a lot of coupons inside that book. If you travel alone take train to the hotel or airport bus which cost $12 AUD, but if you are in a company of 3 or more taxi would have been more economical. There are cafe shops inside the train station or walked down few blocks along George Street there are food court on week days. Overall this hotel is a Two Thumbs Up! Would stay here again if i come back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel very friendly and helpfull staff great location”
Reviews.Author: Eskiee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Menzies for 2 nights while I was in Sydney. The hotel was was in an excellent location. My flight from Canada was early and they gave me a room straight away. Everyone was very helpfull in helping me get around Sydney. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. A very big thank-you to all Staff at the Menzies you Rock !!!!!!!!!!!!!! Eskiee (Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JustMe54321
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. We liked the central location and the very nice lobby. The staff were friendly and helpful. It was great value for money because we were able to book it at a special price of AUD 79 per night. The room wasn't as nice as we had expected though - for a four star hotel, weI feel that renovation is needed. Air conditioning didn't work in our room. Overall it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Divij
Reviews.Content: good hotel rite in the heart of the city and very cloase to the darling harbour

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm was expecting more”
Reviews.Author: brookebowrey
Reviews.Content: The reception and restaurant areas are absolutely stunning, i wish it carried on into the rooms.. We stayed in an Executive King Room and I would have expected something alot nicer than what we got.. I mean it was ok but thought it would be alot nicer. We ordered Nachos room service and it was yum! We went to the restaurant, sat down, was finally brought the menu, to find out we didn't like the sound of anything, so had to walk out. Needed a menu to view before being seated! Remember to get your parking voucher upon check out. We waited in line to pay for our parking to find out we had to go back up to reception and ask them for the voucher to get few dollars off. The person at reception should have asked if we used the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great place...”
Reviews.Author: aneshabib
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the 4 nights stay in Menzies. Everything was very well-organised, and since i emailed them b4 that i wld be checking in early, my check-in, when i arrived, was done in less then 10mins. I had no problems with the room and room service was excellent. The location was just excellent, near all public transport and safe to walk ard at night. Thank you for making my stay for comfortable and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value, clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: dandylionlady
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 5 nights at the Menzies first week of May 09 and could not fault it. Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable with all the usual amenities. The staff were friendly and helpful and the location was great. The indoor pool and spa were a much appreciated bonus at the end of a long day of sight seeing and walking. No problems with lifts, rooms were normal size , plasma tv and air conditioning worked well and everything we needed was supplied. Really good value and we would certainly stay there again. CL, Perth, WA

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dalton1skiing
Reviews.Content: Good points: -Central city location, right across the road from Wynyard train station -Easy location to walk or get transport to many of Sydney's sights including opera house, harbour bridge etc -Can park at secure parking underneath hotel for $25 per night (cheaper than usual rate) -Large, clean lobby -Room included large, comfortable bed, tea/coffee facilities, small fridge, mini-bar (couldnt find any price list), small bath, hairdryer, iron & ironing board, small flat screen TV & desk Bad Points: -Long wait at reception to check-in & check-out -Room was run-down and needed a good clean -Wallpaper peeling off, cracks in walls, light switch partly off, mould in bath & around bathroom, dust blocking lights & exhaust fan in bathroom -Couldnt open any windows so bathroom remained steamed up as exhaust fan not working. Very difficult to do make-up in steamed up mirror -Despite bed being very large & comfy, it was actually 2 mattresses on large base, therefore could feel join in the middle -TV was very small and difficult to see detail from the bed -Only 1x small bath towel each, a tiny bathmat towel & 1 face cloth between 2! -Despite being on 9th floor, view was looking into other tall buildings and roofs -Expensive room service. After 11pm, very limited menu of 5 things. Soup of day $11, lasagne $20, ham/cheese sandwich $15.50, lamb korma $29 & cheese board $18.50 We got a $99 deal via lastminute in their secret hotels. I wouldn't pay any more for it. Maybe they gave us their worst room as we paid such a small rate, not sure. For the location, and a basic hotel room, it would be fine for a night or 2 & certainly better and quieter than a pub type hotel. Not the usual standard for 4 star though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: PeterM3039
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel in the heart of Sydney`s business district, so don`t expect spectacular views from your bedroom window. It was a reasonably sized bedroom, with a good quality bed, small bathroom but adequate, and very clean. There were no drawers in the room but they were soon provided. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. What this hotel had in our opinion was one of the best locations in Sydney, ten minutes walk to Central Quay for all the ferries and the Opera House, five minutes walk to Darling Harbour for all the restaurants and harbour attractions and less than five minutes from the main shopping centre

Reviews.Title: “I NIGHTMARE! PROBLEMS! PROBLEMS! PROBLEMS!”
Reviews.Author: kellecos
Reviews.Content: 1st room was dirty - bathroom filthy behind the door, filthy mirror, mold around the bathtub and cracked or chipped tiles are the very small bath - I am an average size woman and it was too tight! 1 face cloth for a room for 2 people and bathmat the size of a large hankie. The beds were poorly made - EVERYTHING is tucked in so that when you pull the sheet back everything comes away. Very poor lighting. I went down to request a room change and was told that that was the room I had paid for! (I prepaid 6 nights at $140/night online) If I had seen the room I would never have stayed. Swimming pool has a scum stain around the rim. Fitness facilities tired and grimy. Finally 24 hours later, I begged a room change after tracking down the Assistant Manager after 35 minutes and 3 calls to the hotel from an outside line and dealing with the automated telephone system, which then diverted to the assistant manager's mobile phone. I requested that the details of the room change NOT be mentioned to my 21 y.o. autistic son - and just to present him with the key and the new room details. He ignored my request and this caused untold discomfort to my son. Room service is hopeless! A minimum of 30 minutes delay. I requested extra towels at 9.30pm and checked with hotel operator 40 minutes because housekeeping weren't answering the phone, and was told that housekeeping had gone home before bringing me the towels. I wanted to run a bath - the plug was too small. Another 40 minute wait for housekeeping/room service. More mold. Lots more mold. By now it's very late. The TVs are very small and cannot be seen from the bed. you have to STAND in front of them. Housekeeping told me there was no clothes brush! I insisted that the concierge send someone across the road to Coles and buy one - after all it is supposed to be a 4 star hotel ... Yesterday the room clean was badly done - again. the beds were pulled up but the floor was not vacuumed, nor were the surfaces wiped. Sticky hot chocolate was still on the desk as was the cup from the night before. The mirrors in the room are still filthy. I HATE THE PLACE. I WASTED A FORTUNE ON IT! I wish i never stayed there! It is dreadful! The level of incompetence is incomprehensible. I don't know how they got 4 stars! Not even the location can make up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: bellgra
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Menzies for 2 nights for a conference at the hotel. This hotel is average, there is nothing exceptional about it apart from the location. My room was clean, though small and dated, doubt much has been changed in it since the early 90's, apart from the TV. If you can get this place for less than $140 Australian a night it might be worth it. There are however better value for money places to stay in Sydney. The location is pretty much in the middle of everything, right next to bus and trains and about a five minute walk to circular quay and the shops on George and Pitt St. A couple of tips, the coffee across the road at the entry to Wynyard station, think the cafe was called the Frisky Goat, well worth it. Coffee was excellent (genovese beans - very good), and some lovely fresh food. There is a cool bar on the corner of Carrington and Wynyard St, it's a little expensive but pretty hip (televisions in the hand basin of the womens toilet hip). Overall an average hotel, but if you can get it for a good price, there are much worse places to stay. By the way, the conference was run well by the hotel, and had no problems with the catering or rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient with good service”
Reviews.Author: dantheman_nz
Reviews.Content: Location is very good, almost slap bang in the middle between Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. A few steps away from George St where there is a free CBD shuttle that will ferry people around the CBD. It's also across the street from Wynyard station which is serviced by a train to/from the airport. Very handy. Got very good service and information from the concierge's team, a very high mark to them. We got in Sydney early and got a room (at 8am), that's good of them, and got a complimentary late check-out at noon. We got a corner room which was bigger than the average rooms. The hotel needs some renovation to update its property, the hallway and the room looks and feels old and dated. The room didn't have a safe, and not everything was replaced after the room was serviced. The lobby is very grand though.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and ambience”
Reviews.Author: sri67
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is so conveniently located just outside Wynyard station in the CBD of Sydney. The reception is so royal and they treat you as a king. I loved the shops, the gym, the covered pool, and the spa. Their complimentary continental breakfast is so healthy and filling. I loved the view of the park from my room. I would love to go back to this hotel in my very next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Decent quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the ANZAC weekend in a King room. I booked through a website where you can get "secret hotel deals"... you don't know where your staying until paid. So I was a little worried. But in the end it was perfect for me as I had a number of things on that weekend and really only returned to the hotel to change and sleep (a little). It was handy to transport and circular quay. I had little interaction with the staff, but all was pleasant. Room was clean and the bed comfortable. For my purposes the hotel was perfect, but if you planned on staying in your room and relaxing i would suggest paying for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- really good value”
Reviews.Author: SueWhite
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal from Hotel.com with a 10% discount on the internet. Worked out at Â£200 for 3 nights including breakfast for a 4* hotel. Great location - right opposite the station (where the train from the airport stops) and a short walk to the Rocks and Circular Quay. Much better than the Darling Harbour area where public transport is less good. We got a one day transport pass for 2 days we were there - covering trains buses and ferries - only trouble was we found out it doesn't cover the airport train so we had to pay lots extra for that. Hotel was great - no view in our room but nice room, nice pool, great buffet breakfast, wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - but some bad points”
Reviews.Author: KiwiCoupleAbroad
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights the week after easter. The location is very convenient - right across the road from Wynyard station. This makes it great for getting to and from Sydney airport - and by train to other Sydney areas and further afield. It is only a few minutes walk from all of the central attractions: Circular Quay, Opera House, The Rocks, Darling Harbour and central city shopping. Rooms are clean, Service is good, Facilities are good (although free internet access for guests would be useful). The downsides: Our room was very dark with one small window looking onto office buildings across a back alley. Even with all the lights on it was hard to read or use the bathroom - and that was during the daytime. The air conditioning was noisy and couldn't be turned off - making it hard to sleep as it was as noisy as the engines on a jet airplane. It also seemed hard to maintain a good temperature. The noise of plumbing from other rooms also made sleeping difficult. We never dined in the hotel, so we can't really comment on that. Overall it is a good location - although at this price don't expect a panoramic view of the harbour. We have heard that other guests had a much better experience with their room - so perhaps we were given a particularly poor room. We would stay again - but would need to get a much better room with more light, quiet air conditioning and a Carrington st view.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended Place !!!”
Reviews.Author: angelplushie
Reviews.Content: My family and I ( 2 adults 2 children) Stayed here for 3 nights over the easter weekend. Really could not fault this hotel. I cant understand how people say negative comments about the paper thin walls we were on level 5, and it was very busy at the time and didnt here a thing. As with any hotel of course you are going to hear doors closing.. We are well travelled and the sound of a door closing certainly doesnt bother us. All staff were of a high calibre and really made you feel welcome. Our room (standard) had very comfy beds, bathroom was easily big enough, and extremely clean. We had breakfast each morning and the presentation of the food was outstanding.. The selection of food is the same each day, but its simple really just eat something different that is on offer there is heaps to choose from. Like all say you cant beat the location too, walking distance to most main attractions.. We looked at the pool and spa area which looked wonderful, although we didnt use them as we were so busy sight seeing... All in all The Menzies for us as a family was a great choice, An extra special touch was that they gave the kids a bag of easter eggs...

Reviews.Title: “mixed feeling about the menzies”
Reviews.Author: aussie_rose64
Reviews.Content: my adult and teenage daughters and myself stayed in two rooms at the menzies after our cruise and we had mixed feelings about the place. it's in a supurb location with a five minute walk to shopping, circular quay and darling harbour. we went to darling harbour for dinner each night as the resturant was too expensive. the staff are attentive and friendly none more so than the conceirge. rooms were large, my bed was not comfortable and kept rolling sideways on the floor, but my biggest gripe was the paper thin walls. we could hear doors closing and people talking all times of the day and night in the rooms next door and the corridors. we had vouchers for breakfast which cut down the cost because i felt that the breakfast was too expensive. based on the paper thin walls, i'm not sure i'd stay here again. not a bad experience, just expected noise not to be an issue for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: tvujas
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted by the chief of concierge . There was a short wait to check in, but we were offered a complimentary drink in the hotel bar for having to wait in line. Once checked in we made our way to the 11th floor in a fast lift to find the corridors welcoming and clean,if not a little dark ,the room spotless with a pleasant room temperature to greet us. We found the accomodation to be more than adequate with a comfortable king size bed, a good size bathroom and quiet air conditioning. The view from the window was of another building, but what can you expect in the middle of Sydney's CBD? We found all staff eager to please which is a good thing, and the attendants to open the hotel's front doors for you was a nice touch. We made use of the express check out which we found to be very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother, try somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: milx
Reviews.Content: - it was dirty (hair in the bathtub, peanuts on the carpet) - rooms were dark - not enough lighting - buffet breakfast at $33 was too expensive - walls were paper thin - could hear neighbours conversations - while I was sleeping, around midnight, someone opened my door. I was alone in my room and quite distressed from this! - we booked king rooms and got a double single! and no apologies were made! - my swipe card didnt work, therefore I had to ask someone to let me into my room

Reviews.Title: “Great experience every time”
Reviews.Author: sea2skyaus
Reviews.Content: I am very surprised by the negative reviews on the site. I have stayed at the Menzies more than a dozen times in the past year, and I had a positive experience every time. I never had any disappointment. The value is amazing, especially if you get a good rate. The hotel is worth twice as much as what I normally pays for. The location is excellent, right across from Wynyard train station, bus stops and George Street. There is a supermarket across from the hotel at Wynyard station. Another highlight is its pool, hot tub and gym. Other hotels in this price range do not have that. The rooms were always clean, quiet, nice and comfortable. The service was always fast and efficient. I have never have to wait more than 5 minutes, no matter how busy it may be. I have stayed there many times, and could not flaw the hotel. Obviously it's not a luxurious hotel, but it is clearly the best hotel in the price range in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Try the YMCA”
Reviews.Author: Notcomingback
Reviews.Content: I and 2 work colleagues were booked for 2 nights in March. When we arrived around 11pm we were told they only had 3 rooms left (3 singles & we had booked doubles). Strange because the rooms had been guaranteed by credit card and reception did acknowledge they had our booking. Check-in was a disaster... took over 30 minutes; staff kept tapping on the computer and then headed out the back (for a smoke perhaps?). We took little comfort from other guests milling about at reception trying to get basic things like... ("I can't get into my room, this is the fourth time I have been down to reception what are you going to do about it?"). Phones went unaswered. The three rooms we were allocated would have embarrassed any YMCA establishment, small, grotty, air con made noise but didn't actually cool the room, bathroom too small to swing a cat in, bed like something out of 1700s poor house, TV static made it impossible to listen too. Still the view was nice... Check-out was equally painful. Couldn't process bill, took another 30 minutes. Try elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but not a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: E.S.F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very shabby and definately not a 4* hotel. The rooms are very tired and ours was very dark, you need lights on all the time! In fact you couldn't tell what is was like outside because of the close proximity to other buildings. The picture of the hotel is very missleading as it appears to have a green area in front of the hotel - it does, but between this and the hotel, is a very busy road/ bus stops. The air conditioning system in the hotel, is old and very noisy everywhere in the building. The lifts do not work very well, you can wait 10 minutes or more! Breakfast is very expensive ($31 for full breakfast or $24 for continental breakfast) and not very good. The staff are not very helpful. The only good thing about this hotel is the position, which it obviously plays on. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, subpar hotel”
Reviews.Author: sara1bet
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is a great location--right next to the train station, within easy walking distance of the major attractions. Don't expect luxury, however. The rooms are very dated and small. DO NOT PAY EXTRA FOR A "PARK VIEW." Really--all you get is a crowded intersection with a bunch of buses and a tiny patch of green. We found the staff to be friendly, but rather unhelpful. We were told to come back at a certain time when our room would be ready; we ended up waiting in the lobby about 2 hours--along with another couple with a baby--because the staff kept assuring us the room would be ready at any time. As other reviewers noted, we had the fire alarm go off and were not notified. Perhaps the very worst complaint: The walls are paper thin. We spent our nights listening to our neighbors' television and hacking cough and the mornings hearing complete conversations from adjoining rooms as well as every single plumbing activity. When we asked hotel staff if there was anything to be done, they said, no: The walls are just notoriously thin. Erg. Please also be aware: Internet is NOT FREE. Expedia is quite misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel, I will never return”
Reviews.Author: advocate_of_truth
Reviews.Content: After reading positive reviews about this hotel I booked a weekend mystery stay at this hotel. I had perhaps the worst experience I have ever had at the hotel. I won't go into details, but the staff were not accommodating and they were rude. The room that I was assigned to on the third floor was ugly and dated. The beds were uncomfortable and because they were on wheels they kept moving. My friend's mother almost fell off the bed when she tried to sit on it. The room also smelt old and stale. The air conditioning system was something out of the olden days. The room was noisy. At one point the fire alarm went off and I was not even notified if I should evacuate. The only thing positive about this hotel was the location as it was located next to Wynard Station.

Reviews.Title: “OK for AU$99 but not for AU$101”
Reviews.Author: Pixie22
Reviews.Content: Booked as a 4 star secret hotel at $99 a night for 5 nights for a new wardrobe shopping trip. I live in Mackay QLD with not too many men's clothes shops. The king bed was fine filling the room almost, but the bathroom had the shower in the bath and a plastic curtain, hardly 4 star. You were lucky to get wet with the water saving head. I was fortunate that my window looked onto the park, station entrance and street rather than a light well or the back lane. The TV controller had seen better days and functioned poorly, the buttons were mainly stuffed. An email I sent days before arrival asking about TV subtitles, because I am fairly deaf, was ignored. There were no subtitles available and the volume was too low for me. There is no ramp at the hotel entrance to wheel cases up and limited handrails for the infirm. Coach drivers and others smoke around the hotel entrance making passive smoke unavoidable. The lifts were fast to floor 10. On occasions large coach groups block the foyer and some were ignorant to allow me easy passage. There needs to be a corral for these people while they mill about. The location is very good for the train and bus transport and those able to walk a few kilometers, even if access to George Street, needed for buses to other city areas, is via a dodgy arcade with steps, a ramp and escalators. Being in the business area most local outlets are shut on a Sunday and the area dead and sad that day. I did not use any other hotel services and the pool was shut most of my stay. I tried room service three times without answer so I gave up and went elsewhere. I would not have been happy if I had paid the full rate. Recommended only if you have very local business and are not on an expenses paid trip.

Reviews.Title: “Centrall Located but no Free WiFi”
Reviews.Author: iprocure2k3
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location, central to just about everything, 5 minute walk to Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, 15 minutes to Sydney Opera House, and directly next to the Wynyard subway station which has a train departing every 15 minutes to the airport. The hotel gym was ok, no free weights were available. The room was fairly clean though.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: PaulandJulie
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the lobby area! Our room was very old fashioned and very tired. You could clearly hear other toilets flushing! The beds were comfy though and a the hotel is ideally placed for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “A 2-star hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: joanne019
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so incredibly dated, i am shocked it claims to be a four star hotel. LIKED: The rooms were ok, although basic and quite small, the staff were quite lovely and the location is fantastic. HATED: corridors are dated and small, bathrooms are very dated. i booked this through lastminute.com secret hotels and it was definately not a good suprise! The TV in our room didn't work properly, you can HEAR EVERYTHING other people in rooms are doing in the bathroom, walls must be paper thin. This hotel is quite simple not more than a 2 1/2 star. DO NOT book here. although the location is terrific, you will find MUCH better value for money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: fscrickinn
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in every way,and centrally located for all the lovely places to visit. The staff went out of their way to be helpful, and as this was my first visit to Australia, it created a very good impression. When I come back to Sydney from the UK, I will definetly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Menzies”
Reviews.Author: celeste95687
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews of the Menzies through TripAdvisor, we booked our room using wotif.com and decided on the standard room since we only planned to sleep. Great choice - decent room, very clean, 2 comfortable full size beds, no view but didn't mind. The staff were very nice and helpful. Concierge helped with bags and with plng excursions. Hotel location was excellent. It was just a short walk to the Rocks and Circular Quay and really only a few extra blocks in the opposite direction to get to Queen Victoria Bldg, Paddy's Mrkt, China Town. Also great location across from rail station. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position”
Reviews.Author: kazlac
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, everything within walking distance and train station just across the street. Check in wait time was far to long as well as line for breakfast, conceirge staff were excellent and more than helpful, Room was quite small but great comfy beds

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Value, Helpful Staff, Problem with Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: HolidayVibes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Menzies, Sydney 5th-7th December. Greeted on arrival by a very helpful concierge who took our bags before we even got indoors. We were allowed access to room an hour early, helped with sightseeing recommendations, map and more. All staff were friendly and genuinely helpful. Room was clean, value for money (standard room), lookout onto small park was nice, a little noise being beside a busy bus and train station and sirens at night but not enough to annoy. Should have remembered to ask for a room away from lift though, as recommended on here, as people can be very noisey when returning to rooms at 3am. Easy walking distance to shopping district (hotel is in business/financial sector), walk to The Rocks area, Ferry/Circular Quay, walk to Darling Harbour. We did not eat at hotel Friday night but visited the Sports Bar (open to public) on our return at 10pm which had a karaoke evening running. Saturday, breakfast was good, plenty of food. On returning to late Saturday night we asked for dinner at 10pm and although restaurant was about to close we were able to eat. The food was really good, prices high though ($35 main) with need to buy veg/salad seperately and small meals. We needed desert which made for a large dinner cost (would have been way too high without Accor Card). Big thanks to our dinner hostess (Joey) who was very friendly and helpful. Staff did not know this was a special meal (anniversary) yet we receieved wonderful service, just a little rushed but it was rather late at night. Sadly a serious problem at breakfast Sunday morning. First bite of food (poached egg with spinach) my husband bit onto something hard which was a piece of broken glass. He was shocked and scared as this could have been very serious had he swolled it or bit harder, cutting mouth or breaking a tooth etc. I approached the Host and he called out the Chef (I think) but no action was taken. The remaining similar food items were not removed from the serving table. On our checkout (queues as it was 10am but fast moving and an easy process) we complained again and asked for breakfast not to charged to our account as we had not eaten as we were both shaken by the experience. The young lady on reception accepted this well. Our bags were stored without extra charge for a few hours so we could sightsee until leaving. On return home I emailed the hotel as I felt the broken glass in egg was a serious lapse and not adequately dealt with as remaining food was not removed. I had to email a second time four days later before I received a reply which basically agreed with my statements. There was no apology. I really hope that staff were spoken to about this as we feel we were very lucky that my husband was not injured. We were flying back to N.Z that night. In all other ways we loved our stay. The Menzies is an older hotel, clean and good value. Their biggest asset is extremely dedicated staff (except perhaps in the breakfast kitchen). We plan to stay again next year but feel a little undecided and we would not eat at the breakfast restaurant again. These mistakes happen rarely but must be dealt with correctly if they do.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: axxxaaa
Reviews.Content: Good hotel but nothing special. Very good position right in the city center , near the shopping area, the Opera house and the harbour. The room was large but absolute no view. And the bathroom need to be refurnished.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Elcroz
Reviews.Content: The location of the Menzies Hotel and its friendly professional staff were the standout positives of a recent three day stay in Sydney. We were pleasantly surprised given concerns expressed by previous reviewers. Our Superior Park View corner room on the sixth floor was very spacious clean and comfortable. Apart from the king bed there was a two seat sofa and coffee table, writing bureau and built-in wardrobe. The bathroom was large and recently renovated. One must remember this is a longstanding inner Sydney Hotel, so is not a modern construction. Refurbishment can only achieve so much. The room was very quiet and there was no extraneous noise. The breakfast buffet in the Carrington Restaurant was varied and adequate but not spectacular. The dinner menu in the Parkside Restaurant was tasty and well presented but expensive. Main meals ($35+) came with no vegetables, which are served as side dishes for a significant additional cost. Use of the attractive pool, sauna, spa and gym facilities was complimentary. We were very happy with all aspects of our stay at the Menzies. However without the benefit of the discounts associated with my Accor membership, we would have found the full cost of accommodation and dining very pricey and not good value for money. Still, on my family's experience utilising two rooms, I happily recommend the Menzies. We were grateful that one room was ready for an early check-in even though the hotel was particularly busy, as we were travelling with our infant grandson. Staff were happy to oblige with any request.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: RicoFan
Reviews.Content: We had done our homework online in Canada prior to our month long trip to Asia and Austalia. Having stayed at the Menzies before, we thought it best to take advantage of the location and ammenities close by. We had reserved an " executive " room, supposedly newly rennovated and on an exexutive level. It was on the 12th of 13 floors but the room size was no more than a small motel room size with absolutely no shelves or drawers. We were also astounded at the charge of $30/day for internet access, a must to communicate with our family back home. We had just spent the previous 3 weeks in hotels and resorts in the Philippines, Singapore and Cairns and the Menzies just didn't measure up for the price. We were reassigned to a suite after indicating that the " executive " room was inadequate but the upgrade cost another $30/night. Next time in Sydney we will probably consider another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: fattyboombalada
Reviews.Content: I frequent Sydney hotels for business and to sum, this place doesn't cut it. Old and dated, it gives the illusion of something it's not with a renovated lobby. After complaining of the smell and look of my assigned room, I was "upgraded" to a parkview room or whatever they wanted to label it. Not much better really. I had a view over the tiny Wynyard park where I could spot a couple of rats running around. The television was barely audible at its highest volume and there was a very mild sewrage stench coming from the toilet. Furniture is old and dated and room service just on edible. Service OK but slow. Would not recommend this place to anyone. I'd rather the 3 star Travelodge up the road or investing in the Westin at Martin Place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....but could do with a facelift!”
Reviews.Author: k_s_uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. I booked this hotel for its location and it delivered - 5/10 mins to circular quay and darling harbour. The lobby as mentioned in reviews before is very grand, but unfortunately this doesn't go for the bedrooms - they are clean and the bed I had was large and comfortable, but the hotel is in need of a re-fit. Then again we were in Sydney and didn't spend that much time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old and tired”
Reviews.Author: voyager81
Reviews.Content: Great location, but hotel itself has seen better days. Rooms are dark and outdated. Service is friendly albeit slow.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, no problems”
Reviews.Author: Libs85
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Menzies for two nights and found its central location fantastic. While the lobby is quite grand and beautiful, the rooms are really a bit old and tired. There was nothing actually wrong with the rooms, making for a pleasant stay, we just found it was a bit dark and stale. Really no other complaints, we got room service during the night, which was lovely and the staff were all helpful and courteous. Would stay again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Menzies”
Reviews.Content: The Menzies is in an ideal location for exploring Sydney. Winyard Station, a major transportation hub, is across the street, and all of the major sites are within walking distance or a short taxi ride. We enjoyed being able to walk home from the Opera House or after dinner. In addition, there is an underground shopping mall that can be entered by crossing the street and has all the amenities a traveller needs. It includes a supermarket and a food court that caters to the CBD office crowd, but some businesses are open on the weekend, too. Our room was very comfortable, and the hotel staff was friendly, welcoming, and unfailingly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “gday from up and over”
Reviews.Author: nikiandpauldundee
Reviews.Content: Menzies hotel was ok, fine for central sydney location but if was certainly not plush. great location for walking around but accomodation itself not that great. Clean and bed comfy, but not the best we stayed in. However, max brennans chocolate shop is a minute from the door and the hot chocolate is unbelievably good and chocolate oizza you need to try!! Breakfast in the hotel was unusual in that you needed to have a token to get your breakfast in the morning??

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not quite 4 stars..”
Reviews.Author: ACtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Menzies for a week of vacation and overall found it a good hotel. Let me start by saying that I think Sydney is a fantastic place for a holiday! Even though it was winter there was plenty to see and do. The Menzies is located in the central business district , and is across the street from the Wynyard train/subway station so it's very easy to get there from the airport and easy to get trains or buses to other places. We also found it fairly central if you wanted to walk to the shopping or sightseeing areas. All the staff we dealt with were excellent, very friendly and professional. Hotel lobby is very nice, however I found the rest of the hotel was fairly average, what I would consider a 3 star. Our room was large but fairly plain. We had no problem with any noise from other rooms as the previous review had mentioned. The beds in our room were not very good, one felt like it was completely worn out, way too soft. There is a well equipped exercise room on the main floor,( air conditioning didn't work so it was much too hot for me) There is also a pool next door, dimly lit and no windows but if you want to swim it's there! The only other thing we noticed was there weren't a lot of restaurants really close by so we usually went to the rocks or Darling Harbour to eat at night. So not a bad place to stay, but I might try something closer to The Rocks or Darling Harbour next time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable average hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer14
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as I was working in Sydney for a few days. My company booked it for me due to the location being nearby the offices I was working at. The hotel is in an ideal location. It is a short 10 minute walk to the Rocks, Opera House & Bridge, and also only around 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour. (There is also a train station across the road for transport). The lobby is very nice, lots of seating and a grand piano that sometimes has someone playing it. There is also a little cafe there for convenience. The check-in staff were very helpful, gave us good directions and maps to where we wanted to go. The room was adequate, bed comfortable, it was just an average room with nothing special but nothing bad either. The bathroom was quite small but not enough to bother me. The only main complaint I had is that the walls are very thin, so you can hear what is being said in the hallways, and also the plumbing is very noisy. My work collegue was staying in the room directly above me, and I could hear every time she flushed her toilet. Cleaning ladies were very polite when they were passed in the hallway, and the ladies working at the cafe were overly helpful with giving directions to my friend who was picking me up and having trouble. I would be happy to stay here again if the price was right, due to the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: uhcoogdebi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Menzies as part of a Monograms tour with Globus. My room was very nice. As a traveling single, I had a nice king size bed. The bathroom was a little small, but very adequate. The bellmen serve as concierge. They do a great job. They booked several tours for me and gave excellent directions. The breakfast that comes with the room is wonderful. Everything you could want for breakfast was served. The location is wonderful. Just steps from the bus/train station and close enough so that you can walk to Circular Quay or Darling Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: bug09
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times at the Menzies for work. The hotel is easy to reach via rail, and shopping and restaurants are a few minutes walk from the hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable and quiet. Thoroughly recommended for either work or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “"You will not be disapointed"”
Reviews.Author: petali4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Menzies Hotel for three nights recently and from the moment we stepped from the cab we were treated as if we were the only guests especially from Andrew who welcomed us. In fact all the staff were excellent right to the cleaning lady who greeted us with a cheery good morning. Menzies your staff are a credit. We'll be back! Regards Derek & Coral Smith

Reviews.Title: “Very VERY comfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: wildthing271
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in The Menzies many times, principally on the strength of the excellent location, the very very comfortable beds and the value for money. In line with some of the other reviewers here, the rooms probably have seen better days. The bathrooms badly need an upgrade, and the wallpaper in some rooms is fraying and needs replacing. Bedroom windows are filthy, but this is not unique to The Menzies as the city is still under water restruictions. It is evident that some upgrades are under way - rooms now feature flat screen TV's for example, and decor in the communal areas seems to be refreshed. Those minor gripes are more than liveable with. Personally, I find the beds in this hotel amongst the most comfortable of any I have slept in anywhere. The bed linen is clean and crisp, as are the towels in the bathroom. I find the staff at the hotel very friendly as well - check in and out was very efficient, bell staff were friendly and efficient (don't think I had to open the door of the hotel once, so efficient were the bell staff in ensuring they opened it for me!), and the members of the management team I encountered were extremely polite and friendly. I didn't sample the hotel restaurant on this occasion. Unless breakfast is included in the room rate, I object to the price any city centre hotel charges for breakfast - there are plenty of nearby cafes offering freshly cooked breakfasts for a fraction of the price. I did sample a few drinks from One Four, the lobby bar, and again service was good, price reasonable, and location in the lobby great for people watching. The location of this hotel is great. It's 10 minutes walk to Circular Quay, 10 minutes to Darling Harbour, and is located adjacent to Wynard bus terminal and railway station (conveniently on the airport line). I can't lie and say that this is the best hotel in Sydney, but from my experience, in terms of staff friendliness, bed comfort and location, it offers great value for money if you are prepared to accept one or two shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Accommodations in a Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: EricaLynn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Menzies for five nights in mid May 2008. Although Iâ€™ve rated this property as three stars above, this is one of those times when I really wish that Trip Advisor allowed for half stars â€“ in my mind, the Menzies was a solid three-and-a-half star hotel. As has been mentioned here many times before, the Menziesâ€™ most appealing quality is its location. The hotel is located directly across from Wynyard Station, although we never once used the station because everything else we wanted to access within Sydney was also within walking distance of the Menzies. Circular Quay and The Rocks were only about a ten-minute walk up George Street, and the Kings Wharf area of Darling Harbour was even closer, only about three blocks away. Central Station was about a 25-minute walk for easy access to all of the suburban and intercity trains. The Menzies lobby was nicely done, and the common areas on the first floor (the restaurant and piano bar) were charming albeit a bit worn. We took a quick peek into the pool/Jacuzzi area but never used those facilities. Our room was an even-numbered room on the seventh floor of the south wing. The view was directly into the windows of an office building, as others have described. We were initially assigned an odd- numbered room on the third floor with a view across to Wynyard Station, but we relocated to a room with a single queen bed instead of two twin beds (we were going to just push the twin beds together, but they were on wheels; according to other couples with whom we spoke, we made the right choice, as the twins kept rolling apart in the middle of the night when they tried pushing them together). So for those who care about the view from your room, Iâ€™d suggest requesting an odd-numbered room! For us, it didnâ€™t matter because we spent almost no time in our room. Our room was plain but clean and of an adequate size. There was no in-room safe. The small closet included quite a few hangers, but drawer space was limited. There was a minibar in the room that proved useful for chilling some wine picked up in the Hunter Valley (a corkscrew was also provided in the room), and the small table with two chairs offered some extra space to spread out. The bathroom was somewhat small but did offer a full-size shower and a decent amount of counter and shelf space for toiletries. Of note, I understand that the north wing rooms have been renovated, so perhaps they are of a higher caliber than what we found in the south wing. I have two big complaints about our room. The first is that the air conditioning was quite ineffective. I tend to like it rather warm and it didnâ€™t get much above 70 degrees outside, and even I was a bit uncomfortable trying to sleep, so I imagine that the Menzies rooms could be quite unpleasant for someone who prefers cooler temperatures and/or who visits during the heat of summer. My other complaint pertains to the sensitivity of the smoke detectors. In multiple places throughout the room, warnings were posted that taking a shower with the bathroom door open would cause the smoke alarm to go off due to the steam. On our first night at the Menzies, we were awoken around 10:30 pm by the fire alarm (normally not a big deal, but weâ€™d gone to bed at 9 pm because of jet lag!). Subsequent announcements were made that it was a false alarm. No one would tell us for sure that it had been caused by the combination of poor bathroom ventilation and overly sensitive smoke detectors, but that was the going theoryâ€¦ We stayed at the Menzies as part of a package deal through Smartours, so I canâ€™t really comment specifically as to the value of our stay. However, at $1399 per person for three nights in Tahiti, five nights in Sydney, all transfers, breakfast every morning, and roundtrip flights from LAX, I KNOW the Menzies portion of our trip cost was well below rack rates! For those considering purchasing the $30 buffet breakfast, I would suggest looking elsewhere. We ate the breakfast every morning because it was part of our package, but some of the food was not of the best quality, and the selection was limited and did not change from day to day. With the Menzies being so ideally located, there are MANY other breakfast options to choose from in the area. Internet access is available in the rooms, but I believe the charge was $12 per day. We instead opted to use the computers in the business center on the ground floor. These computers were coin-operated; cost was $2 per 15 minutes of internet access. The Menzies also offered a small alcove filled with tourist brochures. The concierge was kind enough to book a tour for us so we did not need to make the call from our room. Overall, the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate to stay at the Menzies again if I found that it was part of a package that seemed like a good value. If I were instead making hotel arrangements on my own, however, I would definitely see what other options might be available in a similarly wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Very 80's (and not in a good way)”
Reviews.Author: JamieCLondon
Reviews.Content: Not worth it. Booked it as a secret deal on lastminute, and when I saw what it was i regretted it straight away. Would have been a great hotel in the 80's. Have no idea why it is 4 stars. The room was too basic, much akin to a motel room. Stay else where is my recommendation. I got a 50% discount and was disappointed, god knows why people pay full price to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely central Syndey hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiwitraveller055
Reviews.Content: The Menzies in Sydney is a lovely old hotel to stay at. We were looked after very well, the front desk people friendly and polite. The concierge are outstanding and rushed to open the front doors for us when we returned. The pool/sauna area was well used by us and our family liked it. The gym has excellent equipment and good layout. We had a superior park view room, it was situated down the quieter street of the hotel, so not as noisy as the front would have been. We felt the room was a good size for the four of us. We didn't use the restaurants at the hotel, a bit expensive for what we were looking for, but there are food halls etc all very handy to the hotel. I would definately recommend this hotel to stay for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the place!”
Reviews.Author: caneable
Reviews.Content: Check in was polite and good. The location is excellent. Right by Rail and bus links and a handy walk from The Rocks, Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. We had been booked into a superior parkview room. Don't know if it was as you couldn't see through the thick cake of grime on the window! It would have been helpful had I spent weeks in limbo dancing lessons as the route into the bathroom, especially in the dark, was incredibly intricate. The words swing and cat come to mind. Added to that, the room was opposite the lift which yawned and creaked all night and so neither of us got a good night's sleep! The next day we enquired about a change and front desk promised to see what they could do, and they did! At first we were quite pleased. It was the only room available and was a downgrade, but actually it had a far better layout, and much more space. Hastily we accepted the change and didn't notice until later the interconnecting door! And we heard everything, and I mean everything! Given that the lady told the gentleman that he had only paid for once, we felt as though we had landed next door to a brothel! Thanks management, I'm so pleased that you value your tourist customers so highly.

Reviews.Title: “what a rubbish hotel”
Reviews.Author: holyhead30
Reviews.Content: it a shame the hotel looks nice till you get inside the corridor and rooms very shabby hotel staff not helpful at all i would,nt give it a star at all just dont book there

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi19
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights and never again! Booked a refurbished executive room and couldnt believe the tiny size of the room ,the air conditioning vent was filthy and there was only one chair for two people. Complained to reception and the young lady showed me to a bigger room on a lower floor which was filthy with dust. She realised I was upset and told me that if I wanted to go to another hotel she thought the manager would not charge me!! I then asked to speak to the manager who listened to my complaints and then managed to find another room for us. He also gave us free breakfasts but these were very poor quality. My husband and I have been on an extended holiday in Hong Kong, New Zealand Australia and Dubai and this hotel and facilities were by far the poorest in all areas. I cannot believe it is 4 star more like 2. Cleanliness was very poor and also very worrying when the fire alarm went off at 5am noone moved on the 14th floor and no member of staff came to speak to us even though the fire brigade arrived. Surely the hotel should have been evacuted?

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, very friendly and attentive, but small room and a bit too noisy.”
Reviews.Author: NoneColumbus
Reviews.Content: The lobby and decorations of the Menzies, Sydney are very elegant. The hotel staff, as well as the decor, made us feel like visiting royalty. They could not have been more friendly and attentive. The doorman always rushed to open the door, with an exuberant â€œwelcome back!â€� Service at the front desk was quick and very amiable. The front desk was well manned at all times and we never had to wait for more than a minute or so before someone got to us with a smile. On the down side, both the room and the bathroom were suprisingly small. The bathtub was too small for an adult to take a bath, but as a shower booth it was alright. We werenâ€™t particularly cramped, but no one would call the room and bath spacious. The room and bathroom were spotless. The bed was big enough and comfortable. The room had a desk, a coffee maker and thankfully a supply of American instant coffee. American coffee is hard to find in Australia. Our guide book said Australians think American coffee tastes like â€œditch waterâ€�. It is all a matter of what you're used to, I guess. The coffee they do have, like espresso, latte and cappuccino, costs something like three to five dollars a cup and there are no free refills. The room had wireless internet, but it cost something like twenty dollars a day to use. There were about four computers on the ground floor in a separate computer room. They were coin operated and cost two dollars every fifteen minutes. The front desk cheerfully provided change when needed (I never saw a change machine in Australia). You can print for an additional per page charge. There are no nearby internet cafes that I found. I did find the internet in a convenience store several blocks away, but they were charging two dollars for fifteen minutes as well. To our surprise, there was no telephone book in the room. We like to use the yellow pages to look for restaurants, book stores, internet cafes, etc. So its absence was an inconvenience and the Menzies, Sydney was the only hotel where we stayed in Australia that did not have one. There was a telephone in the room. Sydney reminded us of New York or maybe Toronto. We always felt right at home everywhere we went in Australia. The Menzies, Sydney is on a street called Carrington, which is something like a service road for buses and taxis off of the main street of York. The hotel is across from the street from a metro light rail station. The good news is that catching a bus, train or taxi is easy there. The train station has a nice variety of carry out food and small shops, which stay open later than most of the rest of the shops in the area. The bad news is that all the buses and trains coming and going is noisy at all hours. Our room was on the eleventh floor and it still rumbled constantly with the passing underground trains and the din of passing traffic. I guess it is the price that must be paid for such a central location. The hotel is located right in downtown Sydney (the â€œCBDâ€� or â€œcentral business districtâ€�, they call it). It is only a short block from George Street, which is the most important street through downtown Sydney. Our guide told us that it is the only street in Sydney, of any length, that never changes its name as it goes along. There are many nice shops in the area, but most close at 6:00 PM. The area is very much in the commercial business district and the nearby stores and restaurants cater mostly to the people who work there during the day. As a result, the nearby restaurants cater mostly to the lunch trade and not to the supper trade. In fact, little in the area close to the hotel does cater much to tourists, unlike the areas bordering the harbor. There is a Seven Eleven a few doors away from the hotel and the train station right across the street has a wealth of shops to pick up beverages, snacks and light meals. However, to my surprise, the prices in the hotel shop were actually somewhat less than the Seven Eleven, but somewhat more than in the shops in the train station across the street. The restaurants close to the hotel offered mostly a sandwich menu and, if they had tables at all, most were small, rickety and in a cramped space. We never did find a good sit down supper restaurant near the hotel. The hotel restaurant is good, but pricey. However, its prices turned out to be about what our guide book said other upscale restaurants were charging in Sydney. We ate there the first night. It was as elegant and the service was as attentive and prompt as the rest of the hotel. The food was good and was, by far, the best we ate in Sydney. However, it costs about $35 a person to eat there. Our tab for two was $68. While the Australian dollar is worth slightly less than an American dollar, by the time you pay the conversion fees, it is pretty much the same. The hotel had a breakfast buffet for $23 continental and a full hot breakfast for $29.50, which we did not try. It is not elegant dining, but you can get a hot breakfast in the train station and several other places close to the hotel in the $10 range. The breakfast restaurant we liked the best was the Caffe Capri, which was located at the head on the escalator on the far end of the Menzies Arcade. The entrance to the Menzies Arcade is right next door to the hotel. There were sit down tables and prompt, friendly table service. A delicious omelette with a choice of three ingredients and hot toast were $10.90. Predictably, they did not offer any of that "ditch water" American coffee. What they had was â€œlong blackâ€� coffee for $2.80, which the waitress described as a â€œmildâ€� espresso. I drank it, but I have to say that it was way too strong for my American taste. Taxi fares in Sydney are by meter. There is no point in asking in advance how much it costs to go somewhere, since it depends on time and traffic. The hotel is some four blocks from the Circular Quay (pronounced â€œKeyâ€�). It cost about a $13 cab fare to get there. However, it not an impossible walk, since it is about a 15 minute walk back to the hotel. From the Circular Quay, you get a good view of both the ever famous Sydney Opera House and the ever famous Harbor Bridge. There are quite a few restaurants in this harbor area, that they call â€œThe Rocksâ€�. That is also the place where you can catch a harbor cruise. We bought tickets to do the cruise with Matilda Cruises, which is associated somehow with Captain Cook Cruises, which has a Grey Lines Tours logo on it. I would not call Matilda a well run company. We bought the ticket at 3:00 PM and they told us the cruise would leave at 3:15. The first inkling of a problem was when the guy waiting on the bench next to us started to complain bitterly that he could not get on a boat. When the boat arrived, he did get on, muttering with loud exasperation, â€œfinallyâ€�. When they looked at our ticket, they said our boat did not leave until 3:30.
