No time at all was marked on the ticket. At 3:30 a boat pulled in, sat there for a few minutes and then pulled out without picking up anyone. I went back to the Matilda ticket booth. The lady on duty looked at my ticket and said it was for the next day (no date was marked on it either) and could we come back tomorrow, which made me wonder why they had sold it to us. When I said we could not, she reluctantly wrote on the ticket that we could use it at 4:30 that afternoon, on a boat that would arrive at 4:15. The boat had not arrived at 4:30. So I went back to the Matilda ticket boot, which had closed. However, it had a sign to go to the nearby Captain Cook ticket booth. The lady there said the boat was just running late. It arrived about 4:40. However, when we went to board, the person taking the tickets started telling us that we needed to take â€œthe next boatâ€�. I pointed out to him that our ticket specifically said it was for 4:30. After much discussion, he finally let us on with great reluctance and scowling. After all that, I have to say that we were very disappointed with the cruise. The boat was filthy. The windows were so salt covered and dirty that you could hardly see out through the glare on the salt and dirt coating. The sun was so low in the sky by that time in the late afternoon, that we could not see out of one side of the boat, even had those filthy windows on that side been spotless. The really scary thing, however, was that the announcer said over and over again on that trip that it was the last trip of the day, which made us wonder which â€œnext boatâ€� they had tried to make us wait for. I have to say that other people did get on that boat with no problem, so it is a mystery to me why some people would have so many problems while others did not. Check out time Menzies, Sydney is officially 10:30, but they readily agreed to let us stay till noon at no charge, which was a great convenience. We greatly appreciated that. Of course, no hotel is perfect. So, despite our various quibbles about its shortcomings, we did enjoy our stay at the Menzies, Sydney very much and would gladly stay there again. We do recommend it, shortcomings and all.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: ozmadmax
Reviews.Content: This hotel may have seen better days. Location may be the only good point (close to business and tourist sites). Rooms in need of a refurbishment and tiny bathrooms (mind your head when you step in the shower). Public areas are a little tired.

Reviews.Title: “Dependable value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: travelfromheretother
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Menzies for three nights for business. The location is superb within walking distance of the rocks, circula quay, the opera house, and the other CBD-sites . The hotel is large and plays host to plenty of tour groups. Be prepared to see buses outside and piles of luggage being checked. My room was adequate, but with a tiny window and no view. Desk space for working was fine and the lighting and a/c were sufficient. Bathroom is small but has nice finishes. The hotel is older --- that's clear from the elevators, the hallways and rooms and the pool, which looks like the set from a bad 70's movie. (Dark, indoors, weird shaped, underground.) But the hotel tries its best and I experienced particularly notable service while there. The bottom line is, this hotel is the place to stay if you'd rather save money on loding to spend on Sydney's sites or restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with some local flavor”
Reviews.Author: Danamal
Reviews.Content: Older hotel in the Central Business District with some local flavor and character - room was clean and quiet - and LARGE!! Good elevator service, and convenient indoor pool. Yes the place is older but it was fun to sit in the lobby and listen to the pianist and watch the activity outside. Train station and metro right outside the door - walking distance to the Harbour and Opera House. Friendly and helpful staff. Stayed here 5 nights as part of tour, and for the price I thought it was great value. Breakfast hearty and plentiful. Affordable and fast Internet Service in the lobby along with a reasonably priced Gift and Convenience store. Overall a pleasant experience in a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: newbie24
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i have just got back from a 3 week holiday in Australia. We spent a week in this hotel in Sydney and loved every minute. It is very quiet, we didnâ€™t hear another guest when we were in our room, and there were plenty of guests staying. I would defiantly stay again. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The concierge booked a few restaurants for us and gave us a few tips on places to see. The Hotel is great for business users as it is in the CBD and is also brilliant for holiday makers as it is in a great location. A 10 minute walk in one direction to the Rocks and Circular Quay where you can see the spectacular Sydney Harbour Bridge, Opera House and Botanical Gardens or catch a Ferry to the Zoo or Manly. And a 10-15 minute walk the other way to Darling Harbour to watch the sunset and eat fresh seafood - but beware, this is expensive, even compared to London prices. The hotel is also located opposite a bus stop and taxi rank and also Waynard Underground station where you can catch the train to Bondi beach and Sydney's Suburbs. The Hotel has a very sophisticated look and feel with dark wood and marble finish throughout in all public areas. The rooms are very clean and modern with large queensized beds and flat screen TV's and the Hotel is extremely well equipt with a gym, sauna, swimming pool, gift shop, Sports Bar with free Pool tables, Piano Bar, Restaurant. We were surprised to find that the Sports Bar was not open at the weekend and closed at 10pm most nights. However the Piano Bar was open later and is well worth a visit on a Saturday Night. Great value for such a good hotel, would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, central hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TedC
Reviews.Content: Booked early and got a good deal. Arrived early (before 9 am!) - had contacted the hotel at time of booking to see if it was ok to leave luggage - Not alone did they acknowledge this but, as the room was free, allowed a very early check-in. Needless to say having just come from a 16 hour plane trip this was a most welcome and friendly first impression. I agree with some of the previous writers in relation to the decor - it can be a bit dreary in places - but allowing for the location, very kind & helpful staff, ample breakfast, sizeable room and general cleanliness this is a minor quibble. Overall, very reasonable for a central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Buffaloman
Reviews.Content: The Menzies bargain rates and center city location are positives. Downtown sites are easily walkable, or the center city train lines all pass through the station right across the street. The property however is older and rather tired. Rooms featured among the most comfortable beds I've found in a hotel, but also leaks in the bathroom ceiling, ineffective air conditioning (room could not be cooled below 76 F.), and mildewed smells in common areas. If you are looking for a cheap place to sleep, The Menzies might be your place, if you want a first-class hotel experience, it is best to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “What a dismal night!”
Reviews.Author: Ajs30
Reviews.Content: Hmm...due to an early morning medical appointment we needed to stay in Sydney for the night. Unfortunately for us, the Menzies was the closest hotel to where we needed to go. Upon checking in, neither the doorman or the desk staff offered to have our bags taken to our room...perhaps the first of many bad signs. Surprised at the cheap rates for a 4 star hotel, the surprise was all ours when we saw our free upgrade to the 'Connor Suite' on the 14th floor. It was like stepping into a time machine and stepping out in 1971! We went back down to ask if there was anything else available and upon seeing our alternatives, we decided to stick with what we'd been given. The room was dated and grubby. Upon examining the 'kitchenette' I found rubbish placed in the cupboards, obviously too high for housekeeping to see or reach. The carpet was tatty, the walls grubby. The curtains needed washing and as this was a non smoking room, had a number of cigarette burns in them...perhaps a sign of when they last were cleaned. Our son required a roll away bed and after heading out we returned to find it...tattered and torn on one corner. One t.v required a technician to recieve a decent picture, and our king sized bed was fitted with a the bead head of a double bed. The view from the room was over a dingy park where I watched drunks and homeless people settle down for the evening. The hotel's restaurant, touted as something special was nothing more than average. Our garlic bread arrived without garlic, my $35 lamb rack, tough and chewy. The wine list however was good. Than goodness our Accor card got us 33% off the $200 bill (for 2 adults and one child)! The next morning saw us at the buffet breakfast. It was o.k and whilst the staff were pleasant, they could have spent more time cleaning the mess the last people who sat at our table left on the seats. When checking out, we were asked how we'd enjoyed our meal the night before. Our lack of excitement was met with stoney silence. The only good things I can say about the Menzies, is that our suite was large. All in all, I couldn't wait to leave and will never be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: PerthTraveller99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Menzies for two nights and was not disappointed. Porters collected our bags from the car and delivered to the room. The room was a park view and had a lovely view over wynyard park. Room was very clean with a marble bathroom. Walls were very solid and we heard nothing from other rooms during our stay. Concierge was helpful. This hotel provides excellent value for money in one the of the most convenient locations within Sydney - a short walk to the harbour and above Wynyard station.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: suntrvlr
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney on a tour for 5 days. The hotel is in a great location as other reviewers have mentioned. The hotel is a three star hotel but the location earns the fourth star. Some of the rooms are old and small. If you want a king bed request it. Sometimes they will give you a twin room. Most of the time they will 'zip' the beds together. We had a horrible room 405; small, musty, right off of the elevator and we had to make a bit of a fuss for them to move us. The room was dreadful! But they moved us to 225 (or 228) i can't remember...and the new room was spacious with a flat screen tv. Go figure! I would recommend this hotel. You can get where you need to go easily by train, bus, taxi, ferry or on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: galaga_girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 2 nights to go to a concert, having the train station (wynyard) right across the road was a bonus and one of the main reasons why we stayed here. The area felt safe at night, I usually stay around Haymarket/Darling Harbour but would stay here again. The room was HUGE, but we had a lovely view of a brick wall! The bathrooms were clean and service was great. The only downside is the cost, it is quite expensive and don't even bother with room service - WAY OVERPRICED.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karate80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. Me and some friends only stayed one night but the bed was so comfy, the room was lovely and clean and spacious. The bathroom was nice and the location of the hotel is very handy. Its right across from Wynyard Station so very close to trains and buses and there are food places nearby. Close walk or taxi ride to all the clubs and restaurants. Hotel staff nice and polite. The bed was so soft that we didnt want to get up the next morning, very comfortable and definately recommended if your after a comfortable room and handy location. Room service is also wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Menzies Sydney”
Reviews.Author: lithlith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in early August of 2007 while on a Globus tour. The hotel has an old feel to it, some may call this charming - depends on your style. Our room looked old and dated. The only problem in the room that we ran into was that our TV kept telling us that we had a phone message, but the light on the phone wasn't lit up. When we followed the instructions to retrieve the message on the phone it would not let us access the voicemail system. There were two employees who came up to help, but no one could figure out how to get the message. So, we never got the message - good thing it wasn't an emergency. We ate breakfast all three mornings at the hotel, compliments of our tour. There was a large breakfast buffet with lots of hot items, and fruit, cereal, breads, and juices. The hotel is centrally located in the business district of Sydney, so there are not a lot of restaurants around, unless you are willing to walk 10-15 minutes. Both the Rocks and the Darling Harbor areas are 10-15 minute walks, where you'll find lots of restaurants and entertainment. There was a subway stop directly across the street from the hotel entrance, as well as stops for numerous bus lines. But, we always walked every where we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AussieKaren
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a business stay in Sydney and this motel is a gem. It is directly opposite Wynyard station and Wynyard Bus Stop which makes everything in Sydney accessible. It's a very short 5-10 minute walk to Circular Quay and a very short walk to the main shopping district. Heaps of food options within easy walking distant inclusing your usual fast food outlets (starbucks, McDonalds, Subway, 7 eleven etc) The service was outstanding. Check-in and check-out was fast and easy. The indor pool, spa and gym were all great and not busy. Room service was quick and the meal was a good size. The room was big and enough room to walk around easily.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lottie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in late July. I booked this from the lastminute.com website as it was a "secret" 4* hotel in central Sydney at AUD99 a night. The location is definitely fantastic, right opposite Wynyard Station, two blocks from Pitt St and about a ten minute walk to Circular Quay and the Rocks. The reception area is certainly wonderful as are all the other public areas (except for Sporters Bar - if you hate karaoke don't go there!). The staff are also fantastic. Everyone had a smile on their faces and nothing was too much trouble. Once you go up to your floor though the scenery changes a bit! The hallways are very drab and in desparate need of a paint. Our first room was a queen bedded room on the back of the building so the view was of an office building. If you were staying on your own for a couple of nights it would have been quite okay. However there was nothing to put your bag on so we put everything on the floor and with two big suitcases it certainly cut down the room. My husband quickly decided this wasn't going to be the room for us and went down to reception and for $20 a night we were upgraded to a room on the front of the building with a king size bed. This room was a little bit bigger but still very tired looking with dinged furniture and a grey trim everywhere. There are two chairs in the room, one for the desk and the other a very uncomfortable bucket chair. So, sitting on the bed was the most comfortable option and I'm really not a fan of that. The bathroom was very small and if you are over six foot be prepared to not be able to stand up properly in the shower/bath as the roof is lower over that part of the room. I guess it was functional though. The air-conditioning was a disaster. It just didn't seem to work at all and we ended up switching it off and opening the window. Luckily it wasn't too noisy outside as it was a weekend. I don't know if I would be able to cope with being there in summer. We did have breakfast at the hotel one morning. It was AUD29.50 for a full buffet which had a great selection. Down at Circular Quay there are quite a few restaurants that do breakfast in the morning. There aren't a huge number of places to eat right near the hotel so the best thing to do is to walk down to the Rocks or Darling Harbour where there are a number of restaurants. We found great pizza at Zia Pina on the Rocks and Thai at Chinta Ria in Darling Harbour is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: nriemen
Reviews.Content: Great front desk! Everyone was always willing to help! Great location: short walk to: The Rocks, the harbor and Opera House areas. A liquor store just a few doors down and lots of shopping underground across the street for take out meals, cold drinks, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fishman620
Reviews.Content: The Menzies Sydney was very centrally located. Right across the street was there train station and you could catch the bus right outside the door. We were within walking distance of both harbors. The room itself was a little dated but was sufficient for our needs, the bathroom left alot to be desired. Our view was of another building. But because of the location, I would stay there again, easy access to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Trav11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 12 year old grandaughter to Sydney for her birthday for 4 days. We are "Accor Advantage Plus" members so used our one complimentary night and paid half the rack rate for the other two nights. We also chose this hotel as it was central to the ferries, shops and everywhere else we wanted to go and were pleasantly surprised after reading some "not so good" reviews of the standard rooms in the back of the hotel. The only negative would be that the rooms overlook an office building next door but I guess the hotel can't do anything about that. Our room had two double beds and looked like it had been very recently refurbished, was very clean and comfortable. I cannot speak highly enough of the professional, courteous and very helpful staff at all times who even came across part of the road when crossing from Wynyard station to help carry our luggage. We had some airline problems but the staff were extremely helpful over an hour or so in letting us receive faxes and emails before we left and well after we'd checked out. The heated pool was cool so we mainly only used the spa but our grandaughter had a great time using the gym. We mainly ate out of the hotel at the Carrington Cafe a few doors down or McCafe a couple of blocks away on George St towards Circular Quay. It was quiet at that particular McCafe and very convenient. There are also many takeaways in Wynyard station subway. Overall, we'd certainly stay there again and thank the hotel staff for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Neatybeet
Reviews.Content: After reading a few other reviews on Trip Advisor I was a bit dubious about having booked this hotel, but I can't fault the experience. The hotel and room were clean and well presented and the staff extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was at the back of the hotel so no view to speak of, but this didn't matter as the location right in the heart of everything meant we didn't need to gaze out the window to see things - we just needed to walk out the front door of the hotel and experience them ourselves. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to other travelers and would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: Marie004
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sydney with no where to stay. At the Sydney Airport we noticed Sydney Visitor Centre, so we approached them with "we need somewhere to stay". Kim one of the receptionists who worked there found us The Menzies in Carrington Street, she highly recommended this place to us. So we paid her and off on our journey to The Menzies. What a beautiful place, situated right across from Wynyard Train Station and only minutes by train to the various sights of Sydney. Every day Clean sheets and towels were supplied and nothing was too hard for any of the staff. We stayed 5 nights at The Menzies and was very sad to leave such an excellent place and it just made our stay wonderful. We found the staff very Professional in every way, courteous and friendly. We also felt very safe staying here too. We would highly recommend this place to all travellers and would be only too happy if any of you have any questions which I would be only too happy to answer. Cheers and Thank You to The Menzies and their wonderful staff. Keep up the good work Take Care Marie Mckenna

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: SJB100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband at the beginning of May 07 for 5 nights and found the hotel quite average. It seems that the majority of the money that has been spent on this hotel was on the foyer. The foyer was quite impressive and grand. Unfortunately I am unable to say the same for the rooms. Our room was in need of decorating and looked rather tired. The cleanliness of the room was not great, my husband actually washed the cabinet down where the coffee making facilities sat as it was dirty. The main problem I found with this hotel was that the walls seem incredibly thin and I was woken up by people having conversations in their room or watching TV. The swimming pool area was not very appealing and the jacuzzi was out of order for some of our stay. On the plus side, the staff at the hotel can not do enough for you and I really cannot fault their customer service skills. Excellent location for sightseeing, just a short walk to all the main tourist attractions which makes this hotel a convenient stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - A very nice valued hotel”
Reviews.Author: CWipes
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 days at the Menzies in Sydney at the end of March 2007 The highlight of this hotel has to be it's location. It's right in the middle of everything you need. Located across the street from Wynard Station, it's a quick trip 12 minutes by train to and from the airport. On George Street one block behind the hotel, you'll find an American Express Foreign Exchange Office where if you're an AmEx card holder, you can write personal checks and cash them in to the local currency with no commission charge. If you can figure it out, you can walk via the passage way from the hotel to George street. Located in the Wynard Station on the 2nd level you'll find a supermarket. On the 2nd & 3rd floor of Wynyard station you'll also find numerous pastry shops where you can pick something up for breakfast, or perhaps something for a picnic. On the 1st or bottom floor, you'll find starbucks, Hungry Jack (aka Burger King) or Mc Donalds. Back to the hotel. The room itself was efficient. I used all the space that was available. Since I was in Sydney for a week, I contacted the front desk to have them remove the contents of the mini bar so I could fill it with stuff from the supermarket next door. I picked up a 5 Gal jug of water. Unfortunately upon departure, I think the hotel charged me for the contents of the Minibar, which is why a charge of 137AUD showed up. I'm trying to resolve that now. The air conditioning in the room works well. While it's not a strong flow, it's constant. So if you leave it on, eventually it will get cool on a hot day, even hilly at night. I think that Australians have a better sense of energy efficiency then in the US. The bathroom takes a little getting use to, especially the placement and size of the toilet (look for the button on the wall to flush), and the lack of a full shower door. Water temperature, pressure and control are all fine. There are multiple restaurants located in the hotel, but did you really fly more then 10 hours just to eat in the hotel? Get out there and find some great restaurants they do exists, and are only a short walk away. Our room was facing the bus stop, Wynyard station and on a low floor, but it was very quite at night. I'd love to stay here again. It was a great value, and it's right in the middle of everything you'd need for you stay. See attached photos

Reviews.Title: “The Menzies - Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: flights-of-fantasy
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at The Menzies over the Easter Period as we booked 'Easter in the City' on the their website at a very competitive price - $200AUD including breakfast for four. I was a little sceptical after reading some reviews on this site regarding this hotel. After phoning to confirm our hotel I mention if we could be upgraded to a Park View and they kindly upgraded us at no extra cost. Checked in around 10:00am as our flight was early. As we are family of 2 adults and 2 children (14/11) we shared a room with two double beds, the room was a good size with enough hanging and draw space for the 4 of us. Very comfortable beds and enough pillows to watch TV in bed. Room service was prompt. Excellent housekeeping each day. The Menzies is in a great location, just across the road is the bus/railway station and also a Coles Supermarket. Walking distance to The Rocks/Circular Quay/Opera House and of course the CBD. Requested a late checkout and have no problems with this. I would certainly stay at the Menzies again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RSLocke
Reviews.Content: We booked the Menzies as a "secret hotel" via lastminute.com. It is in a great location and very easy to find if you are coming from the airport (train straight to Wynyard Station which is over the road from the hotel). The bedroom was large and clean but the bathroom in comparison was quite shabby and outdated. Our room also looked out on to an office block (2 metres away) so we had to keep the curtains closed at all times. Our room was also quite noisy - the aircon vents often woke us up during the night. Best of all was the location - 10 minutes walk away from Circular Quay and The Rocks. We were only in Sydney for 3 days so this was ideal. Nothing memorable about the staff, they were friendly enough but nothing out of the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumDE
Reviews.Content: Our recent visit to beautiful Sydney was complemented by the cheerful, accomodating staff at the lovely, centrally located Menzies Hotel. After a long flight from the US, I found the elegant lobby refreshing and comfortable. Our room was of good size for a city hotel (vs. NYC or Paris), clean and well appointed. I was slightly put off by the somewhat dingey gray hallways, which smelled of smoke, although I understand that the north wing has been recently renovated and this situation resolved. A lovely, large buffet breakfast is served at the hotel restaurant, and there is a lively happy hour in the lobby bar. Don't miss the beautiful indoor pool and gym. Most memorable, though, was the friendly, extremely helpful staff--a rare find in a center-city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Julian1961
Reviews.Content: The location is everything with this hotel, you can even catch the train from Sydney airport and get off right opposite! The room we were originally allocated was upgraded (free of charge) due to a misunderstanding about the bed available for the third person staying with us. We booked via an internet site and were charged $AU140 per night for two nights with a $AU45 tariff for the extra person. If you don't expect 5 star service in this 4 star hotel you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it...”
Reviews.Author: MzMiata
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a one night stay for the weekend. It was booked online on lastminute.com.au as a secret hotel deal. For the price I paid it was really good value. We used the spa, pool and the gym. The hotel is located just a few minutes walk from Pitt Street mall and the Rocks and is about 10 minutes walk to Chinatown. If you need to catch a train somewhere, across the street is Wynard Train Station. I would definitely stay here again. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Great Xmas weekend”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaCoco
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the Xmas weekend. Location was great for city shopping and close to The Rocks & Circular Quay dining areas. We stayed on Level 9, room was very clean and comfortable. We had dinner there on Xmas eve, the garlic prawn was very salty, food was just average. Overall it is a great hotel, we would be back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Sydney Tourism!”
Reviews.Author: katy_and_mike
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Menzies for four nights in December, '06 while vactioning in Sydney and were extremely happy with this choice. The location of the hotel is superb (right on the edge of The Rocks / CBD) and we comfortably walked from here to just about everywhere (pubs in The Rocks area, ferries at the Circular Quay, restaurants in Darling Harbour). Conveniently, the Wynyard train station is literally at the doorstep of the hotel. We took a direct rail link to the airport (only 17 minutes from this station) and it couldn't have been easier (We definitely recommend this - no traffic to contend with and there is regular train service.) As a bonus, the Wynyard station has a small underground shopping mall, including a Cole's grocery store where we were able to purchase drinks and snacks. Of course, there are also plenty of other convenient coffee shops, etc. right up on the ground level. You can cut through an arcade next to the hotel and right onto George Street, a main thoroughfare. Our room, labeled a "Deluxe Executive" room was on the 11th floor of the hotel with a view of Wynyard Park far below. The bathroom was a little bit dated with occasionally noisy pipes, but still nice - a marble vanity with plenty of space to spread our toiletries out. The room was spacious and included a flat-screen TV and an arm chair & ottoman. The bed was heavenly - the best bed we had during our stay in Australia - perfect for sleeping away the jet lag. During our stay we took a dip in the indoor hotel pool and spa one night and enjoyed this. Its a small indoor pool, but for an inner-city hotel we thought it was a great addition. There is also a sauna. The check-in staff were friendly and helpful with maps and information as well as the concierge (a rotating staff of concierges were available during our stay). The concierge accepted our bags from Qantas (they arrived the day after we did) and had them placed in our room while we were out touring. One of the concierges also booked a Hunter Valley wine tour for us. We got an AMAZING deal on this hotel on the Accor Hotels Australia Website ( --- ) and would recommend that you check around for deals. When we booked on the hotel website, they offerred the "Deluxe Executive" upgrade for only AU $10.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best”
Reviews.Author: davsyd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Menzies for 2 nights. Check-in guy was very friendly and gave us a larger room in North Tower but had awful view of backs of buildings. Room was ok. I think it may have been re-furbished it had flat tv and beds were comfortable. Bathrooms are very dated and shower pressure is very weak. We had dinner in restaurant and it was not the best. We asked for the beef to be medium and it come 'more' then well -done. DO NOT get the Apple and Berry crumble it is not a crumble but a little pie that seemed to be heated up in microwave, it was soggy and awful!! This restaurant is quite expensive so you would expect more. There is also this annoying Manager in restaurant that strutts around and talking to the guests very loudly in an over friendly matter, now some guests might like this personal touch but I found it quite annoying and inapropriate. They do not seem to be able to do express check out from room tv so in reception I found an express check out box with NO forms to fill in, so a guy got one for me, just as well as the queue to check out was nearly out the door. All in all I would stay here again if the price is right but there are much better hotels in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Fantastic Location, Nothing Else”
Reviews.Author: sjturner
Reviews.Content: Booked this Accor hotel using there own website. Payed Â£420 for 5 nights. The only good thing about this hotel is it's location, everything else is average/poor. The room was averagely decorated, it looked like it had been refurbished in the last few years and contained a flat screen tv, minibar. The flat screen tv was not very good, it made a loud noise evertime I changed channel and if you turned the sound down low the sound would break up. We had a view of an office block (rear view from hotel) which was not very nice. The bathroom was very old and the pipes made strange noises! The room a/c also looked like it had been installed in the 60's. The hotel swimming pool was very small and not a pool that I would use again. In summary I think this hotel is average and if you can find another hotel in a similar location for a similar price I would go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But...”
Reviews.Author: The_Iron_Duke
Reviews.Content: I've just spent a week at this hotel on a business trip where I stayed in one of the "south wing" rooms with a pleasant view over Wynyard Park. The room was acceptable, with a large, comfortable bed. Bathroom was fine for my needs, although it is somewhat dated, and one should note that the range of toiletries provided is limited. There were also coffee/tea making facilities and a minibar, although i had to request for the latter to be re-stocked when I used anything. Overall impression is that the hotel is a bit "tired" although the public/communal areas are generally well-maintained. On the plus side: - I have to agree with other reviewers in that the position is great, particularaly if you're travelling on business and want to take advantage of limited opportunities to explore some of Sydney. - Lots of local shops, bars, restaurants. However, please note that this part of town, in my experience, largely closes down on Saturday and Sunday. In that case you will have a ten or fifteen minute walk to find eating and drinking. - The first floor cocktail bar has live entertainment on Thurs/Fri every week. - Compared to hotels in many other countries, it did seem to offer accommodation that is good value for money. On the not-so-good side: - Staff were patchy. The person serving me at check-in (I admit I'm not after my best after a 24 hour flight) was less than welcoming and even off-hand. However, most other staff couldn't have been more helpful. - Lots of large tourist coach parties coming and going during the week. These seemed to be either school children or senior citizens. The real problem with this is that they all descend for breakfast at the same time, so you can have trouble getting a seat. It also seemed to me that the school parties were all booked onto the same floor, which I could imagine could be noisy if you happen to be on the floor below (I wasn't, so can't speak with authority on this). - Limited choice of TV channels - You need a wireless-capable laptop to access the internet from your room. - The bar is very expensive, although, unlike some other reviewers, I did not think that the full breakfast was untoward. - The interconnecting doors between rooms are not well sound-insulated. Even when people were talking at a normal level, it was quite possible to hear next door's conversation in my room. If their TV was turned up loud, then it was really distracting. This is not ideal if you are jet-lagged nor, I would imagine, is it something that you would want if travelling with your partner. - The city council decided to dig up the road a block or so from the hotel. What's the problem with that? Nothing in principle, but they started sometime around one o'clock in the morning for two consecutive days. Overall, it was a pretty average stay. Whilst the construction noise was not the hotel's fault, I would have expected them to know that this was happening and communicate appropriately with the guests. This did not happen.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying in a Place with such history”
Reviews.Author: VTP
Reviews.Content: I had not been to Sydney in a few years and it was great to feel comfortable in a hotel and be able to ask all sorts of questions, even the silly ones.The hotel is located in the heart of the city and I felt very safe there, which is a big plus for me when I travel. The staff were very friendly and listened to what you had to say and I saw in the lobby that they had won a Service Award recently and I can understand why. You can read and see history scattered throughout the hotel. If you want security, comfort and great location and do not want to pay over the top, then this hotel is a great place to stay! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A little run around”
Reviews.Author: prepaid
Reviews.Content: An okay 4 star hotel. We arrived early in the morning 7am, and were able to check into our room, which normally wouldn't have been ready till 3pm. That was great. It was a bit of a walk from the lobby to the elevator for the wing our room was on. Then from the elevator we had to walk round about to our room, so it was actually quite a journey to our room. Then when in our room, it was a little small, but acceptable. The bathroom was a little disappointing, it seemed quite old, and the shower head was loose. Not the most up to date bathroom. The internet service at the hotel is a little disappointing. It is resold wireless service, that limits you to 500 megabytes per 24 hours, so if you need to do any sort of serious file transfers this place will not work for you. But besides that it was a nice hotel, that is right across from an underground station so that makes getting around a bit easier.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Constant_Holidaying
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel off the website based on its location. It is so close to everything you need with the train station literally under the hotel and the bus station right across the road. The rooms are comfortable, nothing too fancy, and the service is really good. Everyone had a smile and the doorman remembered our name every day we were there (5 days). I would reccommend the hotel for anyone visiting Sydney for the first time as it is central to the Opera House, shopping malls and Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “The epitome of "average"”
Reviews.Author: Monsieur_Aubergine
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice on business and have to say it's the most average hotel I've ever been in. Not great, not terrible. The room I last stayed in was absolutely ordinary - a bed, a LCD TV, one dreary print on the wall, a table, a bathroom, a dull view across the alleyway to the rear of a mostly empty 1950s office block... I almost fell asleep writing this review trying to recall anything memorable about the room. It's like militantly ordinary. Good points - location good for Wynyard area business needs, lots of cafes and restaurants, 10 minute walk to the Quay or Darling Harbour, bus interchange right outside, train station and 24 hour supermarket under Wynyard Park outside front door. Piano Bar does good drinks. Front desk staff attentive and efficient. Mediocre points - breakfast overpriced and ordinary (go to any of the nearby cafes for a much better and more interesting breakfast). Room keycards lose their coding very easily - even kept away from other cards mine still wiped itself twice and had to get reprogrammed. Previous stay was in "north wing" and I scored a corner room (corner of Margaret St and Wynyard Lane) which was a good size and had better ambience. "South wing" rooms seem much more ordinary. Very very ordinzzzzzz... Try to get a "north wing" room I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: WJL1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Menzies in early August for 2 nights. I found the rooms to be average. A little run down and tired in appearance. The bathroom was functional but also showed signs of wear. The most modern feature were the flatscreen tvs, which were very good. However, the biggest drawback I found was the connecting doors between rooms. Although they were locked, they were no sound proof. Therefore, I could hear my neighbour watching tv close to midnight and hear the hair dryer going first thing in the morning. You could also hear your neighbour's shower. Which didn't create good sleeping conditions for me. There was a school group booked in the hotel the same time as I but thankfully we were on different floors. However I overheard another traveller complaining to Reception about the noise levels. The buffet breakfast was fairly decent. It offered everything one would expect and seemed to be replenished fairly often. The benefit to the Menzies is its proximity to the business district. Overall, I would say the Menzies is not a bad place to stay but if you prefer peace and quiet and a good night's sleep, perhaps try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janeysmoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of August for 4 nights (this would be the quiet time of year) while on a RTW trip. We found it to be clean and quiet and within walking distance of the Opera House, the Rocks and the main shopping and eating areas. Our room overlooked the street. We had a superkingsize bed which was very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel. We didn't try the breakfast, as with everywhere else in the world, if you're prepared to walk for another 5 minutes, you can get something at about a quarter of the price.

Reviews.Title: “D D & D”
Reviews.Author: AndrewandJenny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Menzies in February 2005 and found the room small, Dull, Dreary and Depressing, with a wonderful view of an office block where typists sat at their computers. The dullness was even more marked because we had to draw our curtains to preserve some kind of privacy. When we complained and asked for an upgrade we were met with sheer indifference at the reception, but when we finally did pay extra for a so-called park view (actually street view) the room was only slightly better. Basically the hotel spend nothing on upgrading, decorating, or brightening the rooms. They are quite content with receiving complaints like ours, only to receive occupany from other unsuspecting guests. Breakfast - very expensive. Recommend going to one of the breakfast bars, of which there are many nearby. Hotel staff - couldn't care less, and if they did, they wouldn't have any power to change things. Book elsewhere. On the credit side the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Menzies”
Reviews.Author: dancingprincess
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Menzies twice now and enjoyed both stays.It is a fantastic location right next to the train station which will get you easy, cheap access around the city.You can easily walk to Circular Quay, harbour, the rocks areas. Staff were very pleasant allowing us to check in early and helping with train timetables. The pool area (indoors) is a little small and noisy but the room are nice and spacious. Overall the stay was very nice.The buffet breakfast was OK but not excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Another happy stay at the Menzies”
Reviews.Author: doodler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Menzies several times, both before and since the refurbishment, and have really enjoyed our stays, including in the despised (by some) rooms at the rear. The rooms are a good size for a Sydney hotel, good bathrooms, with bath, and compare favourably to the sister hotel, the Sofitel Wentworth. We have not had any problems with noise or air-con. We also like the hotel amenities, and the location. There is a really good commuter caff in the Wynyard concourse, where you can get your breakfast for much less than the hotel charge. Of course, being Sydney, there are also any number of smarter cafes nearby (on a weekday) if a more elegant breakfast is required. The Airporter bus stops at the hotel, and this is slightly cheaper and easier than the train. A taxi is around $35 and may be a better option for more people.

Reviews.Title: “Central location ideal”
Reviews.Author: Beaverskins
Reviews.Content: Central location ideal for seeing vibrant Sydney. This elegant hotel has updated rooms that are quiet, immaculate and very comfortable. Our 5 day stay was filled with easy sightseeing via train, ferry, bus and on foot. There is easy airport access by train to and from Wynyard Station dirctly across the road from the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: The Menzies Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 14 Carrington Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
